It feels like they don‚Äôt want to bother the runners and cyclists with swimming information at all; God forbid they stumble upon a swim route‚Ä¶

Forget about finding a new place to swim on vacation through Strava entirely. How hard can it be to add a button to filter for swim segments just like there are for running and biking? This is an app widely used by triathletes, after all.
title: Swimming is wildly ignored

review: I‚Äôve been using the app now for nearly a year and it actually started out working great. However, after I became a paid subscriber, the app frequently fails to update my results. For instance: I hit a new PR today on a segment with a time of 18 minutes and the app will continues to show my previous 21 minute time as my PR and on the leader boards( in which my position is much lower than it now should be). I went through all the steps to refresh achievements (which is ridiculously only accessible on web and NOT from the app) and it continues not to update. Even worse, this has happened to me half a dozen times in as many months, and they make it nearly impossible to contact Strava to resolve issues. For the price of this app, these are inexcusable problems to have to deal with.
title: Not worth paying for

review:
Strava is the best app for analyzing run data, segments, progression over time, etc. As a data nerd, I love it, and happily pay for the premium service. 

But, the Apple Watch app is an embarrassment. There are dozens of threads about issues people have with data syncing, lost distance, unclear online directions, worse data collection than Apple‚Äôs built-in tools (which Stava‚Äôs team have access to through APIs). I use Apple‚Äôs Workout app to track my runs, and import to Strava with a third app (RunGap). This is the only way I have been able to consistently track my entire run, get heart rate data, and have a watch app UI that is well thought out. The data I get though this process is as robust as the best dedicated GPS watches, but I can‚Äôt get it done with Strava‚Äôs app.
title: Best running app, but...

review:
Enjoy using the app, but considering the price everybody is paying for premium, I feel like the app can get some increased functions. For example, the ‚ÄúFitness and Freshness‚Äù is only available on the website. Seems like that can be developed into an app-friendly format. 

Also, it would be nice to have equipment options for all sports. For example, having the option for different surfboards/skis/snowboards to choose from. Plenty of people have multiple options for these. 

To piggyback on equipment options, it would also be nice to have a default equipment option for a specific foot activity.  When I upload a hike, it automatically defaults to my chosen running shoes. It would be nice to have a hike-only default shoe option, instead of having to change that later. This ties in with just having specific equipment lists to specific activities, as noted above about having equipment options for activities that currently do not have that option at all. 

Just little stuff like that.
title: App improvements needed

review:
Strava is awesome. I use it to bring colleagues, friends, and family on the app to keep them accountable for working out. What I would propose to the development team is for groups being able to track by time, rather than the specific workouts. Not everyone is a runner, and I enjoy being able to compete against anybody no body the exercise. 

Besides that, the rewards, the communities, the races, the little map it shows after a run is fantastic. I like that it connects seamlessly to my Garmin. I had plus for a month and it was awesome, but I don‚Äôt run consistently enough to buy it but for those that do it‚Äôs valuable.
title: Great App could have more

review: I hate to write this review as I have enjoyed using Strava in the past and I think that it did many things well. If one chose to pay for a subscription they received extra things that for many may have been well worth the investment. However, when you (Strava) feel that enough folks are not subscribing you should not take what was free and then charge for it!  That is in poor taste. What you should do is improve what you offer for your paid subscribers that has never been offered for free. When you take what you once did not charge for and then charge for it while not improving it at all it says that you could not improve your product enough to create subscribers through new innovations. Very sad. I will not only not be paying to subscribe to see my ‚ÄúMatched Activities‚Äù but I will also now be deleting your app from my phone.
title: A sad day....

review:
I am extremely disappointed to discover Strava‚Äôs sudden removal of once free features. These types of business models that take away free features instead improving paid features only result in driving potential customers away, not attracting them. For example, instead of completely removing free access to your route building program, why not limit free users to a specific amount of routes per month. This will
Show off your amazing features instead of completely limiting them to paid users that you won‚Äôt have.... I‚Äôll be taking my route building to other platforms that offer their services for free, instead of upgrading for something hundreds do for free. These types of actions will result in the downfall of this company which is really sad given that you all have created something really special. 

Focus on creating something people want to pay for instead of taking away from your free platform. That will drive success and indication, instead you took the easy way out and people aren‚Äôt happy. Also I would remove the people who drove you all in this direction, they‚Äôve created a toxic company culture that reflects poorly on everyone. 

Sincerely, a previous Strava user.
title: Create a product people will pay for...

review:
Stava used to be a great app that I used all the time i'm often multiple times a day, and really found it helpful and a great way to track my friends. Unfortunately there was a recent update to the format and now it is not very useful. I keep seeing the same bicycle rides in my feed. Just because a group of people I follow went on a big group ride, it just keeps coming up as the group ride to re-re-re-review over and over and over.
The Strava feed worked better when it was in chronological order. It would be great for users to be able to select the classic view if that is what they want. I don't use Facebook so maybe that's why I don't understand this new feed.  It may be time to start using one of the other apps instead of Strava.
title: Was a Great App until a recent format change

review: I‚Äôm a fervent and frequent user of Strava, particularly using its Apple Watch app. Unfortunately after this release, the Strava in Apple Watch is quite buggy, constantly de-installing itself from the Watch, including in mid-routines, which unfortunately in my case I discovered in the middle of my weekly long run; What was my surprise that even though the Apple Wath app started running smoothly (which I doubled checked given the recent de-installations), it looks like somewhere thru my running, it deinstalled, NOT recording anything of my routine. I hope they solve this bugs so I can starting using/trusting again the Appel Watch version.
title: Problem with Apple Watch

review: I recently switched to Strava from Map My Run based on the suggestions of multiple friends. It works fine, but the main thing I miss from MMR and the Apple workout watch app is the ability to control the music you are listening to from within the app itself. With MMR and the Apple apps on the watch you just swipe left and there is a third page where you and skips songs or adjust the volume. Strava doesn‚Äôt have that third page. You need to leave the Stava app, open the Now Playing app, make your adjustments, and toggle back and forth... manageable- yes, however it is a function I got used to in the other apps and miss in this app.
title: Watch app needs music control

review: I love the layout of Strava, but it‚Äôs not a great business model to give users features only to slowly take them away (leaderboards, weekly mileage) to try to get them to buy premium. At some point I‚Äôm going to get annoyed enough that we can no longer access simple features like weekly mileage or get tired of the constant pop-ups prompting me to buy premium. There‚Äôs a lot of alternatives on the market (Garmin Connect, RunKeeper, MapMyRun) that offer the same features, so Strava should be capitalizing on the popularity they have and trying to find a way to make that profitable without removing existing (simple, honestly) features, rather than slowly driving people away by trying to force purchase of premium ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è tracking weekly mileage is the bare minimum of a functioning exercise app.
title: They keep removing simple features to force you to buy premium

review: I know that you have to chase through each notification for your own rides to get your best chance at reporting them to Apple Health, and ultimately Activity. Would you add hooks so a shortcut could be launched and cycle through notifications of your own rides? Even the most recent one of your own would be handy, as I‚Äôll go on 3 or more rides on my Peloton and have to click through each notification manually just to get them recorded in Apple Health. I fixed the app/device priority stacking to get the calories recorded evenly between Health -> Active Energy and Activity -> Move Calories. This could help automate a ‚Äúfix‚Äù for this and other macros between apps.
title: Could be more useful with Shortcut hooks

review:
Every negative review is from non-paying subscription users. I am a two year user 10,000 miles on and off grid rides. Never had a single issue. Ride for days off grid and my data is there. Accuracy is good. Get sensors. Use wahoo on bike computer. Only disappointment was when flybys changed. Always looking to improve routes, looking at others routes on my similar route was a great feature. Some rides there was dozens of flybys. Now you rarely see any flybys. 

I do not understand the negative reviews. Nothing is free. Get the paid version and enjoy.
title: Look who‚Äôs complaining‚Ä¶.not me

review: Great way to connect with friends, compare segment performance, and download routes. However I feel other apps do some non-social things better. For example: The app Ride with GPS creating routes feature is a fine tuned machine compared to Strava‚Äôs clunky beta route builder, even my Lezyne GPS comes with a better route builder online app.  The ability to upload a GPX file not related to a Strava activity into the Strava route builder would be helpful.  Overall Strava has become the Facebook of Running, Cycling and swimming with some good features, but it‚Äôs currently not the one and only app I use at the moment. I go back and forth on if the premium membership is with the cost, but I‚Äôll likely renew.
title: Great Social Activity app with some features needing improvement

review: Does anyone know how to get logged in when it says something went wrong try again? I swear I‚Äôve tried everything from updating it, to shutting down my phone , to deleting and downloading it again. It says I have an account on my computer and will still give me notifications but it will not let me get in on the mobile app. I love Strava and would like to use it so I can see my friends and XC teams runs, but it just doesn‚Äôt work. I hope someone can answer this with any other suggestions on how to help get it working again!
title: Need help getting logged in

review:
I‚Äôve been using Strava since it came out. I‚Äôm sad to say that what used to be a really great app/service that focused on providing users the best possible experience has slowly turned into a profit-focused nickle-and-dime business. 

While I didn‚Äôt mind them changing the all-encompassing premium version into the current Summit format, I am really annoyed that they have started taking away features that have always been free.

What started with just taking away Heatmaps has now progressed into being NOT BEING ABLE TO USE THE STRAVA APP TO RECORD HR DATA anymore. I believe this is an effort to get people to buy Wahoo HR Straps (which I have to admit are great) and/or standalone activity trackers. 

I used to have Strava Premium before an injury put me out for a few months and this kind of behavior from Strava makes me not want to sign back up and give them my support. However, if they fix the HR strap issue and add support for recording treadmill runs and stationary bike rides I will definitely get premium again.
title: Slowly Becoming Useless In Its Free Format

review:
I really like this app and use it whenever I ride. I started using a heart rate monitor for training a few months ago. It was really cool how I could connect the heart rate monitor directly to Strava. Recently Strava removed the ability to pair heart rate monitors directly to the app. Now you have to use another app and record your rides with Wahoo or Garmin and the. Upload them to Strava. This process is super clunky and inconvenient. I really wish the developers would bring back the ability to pair heart rate monitors directly to the app. What‚Äôs the point of having summit if you have to record your rides in other apps like Garmin or Wahoo. 

Please bring back the heart rate monitor feature.
title: Strava needs to bring back the ability to pair a heart rate monitor directly to the app

review: The performance of the GPS and auto pause both on the iPhone app and watch are quite nice. However there are few issues that have me continuing to use iSmoothRun, namely the fact that there is virtually no customization of audio cues or the display on the watch is quite frustrating. Also, there is no support for Bluetooth paired earpieces. Running 6 to 7 times per week I am looking for a more than a way to compete with others after my run but to improve each individual run having better control would be so helpful.
title: Promising features

review: I deleted this app and won‚Äôt be using anymore. Their costs haven‚Äôt gone up, so why increase the price? Guess us runners who are leaders in our communities should start our own app. üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èBye Strava. Btw‚Ä¶ Strava‚Äôs navigation and appearance is not easy to use. Complicated navigating the app, basic features hard to find. The average pace per mile calculation for miles is off by about 10-15 seconds vs all other apps and metrics. Strava needs to focus on metric accuracy if they are going to charge $80 to use this app. Runmeter is free and has better metrics, plus you don‚Äôt need to upgrade to the $9/year price to access basic information. Strava also doesn‚Äôt have turn by turn voice navigation for routes‚Ä¶ such a basic feature, but they don‚Äôt offer it.
title: Greedy Company - Inaccurate Pace Calculation - No turn by turn navigation

review:
‚ÄúNARP‚Äù: non-athletic regular person.

After using the app as a paid subscriber for well over a year now, I have learned that Strava is not even close to what it is hyped up to be. The amount of technology errors is absolutely unacceptable and the quality of updates only proceeds to go downhill. It is beyond apparent that Strava is a company with below average programmers, none of whom actually use the app themselves. Ie. I have not met a single person that has runs upload regularly without a hitch- and I just recorded a ride directly to my phone that didn‚Äôt upload. How does that even happen when it has internet connection the entire route?

Moral of the story: dozens of easy to fix errors that persist while paywalls go up and no new features roll out. You have to wonder what the programmers are doing with the exorbitant price I pay for this app.
title: Below Average Tech Made By NARPs

review:
The update for the app works, from what I can see but now you have to pay for access to ALL the content. I will not be paying for it and will most likely not continue to use or check any information on this app. I was considering even paying the subscription for the extra content, but with the new change that was a step too far. What if Facebook started requiring everyone to pay for a subscription to access all content? Thanks Strava for taking a good thing and screwing it up.

I might even get a response from the developers saying something along the lines of how sorry they are to see me go, but they can save it. If they are truly sorry, they‚Äôll bring back free content and split the paid subscription for extra content (the way it was).
title: Why pay for this

review: Log my rides with my bike computer that sync to Strava. Great for keeping up with your friends. Gave up on Strava being able to sync workout/ride data to iOS Health - constantly duplicated workout and distance entries. It does, however, read data from Health without issue (for example weight, etc) that are provided by other devices/apps. I rely on the bike computer app (Wahoo) to sync workout data to Health which it manages to do correctly without issue. Ride analysis, once the ride data is in Strava, is top notch and easy to interpret. I do wish Strava was a little more featured for logging workouts that are not cycling, running or swimming.  Otherwise a solid, informative and fun app.
title: Almost great

review:
I was looking for an app to simply map my bike trips, just to see where I travelled.  Strava was the top choice and it seemed to fit the bill.  

The free version comes with lots of opportunities to purchase a subscription and follow other people.  After finishing my rides and ending tracking on the app, I wasn‚Äôt able to look at my previous routes later.  

Of course, I can view everything with a subscription, which I‚Äôm not willing to do.  I don‚Äôt see the advantage of a subscription in my situation.  If you enjoy any of the supported activities and want to brag about yourself or be inspired by others bragging about themselves, then maybe.  The app is basically useless without a subscription, and shouldn‚Äôt be advertised it as free.
title: Useful‚Ä¶ with a subscription

review: Ive been on strava for a decade. It was an amazing app that offers so much for online cycling communities and individuals trying to increase their fitness and technique. Then they added premium. Then they increased the price of premium. Then they started paywaling features that were free. And now nearly everything is paywalled. Whats even more frustrating is that Ive given them maybe a hundred bucks from them and they just want more for less. The final straw is the in app advertisements offering ‚Äúhave a month free on us.‚Äù but when you click it, its ‚Äúbuy 11 months get one free.‚Äù thats not ‚Äúon us.‚Äù thats a rip off, especially when most cyclists dont ride every month of the year, and they have the data to know this. Ill be starting to look for app alternatives because of all this.
title: Going downhill in a hurry.

review: Love Strava! Longtime user, first time reviewer. I‚Äôve used Strava more and more and the competitiveness has encouraged me to spend on an indoor bike trainer I can use during the winters. Since this is my first trainer, I got one that isn‚Äôt fancy, i.e., doesn‚Äôt have a subscription/connect to the Internet etc. Since Strava can‚Äôt connect to this trainer, I have to go to my browser and manually add the workout online, rather than using the app. This isn‚Äôt great, and adds more complexity to overall UX. Hoping to see this fixed in the next few updates!
title: Great app, but the biggest area for improvement is‚Ä¶

review: When I first started using the app it was only minor distance problems, like if I wanted to run a 1.5mile run then I‚Äôd have to run an extra .1 or .2 miles. But I just ran 2.5 miles and it only registered as 2, for someone who runs for time and a score a half mile is a ridiculous difference for a timed run. Idk if using WiFi or not makes a difference but that much of a difference pretty much makes the app useless. It‚Äôs a shame because I love every other aspect of this app. Being able to join clubs, share runs with your friends and join challenges makes running more interesting and fun. However, at the end of the day an accurate tracking system is what I‚Äôm looking for in an app like this.
title: Doesn‚Äôt accurately track distance or speed

review: I have enjoyed Strava for several years now, loving the social aspect of sharing the outdoors with my friends. The new update has taken away the formerly free features of being able to see other‚Äôs segment times. This has taken away much of the enjoyment of the app and has instilled disappointment in the company from everyone I know who uses the app. I would have been content with ads being placed on the app, but the change to premium membership to use these basic features has degraded the sense of community previously fostered by its use. I still enjoy the app for its ability to track miles and segments, however, I feel as though the community of Strava has been damaged by these new updates.
title: Why the change?

review: It works great but occasionally upon opening app it would not respond, couldn‚Äôt record a ride. I discovered it did this whenever there was a new update for the app. I‚Äôd download the update, it would take a minute or two to install after opening app again. Then finally I could record and start my ride. This morning open it, it‚Äôs frozen again. I just went through this yesterday downloading a new update. Check for updates again and none shown. Open and close app and every time still frozen.  I gave up and had my best ride with no data logged.  I didn‚Äôt see any option to share data with iHealth either? This would have been great because anything shared to iHealth gets logged into my diabetes monitor app.
title: Freezes upon opening. Can‚Äôt click anything iPhone XR

review: Really like the social side of Strava and keeping connected to other runners. The basics of the app are good. One thing that drives me crazy‚Ä¶the audio cues work when logging an outdoor run but not for a trail run when it is more dangerous to look at your watch to get pace/distance. I‚Äôve resorted to starting activit√©s as outdoor run, then changing the activity after the fact, annoying. Another thing I don‚Äôt like is the run posting details are different in the feed for running based on the run activity type. If I log outdoor run, it shows my pace when it posts, if I log trail run, it shows elevation and total time, no pace. You have to go into the details of the trail run to see the pace.
title: Good, not perfect

review:
I‚Äôve been using Strava for three or four years. The first couple of years, I kept up my handwritten journal record of each ride, but then just sort of stopped, because I can describe each ride and add photos on Strava, so why bother? My only fear is what if Strava goes away and then I lose all that history? I wish I could make a printed album of all my Strava rides!
One thing that Strava brings out for better or for worse is my competitive nature. Sometimes I am shocked that I am top ten in a segment that I didn‚Äôt even know existed, and then I try to better my time and ride stupidly instead of safely.
title: Great tracking tool

review: The ‚Äòride‚Äô view map is too zoomed out. The compensation for 3D is a loss. That is a massive inconvenience to mobile users needing to ‚Äúzoom in further‚Äù as before. Also, in desktop the auto sizing map window default is way too small and not practical for landscape screens when comparing rides and switching segments. You should not have to zoom out your desktop browser for basic utilization. ‚ÄòHeat Map‚Äô is too far out on the viewer. ‚ÄòFly Over‚Äô should be more easily accessible beyond it‚Äôs desktop notification deployment. Segment builders should be able to update Strava as to the division their trails without being conflicted with satellite variance/tolerance in athletes/user‚Äôs time. I am a paying user. Please update.
title: Map (mobile/desktop) update request

review: Have you ever seen another GPS app with a beacon that did not point in the direction the phone was pointed? No you haven‚Äôt because there isn‚Äôt another one. Have you ever been lost in the Woods at an unmarked intersection wondering which way to go and it‚Äôs getting dark? I only use it for the beacon to send to my wife -and hope that someday somebody else will give us a real GPS real time operating system for iPhone with access to trail maps. As well, 75% of the time I send the real time beacon to somebody they can‚Äôt see me even though I can see that the app is recording my position.  I‚Äôm paying $60 a year for this. This is a typical app where the coders sit in a chair staring at a screen with bottles of Coca-Cola and never get out and use it. Customer support? Forget about it!
title: the worst app - I hope somebody start some competition!

review: For 7 years I have been a loyal strava user. While some of my friends used power meters, I only felt the need to wear a heart monitor. A few updates ago, strava removed the ability to use almost all types of heart monitors save for computers and an Apple watch. Now another couple of updates later strava has taken away the ability to see our past results or compare our efforts with others on any particular day. What a joke. This ‚Äòfree‚Äô app is now practically useless and one is forced to pay in order to be able to use the most basic and relevant aspects of the app. With my next bike upgrade, I am planning on stepping up to a power meter and will invest in a good bike computer. I was going to subscribe to strava but now will just leave the app at its most stripped down facebookesque version.
title: Terrible Updates

review:
Overall it‚Äôs a good app and easy to use. A few times I paused my run, when o resumed, clock started but mileage didn‚Äôt, so it looked like time was for 6 miles which is what had run at that point, but distance only showed 5.  Had to ‚Äúfinish‚Äù the run on the app and started again. Not a big deal but I lost a mile of data. After this happened a few times I realized I had to update the app. I hope this is one of the issues that was fixed. 
Sometimes it takes a long time for the data to be synched to other apps (one time it took over 3 hours).  So now I don‚Äôt bother checking until some time later.
title: Occasionally doesn‚Äôt work well but good overall

review: I wanted to like this app because of the social feature but my data is always off. I run marked trails so I know my mileage and the Strava app always shows my mileage as 0.1-0.2 miles fewer than what I have actually run. That doesn‚Äôt seem like much but it consistently does it and there is no way to adjust the mileage. I have tried to wait a couple minutes to let the app acquire a good GPS signal as suggested but this hasn‚Äôt made any difference. I also began using the indoor run selection on my Apple Watch and it does the same thing. This makes my mile average a good 20-30 seconds per mile longer than it actually is. I have used other running apps (Runtastic is my favorite) and don‚Äôt have any problems with them. I wish Strava would fix these issues
title: Data is always incorrect

review: I love Strava and the only thing holding me back from five stars are two things. I wish rucking was an option instead of just hiking. I have already submitted a request after inquiring about this in the past. And, I wish there was a spot somewhere that would tell you your total monthly mileage for running/walking/cycling and not just weekly totals. Nike Run Club does a nice job with the monthly/weekly/last month/last week totals. That‚Äôs one of the main reasons I‚Äôve kept Nike Run Club is for that feature. I do, however, love Strava, and know the updates will continue to make it a great product. Thanks, Strava!
title: I love Strava

review:
I signed up for the free trial because I wanted to check out the additional features and see if it would be worth paying for a subscription. It only took a few rides to realize that the paid version lacks functionality compared to other free apps.
   I cancelled a few weeks into the trial and filled out the section about what I felt they lacked. I requested that if these features are added please let me know and I‚Äôd reconsider a subscription. 
   Then I noticed a charge on my statement and come to find out they charged me anyway. I have sent an email to this company in the past with a question and never got a response. This time I flagged the charge through apple with hopes to get a better response. 
   So basically, the free version is good, but don‚Äôt sign up for the trial or expect any responses whatsoever from this developer.
title: Don‚Äôt do the free trial!!!

review: I love the social element of Strava and the ability to keep track of my workouts... however they have slowly been removing features available through the free version. I don‚Äôt need or want all of the fancy analyses of my workout- but cmon, Strava, I can‚Äôt even see how many miles I‚Äôve run each week anymore? I‚Äôm sure there are thousands just like me who have no interest (or $$) for the paid version and don‚Äôt care to have all the fancy features... but now we can‚Äôt even perform simple functions. Very disappointed - however I will now be keeping my weekly mileage written by hand rather than giving into this money trap. My suggestion is to look at other apps such as MapMyRun before getting stuck on Strava - you can do less than they promise.
title: Upset with changes to the app. Big failure.

review: My team uses Strava as a way to keep a training log and keep up with each other‚Äôs workouts year round. It has become our own little version of social media over the years and many of us are on there almost every day. Recently, a few of us have had a problem where our Garmin devices have become disconnected from Strava, so our activities stop syncing. I have personally had this happen at least twice now over the last month or so. It is a little frustrating to have to continually reconnect the app when it has been connected previously with no issues. Hopefully this problem gets resolved soon!
title: Strava Obsessed

review: Strava is a great app and it is fun to cheer on friends in their activities.  I am a 29 year old who has been an athlete my whole life and was just diagnosed with early arthritis in my knee this year. I physically can‚Äôt run due to joint damage and the lingering pain the lasts for weeks, but I can walk. I‚Äôm happy to see that different activities such as ‚Äúwalking‚Äù and ‚Äúrock climbing‚Äù now count towards the weekly/monthly stats. There are a lot of ways people are and aren‚Äôt able to move their body - and whatever way they can/enjoy, should count and should be celebrated.
title: Thank you for more inclusivity!!

review:
I have used this app for many many years and I have just recently bought a free months membership for the benefit of the gps route system, due to the bogus restrictions. Well I tried everything to add a segment to my run and it won‚Äôt let me no matter what. This is the most frustrating experience I‚Äôve had with an app and will never purchase a real membership because of this. The only way I can run a segment is by using ‚Äúlive segments‚Äù however when I run to the segments they NEVER show up on the Strava map and I NEED to go into the Strava website EVERY time I need to set a route to a segments starting point‚Ä¶. 
I looked up everywhere how to solve this problem and I am still confused while 30 other people have completed this segment (urban course) no problem.
title: Disappointing to say the least

review: Strava is the king of all ride/run tracking apps, and is probably in the top-3 I use overall, in terms of frequency. It‚Äôs the best ride and run  tracker, that‚Äôs a given. But it‚Äôs also great for almost any other activity, and the social features - particularly public segments, leaderboards, photo sharing, discussions, route creation, club organization etc. etc. are extremely sticky and it‚Äôs hard to imagine any challenger ever dethroning it. I don‚Äôt have any financial stake in the company, I just genuinely love the app. It‚Äôs not perfect, but it‚Äôs far and away the best in its field. 5+ stars.
title: One (workout) app to rule them all!

review:
I switched over from Map My Run a few years ago. The ads got so annoying that I could not do anything with it. I would be 10-15 minutes trying to X out of ads just trying to track a run. Then at the end of the run, I would be another 10 minutes just to get to the results.

I have no issues with this app. I run, bike, kayak, and hike. It tracks it all. It remembers routes so you can compare times. I can even see other friends and family that use this app and give kudos and support comments. 

I recommend to anyone who is active
title: 2 and a half years and still liking Strava

review: i want to like strava. i *really* do. i've got thousands of miles logged. i've been using it for years now. lately though, if i so much as leave the app for 2 minutes to change a song, it crashes. it doesn't even save the record of my ride before doing so. utterly infuriating when you're 25 miles into a 30 mile record ride. at this point strava making it through an entire ride is no longer the norm. going to start looking elsewhere because this makes me so angry and totally destroys my motivation. before this i was finding ways to cope with the truly BS funneling of free features into a subscription-only access model--especially when other apps offer those things AND MORE FOR FREE--but between these two things this app is turning into a real loser real fast. Goodbye Strava.
title: used to be alright. now it crashes every 20 miles.

review:
Right after the most recent update in June 4th, the app became unusable. It kept crashing if you used your phone for anything else. When I go for a ride or walk with kids, I usually take photos. After the latest update, I have to restart Strava every time I take the pictures. First time I thought it‚Äôs a glitch (lost 0.5 of a walk), second time it lost 2 miles of a ride and I started to pay attention. It working if I just left a phone on the pocket, but if I take a picture, use text message, open google maps, check email, etc, I need to restart Strava. 

And it also started to add random, disconnected segments to the activity image (that did not affect the actual metrics).
title: Not usable after most resent update.

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for up 5 years now. It‚Äôs by far my exercise go to and I love all the features. I‚Äôve paid for Summit for year‚Äôs evidencing it. Only catch - the Apple Watch app has caused me much frustration- workouts often have a very hard time syncing. I‚Äôve even lost a few along the way (incl a 21 mile run this past weekend). A few months ago I couldn‚Äôt get logged in on the watch, and it just didn‚Äôt work for weeks at least. If you could get this watch app up to par, I‚Äôd be a 5+++ star, easily.
title: Top 5 used apps...and it‚Äôs gotten so much better this year!

review:
I absolutely love the Strava app, but I have to remove a star for three main concerns. 
1. When I go for a run and then sync from my Apple Watch to Strava, my mile times and overall pace change. I will go running with someone else who has been side by side with me, but after I sync, I‚Äôm magically 10 seconds per mile faster. 
2. PLEASE give us current pace, not just the predicted split time and overall pace on the Apple Watch. 
3. Again, PLEASE, hundredths of a mile on the Apple Watch display (2.95 instead of 2.9). It‚Äôs annoying not knowing how close I am to my next tenth of a mile, especially when I‚Äôm doing speedwork and need to work in smaller numbers.
title: Please - Apple Watch features needed!

review: Been a long time user of the app and it has done nothing but take away good features and make bad decisions. the functionality of the app has really gone downhill since 2019 and it just gets worse. the managers make poor decisions on implementing features, and don't listen to the community at all. when the community suggests a change, they get silenced by the random bans and public censorship of the app. the stance the company takes when interacting with the public is very shallow, and it seems nowadays the developers don't care and are only looking for a cash grab. pretty sad considering how great this app used to be. don't recommend, try something else, anything else really. all strava will do is disappoint you.
title: Miss the old strava

review:
App is good but lacks some functionality turning it it useless for me.

The best part of the app is the functionality to find new trails. 

The worst is that you cannot edit the indoor sessions data (for example, add distance for indoor bike sessions). What‚Äôs the point of having an app to track workouts if the app does not allow you to record the full picture of your workouts? Indoor sessions do count A LOT in my structured endurance training plan. Not having the option to fully record my stats leaves at least half of my sessions out of my workout diary during winter time (when indoor sessions are more frequent), which pretty much turns the whole app useless for me.
title: Good but has some flaws

review: I love the app and it‚Äôs capabilities‚Ä¶ When it actually works properly with my devices. I have no other problems with most other apps I use, but Strava simply does not function as intended. At one time it worked properly, and then it required an update. Since then, it has been impossible to sync any activity or workout correctly. It either doesn‚Äôt track the entire activity, only tracks part of the activity, or doesn‚Äôt track it at all. Forget about it trying to sync that information into the Apple health tracker. I‚Äôd like to say I‚Äôve given up on that, but the truth is I continue to try and it continues to fail no matter how many forums I research and no mentor how many methods I attempt.
title: The syncing with Apple is maddening

review:
This was once a great app for the average runner who liked to track progress leading up to races.  Strava‚Äôs continued scaling back of basic key features in the past few months to try and force paid users is disappointing.  

It makes total sense for the more enhanced analytics and segment rankings to be paid.  I‚Äôve considered paying for those.  

However, the latest update removes your ability to even see weekly mileage stats- not only for followers, but for you to see your own weekly mileage.  How can you call this a running app without seeing weekly mileage totals?!?
title: Once a great app

review: The app and analytics it offers is amazing.  I love it!  However,  it does not offer work tracking for swims. For an app that seems to market to triathletes, you would think it would have swimming functionality as well.  My Apple Watch does a great job of tracking swims. However, I can‚Äôt get all of the data synced with Strava, such as, metrics like heart rate and lap splits.  Also, if I manually input the swim,  it doesn‚Äôt factor into many of the analytics, such as the fitness and relative effort charts.  That being said,  this would be a 5 Star app if it was not for the limited swimming functionality.
title: Great, but missing key features.

review:
Dear Strava Inc,

You ask us to pay you $60 for barely useful ‚Äúcool features‚Äù in your app. There‚Äôs nothing in there that would justify such price. How about you make your app useful to a cyclist who can use turn by turn navigation for a track he/she created? What is the use of your track map planing feature when you can‚Äôt hear where to turn while riding a bike? It‚Äôs strange how you have this decent planning tool to creat a track, but yet it‚Äôs so useless when it comes time to use it. Do you expect cyclists to pull out their phones in middle of the ride and check where they‚Äôre supposed to go? If you‚Äôre asking for more money from your app users, then provide a utility would be beneficial. Outside of keeping our workout records, which can be done for free with other apps, you do not offer any value.
title: No turn by turn navigation

review: I have been a Strava premium member for several years, and I have loved all that it offers. It had everything I wanted and worked great. Recently, however, Strava removed Bluetooth compatibility with the app making it useless for tracking activities if you want to use HR monitor, cadence monitor, etc. You now have to use a separate app and import into Strava to use its analytics and social aspect. This is unacceptable! Why should I pay a premium price for an app that isn‚Äôt fully functional and can‚Äôt stand on its own? Strava needs to drastically reduce its price or fix the issue. To give a lame excuse, remove functionality, and expect me to keep paying the same price is ridiculous. If they can‚Äôt fix the problem, I will move on to something else.
title: No Bluetooth compatibility anymore!

review:
Strava is the only social media I interact with, no this isn‚Äôt a social media app but I sure do love getting to show my friends how fast I am. 

Long time bike run club user, I wasn‚Äôt a fan of their sharing model to show my friends I can run fast. Really enjoy competing on Strava and the endless course records all over.

It‚Äôs like the Pok√©mon go of running, you can go out and catch all the course records in your neighborhood or as far as Brazil. Love seeing how much faster I am than most and getting encouragement from all my friends that see how fast I am.

Could do without all the peloton posers but o guess I can deal. Could use a better music app integration as well to really make strava my one stop shop. 

The watch integration is great and literally got me to buy the Iwatch ultra just so I could stop running around like a doofus with my phone in my hands. Overall I love it and think I run more because of it.
title: Better than the others, worth the money

review: I love this app‚Äîit‚Äôs clean, it works with my watch, and it‚Äôs engaging enough that I will scroll through it even when I‚Äôm not in the middle of a workout just to see what others are up to. Two things: I would add the ability to un-kudo something (not that it‚Äôs necessarily something I‚Äôve needed to do, what‚Äôs wrong with spreading the love? But having the option would make the experience more akin to a typical social media app.) also, the ability to give kudos on comments. If these were added I think Strava would be the epitome of a model running app. Checks every box for me. Cheers.
title: Hands down best running app!

review:
I never write reviews, but I‚Äôm so incredibly disappointed in Strava in the past month. They took almost every single moderately useful feature of the app and put it behind a paywall without a word of warning. 
I guess it‚Äôs still nice to see an aggregate of my workouts, but no longer can you compare segments to your friends or track your progress. 
Not sure why they thought this was a good idea, but I‚Äôm going to be trying to find an alternative to this because that‚Äôs just bad form. What gets me is that they had a whole array of features that you had to pay for that helped with training, which I don‚Äôt use, so it seems reasonable that those would be premium. Tracking your progress across time should not be a premium feature.
title: Disappointed in Strava

review: I think a private massaging function should be added because you can keep in touch with people better. I‚Äôm on a cross country team and my friend missed practice and he goes to a different school so it is hard for him to get there on time. Or we have early releases and he doesn‚Äôt, so sadly I didn‚Äôt get to run with him today. But our coach wanted me to tell him that he needs to run for 30 minutes, but I can‚Äôt because there is no private messaging function!!!!!! Overall I think the app is great but could use work. Sorry that I was kind of all over the place on that.
title: Private messaging

review: I really want this app to work well with my Apple Watch, it has great features and I‚Äôm paying $80 a year for the full experience. But daily it‚Äôs not time stamping my activities correctly, and usually twice a week I have to manually input an activity because it doesn't upload from my Apple Watch, or my other favorite is how it doesn‚Äôt always share the right amount of workout time with fitness+. So you have to stay on top of your activities because this app is hit and miss as far as if it will work. Bummer, really hoped for a more reliable experience for how much I‚Äôm paying between Strava and Fitness+
title: Glitches at least a couple times a week

review: There is only one requirement I have for this app - ACTIVITIES FROM A CONNECTED DEVICE SHOULD UPLOAD EASILY. Instead, my Apple watch taunts me with "to sync this activity make sure your Apple watch is connected to the network" and the sync button does nothing but return me to the previous screen. Which network, Strava? My four bar 5g connection? Or my 200mb home wifi?  Because I'm connected to both right now and my activities still won't sync. Worse yet, your troubleshooting boils down to "restart your phone and watch, if that doesn't work too bad".   If you aren't able to make the most basic part of your product work consistently, you don't deserve my or anyone else's money. I've been using Strava for nearly ten years but it's time to move on.
title: Long time user who will not be renewing.

review:
Recording and analyzing winter endurance sports feels completely neglected. For starters, backcountry skiing & downhill skiing & snowboarding (and many other activities) are unavailable to track on Apple Watch, which considerably distorts calorie burn statistics. For some odd reason nordic skiing, however, is available. Editing the activity type after recording also doesn‚Äôt appear to correct for the incorrect calorie burn estimates.

Also regarding the watch app, you‚Äôre unable to customize the display to show different information than what is displayed by default. I personally would like the watch to show distance traveled, elevation gained, time traveled, and current HR. 

As far as analysis, I want to be able to edit my dashboard to show my ski touring mileage and other stats (or completely different activities altogether). Instead, Strava defaults the dashboard to show only run, bike, and swim stats. 

There are now a huge number of endurance sports out there for which there are user bases eager to track the information that is pertinent to them and to their specific sports. The interfaces for input and analysis of the data are just too restrictive to garner a positive review.
title: The problem are the interfaces (Watch and iOS).

review: The app is ok...I‚Äôve been using it since early 2015 and lately it seems to be getting worse. I‚Äôve always used an updated version of the IPhone (nothing too old) to run the app. For the first couple of years I would occasionally have a problem with the distance or a line going straight out and back...but lately? If I stop for a traffic light the app goes haywire and has me running in circles until I start moving again. Literally every run registers as me running more because the line will be all scrambled. The other day I ran with friends and Strava said I went 4.71 miles but all my friends registered very close to 4 miles. To be almost 3/4 of a mile off? That‚Äôs way too much for a short, 4 mile run.
title: MEH

review: While most people think of Strava as a an app to track fitness, in reality it is that and much more.  It truly has been the key to a better and richer quality of life for me.  Through it, I‚Äôve gotten over that first awkward bit of not knowing or remembering someone‚Äôs name and allowed me to gain insights into who they really are.  It has been a irreplaceable part of my social circle through we I stay in contact with friends far and near.  Through it my friends and I encourage, tease, joust regularly.  I am generally a quiet and reserved person, but when I‚Äôm exercising that all changes and Strava basically allows me to carry over that openness to the rest of my life.
title: What is Strava

review: As a runner and a mountain biker, I love everything about Strava- I even use the app to keep track (and try to keep up) with my friends who do the same! One star docked from the review for a lack of a very simple feature- the ability to add a spin ride. I spin through the winter when I can‚Äôt ride, but for YEARS there has been no ability to add a spin ride, even though I can add ‚ÄòNordic Ski‚Äô ‚ÄòRick climbing‚Äô and ‚ÄòSnowshoe‚Äô activities. Seems like it would be an easy fix, but multiple forums online bemoan the long term omission and apparent lack of attention to users over this simple feature. It‚Äôs too bad, as the app is sooo close to being an all-in-one fitness tracker for me...
title: Great!

review:
I've been using strava for years, and aside from the occasional trouble losing the GPS signal, it's been relatively consistent.
With this newest version, 147, though, it adds an extra 14% distance to the route. This is the same route I do every week, and the previous, shorter distance lines up more closely with the parks map distance. 
The longer recorded distance completely changed my recorded pace, and makes it look like I'm running significantly faster than I am. It has ruined my attempt to track my progress, as the numbers are now virtually meaningless.
title: Version 147 ruins distance measurement

review: I‚Äôve used this app a few times on some really long bike routes for races and would have been totally screwed on race day if it wasn‚Äôt for painted road markers. It‚Äôs a great app for doing routes you already know by heart and for recording a freestyle route but trying to match somebody else‚Äôs in a city or part of town you‚Äôve never been in can be very tedious and frustrating when you have to check your phone to make sure you‚Äôre still on course. But if you know everything and you‚Äôre a human GPS, this app can take you to the next level.
title: Please add verbal turn-by-turn directions

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava since 2010 and really have been happy with the whole experience. The feature updates and privacy controls introduced over the years have kept it leading edge and fun. I love seeing old rides and bringing back memories of when I was in great fitness and also when I was struggling. I‚Äôve made many friends by meeting them and sharing rides. It‚Äôs still amazing that you can scroll through and only see following friends but no ads! I‚Äôd say this is the best social media platform available üôÇ
title: Long time user

review:
I started out cycling with MapMyRide but as they say: ‚ÄúAll Children Grow Up.‚Äù
Strava has been a great tool for me to track my progress as an athlete, which I never seriously thought of myself as prior. I‚Äôve ridden further and stronger than I thought I could, not BECAUSE of the app, but WITH the app‚Äôs help.
Strava has also given me access to a community from which I‚Äôve made several new solid friendships based on a mutual love of cycling.
I recommend going ‚ÄòPremium‚Äô with this app. $60 (or so) a year is a paltry fee for what you get... They did it right and they did it well.
title: Works Great!

review: I have created over 90 routes on this app over the years and cannot for the life of me figure out why Strava would not allow me to search for the route rather than scrolling through all of my routes. What is the purpose of naming a route if I can‚Äôt search for it? It seems like a huge oversight! And now, in this latest series of updates, when I favourite a route that changes nothing. It used to prioritize the favored routes to the top of the list, but now nothing happens. So, what is the purpose of using the favorites if it doesn‚Äôt prioritize the route and put it at the top of the list? That coupled with not being able to search for the route makes this app nearly unusable.
title: Cannot search routes

review: Please, please Zwift....keep the sport clean and fun by strictly enforcing removal of people who choose to apply grotesque swears words as their names ( there are children watching and riding/running) or those who want to bring politics onto the screen whilst we‚Äôre all riding.  Getting on Zwift is supposed to be an opportunity to leave the world behind for an Time as well as a break from the social media ‚Äúcall out crowd‚Äù,  those who choose to say and do things blindly behind the veil of E-nonymity.  I think I speak for the majority using your great app: don‚Äôt let it be poisoned by these people with no class, etiquette or manners.
title: Swear words and Politics

review: Used app for four years. Loved it. Was bummed about loosing certain features like reviewing segments when subscription was introduced. So I decided to go big and pay for the yearly subscription. Only to find out that my membership never upgraded and it is stuck on the ‚Äúfree‚Äù version. Even though I‚Äôve paid. Not a huge deal... just check in with customer service. Except customer service is non existent. I sent in a request form over a week ago and have heard nothing back. I‚Äôm paying for the free subscription and I‚Äôm pretty annoyed that no one has contacted me to help troubleshoot. C‚Äômon strava! Paying for a subscription, the service should get better, not worse!
title: Love app but customer service is non existent

review: I used Strava pretty regularly, because it has worked well with my Apple Watch and I enjoy the Summit features. My watch and Strava recently stopped syncing. I went to the website and read the FAQ, then followed the steps (twice) before reaching out to their support team. They sent me an automated message in response, directing me back to the FAQ I told them in the message I‚Äôd already used. Two weeks later, and still no response (despite the fact a customer service employee has interacted with my request, merging the ticket). This is pretty disappointing - I had paid for the year subscription in a bundle, and now the service isn‚Äôt working. I‚Äôd advise against doing what I did - if the app stops working, you won‚Äôt get help and you‚Äôll be out the subscription fee. Stick to the free version.
title: Poor Customer Service

review: I never knew that I will be so loyal to any app on the phone. Though I use other Workout apps needed for a specific activity, Strava is the most used app for all my outdoor activities. There are no gimmicks or tricks in this app to get you sign up for a paid version. The free version is equally good for most users. I consider myself a highly active person and still use the free version. It‚Äôs the most reliable, easy to use, easily integrated, no battery hogger and free app that I have used for many many years. Kudos to Strava team.
title: Most reliable app ever

review: The kudos are cool but even if you‚Äôre not totally into the social side of it, Strava helps you track your fitness and explore areas around you. Premium is worth it in having access to friendly competition in the segments and challenges and I get so much use out of the route builder, especially when traveling since it helps you see common paths the locals enjoy. Super easy integration for your fitness trackers and other apps, and the camaraderie and support you can find in the communities is like nowhere else!
title: So many sweet features!

review:
I tried to contact support because after being charged $65 for a premium sub, my account was still showing as ‚Äúfree‚Äù tier. ‚ÄúSupport‚Äù is just a FAQ that tells you to tap ‚Äúrestore purchases‚Äù, which does nothing. There‚Äôs no phone number or chat available. I sent an email. So far, terrible terrible service. 

Update: After 5 days, Strava had not updated my account to reflect my purchase, and the customer service rep was just emailing me their FAQ and Troubleshooting guide. Absolute disgrace of a customer service from this app. I have no idea if the technical features are good, because I literally cannot buy a subscription from them, but I have to assume they are terrible based on my experience so far. I charged back my $65.
title: Charged me $65, didn‚Äôt upgrade account, no customer service

review: This is one of the best cycling/running apps that I have used over the years. It can track your location mid ride/run if you check it often and it doesn‚Äôt take much time to load ( 30 secs top). It does have one downside though, it is that you have to use the internet on you phone or computer to put in your gear. It also has a social thing where you can see what you or your friends are doing or see where they have been riding/running that week. Overall this is a very good app and I highly suggest downloading it. So have fun and happy trails everyone.
title: 5‚≠êÔ∏è app

review: For us non subscribers, the features Strava keeps taking away, have made this app worthless in terms of being a social site. All this app can do (unless you pay for it) is track your daily times and show you how far behind from the top ten you are. And it doesn‚Äôt even do that accurately when compared to other gps apps. I was tempted to pay because I missed the leaderboards. But after this latest low blow to get more subscribers I‚Äôve become more determined to find a new app. The social aspect was the only thing keeping me with Strava as I am not a professional, I‚Äôm not training for anything, and I can‚Äôt even ride all year long in my state.  So disappointed in how the executives have decided to run Strava. Who are you taking advice from? A teenager?
title: Not social anymore

review:
Fails to accurately record calories.  Doesn‚Äôt read weight, height, or other data from Apple Health.  I had to go to their website (!?) and log in to even input my weight at all in order to get it to say anything other than 0 calories.  Doesn‚Äôt accurately record data to Apple Health either!  Creates duplicate or triplicate entries of each data field in Apple Health every time I run / hike / etc.  I have to manually delete these duplicates otherwise my daily metrics (which are used by other apps) are all screwed up.

So it‚Äôs not really an effective fitness app.  For mapping purposes, Gaia GPS is far superior.  I suppose some people might like the social aspect here, but that‚Äôs of almost no interest to me.

It has nice visual design, which is a plus for any app.  But without key functionality, that doesn‚Äôt count for much.
title: Nearly useless

review: This app is such a great way to keep track of workouts and general fitness. This app has a few minor inconveniences like not having all types of workouts or randomly crashing (but I think that‚Äôs just my phone from the prehistoric era). My favorite feature/features of the app are probably the maps and routes. I do wish that more was open to non- subscribers but I understand marketing and it is what it is. This is my first recommendation to somebody trying to track their fitness and record their workouts. 10/10
title: üòé

review: I have been a Strava user for about 2 years and love it for the most part. I am rating it a single star because the engineers need to get their stuff together. I am trying premium for this month as the free thing but don‚Äôt see a need to keep it and pay anything when there is no true integration between the Apple Watch and the iPhone app. Many apps have the watch and phone apps sync up with no issue and yet I read on the Strava website that Strava puts this feature with low priority. So the dilemma is use the iPhone app so you can use the beacon, but no heart rate is recorded, or use the watch app to get the heart rate but loose beacon and you can‚Äôt see where you are in the route. Not enticing to pay for an app that won‚Äôt integrate fully. Needless to say I won‚Äôt be continuing with premium until this is remedied.
title: Should be 5 stars but...

review: Strava used to be really good as a free app. Now with recent updates, they have taken a lot away. Such as building your route, leaderboards and tracking weekly progress. I can no longer go in and view last weeks mileage as of August 15th 2020. What‚Äôs the point of tracking mileage, if you can‚Äôt see previous weeks? I think taking free features away and hiding them behind a paywall is a very poor business model. Shame on you Strava. It‚Äôs not like they came out with new features and charged you for those. Might I make a suggestion as well. Your segments are great, but you should put what that person ran total mileage and total average pace as well. That way you can see who was sniping segments vs the real runners who just took segments while on a normal run.
title: Poor updates

review: Strava is an absolute game-changer for fitness enthusiasts! Whether you're a runner, cyclist, or just someone looking to track their fitness journey, Strava's intuitive interface and community-driven features make it the go-to platform. The route discovery, competitive segments, and detailed analytics offer insights into your performance like no other app. But beyond the metrics, it's the global community of athletes that truly sets Strava apart, making every workout feel like part of a larger, supportive network. A must-have for anyone passionate about their fitness goals!
title: Game changer

review: I have enjoyed Strava for a few years and I‚Äôve even used premium (now summit) for a while. I stopped using summit due to the free app being so good. I really haven‚Äôt missed much in the premium feature set. I can understand taking away segments, matched runs and even the social aspects of the app to free members. I‚Äôm not okay with Strava charging me to have access to my own training log. I joined Strava to track my running electronically and to have a consistent place to keep my data whether I run with a Garmin, Suunto, Polar, Coros or something else. I won‚Äôt pay to access the data that I‚Äôve provided to Strava. I‚Äôll be looking elsewhere unless the training log becomes free again. Suunto‚Äôs app is terrible but at least they don‚Äôt charge me to look at MY data.
title: Review for the new update

review: I love Strava and will gladly bring it back up to 5-stars, but they need to fix the latest way of stopping a session on your phone. They removed the ability delete a session before you save it. This is critical for anyone that runs multiple sessions (eg one on the phone and one on the watch) to allow things like a beacon (not available on the watch) and heart rate (clearly needs the watch). Unfortunately, this latest update forces you to save both before you delete one - which screws up PRs, is confusing (they both default to the same name - how do I know which one has my heart rate?), etc. Please go back to the way it was.  And to make it even better, please add beacon to the watch and the ability to modify the Strava Apple Watch face so I can choose what it shows (eg elevation vs ride time).
title: Latest Release Stinks

review: Why can‚Äôt I use the Apple Watch for heart rate analysis while using the iPhone app? This is a critical missing function! I was under the impression that this was possible with this app so I paid for the premium membership. Turns out, you only get heart rate analysis when using the Watch app. The watch app is more dumbed down as it only lets you select from a few predefined activities. After my ride with the watch I have to open up the phone app and edit in all the missing details like equipment used. You also can not select a route on the watch! I will be going back to Cyclemeter where I get all of the analysis info on my phone screen and the heart rate from my watch at a 1/5 of the price.
title: No Apple Watch Heart Rate Monitor when Using Phone App

review: I wanted to like strava because of the analysis it gives, and cool features. I can‚Äôt get over how inaccurate the data for a run can be. Other apps like MapMyRun must use more than straight GPS (maybe cell tower triangulation or some smoothing algorithm) to make your runs more accurate. As it is, this tool is useless to me and I could never see paying for it. I did a run today and it showed I ran .36 further than I actually did on a short 4 mile run. Every aspect of this tool is to analyze workouts based on data such as GPS, HR, etc, but as the saying goes - garbage in, garbage out. I see people reporting this as far back as at least 2 years :/
title: Inaccurate

review: I run only with my cellular Apple Watch and AirPods to track my runs with Strava but the app is lacking. For a fitness app that tracks so many stats it will be nice for some custom options to view on the Watch app like cadence and alarms for pace and distance markers. Music integration on a separate page will be a great add on as I have to switch apps on the watch while running and it can effect my pace to do that. Overall I‚Äôm happy with the Strava app on the iPhone with the PRs and segment times that are great to see improvements. It can be better and these are some things that the basic fitness app on the Apple Watch includes.
title: Apple Watch app needs improvements

review: Okay so this app rocks, I‚Äôve been getting more friends to use it and we all have a lot of fun with it. My only complaint is that I‚Äôm currently having an issue with the gps reliability. More often than not now, I‚Äôll start recording for a bike ride, and for the first mile or two, it won‚Äôt actually track me. So then when it eventually starts working, there‚Äôs just a straight diagonal line from where I start to where the Gps starts working properly. So I‚Äôm losing ride time, distance, and segment challenges. If they could fix this bug in an update soon, that would be very much appreciated.
title: Love it but currently needs a bug fix

review: I‚Äôve been using it for 6 - 7 years. It‚Äôs gotten me through so much. Without this app I‚Äôd have never finished any of my marathons or training runs. The data is presented beautifully, with minimal glitches and user interface issues. Almost none if I were being honest. You can view your runs, talk to friends, track fitness, and get detailed information on many aspects of endurance training. It‚Äôs especially useful for bikers and open water swimmers. There‚Äôs only good things to say‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs unmatched. Hopefully it stays that way.
title: BEST APP IN THE WORLD

review:
I don‚Äôt own a smart bike or smart treadmill that would send my times and mileage to Strava.  I‚Äôd love to see the spinning ‚Äúscroll‚Äù to times and mileage turned into a number pad where you can just input numbers.  This may seem small, but when your runs and rides are in the 50-minute mark or your mileages are in the high 20s, just punching in those numbers instead of scrolling that wheel forever would be a big improvement.

Also - I don‚Äôt want to pay for this app. Stop telling me to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù every time I do ANYTHING on this app üòÇ
title: Would love to see the scroll to times/mileage disappear

review:
To feed my mental attitude I must be able to see my progress. Strava does just that. Due to my work schedule most of my riding is done alone, with STAVA I am virtually connected to all my cycling friends. If I slack off they will all know it. The accountability and encouragement by them is extremely helpful to my continued success. When I post a ride my results are there for everyone to see, I like it that way. 
When I‚Äôm feeling a little down about my progress It‚Äôs astounding to look back and see the impressive gains from when I first began my cycling adventures. Thank You STRAVA üòä
title: Progress You Can See

review: I have had Strava for about a year and a half now and let me say, it's amazing. The amount of features that you get without paying the subscription is outstanding. The app got even better for me when in January, I purchased an Apple Watch Series 4. It works seemlessly on my watch, tracking all my segments and such correctly. The app has motivated me with its challenges and social aspect to get out more and run/ride/hike etc. I have lost nearly 30lbs since the beginning of the year and Strava has certainly helped. Hope to see the app get even better with time.
title: Amazing app.

review: This company refuses to listen to its customers, refused to support people who cannot run or who cannot bike. There are millions of people who due to physical limitation or age, cannot run or bike. On this companies forums there are a multitude of people who have requested walks be added as an activity, from 2012 to the present day nothing has been done and the company continues to ignore its customers. What does this say about this company? It says they don‚Äôt care, they do what they want to do. I used to pay for a subscription to Strava, but after seeing the way this company treats its users, the people who write their paycheck, I canceled my subscription and went with a competing product. If you can‚Äôt listen to your customers you don‚Äôt deserve to be doing business with anyone! It‚Äôs an absolute disgrace!
title: This is the worst company and the worst app

review:
I have has Starva for a few years now. I didn‚Äôt use it for about a year, but during the time I did use it I had just the basic items. The mapping time and distance travelled in my wheelchair it was great it really encouraged me to do more. 
But then after that year of being out not able to roll, I assume Starva made a change. So I went back to rolling and it won‚Äôt keep working, it keeps asking me to do the 30 day trial. Not happening. I don‚Äôt need all of that fancy stuff on it, I‚Äôm not spending the money on it. 
So I will delete the app, don‚Äôt like doing so it was just right for someone like me needing the basic information.
title: Disappointed

review: Strava has made one of the best GPS exercise social media apps. But the lack of features and customization typical in a standard GPS watch is very disappointing. Please add the ability to take manual splits with a double tap to the Apple Watch version of the app! Also, the ability to customize the metrics for the watch app display is badly needed. These missing features make the Apple Watch app version inferior to a standard GPS watch. Lastly, please add the ability to build workouts for runs, such as intervals based on time or distance, so that we can do basic workouts like fartleks, mile reps, and lactate threshold distance based workouts.
title: Add splits for Apple Watch

review: I adore Strava! I first used it as a road cyclist and was super into segments, and competing with myself most of all, always trying to best my last ride. Now, I still enjoy Strava for biking, but I also walk my dogs and hike with my dogs using the app. It is such a reliable app, doesn‚Äôt have a lot of bugs, and is really easy to use compared with other active lifestyle apps. I highly recommend this app for cyclists, and anybody who wants to record their activities. You can use it for biking, running, walking, hiking, and more!
title: Best active lifestyle app!

review:
I have been using Strava for a long time - 4 years or so. As of the last update, they added a feature that when you start an activity a window pops up that makes you select an activity, then you have to hit Start again to start the activity. This is SO ANNOYING. Why do I have to click 3 buttons to do one thing? Please revert back to the old way of starting an activity.
Besides this new, highly annoying, nonsensical feature Strava is the greatest distance and elevation tracking app available. If you bike, run, or hike I highly recommend it (assuming they FIX THE START FEATURE).
title: New Start feature on mobile is TERRIBLE

review:
I‚Äôm an ex-racer who left riding for years because I was lacking a place where I could compete without the pressure of having to train at the same level as I did while racing. I‚Äôve been hooked on Strava for 5+ years and its to this app that I‚Äôm back on the bike and enjoying it.

I travel quite a lot and find the best rides to download from looking up segments in the area I‚Äôm traveling to, and then downloading rides from the local top KOMers.  Those are typically the folks that know the best rides IMO.  

Keep up the good work Strava, and thanks!
title: Best thing to happen to cycling in the past 15 years

review: Pls never take a free trial with them coz if you forget its over you will never get it, in my case it was an annual one and the amount got deducted and when i raised multiple queries through app no one responded, finally when i contacted Apple , they gave me Strava developers contact link and those people have been telling me to get refund from Apple and Apple was telling to get refund from Strava, basically it was a merry go around situation and i had lost my job and every penny was important to me, due to my situation and travelling out of country due to personal reasons, never even used this app. But no one understood my situation and i never got the money so pls never ever put free trials or put reminders coz if you forget in an emergency ur done
title: Shame on you Strava for looting people‚Äôs money

review: Have used this to track my runs for two years now and loved it!  Especially with the audio cues I got through my Bluetooth headphones.  I was massively disappointed then when I recently bought an Apple Watch to help track my heart rate and learned that strava doesn‚Äôt play audio cues through Bluetooth headphones while using the app through the Apple Watch.  So I essentially have to choose whether to use the app through the phone and get audio cues and sacrifice heart rate feedback, or through the Apple Watch and get heart rate but sacrifice audio cues.   Till this is fixed, this is a 3 star app for me.
title: Perfect running app‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.except with Apple Watch

review:
Strava just isn‚Äôt able to tell me how far I run. Just today, I went on a 7.5 mile run, and Strava told me I only ran 3. Up until maybe a month or so ago, it would only have these glitches very rarely. However, recently, it always seems to give me wildly inaccurate distances and paces.

And even when it does work, Strava has been pushing their payed membership so hard that they are taking most of the services on the app off the free version. I can no longer see how my efforts compare with each other, or how they compare with other people.

All in all, I would rather just estimate my distance, and then use a stopwatch to time myself than use Strava. It would be more accurate, and wouldn‚Äôt constantly advertise a payed membership.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work

review: I‚Äôve been using strava for a while as it was mandatory as part of a team I‚Äôm on. If it weren‚Äôt mandatory I would stick to Nike Run. Entry for runs and workouts is extremely manual and doesn‚Äôt track changes in speed or intervals unless you use the app to run (which is not ideal). I was excited that they offer API connections with things like Mindbody so that it would cut back on how often I had to manually enter workouts. That is until I realized I had to reset the API connection every time I wanted it to pull in data. And then the API connection broke the entire app on my iPhone and it‚Äôs unusable now. I get an error every time I open it. Thankfully now I don‚Äôt have to track in Strava anymore and can keep my data consistent in Nike and Volt (which offers AI learning and actual programming).
title: Full of Bugs, super manual entry

review:
I fell inlove with my bike and I met strava almost a year after and just fell in love again(; ‚ô• Download it know!!! 

I‚Äôm just not sure why it doesn‚Äôt record some activities, let me explain it: It does tracks the whole activity but (sometimes) if I add some pictures it takes too much time to save/publish it & (sometimes) it just doesn‚Äôt. This has happened to me like 3 time only, and I‚Äôve used it for a year now, with, lets say, 50 activities... 
It may be because of poor internet signal ... perhaps, not sure.
title: Love it

review:
Do I need to buy a desktop computer to create a new segment now?ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Strava has consistently performed poorly on mobile devices. A lot of times links to Strava activities will not work on my phone. Sometimes links will take you to the app for a split second and then force you back to a website that doesn‚Äôt work. Help please!

Also, can I please change my map units of measurement to feet? When I‚Äôm 80 hours into a peakbagging adventure I would prefer not to convert meters on your map to feet on my watch. Why isn‚Äôt that the default in countries where that is the default?
title: Can we please use this ‚Äúmobile app‚Äù on our phones?

review: This app has made my cycling way more enjoyable when I get back and get to share where I have been to my friends and.... strangers? One thing I don‚Äôt like is that anyone can see exactly where I live. It would be very appreciated if there was an option to grey out a vicinity around my neighborhood or maybe 2500ft radius around my home. It concerns me that I can see people‚Äôs starting point which is quite commonly their own home. Please let me know if you take this review into consideration. I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you. -Kurt
title: Love this but please read this developers

review: I‚Äôve been with Strava from almost the very beginning. In the past year each time I get an update there‚Äôs one feature taken away and held ransom if you don‚Äôt sign up to their membership. They‚Äôve had all these options for many of years and did fine as a company. Figured selling our data would have paid the bills, but turning into a greedy capitalist company seems to be the motivator. Selling point 101...If you‚Äôre going to charge a membership for features at least create/add something new instead of taking away features that have been there forever and charge for that...The only major improvement has been the stress indicator and pace gap indicator. I get more information from my Garmin app than Strava and I don‚Äôt have to pay a ‚Äúmembership‚Äù ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.
title: Less and Less

review:
Was working great, but for the last 2 days I can no longer sync rides from Strava ‚ÄîTO‚Äî the iOS activities/ workouts app. I can pull data from there INTO Strava which is the new feature but it no longer pushes data from Strava to the iOS workouts. Please fix.

Update: seems there is a new setting in Strava>settings>health to toggle sending new activities to Health. That needs to be on. Considering I can‚Äôt find any way to send them manually and you grant Strava access to write to workouts this should be on if you allow those permissions. But whatever, seems to work now.
title: Update seems to have broken iOS sync

review: I like your app but why am I not allowed to see my efforts on segments anymore? Kinda BS.  My friends and me use the free version of strava and we like being able to compare our times on segments were kinda broke and in college. This app is kinda useless to me now.. Might as well start taking a picture of my gps route and uploading it to Instagram. Did plan on eventually buying summit or whatever but not out of spite I‚Äôm re considering it. The free segments thing is what turned me on to strava in first place now there gone.
title: SEGMENTS

review: Wow! Love the idea. Many at the top of leader board must also. Segments must not work unless you have an expensive GPS. Because that is what the people on leader board seem to have. I Read and followed instructions. Just ended up frustrated. Don't need that from my recreation. I'm not nearly smart enough to tell the developer what to do about faulty GPS and cellular signals.
