But if your going to make an app run on a phone, it should do what it claims. Biked through segment six times Sunday. App never picked it up. Went to website as directed. Clicked don't see segment. Segment does not appear in search, even though I find it and a leader board, in app, and on website. Trip miles are wrong. Max speed is wrong. Seems pretty useless. Going back to riding without my phone. More peaceful anyways.
title: Great concept poor execution

review: I started looking into Strava when I started competitively mountain biking, and was extremely disappointed when I installed the app. I was first able to sign in through my email, which went smooth but as soon as the set up was finished I was continuously getting error and try again messages when trying to navigate the app. After fiddling around for way too long trying to get it to work I decided to delete the app and try again. And to my surprise I was not even able to sign in nor was I able to create a new account through my Email, my Google, my Apple ID or anything else which had left me here looking for answers and possibly a different app. Overall I am extremely disappointed.
title: Can‚Äôt even login

review: I've mainly used strava for tracking my runs, see pace, distance, etc. Strava is great for that and offers a social aspect where you can see friends activity, although I've never used it. Recently though it completely broke for me, I'm getting a 403 on everything except recording a run which means I can't save the stats or compare with previous runs. I've tried redownloading to no avail. Support articles on the issue are nonexistent.  There isn't a way for me to log out either, the bottom menu is screwed up so the icons overlap. Not sure whats happening but pretty disappointed. Apps have bugs, but this completely broke the app to the point that I can't even log out to fix it.
title: Good stat tracker until recently

review:
I‚Äôve been using Strava for years.  This year it has really helped my wife and I become more physically active, we‚Äôve been setting goals and Strava made it fun to meet them.  My wife loved that it showed how many miles she's gone over the month.

They recently removed this feature in the free version, putting it behind the pay wall.  Pretty sad.  So now you're not paying for new features, you're paying for features you used to have.  Not going to happen, $60 is too much.  We might pay a one time $5 charge or something, but we aren't going to add another subscription.  

Thanks for the help over the years, Strava, but I guess it's time we move on.  Sorry you've become sellouts.
title: Removing features for pay wall.

review:
The annual subscription is well worth the price for the resources it provides. When you‚Äôre around home you can match up similar routes and workouts and track your progress. When you‚Äôre away, you can easily find a good route and get a good workout in.

Syncs the all kinds of devices and apps.

All the while supporting and being supported by a huge community of athletes.  This is just a great tool for slightly serious, semi-serious and serious athlete. Go for it!
title: The App for athletes‚Ä¶serious and otherwise

review:
The almost never announced steep price increase for current subscribers was a joke. This thing ain‚Äôt worth no $80 a year. It was barley worth $60 a year. They claim they added all these new features which is garbage. They refused to acknowledge the secrecy of the price hike and then after they were called out they finally sent emails out to address it. Never apologized for their shadiness. I canceled my subscription which ends in 2 months Now on top of that, the app constantly shows an icon that represents that I have 4 notifications when I only have 1 or 2 or 3 or 5 or 6. It always shows 4. 
The App is ok but it isn‚Äôt worth 3 stars and with the garbage this company pulled on its loyal user base, this whole thing is worth -5 stars
title: No reason for steep price increase

review:
Updating my review to 5 stars after Strava reversed its decision not to sync to Apple health data from 3rd party apps. Strava is the perfect central hub to integrate my cycling apps (TrainerRoad and Garmin Connect) into one database to track performance, as well as communicate health stats seamlessly in the Apple ecosystem. As I have become a more avid cyclist, I have definitely found value in Strava‚Äôs services for tracking performance and trends and, as a result, am an annual subscriber.

Thank you for listening to your customers!
title: For me, my ride never happened if not uploaded to Strava!

review:
Just a a big fail with the watch app where it recorded a half-marathon race as an indoor treadmill so I lost all GPS data & inaccurate distance. Thankfully I could delete it and use my official time, but really want those splits. 

Watch app should allow for more config of the screen, like instant pace, current split avg pace, current activity avg pace, goals, bigger HR display. Also would prefer if I could have the phone app be the main recording device and use the watch as my ‚Äúdisplay‚Äù.
title: Almost great, but watch app needs work

review:
If you want an app for cycling and you get your motivation internally, not needing competition or ‚Äúat-a-boys‚Äù from others, then don‚Äôt use this app - it‚Äôs terrible compared to Samsung Health. 

I just wanted a native IOS app that would get my heart rate from my Apple Watch and display out on the screen while cycling. I wanted to be able to customize the display, which shows while cycling. Strava locks you into a basic display of mostly less useful artistic for my needs. 

In going back to Samsung Health, while very disappointed in Apple‚Äôs Fitness app. It‚Äôs even worse than Strava when it comes to cycling. 

Samsung Health allows you to customize the display. It just wasn‚Äôt getting my heart rate, so I was looking for an app that would. Others raved about Strava, but call me old school. I don‚Äôt need to tell the community who I‚Äôve paid money (Venmo) or what my cycling stats were. I don‚Äôt get it. 

Anyway, if you want customization in the app, you‚Äôll have to subscribe and give away a lot of money monthly. No thanks. I don‚Äôt see what all the rave was. Just hype I guess.
title: Requires expensive substitution for even basic features

review:
I really like the social aspect of this app and have enjoyed the fitness tracking. But as I‚Äôve improved and try to compare my performance with previous rides I can see how inaccurate the tracking is. 
I frequently ride the same exact route to track my progress but have found the data to be so inaccurate as to be useless. I first noticed when it said I climbed 1500 feet and I know that hill was 900 the last time.  Other times it recorded it as little as 600 feet. 
Timing in segments is way off too. While trading with other riders, my stats were slower when I clearly finished the segment faster. 
IDK if it‚Äôs the phone, the satellites or the app but I wouldn‚Äôt pay for extra features.
title: Inaccurate tracking

review: Have been loving this app! As a new runner I was excited to have my entire history from my very first run all in one place. Now in week 3 of training for a 10k I‚Äôm starting to appreciate the need for pacing. While I‚Äôve already been a bit frustrated that I can‚Äôt see my current pace (only average pace), today is my first tempo run and being able to see my current pace is kind of important. I was even willing to level up to the paid version to get this feature. But alas, it does not exist. Seems like such a simple thing. I‚Äôm jumping ship to another app solely because of this, couldn‚Äôt bring myself to give more than 2 stars. Makes no sense to me why this feature isn‚Äôt on the menu.
title: Can‚Äôt view current pace

review: Only thing I can criticize is at least one or two times a run it will pause my run without me noticing and will mess up the accuracy of the run.  On at least two occasions it actually ended & recorded my run with out me noticing mid run.  So not sure if there is a sensitivity issue with my arm motion while I‚Äôm running or maybe if sweat drops are hitting the screen in the wrong spot.  Otherwise awesome app, I have never taken my runs as serious as I do now keeping track on the app.  Really makes you push yourself!
title: Great App

review:
Update 5/8/19: They have now broken the social aspect of the app. Now, they‚Äôll bunch up several trips taken over the last few weeks by the acquaintance you follow back out of social obligation, and place them above those of your friends who you know just finished riding. No option to return to chronological order, even temporarily.

Original post: I use this app almost exclusively for bicycle riding, and it has a lot of great functions, including keeping up with friends and clubs.

The most frustrating part of this app is how difficult it can be to find its most useful menus. If you want to set options for all your rides, keeping the screen from going to sleep, letting you know when it's pausing, etc., you have to set those options within a menu for a particular ride. How does that layout suggest that this setting will be applied to future rides? I was lucky to find them in the first place.

It's a little frustrating how much the app depends on the website for certain features, and that stuff should also be emphasized while using the app, because there's a lot more to unlock at the site.
title: Good app whose menus could be better

review:
I use this primarily because I have a Peloton bike.  It‚Äôs OK but there are some definite issues with the app that would cause me to abandon it if not for the Peloton. 

First - it does not automatically synchronize with my apple activity app.  To get it to upload to the activity app after a bike ride is completed, I must go into the Strava App, go into the workout I just completed and review all data.  Only then will it push the workout to the Apple activity app and give me credit for the workout. 

Second - Once the above is done it double pushes the activity to the Apple activity app.  So every workout I complete on Strava shows up two times on apple activity.  Not exactly accurate tally of what I am doing.  

I use Map My Run for all of my other activity tracking and would probably switch to this app if it weren‚Äôt for these annoying issues.  I run, bike and use the peloton.  The only reason I use this app now is because of the integration with the Peloton.  It would be nice if these issues were fixed so it worked seamlessly, and pushed accurate data to the activity app.
title: Meh...needs some work.

review: After years and years of having a free subscription, and really loving the app‚Ä¶ They took away many of the great attributes and pushed us to become paid subscribers. I totally get it and thought it was worth subscribing. Since I‚Äôve subscribed and paid $60, I don‚Äôt see any segments, I don‚Äôt see any PR‚Äòs, the app is always lagging, and today I can‚Äôt even get into it. So essentially, the app went from a free wonderfully working app to a Subscription with nothing but headaches.
title: They‚Äôre making more money and the app is declining

review: Love this app. Use it on my apple watch quite frequently. Wish the interface on the apple watch showed total elevation gain on your cycling ride, like the workout app. Also wish there was a swim feature on strava for apple watch. I have to use other applications to load my data on strava. Other then those small minor tweaks I would do, ive been using strava for years now and has helped me improve on my cycling and running by helping me compete with my friends. Great aspects and best workout app on the market. Thanks strava
title: Strava is overall the best

review: Ive used Strava for about 4 years and its been excellent, very happy with both running and biking activities.  But all of a sudden ver 58 and 59 the GPS tracking basically doesnt work.  I‚Äôll start an activity, it will record my time for the whole duration, but misses half of the distance traveled (ive only been running recently).  The weird thing today, before i saved my activity the map preview actually showed the whole route even though the distance was wrong, but then when i saved it the map changed to a completely different path.  Please fix the app and ill be happy to change my review to 5 stars (if thats possible)!
title: What happened in version 58??

review: Congratulations to the Strava team and PMs for fooling me into NOT unsubscribing. That little in-app survey just after I clicked ‚ÄúCancel subscription‚Äù did wonders in making me believe I was done unsubscribing. Out of all the available options to present your users this survey, you opted for the one that maximizes friction and chance users will inadvertently NOT unsubscribe. Clearly, this tells me you care more about your own marginal profits than your users. Further, although not industry practice, offering a 30-day trial should be extended until the user has sufficiently used the app (e.g: 4 times wouldn‚Äôt be that much for a pro user). I had no time to use Strava during my 30-day pro trial so I don‚Äôt even know what I have been fooled into paying for.
title: Lost trust

review:
My I watch interface works very well with the newest updates.  My I phone works flawlessly.  
It interfaces with My Fitness pall and my weight scale.   I have used this product for years and only have one request.  I dont know how hard it would be, but could you please rotate the screen when using horizontally.  This would be especially helpful when using my IPad with keyboard.  I would not have to lay my head sideways to watch the screen.  Otherwise, this is a great product.  Thank you for your excellent work.
title: Very very happy.  Nice product.

review: This use to be a  good app but it‚Äôs trying to become like Facebook rather  than an athletic  one app.  The ‚Äúsuggested follow‚Äù is annoying as hell. The inability of the app to go beyond 1 decimal point  is annoying. Strava  will also scrub mileage and speed off may activities. The app forces  you to go online to add things like Shoes etc. this is something that you can do on Garmin. The 3 premium subscription is set up to charge you more in the near future. While this was the best  app years  ago  it has not made any real improvement in years while others have.  Garmin will give you all the Premium data like ‚Äúsafety‚Äù for free. Strava charges $2/month.
title: Had become a so so all

review:
I enjoy using the app for tracking workouts and seeing what my friends across the world are up to.

I previously left a review stating that the synchronization of workouts from Apple Health (created using the Apple Watch workout app) to Strava wasn‚Äôt working, but I found out it was due to some privacy settings set in Apple Health!

It now works and I was delighted to see even walks recorded with the workout app are available for import, since I tend to spontaneously start running with my puppy.
title: Great social media for workouts

review:
Strava is great, can‚Äôt argue with that; *however* whenever i try to add photos to an activity, it just crashes as i am choosing the photo.
I am running ios 11.2.6 on iphone 6 plus (been happening on previous versions and same issue on my other 4s device), this has been happening to me for more than 6 months now and i let it go cause it works after several attempts and hope that in the next update it will be fixed, it doesn‚Äôt. 
Nothing wrong with importing photos to any other app ever no matter how much apps are running. Just fix it.
title: Crashes needs to be fixed

review:
Since I joined cross country and track for high school, I‚Äôve been using Strava for almost all of my activities and I love sharing pictures of my activities with my friends. The one thing I don‚Äôt like about the app is that you can‚Äôt post videos. One of my friends requested pictures and videos from a camp trip and I went to Strava to post them and found I can‚Äôt share most of the stuff in my camera roll without screenshooting a paused clip. 
Overall, it‚Äôs a great app but I still think we should be able to post videos.
title: Posting video/photos

review: I have been using Strava for over four years now, and I still remember the sound of my friend's voice when he first recommended it - "seriously Man, you have to get on Strava".  Whether is it an epic ultra run or a paddle board session with the kids, this app keeps all my friends as well as my kids focused on fitness as a lifestyle, instead of a chore.  My kids love the challenge of placing higher on local segments and I feel like a kid at 50 years old when I am straining to achieve a new best on a segment.  Great idea and thanks for the free motivation!!!
title: Facebook for fitness!

review:
Having used this app for 6 months the free features capabilities have gradually been reducing. Strava are keen to push the premium service round ever corner and your once enjoyed free features seems to disappear with every update and replaced with the prompt to Subscribe..... 
They are now of course adding more value to the subscription model at a cost of annoying the free user base. As a business their most valued asset will aways lie within the capture of your data, so it‚Äôs a fine line between increasing their revenue through subscriptions vs overall user satisfaction.
title: Free version slowly getting worse

review: I use this app almost daily for biking and love almost everything about it. The one thing that drives me crazy is that often I will forget to "end" a ride when I get back to my car, and the app logs my speed and route while driving, thus ruining the overall stats of my ride. There's got to be a way for the app to sense that you're suddenly going 65mph and at the very least send a notification asking if you've stopped biking. Or make rides editable so I can go in after the fact and delete segments that weren't actually part of my ride.
title: Needs an alert feature for ending a ride

review:
A recent problem I‚Äôve noticed is clicking links to Strava and it opens in a browser. This should direct me to the app. This means I have to sign into the mobile web version in order to view the link. I understand mobile app has limitations compared to desktop version. However, I noticed I don‚Äôt get mobile notifications when someone shares a route with me. But I get notifications when I‚Äôm using the desktop site. 

I really like the app and the features but the disparity in experiences is rather frustrating. Also why can‚Äôt I share a route link from my desktop similar from the phone app? Another example of inconsistent experience. 

Here‚Äôs another one: when I click a link to a Strava activity from Twitter, why does the App Store open and not the Strava app?

Lastly, can we see mile or km splits on route maps? If Garmin can do this surely Strava can‚Ä¶
title: Love the app. Hate the inconsistency in experience

review:
Love the app and yes I pay for it. It‚Äôs a pretty great and really helps with training. The social element is useful as well

My biggest complaint, which is small, is the fact that when I run, it won‚Äôt tally up the times.  it‚Äôll tell my my mile splits( very helpful) but it won‚Äôt add them up at a quick glance in the app. For example, it‚Äôll tell me 8:00, 8:00and 7:00 but won‚Äôt tally them up telling me it‚Äôs a 23:00. Small detail but a pain. It‚Äôll tell me overall but won‚Äôt tell me each mileage total time.
title: Pretty good but not perfect

review: The clock on Strava is inaccurate sometimes. There has been many a time that I will start running and start Strava but my the time I check again it says it has been 8 minutes and I‚Äôm only on my first mile? I know this is not true because I take note of the time I start running and it is very frustrating because I do not get accurate stats. Another issue I have with this app is the pause button, whenever I pause the clock doesn‚Äôt stop, this happened to me earlier and I was extremely angry because I had to pause to take off my jacket and it added 2 minutes to my time, I don‚Äôt know if this is an isolated incident or if it has happened to others. Strava please fix this issue
title: Inaccurate stats

review: I love Strava, but wish there was a way to share certain activities with groups I‚Äôm in without having to set my profile to share with everyone. Same goes for when I would like to enter certain challenges that require the organizer to be able to view activities. It‚Äôs a bummer to not have this option to engage more but while still maintain privacy from the general public for privacy and safety reasons. I imagine this issue likely impacts women or others wanting the safety of privacy more than other groups.
title: Love it but would like more privacy and sharing alternatives

review:
Strava took years of goodwill and killed it with this latest update.  They need to make money; I get it. But taking away functionality that has been part of the basic app for years is ill advised.  They want us to pay to even see our own prior rides!!!  I‚Äôm out.  Looking for a new training partner.

Update 1:  turn off your data feed.  No reason to continue to give them the data they want you to pay for.

Update 2: Jumbo: Privacy did a similar move and took existing functionality and moved it into the paid app.  However, Jumbo allowed its existing users to keep the functionality and made the change effective for new customers.  Jumbo A+, Strava F.  Learn Strava.  Many of your legacy users that made you so popular are now vocal critics.
title: Bait and switch

review: Sad to see the Strava team get greedy during the pandemic. When COVID-19 caused many people to lose their jobs and outlets for exercise, Strava started to become more popular (because people started using their app to plan exercise outdoors). Instead of reducing prices like many other companies are doing in the wake of the pandemic, Strava chose to switch many of their free services to be exclusive subscription services. You can no longer plan any route without paying for a subscription. This app has always been very glitchy but was starting to be a helpful resource to build community during social distancing efforts. Bummed that the Strava leadership is making decisions to profit financially instead of serve their communities.
title: Strava got greedy when their users needed them most

review:
I have been using Strava for 7 years now and have always loved ability to compare my rides with my friends and others in my area. With this latest update requiring a subscription to be able to access any of the features of this app is a complete slap in the face to long time users who have been loyally using the app and promoting it to their friend and family. 
I understand the new features that require a subscription but to make the app essentially just a map just is getting greedy without thinking of the thousands who use the app. 
I really hope the makers wake up and realize what they have done before they lose the majority of their users.
title: Strava not loyal to it‚Äôs loyal customers

review: I‚Äôm a premium member and have been using the watch app for over a year, and have really enjoyed the app. But the latest update broke all syncing. I‚Äôm sick of being pushed around between apps when updates break things‚ÄîI started using Strava when Runkeeper broke the heart rate functionality from the phone, but at least their watch app has it. Please fix it and test things thoroughly before pushing them out in the future. An old app that works is always better than a new broken one.
title: Latest update breaks watch app

review: I was a Strava summit paying member but I‚Äôm not anymore. I love Strava and upload on every ride, but paying for summit simply is not worth it. The feature I loved was fitness and freshness and relative effort, but these metrics are completely meaningless once you complete a ride and either forget your power meter or HR monitor, or, the devices disconnect or report incorrect data. Once this happens you are simply unable to manually input this data and your fitness and freshness metrics are completely wrong. Every other training platform (TrainerRoad, training peaks, others) doesn‚Äôt fail in this way, and is therefore so much more worth it from a training tool standpoint. Don‚Äôt waste your money, upload your rides and interact with friends, but Strava metrics are awful
title: Strava Summit is Incompetent Training Tool

review: This has been one of the more comprehensive workout apps. I have 2 suggestions: include .01 miles for runners, and make the watch app a little less finicky. I'm always struggling to get it to start up at the beginning of a workout, or after pausing to restart. That can cost valuable time when you're doing speed workouts... I've seen some apps use a twist of the dial for starting or stopping, or a hard press on the face. Either way would work better than tapping a tiny icon and hoping for the best. I love the app, especially the social aspect, it just needs some fine tuning.
title: Good... But

review:
While so many apps I've tried boast about the bells and whistles they've been able to incorporate, Strava has taken a more less is more approach. They track runs accurately, analyze data and provide helpful feedback. While my NikePlus friends list was longer, my real life engagement with the few Strava followers is far more meaningful and beneficial to my running goals. I'd categorize Strava as an app for real runners. Skip the frills and just run. 
I'm a fan of this app and look forward to years of running with it.
title: Does what it's meant for well

review: Strava is my favorite app of all time!! As am avid runner, cyclist and outdoor enthusiast, I start and end every workout and journey on this app. I love being able to see routes in my area and post pictures and comment on my friends workouts. It‚Äôs honestly how I keep up with a lot of my college teammates (rowers have taken over Strava). I love the community and the encouragement I receive when I get out and move, no matter what activity! I feel motivated and empowered by the magic of this app. Kudos Strava team!
title: Kudos to you!

review:
*** edit Nov 18, 2020 ‚Äî they reactivated Bluetooth HR support so I bumped rating back up to 5 stars and signed up for Summit again.   It was a real pain having to record rides in a different app and then transfer to Strava.  Glad they reconsidered their position on this ****
Have used Strava for over 15,000 miles of cycling but suddenly they decided to remove the ability to link to my Bluetooth heart rate sensor, which had worked flawlessly for years.   Have cancelled my paid Summit membership and am looking for alternatives
title: App ruined;  heart sensors no longer supported

review: I think this is a great app. It is able to map your activities, and there are so many options to choose from. What‚Äôs really cool is it has segments so as you are having fun outside it can still challenge you. But there is a problem, I did a challenge where it was a free prize of 100 minutes of activity, but when I go to claim my prize and I‚Äôm about check out it brings me to shipping the the stupid shipping cost was the same price as the item itself so it wasn‚Äôt actually free. All in all it is still a great app and I use it a bunch.
title: Awesome app

review:
Read their blog and latest policies, and make your own determination whether they should be receiving your money.  The app itself is fine but since switching to a competing app, I realized I could get the same exact thing for less than half the price, and without the politically alienating commentary.

When they opened their mouth, they decided to throw away money.  I hope they SINCERELY believe what they preach and are prepared for any backlash.  I am not a bad person but they decided to tell me I am for beliefs I hold.  If one side can boycott and cancel all over the place, then so can the other, as we should at this point.

App developers should use more discretion when getting involved in today's issues.  Just stick to the app!
title: They decided to alienate me with their politics

review: I have been out of road cycling for about 30 years, been mountain biking, but decided it was time to get back into the pure exhilaration that is road cycling. I had a friend recommend Strava. Did the free version for a month and moved over to premium. I‚Äôve had no issues with usability or sophistication. The app gives you what you need to grow or just maintain. The only fault I have found has to do with gps accuracy not the strava app. Velocities seem to be off by 3-5 mph on hard descents. Then again, fast is just fast. Overall a great app.
title: Strava rocks

review: I‚Äôve loved this app for years and it‚Äôs been so helpful to keep track of my training through high school and now college running, but now I‚Äôm afraid to even update the app because everytime I do another basic feature requires a premium subscription. I don‚Äôt need a whole lot when it comes to keeping track of my runs, but being able to see my weekly mileage as well as the previous weeks‚Äô mileage is an absolute must. I‚Äôm just begging that y‚Äôall bring back the weekly mileage feature for non-premium users because your app is excellent otherwise and I‚Äôd like to keep using it :-(
title: Strava is now a strava premium feature

review: I originally rated Strava 3 stars, but after repeatedly failing to capture GPS data during my runs (and failing to even import the amount of time I ran) I have to give the app a 1 star rating. All of the features in the app - paid and free - are contingent on the ability to record time and distance. Without that the app is utterly useless. I wrote into support asking to help since Strava has now failed to record GPS data on 4 of my last 5 runs. It‚Äôs been over a week with no response, which leads me to believe that management at Strava is completely inept. Instead of stuffing the app with useless monetization features focus on making your app performant - otherwise all of the up-sells in the world won‚Äôt keep you in business.
title: Hate to say, but Strava is a 1 star app

review: Only recently was I turned on to Strava, they had me at first! Everything was awesome, seeing segments and where I stood overall, yearly, and even daily was wicked cool! Now though, most of that has gone to ‚Äúpay to know‚Äù data, which is not really why I use this app. I‚Äôve loved connecting with people and seeing their rides and our times matched up, but now I‚Äôd have to pay to have that feature which isn‚Äôt why I used this app in the first place...the FREE stuff was why I was here. I don‚Äôt ride enough to want or let alone need to pay for this content. It‚Äôs just unfortunate that you HAVE/HAD a good thing going for ya, then you had to shoot yourself in the foot and make it pay to play...no thanks!
title: Loved it while it lasted

review:
I‚Äôve been a loyal Strava user since 2015, and was using it seamlessly with my Apple Watch.  I took 5 months off due to some ‚Äòlife stuff‚Äô and tried to use it recently, only to find my watch didn‚Äôt work. The app froze, and closed repeatedly. After deleting the app off my phone, and watch, restarting both devices and reinstalling the apps on each, I still can‚Äôt make my watch ‚Äòfind‚Äô the Strava app, despite my watch dashboard app saying the app is on my watch, and all permissions are enabled. 
I contacted Strava, and after several days, have not had a response.  
I still love this app, but I won‚Äôt use it if it won‚Äôt sync with my watch.
title: No watch support.

review:
Bottom line I love the Strava app, I‚Äôve used it on my iPhone and Apple Watch since 2015, mainly for biking, and highly recommended it. I would like a few improvements for 5 stars, mainly to the Apple Watch portion.

1. I use it to track my commutes as well as my longer rides and I‚Äôd very much appreciate that the auto-pause functionality didn‚Äôt dim everything on the watch screen (stop at a light and I look down to check my heart rate, distance, etc. and I can‚Äôt see any of it because of the auto-stop dimming).
2. Let me tag commutes from the watch screen when I finish a ride, going into the app later to do this is just annoying.
3. Fix the bug that gives me like 4 alerts on my watch in the first minute of a ride that my ride is ready to upload if I open the iPhone app.

Again, I highly recommend this app, although beware if you get it you‚Äôll probably quickly go premium like I did üòÇ. Also worth it in my opinion.
title: Almost Perfect!

review: I love Strava, I primarily use it to track my cycling metrics, running metrics and weights training. It‚Äôs simple, intuitive and gives you lots of metrics data. If I was to suggest few things I would love to see in the near future, it would be the option to send and receive messages to followers, create group chats within the app. I would also love the ability to upload videos for your training, maybe 30sec clips. Hopefully it‚Äôs in the pipes for their future upgrades. ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
title: Best Cycling app

review: I‚Äôve been using strava for some time to track walks and runs with my dog. The free version does what I need: tracks distance, time spent daily, and since I started using the app. It‚Äôs intuitive and easy to use. However, after the recent update it looks like I have an alert waiting (the bell icon is filled in and has a number on it). When I click on it there is just a blank screen- no message. Maybe just a glitch in the build? Other than this little snafu I really like this app and highly recommend.
title: Great app

review:
I jumped on Strava to get some better data about my workouts and liked everything available. The issue was with workouts that would not sync from my Apple Watch 3 and workouts that seemed to start recording when my workouts were 1/2 complete. I have numerous 6 mile runs where my start point is where I turned around to head back home. Not only that, but my pace is 5 min/miles!
The solution on the forums is to reset the phone, reset the watch, start a workout then stop it and create a new workout. How about fixing the app. I have had zero ‚Äúhalf‚Äù workouts on Garmin and my activity app on my watch for 2 years, or Garmin workouts that refuse to sync to my phone.
title: Not worth the hassle

review: If you are a dedicated rider not concerned with weight loss or incorporating calorie burn/intake as part of a fitness routine, the app is perfectly good. But, if you are trying to ride, run, etc. as part of a weight loss routine then the app is not for you. You should instead stick with the Apple Watch built in activity monitor. The Strava app simply cannot reliably track calorie burn and sync with other apps (eg MyFitnessPal). I‚Äôll ride 25 miles and it says I‚Äôve only burned 150 calories. Even when you give full permissions, it does not work. For such an otherwise good app with lots of features I can‚Äôt believe they appear to have overlooked something like this.
title: Lacks calorie burn syncing

review: Do not pay for this app, use TrainingPeaks if your serious about training. This was a great app, then they stopped development and so I stopped paying. It‚Äôs great for free, TrainingPeaks is a much better paid solution if your serious about data analytics and goals, great team over there. Strava lacks basic separation between mountain bikes or road. It can‚Äôt help you explore and create a route when you find yourself somewhere new. They refuse to respond to community boards on their own website. It‚Äôs pretty cool as an odometer and to check out what friends are doing. But it‚Äôs very frustrating to see these guys ignoring the people that built them.
title: Needs New Leadership

review: I enjoy using Strava. I find the data valuable and I really like the way it is presented with various graphs and visuals. I prefer it to Garmin Connect and like the social component. Recent concerns about safety have caused me to use the route hiding features, which I appreciate, but now I cannot participate in segments and such. I can‚Äôt justify paying for the price increase to nearly $80/year for the same data as Garmin connect presented in a more visually pleasing app. I probably would have just kept paying the $55/year.
title: Strava is a good app; not sure pro is worth price increase

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for years, but lately the features have been declining. Segments are not as robust, and my friends don‚Äôt use it as much. The last straw was the political statement. Your administration may have an opinion, but realize it may differ from half your users. Why go there? As a corporate entity, you can donate to any party or candidate, and you can decline access to anyone who violates your policy. Making a statement that belittles those who disagree with you is more of the cancel culture. Count me out. I don‚Äôt feel the need to silence those who disagree; please show me the same courtesy. If the course reverses, you have alienated half your customer base. Other apps work just as well. Go where you are valued.
title: Why Go Political?

review: i thought this was just a problem with my internet or my run but i joined july 5K the day it started and i‚Äôve ran several 5K runs but they never register to the challenge. i deleted the app and logged out and the next day i ran another 5K and it didn‚Äôt register again, I‚Äôve left the challenge multiple times and nothing is changing, I don‚Äôt know if the people who run this app check the reviews but if you want that last star you better fix this problem for me, thank you. my name is julia kalinina if you‚Äôd like to check my runs and challenges :)
title: i love the app but.

review:
Well, strava is a well designed app I enjoyed using. But it‚Äôs a shame they decided to paywall the leaderboard and a few of the things that didn‚Äôt use to be paywalled. I don‚Äôt fault them for wanting to make money, but I just don‚Äôt care enough about those features to pay as much as they‚Äôre charging, and so maybe I‚Äôll use the app from time to time going forward, but now I don‚Äôt have a compelling reason to, since that was the fun part (as they know).

So II guess what I‚Äôm saying is, it‚Äôs not worth $8 a month unless maybe I was still competitively racing -but I‚Äôm not. And it‚Äôs a shame they made the changes and took away most of the value of the app. But I guess that‚Äôs the point.
title: Enexpected paywalling thumbs down

review:
I‚Äôve been using Nike run, but decided to give Strava a try after a few friends recommended it. I wanted to like it, but it‚Äôs been disappointing. 

I‚Äôve recorded four runs, and the app recorded each one incorrectly in terms of both time and distance. For example, on one run, my first mile is recorded at +19min while the next is <4min. On a separate run, the app didn‚Äôt record the time at all. To give more context, I ran the same familiar each time, but the app recorded different overall distances for each run. I tried trouble shooting the issue in the app with the feedback function, but the issues haven‚Äôt been resolved, and I have not been able to get in contact with anyone from Strava. 

In short, I do not recommend this app.
title: Problems with time and GPS

review: Loved this app when I had an iPhone 8Plus. But that phone had a home button and app switcher didn‚Äôt interfere   On the iPhone 10 and up, app switcher is activated by the swipe up from the bottom. 3x times now the swipe up action to switch out of Strava has caused my ride to end. So I think I‚Äôm done with this app.  Ok watch the updates and see if they move the controls away from the bottom. They‚Äôre just to close. I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs the problem. So I‚Äôm off to the UA apps for now. UA apps do it sometimes too, but their app does a time call out so if you didn‚Äôt notice it stopped, you‚Äôll notice your times have stopped  calling out.
title: Love Hate relationship

review: Seriously, I‚Äôm not sure if I would have gotten much into running without this app. This app really helped me to build into a consistent runner with a consistent training plan. Being able to see exactly what I‚Äôve done and how fast is really motivating. Also just really cool to see all the places I‚Äôve run. Now, a couple years later, it‚Äôs also fun to have a bunch of friends to follow along and see how they‚Äôre training is going. Highly recommend!
title: This app made me a runner

review:
I do competitive long-distance equestrian competitions, called Endurance Riding. I use the free version to track my distance and average speed while training and during competition... it‚Äôs really great for that, and I love how you don‚Äôt get pestered with pop-ups to upgrade. 
However, I have to log my sport as bicycle riding since there is no option for equestrian (kayaking, snowboarding, ice skating, THREE different kinds of skiing... even ‚Äúvirtual rides‚Äù are available as options), which is a disappointment. I would be thrilled to be able to correctly log my sport of choice.
title: Great, but leaves out Equestrian activities

review:
I use Strava nearly every day and am a paying subscriber (for Beacon), but, and, I really have to wonder where their efforts are going. I mean, the software works, so I can‚Äôt imagine it takes that many developers to maintain‚Ä¶ I suppose they are selling ads‚Ä¶ anyhow in the meantime there are a ton of wing foil riders using Strava and forced to post as ‚Äúwindsurfing‚Äù for the lack of a simple addition to a drop down menu. Same for paragliding‚Äîthere are pro pilots posting their flights as ‚Äúkitesurfing.‚Äù 

Why not just add a few more sports?

Cheers!
title: Solid tracking, but rarely updated

review: Love the interface and list of activities.  I think connecting it to a watch adds to the apps depth as it opens up more stats to view and allows you to complete more activities (i.e indoor workouts or yoga) that won‚Äôt record properly with Strava‚Äôs standard GPS tracking system.  The addition of being able to upload videos as well as the 3D satellite maps is entering as well as (for paid memberships) getting to view your life map.
title: Best Running Social Media App

review: Great App just wish I could get everything back. All I see is loading errors and I tried logging out and then tried re-logging in and it still says this ‚ÄúStrava is temporarily unavailable, please try again later (503)‚Äù So now I give up üòûüòîI‚Äôm gonna delete the best run‚Äôn app ever because of a silly glitch. Oh well I guess I‚Äôll just have to find some other app that records runs n‚Äô stuff. Never mind that I payed for a Strava Subscription and have been using it since Covid era and the fact that all my friends will wonder why I disappeared. Lastly I saw that there was an update I tried to update Strava but it failed. Now I‚Äôm feeling super pessimistic about my future fitness will look like without Strava.
title: Strava is Broken üò≠

review:
For some reason after my iPhone updated, the Apple Watch Strava app has been choosing the Outdoor Ride, even when I chose run or walk.  After deleting the app from the watch, and updating the phone app, at least outdoor run gives me run instead of ride.  Walk is still broken.

Also, the miles and heart rate on the watch are TINY, which my 53 year old eyes can‚Äôt see without reading glasses.  Maybe make them a slightly bigger font?

I do love the Strava app on my phone, and the way I can see my hear rate against the elevation of the run.
title: Apple Watch app could use some help

review:
At the end of the day, Strava is unreliable and poorly supported. However, it also lacks features that set it apart from other similar apps and is overly reliant on social media features that have significant and disturbing privacy implications. The app loses data on a regular basis, especially for activities completed without cellular or WiFi service. Reaching out to support offers nothing more than a ‚Äúwe‚Äôre getting to it‚Äù email every two days that ultimately is repeated for weeks upon weeks. 

For serious athletes, Strava has become a bit of a running a joke; An example of something that was once excellent but has been picked and parted into something that‚Äôs barely useful for anything other than getting stalked.
title: Unreliable, poor support

review: Unlike many other users I just recently (in April) started using Strava and it has been a great tracking app for all of my walks and runs. I hadn‚Äôt become familiar with all of the great features that are now being taken away in the free version. My frustration is that in the past five days since the most recent update I have lost two runs that were not saved. There is nothing more crushing than to end your run with the excitement of seeing your stats only to have it disappear as though it never happened when I know it was recording during the activity! It was a great app until now it‚Äôs not!
title: Disappointed!

review: I installed this app on the recommendation from a friend, and I use it in conjunction with a Garmin Watch...specifically, Fenix 3 HR.  I‚Äôve been doing a lot of treadmill runs these days, and the Garmin isnt tracking the mileage accurately, and there‚Äôs no function for treadmill runs on Strava, so I have to go in manually and adjust the numbers thru Garmin post-run.  Well, it doesn‚Äôt appear that there‚Äôs any way to adjust my numbers(mainly distance)on Strava, and they are immediately transferred from Garmin pre-Adjustment. So, all my numbers on Strava are incorrect, rendering the app useless for me.  Can this functionality be added?  Am I missing something?  Thanks.
title: Is There a Way to Edit Your Activity??

review:
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüö¥üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Wouldn‚Äôt it be cool to mash up social media with a running/cycling app? Wouldn‚Äôt it be cool to map your runs/rides, track your distance, monitor your goal progress, post running/cycling photos while also cheering on your friends who are working on their goals? 

Good news! The mash-up has already been developed with Strava. It is the cyclist and runner‚Äôs app joined with social media. I love it! It inspires me to see my fellow runners‚Äô progress. I can like their posts and add comments. The Strava app has boosted my progress as a runner this year.
title: Boosted my Performance

review: I love this app over other fitness tracking apps. However! I think integrating a private messaging or something along those lines would be a good addition. I can see it kind of making it a ‚Äúsocial media‚Äù app, but the only way to meet new people is through commenting. When you need to exchange phone numbers or emails it has to be done via the comment section of an activity. When doing that, it leaves it open to the public to do with they please with it; when it was intended for someone else. Other than that no issues at all. Great app.
title: Almost there!

review:
Love Strava - it‚Äôs a core part of my cycling, from route planning to performance tracking to catching up with friends.

Really wish there was a tablet version, though. When I‚Äôm working on creating or reviewing routes, I really dislike doing it on even the large screen of my iphone 11max. Typing this on my ipad, but for Strava I have to go do my desktop instead. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs easier said than done, but a lot of us subscribers would appreciate it‚Ä¶
title: Please make iPad version

review: I wish there was a ‚ÄúWarm-Up‚Äù and ‚ÄúCool-Down‚Äù setting you could apply to each run/hike/walk/climb/cycle! Seeing as most runners like to take a warm-up/cool-down lap or mile, this distance should be counted towards the total distance ran per day/week/month/year but i don‚Äôt necessarily want my feed clogged up with my warm-up and cool-down mile times. Id rather my feed be solely for the actual run itself, but if you make the warm-ups and cool-downs private, then they wont be applied to the monthly distance challenges! (I think? Right? Lol)
title: Great App! Only one suggestion!

review: I have been using Strava for a number of years and have no complaints about the functionality of the app. I finally purchased a subscription when they made it so most features were only accessible by paid subscribers and was fine with that. I reached out to Strava to see if they could link an old account with a new account that I no longer have access to. Initially, they were responsive to my issue but have since stopped responding. I have attempted to follow up with my help ticket multiple times and have been met with silence each time. If you want to track your activities it‚Äôs a great app, but don‚Äôt your waste money on a company that is completely unwilling to provide the most basic of customer service.
title: No Support

review: I've been using Strava for a few years now to casually track runs and rides, and I've come to love it. I don't know why Strava is expending their developers time taking features away from free users instead of adding new features to paid users. Every update in the last few months has been removing functionality, and Strava is slowing torching the good will it's built for years for profit. I understand $60/year is not crazy, but not everyone can afford to drop that. Making your app worse to force you userbase to pay to get features back is just a terrible, terrible strategy.
title: Strava - what are you doing???

review: I‚Äôm a cross countrey runner in high school. Because of the corona virus my coach wanted us all to download this app and tack everything so he could see how we were doing. It was a great app you could see litterally everything. But it seems like every day, a very very important feature is only accessible through the yearly subscription. I would buy the subscription so I can see BASIC things like weekly mileage and heart rate data that I can see in most other apps, but it‚Äôs 60$ a year! By the end of high school I will have paid 180$ on the app just to see things I could on a normal running app. My goodness everything is being taken out. Please just make it a one time payment, lower the cost, or just let me see my weekly mileage.
title: Way to expensive

review: This app does a great job showing speed, distance, duration, etc. while riding. Deducted one star since it‚Äôs missing integration with music playlists while riding and with heart rate info from Apple Watch when starting activity from iPhone. Also would be nice if it had a camera button while riding. All of these features are on the Map My Ride app, however I like Strava a bit better since it doesn‚Äôt use as much battery, plus it has the ability to add photos/comments to an activity as well as to follow friends.
title: Works Well but Missing Features

review:
Strava has an issue: it is incapable of delivering a consistent experience for its Apple Watch application. I have used Strava for several years - even am a premium member and have enjoyed nearly every aspect of it save for its watch application.  

Here‚Äôs the issue: the watch application will work mostly fine for a long while then suddenly stop working altogether. I have: logged out and logged in again, update all apps, uninstalled and reinstalled, reset privacy setting and countless other things to get the watch app to work and work it will not. 

If you like running with your watch (and not your phone) I‚Äôd recommend staying away from Strava until it gets it together - which may be a few years.
title: Watch Application is Consistently Off

review: Picked up Strava today to track swimming and cycling. Currently using Ride with GPS for the latter and Apple‚Äôs Activity tracker for the former. So, Strava announces boldly it‚Äôs for ‚ÄúRun, Ride, Swim,‚Äù but here‚Äôs the thing, it does not track swimming via its Apple Watch app. What? I‚Äôm supposed to put my iPhone in my bathing suit? No, turns out I‚Äôm supposed to download MySwimPro so that can track swimming and then sync it to Strava. Hello? At the very least, ‚ÄúRun, Ride, Swim‚Äù is misleading, as I think most would assume the app is announcing that it does it all. No where in its App Store presentation does it mention that another app is required to track swimming. At the least, misleading. At the worst, false advertising. I appreciate that it might be grand for running and cycling, but to claim that it tracks swimming is simply false.
title: Not for swimming

review:
iPhone is constantly crashing under the use of this app, when this happens it affects the entire iPhone including any other app for a period of about 10 to 20 seconds even after attempting to close the app.

It‚Äôs a shame that I have to report this issue through the review process because neither Strava or Apple has a simple process of reporting these kind of issues without having to go through a whole login process or verification of some sort.
title: iPhone Constantly Crashing With Strava.

review: Can‚Äôt you make it so that when I enter my lifting data that I do not also have to enter mileage? That gets annoying and seems like an easy fix. I would like the option of entering time to keep track of progressive abdominal work, but the mileage piece does not need to be there. Also, can you make it possible so that adding footwear can be done on the mobile app rather than just the desktop based version? If you could go ahead and do that, that‚Äôd be grrrreat.
title: No need for mileage with weight lifting

review: I am long time premium subscriber and not only do you still not have a male leaderboard (but you have asked me to ‚Äúsubmit that request‚Äù for 4 years!!!) now you remove the training goals from athletes profile page. Why? If you think that‚Äôs personal data allow user option to display but now I can‚Äôt follow people in my running clubs progress except on a little bar graph. Get it together.  One star.
title: Bad update - need weekly training progress back

review:
A great app at its core, but the continual siphoning of the free features on the app behind a paywall is pretty disgraceful. I completely understand blocking certain data (I.e creating runs, and premium heart rate features, etc) behind paywalls - I want you guys (the devs) to succeed as you have made a brilliant app and deserve your success. But locking course record times behind paywalls? Come on man. And now not even showing the nice aesthetics of seeing our previous activities in a neat and orderly manner? It‚Äôs all these small things that are making me sick of this app. Especially when strava‚Äôs competitors are offering these services for free... 

makes you think
title: Almost not worth downloading without paying for premium

review:
Strava is a really good app for tracking your movements while you‚Äôre jogging or biking. I like the way it summarizes your overall activity for every week. Represents useful information like the distance you covered, the time it took to cover the distance, and the route for where you‚Äôve been going.

My only problem with this app is that doesn‚Äôt show your calorie percentage or quantity. Even something that‚Äôs approximate would work. I think this would matter to anyone who is concerned with the amount of calories they consume and burn.
title: A good app that is missing something

review: Strava is a big part of my day, my week , my life . I subscribe because l love looking at all the data ‚Ä¶ at least when things are going well and I‚Äôm on an upswing . When I‚Äôm declining , I don‚Äôt want to look . Integration with other apps is great . I don‚Äôt get the ‚Äúprogress‚Äù feature though which seems to try and tell you where your fitness level is relative to your past performance . It‚Äôs just not clear how/what makes you get better scores others than just recording more activities .
title: Data data

review:
Without any announcement the Apple Watch functionality of seeing your live HR was removed for non-premium users. Now you can only see your average HR.

I understand Strava needs to make a profit somehow, but it feels like charging the premium subscription for a really basic functionality to, arguably, mostly occasional users is not the way to make people willing to go premium.

Anyway, thanks for ruining that workout for me as I was constantly trying to figure out why my HR wasn‚Äôt responding to what I was doing. Not seeing you HR drop after you stop running is quite concerning to say the least. At least make an announcement on such a change of functionality.
title: Live HR removed for non-premium users

review: I don't get it‚Äîwhy does everyone rave about this app? It's okay, but it has less than half of the useful features of MyMyFitness. For instance, the voice feedback is a joke. You get your choice of splits and... nope, that's it. You can get splits at every mile or every half mile. Contrast that with MapMyFitness, which gives you seven options and eight interval choices at either distances or times. What about coaching? Forget it. Paying for premium is a total ripoff. There isn't even a delayed start option. Maybe the social media aspect is more appealing to some people, but UA has that covered too. There's just no question‚Äîwhen it come to fitness tracking, Strava can't compete.
title: Seriously Underwhelming

review: This app asked me to go to website to subscribe to get free trial. After forgetting about it I‚Äôve been charged last year and now this month again. Looking back at my emails I contacted Starva to cancel last year and was sent an image asking for screen shot of my cancelation. When I went to cancel I was taken back to Home Screen without proof of cancelation. Checked my email, no condo email of changes to my subscription. Now trying to prove I canceled so I can get $59 back for this month is becoming a big headache. Any business that makes it this difficult to cancel is not to be trusted. Stay away from this app. I recommend Pace app (I stayed on free version and love it).
title: Difficult to cancel subscription

review: For all the bells and whistles that are added, Strava fails miserably to do the ONE most important thing: accurately track your runs! It was once quite reliable, but recently the accuracy has dropped precipitously. On 80% of my runs in a large, suburban community, the GPS jumps around and completely ruins my distance and pace stats. I have no idea how far I ran or how fast, and it seriously screws up my all-time stats too. I keep the app up-to-date and have sent MULTIPLE requests to customer service for help, with NO REPLY. I‚Äôve been using Strava for years, and I‚Äôll be sad to abandon my running history, but this is totally unacceptable and I‚Äôm switching to a better platform! You should, too.
title: Buggy & Inaccurate

review: What is the purpose of this apps existence? It says it reads data from Apple Watch/health kit, and it tracks heart rate just fine. But it doesn‚Äôt record calories burned for indoor cycling? If it can‚Äôt do that, I might as well just use Apple‚Äôs built in fitness app which automatically exports to Strava, and gives me all the same data AND my calories, even if it‚Äôs in Apples confusing formula of separating ‚Äúmove‚Äù and ‚Äúactive‚Äù calories, it‚Äôs better than nothing. C‚Äômon Strava. Do better.
title: Disappointing

review: I love the versatility of Strava when it comes to collecting events from different activities. We run, we bike, some swim...it‚Äôs nice to see it all in one place. I also like how Strava connects to other devices for seamless data transfer. Thanks for reminding me when it‚Äôs time for new running shoes as well. I love watching my friends be active and being able to tell them GOOD JOB! Great app for anyone from beginners to seasoned athletes. Keep all your stats in one place. Strava will even put together memories for you!
title: Best app for tracking activity

review: It is the only app I could find that could collect my Peloton, Ergatta and outdoor activities in one place.  Each activity has great information about location, length, elevation, relative effort, etc. However, there is no easy way to see how you are progressing over time. The app needs some simple graphs to compare workout output, calories, time and relative effort over time across all activities. The only graph I could find was something called ‚Äútraining‚Äù but it only captures information from Peloton, not any outdoor activities.  It would be worth the money if there were some analytics like MPaceLine has.
title: Nice integration but poor Analytics

review:
I‚Äôve been an avid Strava user for a few years. I recently took a bike ride and went to compare some of the segments against previous attempts, only to discover this is now a ‚Äúsubscription only‚Äù feature. A quick read of the app update shows that a number of formerly free features are now only available through a paid subscription. Seemingly, reviewers are taking note. 

I understand more people may be doing outdoor exercise due to the pandemic, but asking people to pay for features that were once free is a poor move. I‚Äôm one of millions whose household income is DOWN as a result of the current economy, and my family has been canceling subscriptions with the understanding that it will take some time for the economy to recover. 

Other subscription models I‚Äôve used in the past grandfathered in previous users and made these kinds of dramatic changes only for new users. For STRAVA to implement this across the board is just bad form. 

Will I continue to use Strava? Maybe. But the odds are not in Strava‚Äôs favor.
title: Strava Isn‚Äôt What it Used to Be

review:
You guys at strava really screwed the people who liked using this app for free . Now we can‚Äôt see out weekly goals without paying and I can‚Äôt see my progression over segments without paying . I‚Äôm not talking about comparing efforts I‚Äôm just talking about seeing the ‚Äúperformance over time ‚Äú and the leaderboard are no longer available. It use to make you pay for leaderboards amongst your age group. Just a huge thumbs down from me for those two reasons . Seriously strava crew what‚Äôs the deal ? If I wanna track my ride and stats I‚Äôd use the under armor app or wahoo . 
Sincerely, 
A disappointed user .
title: Great app but still not paying

review: This app is great. We use a club to have my school Xc and track team‚Äôs activities on it. It‚Äôs fun to see where everybody running and their stats. The recording of runs from the app doesn‚Äôt work very well but I got a Garmin so it‚Äôs fine now and uploads immediately. A feature that I think would be really cool is to have a place where you could see all of your runs on one map. So you can see everywhere you gone on all your recorded runs. I would want to try and run on every street in my town.
title: Great +idea

review:
I do not like this app. What is the point of having the app on your phone when you have to use your desktop to look at any real data?  And how hard is it to make changes to something as basic as your shoes? This shouldn‚Äôt be that difficult, especially for the annual membership price. I wished I would have done a free trial - oh wait, they don‚Äôt offer one -BECAUSE NO ONE WOULD BUY IT. 

The NIKE RUN app is a thousand times better- more user friendly, easier to navigate, provides a training schedule you can edit to your schedule, you can change what shoes you wore on the app, it tracks your mileage, pace and elevation more accurately and...and.... it‚Äôs cheaper.  

I won‚Äôt make the mistake of using/paying for this app again.
title: I paid for this?!!!

review: I generally enjoy the app and find it very useful. My one criticism of the app is with respect to the maps. I was in Lenox, MA this past weekend and just wanted to go on a three mile run. The map I was given literally took us on the shoulder of a 4-lane highway. I was assuming that maybe there was a trail that ran parallel to the highway, but the map literally took us on the shoulder of the highway. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll trust these maps in areas that I am unfamiliar with in the future. That was dangerous.
title: Running maps

review:
First off, this app does log your rides really well. I guess if that is all you are looking for then awesome. 

Paying for premium on the other hand is really only worth it for me specifically because of the beacon feature. Unfortunately they have not integrated that feature into the Apple Watch and you‚Äôre left to use both the phone and the watch and end up logging two separate rides. I want the app on the watch to send the beacon text automatically as I start riding. 

Strava, please fix this. I‚Äôve seen other people complain about it, for over a year and yet nothing has been done.
title: Good but not great.

review: This is one app where I don‚Äôt mind subscribing because my subscription supports further development. Although I enjoy the sharing and social media aspects of the app it is my principal way to keep a diary of activities and compare them year to year. To that end I would really like a more robust compare to this month last year feature. Also since I ride with a two sided power meter I would really find it useful to have left right balance displayed in the analysis section.
title: Improving over time

review: Amazing Work to the Strava team for such an brilliant App. Besides all of the great work and data already provided by Strava. Two capabilities I would love to see would be an 1) interval capability when running or biking so that you can preset a run with zones and train with it and 2) the capability to show your heart rate zone or power zone if someone has a Heart rate monitor/watch and/or power meters on the bike and for it to tell you if you are above or below that zone when running/biking.
title: Amazing App & New Capability

review: This is great; not only does Strava give you a similar experience to instagram in the sheer amount of information available, but it also gives you a chance to find other people near you who also enjoy the same activities as you. It's also really useful for finding new routes and competing for times on segments, which is super fun. Would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys getting outdoors and sharing your experience with others.
title: Social Media for active people

review: I love to track my miles , my speed and my MAPS or route. It gives me my elevation gain. I ride for pleasure but it‚Äôs nice to know where I‚Äôve been. And if I‚Äôm improving my speed.  I love the fact that it logs my  annual milage and annual  elevation gain. I don‚Äôt think the calorie burn is very accurate but it‚Äôs good enough !  I LOVE  THE AUTO PAUSE ( I stopped using this app years ago as I couldn‚Äôt tell how fast I was pedaling. Every stop light kept longing time)  SO GLAD TO BE UP WITH THE TIMES FOR THE LAST 5 YEARS OR SO ! I tell all my friends about it. I use it on walks too !
title: I love this app

review: My old Garmin and my ASICS Runkeeper app agree almost perfectly for my routes. However, Strava gives me distances and average paces that make me look like I‚Äôm runner farther and faster than I actually am. The map shows a zig-zagging running path, which probably contributes to this. And I occasionally have a huge line on my running route that of course is not real. These problems don‚Äôt exist with the Runkeeper app or my Garmin. I overall like the Runkeeper app much better, but I continue to use Strava for the social aspect of seeing my friends‚Äô workouts. If the GPS accuracy was better, I would be much more satisfied with the app.
title: Inaccurate GPS

review:
Strava?!?!?!?

What the heck guys.

The only features that set this dang app apart from anything else are now all gone. One of my favorite things about riding my bike was competing on segments with my friends and now I have to pay $65 a year just for that one small thing? I‚Äôm unemployed due to Covid and I feel as though many are in the same boat, bummer of a time to be nixing all of the features in a free app. I hope this was a really necessary financial decision for this company because it really just comes across as greedy. I know plenty of hardcore guys who were already subscribed to your service, but there‚Äôs so many people like me who just want a few basic features. Thanks a lot.
title: Nerfed the free version

review: This app is great for folks that want to keep track of their activities.  I really like the data that it keeps for heart rate and stuff. If I had to give one piece of advice is the fitness score doesn't seem to be accurate.  I am not sure how it is measured but you don't really get a lot of credit for short workouts no matter how hard they are.  I recommend this app to everyone I ride, run when I did or without with.
title: Been using for years.

review: I like other apps personally but I so enjoy sharing and keeping in touch with running and cycling friends as well as seeing how my segments rate with others.  It is motivating and keeps me accountable for my effort and progress.  The BIG problem is that Strava has been crashing on my I watch lately.  I have had multiple problems using Strava with my watch.  This is why I bought the I watch!  Other apps work much more consistently but I really wish I didn‚Äôt have to switch tracking programs in the middle of my training plan.
title: Fix the bugs please!

review:
If you‚Äôre just using this for one specific activity, then its 5 stars.  Changing from one activity to another is:
A) not intuitive 
B) takes too much time when you just want to get on with it
C) I‚Äôve found it now, but until I do it a few times going to have to look up how each time, as it‚Äôs hidden far too deep in Settings.

Recommend: instead of having to go to Settings and look through everything to figure out how to change it, change it that you can select your activity ON THE RECORD PAGE!  This is the logical and customer friendly, intuitive way to do it.

I‚Äôm raising money for St Jude‚Äôs for walking my dog, and tonight see I‚Äôm missing several days of data and all it has is time.  Why? Because the I‚Äôm trying to start a regular yoga routine and wanted to record my time.  

Really a bit annoyed and frustrated right now.  Also learned in the past that Strava and Fitbit don‚Äôt sync well.
title: Great BUT!!!

review: Strava used to be good for route planning. You used to be able to zoom all the way into street level and see where marked bike lanes were and precisely where segment started and ended. But with the map update several months ago you can no longer do that. So now I am forced to use other apps/maps to find the critical data I need. Kept hoping Strava would fix this but has been several months and still can‚Äôt zoom in all the way as previous version. The 3D mapping imho is not that great and more of a gimmick.
title: Disappointed with the map update

review:
Strava does NOT listen to paying clients. An untold number of users have requested over the years that they add horseback riding as a recognized sport, but they are condescending in their replies to us. Look up ‚ÄúHorseback Riders of Strava‚Äù (or something to that effect) on Strava to see how many members there are in that group. If the powers that be on Strava think that ‚Äúyou just sit there‚Äù, then they clearly have never been riding for any appreciable amount of time.

Strava, I am tired of having to categorize my rides as other sports other than horseback riding!!!

I am a paying customer, as well as a multi sport athlete (cycling being my go-to). Please stop putting us off and add it as the legitimate sport that it is!
title: Refuses to add Horseback Riding as a recognized sport

review:
Strava chose to downgrade the service they provide to non-subscribers and thereby compromise the value of the platform for everyone.  Strava has access to a gold mine of data, and has not been able to monetize the asset. Neither have they pursued advertising revenue - ‚Äúwant to beat your PR - here‚Äôs a bike / tire / shoe that will get you there‚Äù. 

They have not addressed common user requests and have not significantly added functionality in the past few YEARS!!

Strava, you have great potential - instead you have chosen a death spiral.
title: Growth by subtraction

review:
Today I rode with my buddy, exactly same trails, his phone Strava said he rode 1mi more and something like 15min more than me, I use a Garmin 520 so I know the GPS is legit.

This is exactly why I canceled my service, but I decided to see where I stacked up today on those trails since the numbers were so far off and I finished a good 15sec ahead of my buddy on all of the trails.....apparently Strava has gotten so petty over not being a member now you don't get anything rider stats against other riders.ü§£ü§£ü§£ü§£ü§£You are a joke STRAVA and hopefully more people realize how in accurate you MTB riding is and leave.  If you are going to let people get better times for having LESS accurate GPS devices what's the point???
title: Absolute Garbage

review: Good lord, I mean this used to be my go to app, but I‚Äôm going to try out new ones now. It used to work flawlessly, then y‚Äôall took all kinds of options away, which I dealt with because it was still an awesome app. But now my workouts take forever to sync with my apple products, sporadically. Some sync right away and it‚Äôs great, others and it takes all night. When I go online, it looks perfect, but somewhere in the app world it‚Äôs not sharing correctly, as well as not updating my challenges. I noticed it a few days ago and sure enough, that was the date of the last update. ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Just leave it alone

review: My biggest gripe is that the features I pay for aren‚Äôt available on the app. I‚Äôm following the half-marathon plan and it‚Äôs great that I get emails to remind and ‚Äúcoach‚Äù me, but it should be integrated in the training page of the app as well. Additionally, when following a plan, for each days prescribed workout, you should be able to record the workout straight from the training page‚Äôs assignment and have the workout information already pre-filled-out, and all that is entered after is your personal metrics. Again, love the desktop version, but the app seriously needs some tlc.
title: Strava is great, app is lacking

review:
Is it me or is strava the best thing that happened since sliced bread? Joke aside, it is a polished app for free woohoo! The set up for detail minded people is through the website. You got to be kidding me complaining the extra 10 minutes to setup (?). Why, did your mom gave birth to you less than 10 minutes? 
And the two decimal place? Give me a break..  
Unless you can create a better app that has all the features you are complaining about, until then take a chill pill!
title: Some people liked to gripe

review:
I use the app all the time. It‚Äôs great to interact with folks all over the world. It‚Äôs awesome to compare your results to others to see how you stack up. For the most part it is very reliable and I can count on it to track the results and provide analysis. Very flexible with the different workout categories. 

The only issue is it‚Äôs integration with Apple health app. Duplicate entries, triplicate entries and I‚Äôm left to clean it up. All I want is it to report the data correctly.  I‚Äôve tried all the fixes but to no avail.
title: Working with Health App

review: Why is strava so beast? I can see what all my friends are doing, track my running, biking, lifting, swimming, disc golf all in one place. This is my favorite app on my entire phone, and for good reason. If you asked me to rate all my apps on a beast scale strava would be rancor status because the rancor is one of the biggest and baddest beasts out there. Only negative thing I have to say about strava is they didn‚Äôt respond to my Instagram DM about being a strava influencer. Otherwise, all love ü´∂üèº
title: Strava is so beast

review:
This app is my biggest motivator for running, in that even on days when I don‚Äôt feel like getting out, I scroll through and see others hiking or running and I‚Äôm inspired to do the same. I love that I can follow my friends, upload photos of my adventures, and keep track of all my successes, growth, and miles along the way. I recommend this app to anyone that enjoys daily walks, bike rides, or other exercises. It‚Äôs fun to see your miles add up!
Alex Moore, Bend OR
title: Like FB for Runners

review:
First you will use Strava to track your performance, and then to keep up with teammates and friends. Then you will continue to follow those who move away, and encourage those who are undergoing rehab from injuries or illness. 

Next, you will see rides, runs, hikes, paddles, rows, and snow sports from all over the world with a unique twist or a jaw dropping photo.

Right now, someone, somewhere, is getting on a bike, lacing up their shoes, stepping into their bindings, or climbing into a kayak. Maybe they are celebrating a birthday or an anniversary. Perhaps it is in memory of a loved one who passed. They may turn in the performance of a lifetime, take a photo of incredible beauty of a place you never been, or be involved in an event so bizarre no fiction writer could hallucinate it.  Strava lets you share that. 

It doesn‚Äôt replace being in the peloton, but sometimes it is the next best thing.
title: Why Strava

review: If you‚Äôre going to make part of your app free, at least let me use it in peace. Strava is a cool idea. I like using it to track my running mileage and other basic statistics. But I dislike it when the ‚ÄúGo Premium‚Äù ad washes over my entire screen. The ‚Äúclose‚Äù button is in orange text that blends in excellently with the background, making it seem like the only option to leave that page is to start your free trial. How clever of the product designers. If you want me to pay then don‚Äôt make any free features! Also there is some potential for that coercive design to be an accessibility liability. Just saying!
title: Stop Coercing Me To Go Premium

review:
Been using Strava for almost two years (a trail marathon, a 50K and several adventure runs in there). That‚Äôs not boasting (just look at my times), but it is saying I feel like I‚Äôve tested it out. 

The free version has all the metrics I would ever want and for a few bucks I add some safety with the Summitt add on. The peace of mind to change routes in the middle of a run without feeling bad because I switched up the plans I left behind is worth it. 

The social media aspect is not a big deal to me, but i know others like it.
title: Yes!

review: I feel like I am always emailing a bot with Strava rather than an actual person. Strava you have such bad manners. You all push a button and send links that have nothing to do with my real problem. You all used to be so much better. I signed up 2years ago because a friend said you were a small business and he wanted to support you all financially; that is why he paid for the premium service. I believed his words so I payed too. Im of that age where customer service used to be so important in business; the time when the customer was shown respect. I‚Äôve dealt with both Wahoo and Zwift with issues and an actual real person emails you back. That‚Äôs at least gives them some accountability.
title: Customer service

review: I love Strava and recommend it to all my friends. But recently I‚Äôve had trouble with the GPS. Examples: it will show as a straight line or not record the actual timing. I do it from my Apple Watch and never had issues. But yday it happened again and it was very frustrating. I checked the support websites - my ‚Äúbackground app refresh‚Äù is ON. However, on my iPhone - in the Settings - Privacy - Location area, the option ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù does not exist. I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs the issue. Just installed the update and hope it‚Äôs fixed. Thanks!
