title: Error with GPS

review:
A couple years ago I bought an Apple Watch and had a problem uploading runs when I would get back in range of my phone after returning from a run. Here we are with dozens of updates later and the problem STILL exists. I have done the workarounds Strava suggests, making sure I am out of range of the one before starting the run. Still have the problem. I can see the run in my watch history, but no matter how many times I try to force it to manually upload from the watch, nothing. This happens even while the watch/phone combo uploads other activities. VERY frustrating. 

I can not recommend this app if you regularly use an Apple Watch away from your phone.
title: Unreliable Uploads with Apple Watch

review:
Strava gets so many things right with this app. From the accuracy of it tracking to the syncing with it desktop client I have not found anything that compares.

I would like to give it 4 1/2 star but that is not an option. The only improvement I would like is I would like single season achievements. I was in a motorcycle accident a few years ago and had to stop cycling for a time and I am not as fast as I was then but I would like to see my improvements over the course of a season. Outside of that this is an outstanding app.
title: The Best Cycling App

review: I‚Äôve always circled back to Strava when the weather‚Äôs nice and I‚Äôm running outside more often. What I love is that unlike many workout apps, it doesn‚Äôt grossly inhibit your experience or data in an effort to get you to upgrade. You can still get really valuable information without paying more. As I get better at my workouts, the experience I‚Äôm having with the app makes me more interested in some of the deeper personalization/metrics that upgrading can get you.
title: Great, even for beginners

review: Strava has become an important part of my training and I use it every day. Having a few of my friends and family members on it gives me a little nudge of social reinforcement when I am deciding whether to work out or not. It‚Äôs been an awesome way to track my progress, and the interface is easy to use. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it five stars is I‚Äôve had some trouble at the end of workouts with routes disappearing. I also wish they were better support for hiking, but it‚Äôs still one of my favorite apps!
title: I use it every day

review:
Strava consistently records inaccurate data. Strava reports almost mile times almost 90 seconds early. Every. Single. Time. When I‚Äôve repeatedly contacted support there is no real response besides a canned message that I ‚Äúbad gps data‚Äù or my phone is the problem... yet if I run with both Mapmyrun and Strava  open, pulling from same GPS signal, the free app has no inaccuracies and actually gives me correct info. The GPS inaccuracy is a known issue and it‚Äôs crazy to me that Strava has the gall to charge so much without support or response. I love the challenges and interface, however, reliability for accurate times is a non-negotiable.

Do better at supporting your pricey app and responding to your customer.
title: Inaccurate data. No customer support.

review:
Removal of third party device support via BLE is an awful move! So many better apps with device support... Strava really dropped the ball on this one. Bring back device support and stop sending us to other brands, and workarounds. 

And also, can‚Äôt we get the heart rate from the Apple Watch when recording from the phone? It‚Äôs 2020... we are using some of the most advanced devices in the world... we can‚Äôt figure out how to get the heart rate from the watch, when using the phone? Come on... so many basic apps have this functionality, I don‚Äôt understand why strava can‚Äôt make this happen? 

I want to like this app and only use it, but someone at Strava needs to get it together!
title: No device support... cant use watch either!

review: I‚Äôve used Strava for about a year now, mostly without issues. Maybe they released a bad update recently because twice in the past three days it has been MAJORLY inaccurate in terms of distance run, and therefore speed. This has resulted in setting fake PRs for the mile and half mile that I‚Äôll never be close to matching in the real world. Not cool considering I enjoy actually setting new PR.  If this happens again this week I‚Äôm going to have to switch to another app. Very disappointed and frustrated with Strava right now
title: Has been very inaccurate lately

review: Greed ruined another good app.  I won't pay for this sort of service and it's ridiculous that all of the advanced features were once free or some part of the feature was free and now it has to be paid for.  Not allowing i individuals to see their laps for a workout unless they pay is ridiculous. I'm about to change apps and leave strava behind.  Find another way to fund your app bc if you can't, you're surely going to lose patrons.
title: Why does every decent fitness app get greedy

review: I started running a few weeks ago and absolutely love this app to track my miles. I was excited to join the challenges to see how far I can push myself and meet new goals. However, given a condition I have in my hips and back I can only do low impact running indoors. I have to add each activity manually which I‚Äôve learned do not count towards challenges. I don‚Äôt know if it a glitch in the app or a choice Stravia is making but it was disappointing I couldn‚Äôt join the challenges. Otherwise this app is fantastic.
title: Great app with a minor flaw

review: I don‚Äôt write reviews yet Strava is worth the effort. This app is great. It integrates with my Wahoo RPM and Cadence sensors. It automatically updates my iPhone health app which automatically updates my heart rate between my iPhone and Strava. Aside from Start Recording starts by opening the app on my watch or manually on my phone. So easy. Worth it. I have not decided on the additional information as I am not that hardcore. Who knows, perhaps in a few weeks. In the meantime this is the best app I have used. Hands down.
title: Integrates EVERYTHING

review:
Great sharing and tracking features. Love the auto pause on the Apple Watch and phone on bike rides.

Issue that is very frustrating is that there is no option to distinguish between different types of biking. I regularly go on road bike rides and mountain bike rides and obviously my speed and effort vary greatly between the two; however there is no way to distinguish between the two in order to track progress.

Additionally, the calorie count populated as zero for exercise on the Apple Watch which is frustrating.
title: Great tracking and social aspects

review:
Curse these cursed updates! I had Strava working more or less how I wanted on iPhone and Apple Watch: no notifications on the phone and yes haptic response on mile markers on the watch. After this update, I have yet to get the same per mile notifications on the watch, even with the phone buzzing every time anyone adds a ‚Äúkudos‚Äù to any activity. ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨. I really wish I could go back in time to the functionality I preferred. 

Oh, also, I still yearn for an actual current pace, not just average overall or average for current mile. Makes it tough to adjust pacing without guess work while running.
title: Cursed Updates!

review:
Strava is like social media for runners and athletes of all types. Overall, it‚Äôs great to see friends‚Äô activities. I even used Strava to get connected to other runners when I moved to a new city.

But the app almost always has random weird bugs. Today, it won‚Äôt let me add photos to my workout. Other times, it will disconnect from my Garmin account so none of my workouts would sync. They get things fixed but it takes a while.
title: Good ‚Äúsocial media‚Äù for active people, but often buggy

review: I have been using this app to log my runs for XC and Track season. However, I saw something odd about one of the segments. I have completed three efforts on one segment and should‚Äôve gotten the Local Legend title, but the app still says that the other person who was Local Legend before still was. I don‚Äôt know if y‚Äôall at Strava can fix this, but if you can please do! Overall, great app and program in general!!!
title: App is great but there are a few bugs‚Ä¶.

review: When it‚Äôs working properly, it‚Äôs a great app. I particularly like the segments function, which really motivates me to up my ride. However, I‚Äôve had multiple problems with this app and have read the various threads online where people have reported similar issues, such as the app failing to show your average speed and your mileage during your ride, often resulting in the app only partially recording your total mileage (very frustrating when competing against others in a monthly mileage challenge). Strava‚Äôs developers need to fix these recurring issues or they‚Äôll lose more riders and runners to competitors like Map My Ride.
title: Fails to record mileage and ave speed

review: Love Strava and it‚Äôs connectivity to other apps and ppl. Would love if the phone would sync with Apple Watch Strava app use while running, so I can see distance and avg pace whether I look at watch or phone during run.  And would love if the app ‚Äútold‚Äù me my distance, avg pace, and split pace at each mile accomplished during run (a competing app does these things and they are the only things I miss).
title: Love, but have suggestions to make even better

review: When traveling to a new city, maps are great to find a frequently run route. But to know how to run it requires us to look at our phones!  Please create an audible turn-by-turn directions option like Google maps. I‚Äôve tried to download the maps and use The Ride with GPS app, but those directions are horrible. Google maps has been the best. Strava: please consider a partnership with them to integrate that functionality.
title: Need Audible directions like Google maps

review: This used to be a great app for logging in and tracking bike rides and runs.  But with every update it gets worse.  Case in point, when I hit record, it tells me it started.  But when I finish it shows as if nothing ever happened, same for the watch extension.  Also, had an incident in which the app wouldn‚Äôt react to any commands, only to execute it an hour later, like it was delayed, it happened with both the phone and watch app.  It happened twice, the second time happened even after I restarted both the phone and the watch‚Ä¶.  I‚Äôm glad I haven‚Äôt paid for a subscription, total disappointment.
title: Bugs, bugs, bugs, did I mention‚Ä¶ bugs?

review: I have to say this is better that other apps I tried but this is still pretty poor quality software.  Syncing between watch and phone is hit or miss.  I lost data for several runs.  Website is also slow to update. For a service that charges money, this is grossly unacceptable. Also if you have problems don‚Äôt bother contacting support.
title: Better than others but still poor quality

review: Really enjoy the app for connecting with my running friends near and far! I use a  Garmin watch to collect the data but almost never look at the Garmin app.  Look at Strava instead. We always say if it is not on Strava it did not happen!  One note for you, with most recent update the mile split bar graph has the bars getting longer the faster you go. That seems counterintuitive to me. I prefer the way it used to be where the bra got shorter the faster you go!
title: Latest Update

review: Strava has been a great running app for me. I‚Äôve logged over 1000 miles on it over the last three years, and it works great almost every time. Occasionally the map function has glitched a bit and missed recording part of the run. I love that it records the pace, mile splits, distance, and elevation gain of my runs. I also like that Strava keeps all my past runs so I can compare times on the same course. My favorite function is that my family and I can share our runs on Strava which helps us stay in touch.
title: Strava is good most days

review: I love this app, HOWEVER, the ‚Äúlocal legend‚Äù feature is a joke.  Supposedly it is a title given to the individual who rides a certain segment the most within 90 days. There are probably 20 of these near my house where I have several dozen rides (and Strava has all of them listed including all the segments), yeah I am the local legend of none of them, and most of these ‚Äúlegends‚Äù have less than 10 rides.  Pretty terrible algorithm
title: Great EXCEPT for 1 feature

review: It would be more inclusive to be able to have the user adjust what performance metrics to display when exporting a highlight photo or what displays on activity feed. We should be able to display any user selected combo of distance, pace, elevation gain, avg heart rate, calories, etc. Right now it displays distance, pace (or instead displays elevation if the route is steep enough), and moving time (elapsed if it is a race). Choosing to not show some of these is more inclusive as some people are insecure about their performance! I‚Äòve seen some of my friends quit strava over what they view as poor performance and I think that‚Äôs the opposite of what this app should be for!
title: Could be more inclusive

review: I love this app. I use it for almost everything I do. Super easy to use, I love to see what I‚Äôve done and compare things. It needs more sports though, it‚Äôs got a lot but I would add skateboarding and long boarding, I do a lot of that and would love to track it. And I think there should be more options for how you measure your achievements, like when I‚Äôm hiking I wish there was a setting so I could see my fastest hike. Right now it shows my longest as the best and it was a really bad time
title: Awesome app. Would add more sports

review: I use this app a lot to track my calories when I run. However, it‚Äôs easy to accidentally forget to stop my recording before I drive. Every time this happens I have to delete my whole recording. I wish there was a notification that popped up when my Bluetooth connected to my car. That way it‚Äôd recognize I‚Äôm about to drive. It‚Äôs so frustrating to have to delete my data after. I‚Äôd even be happy with being able to erase part of my run so that I don‚Äôt achieve a medal for running 65 mph.
title: Helpful but can be improved

review: This has been a great app so far but once they remove BT support later this month, it looses all value. Now you are forced to purchase an expensive alternative device to record your data or use an alternative app. For those of us who need our phones during our rides either because of medical conditions, music or a need to remain in contact with others, you will now need to use another app to record your info and then import the data into Strava. But if I am using another app, I see no purpose in using Strava. And if I have to buy an expensive bike computer, I will be using the Device manufacturers‚Äô native app. So bye bye Strava and I think I will try Specialized‚Äôs Ride app or Wahoos app next.
title: BT Sensors no longer supported

review: I got Strava because I thought it could easily help me find routes for biking, I‚Äôm trying to make biking more of a part of my fitness routine. Having to get on a desktop computer to set routes adds way too much friction to what should be something fairly easy to do on a phone. I signed up for the premium trial (happy to pay for something that‚Äôs useful), but I‚Äôll probably cancel it if I can find an app that will help map bike routes on my phone (I think even Google maps and Waze have a basic version of this, I thought with the popularity of Strava they‚Äôd offer something better).
title: No routing in app?

review:
Great to see you continue to improve the app! Glad to see the sports adjust to what you do for the 3 month view. Finally can see my winter sports. 

Next up - the Statistics Page should also measure other sports!   

Nordic Skiing should be split into Classic and Skate. These are two different sports and times, ie segments. An be vastly different. I would love to be able to look at the difference.
title: Great to see improvement - Next Up Update the Statistics Page!

review:
Very slick UI, easy to use, the most accurate GPS integration I've seen in any app.  I mainly use Strava to track my workouts because their integration with Garmin and other devices is so good. I would highly recommend if you don‚Äôt want to drain your phone battery during rides. As a Summit member all of the post workout analysis is vital to any athlete looking to improve.

I have been using Strava since 2014 and will continue supporting this awesome product. It‚Äôs a must have for any cyclist.
title: Incredible üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

review:
I have a new iPhone 12 mini. I‚Äôve been using the app for years with my iPhone 6s with no issues l. Since migrating to new phone, GPS on Strava is creating bounce, adding wildly more mileage. My mapped hike, run, bike or ski looks like a drunken sailor, with wild squiggly lines compared to the same mapped trails on a non Apple 12 user. 

My friend recently upgraded to an Apple 12 as well. We hiked with a friend on an Apple 11. I had all 3 of us Strava the route. Both of us on Apple 12 had bounce, while Apple 11 recoded accurately. Apple ran diagnostics on my phone at the Genius Bar re: this issue. It‚Äôs not them - it‚Äôs you. Can you adjust so that the new iPhone 12‚Äôs can work with this app?
title: iPhone 12 GPS fail

review: Strata is inconsistent in use. I also have a bunch of people following me that shouldn‚Äôt be on my follow list. When I asked for tech-support it is slow and irrelevant. Like using strata but very disappointed in the tech-support help and other features like having people follow you that aren‚Äôt in your club. Jerry Gottstein PS now I can‚Äôt even send us because every time I enter a nickname will take it. You guys have to get your act together. It‚Äôs annoying to try to communicate with you.
title: Tech support

review:
There are two incredibly annoying and obvious flaws I‚Äôve noticed. The first is one is not given the decision to activate the social media aspects it is automatically activated. This was incredibly annoying as I had no plan to post my runs but it was done anyway.

The second, and this one is far worse, is the runs themselves do not save without data. The past few days I have lost internet service at the end of my run and when I hit save the run was just gone forever. Would it be that complicated to have the run save on the app until service is acquired?

 I will be deleting this app and using a competitors which will likely not have such glaring and fixable bugs.
title: Clear design flaws

review:
I‚Äôve been using Strava since high school and throughout college as a student-athlete. I love how user friendly the app is and the workout analysis it gives after my runs. I also love how easy it is to sync my data between my Garmin Forerunner 255 and Garmin Connect which automatically loads my runs to strava without having to open the app. 

Great user friendly app and seamless connection between GPS watches!
title: Great app to track my activity!

review: For a leading app this has got to have the shoddiest development team of all. Over the past 5 years I have experienced bug after bug after bug with this app. If it‚Äôs not runs or rides being left unrecorded (even though time and waypoints are being reached) it‚Äôs the announcement voice going all 1995-robo all of a sudden. The iOS 12 beta was out for over 2 months ago, am i to believe that none of these issues were present in testing? A more likely scenario is that the reactive Strava development team didn‚Äôt even bother to test. Shameful. Get it together Strava, hire a new QA lead and maybe two dozen more developers while you‚Äôre at it. Humph.
title: Does anyone do QA at Strava?!?

review: I like strava, getting to see what your friends are doing is an encouragement to work hard, and somewhat of an accountability to keep the fitness going. ***Recommendation: I do wish that strava would enable a lock screen ability so that I can quickly check my pace, distance etc with raising my phone instead of having to try and dry my finger print off while running to unlock the phone and check. If strava had this function it would be top notch fitness app in my mind! Can you make it happen strava team?!
title: Like it

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong this app is well thought out and is a quality app and performers like a tracking app should. I‚Äôve moved from mapmyrun to Strava thinking this app would offer something more. I like the personal record metals and live tracking on other users, but I don‚Äôt like how easy it has been to mess my tracking and not be able to enter manually or pre-calculate my distance in order to continue tracking my progress. If you pay for this app it would be nice to set up a group class for beginners to experts cyclists and win local prizes etc.
title: Quality app but lacks in price &

review: I‚Äôm a traumatic brain injury survivor and Strava helps me see what‚Äôs going on.   Good data - there‚Äôs no substitute.   Viewing other athletes work history has helped me prepare.  Example:  I completed the Rock Ridge Darkside back in July.  150 miles of Flint Hills epic goat jeep path lunacy in the dark.  Electronics failed.  Lost.  Off course.   Started at 9PM.    Finished the next day just before the Noon cutoff.   Ironically No data captured for that event - but it was the first since accident‚Ä¶.  And Strava helped get me there!
title: It helps!

review: I love strava, found it to replace the Nike+ running app that was poor at tracking. I even have paid for Summit. However, while I would have given Strava a 10 out of 5 two months ago, it‚Äôs a 3/5 now. 7 of my last 23 runs have had gps, syncing, or other issues that have inaccurately recorded my workout. Of the 7/23, the last 2 have failed epic-ly. The last being a 2.7ish mile run where the gps failed, heart rate tracker failed, and time failed. Only mileage number was relatively accurate. I‚Äôm going to give it one more try before switching run keeper apps.
title: Was the best, now a jest

review: I used to love this app but I think I am going to look for a better one. Several times now the ads and notifications to upgrade appear on the screen in the middle of my workout. The problem is that when I try to turn them off the app stops recording. Several times I didn‚Äôt realize it and had to start over. That may not be such a big deal to some people but I walk in different cities and sometimes the only way I find my way back is through retracing my route. That‚Äôs a problem when the app stops and I find myself somewhere with no clue as to what route I took.
title: Keeps turning off when ads appear!

review:
Please bring back the heart rate monitor on fee app for fitness devices and smart watches. 

I have been a Strava member for some time and like the app, but don‚Äôt appreciate the removal of heart rate monitor on the free app for the Apple Watch. I understand that Strava is trying to drive users to the premium versions where features include heart rate zone analysis. However, blocking native Apple Watch functionality while recording the activity is not a good solution. Instead you should continue to provide the heart rate monitor during Apple Watch usage, but not provide details & heart rate data stratification on user profiles when activity is synced unless they are paying for the premium packages. 

I‚Äôm sure several members check their heart rate to monitor their health while training to determine if they should increase or decrease intensity based on real time feed back. 

Please add this feature back to the app.
title: Please bring heart rate monitor back to fitness trackers

review:
While I consider Strava to be the best activity tracking social media platform on the market, it can still be better. The ability to group pedal assist rides with normal rides or as a stand alone heatmap would be super nice because the user workaround is to define a pedal assist ride as a normal ride which I‚Äôm certain aggravates users focused on segments. Another improvement would be to search ride history by bike ridden. 

Remember, if you don‚Äôt continue to improve a product or service, it‚Äôs fairly certain your competitors will catch and or pass you. 

From a happy user looking to help.
title: Strava could be better

review: I use this with my Apple Watch when running (without the iPhone). When I raise my wrist to check distance or pace the run will automatically pause even though I‚Äôm still running. After the run there‚Äôs a message to save or delete the run, but the buttons are small and the delete button is the same size as the save button so it‚Äôs too easy to accidentally delete your run (yes, I‚Äôve done it). When I get back home it takes a long time to get the run on the Watch to sync with the phone so I can check splits and stuff. It‚Äôs frustrating!
title: Needs Improvement

review:
As a premium member I really enjoy all the data I see.   Even though I‚Äôm 73 years old I like seeing my power metrics, PRs, overall improvement etc.   

I would like to see one new feature.  Instead of defining a new segment by using the map and trying to ‚Äúdrop the pin‚Äù close to the start and finish I would like to be able to use the lap function on my Wahoo Elemnt to precisely define a segments beginning and end.
title: Happy Premium Member

review: I appreciate Strava because it allows me to record my lives. It shows me the trends of my rides that I repeat. I would say. The only improvement in needs is a direct message ability but I like the fact that I can put photos with the ride and the app is consistent. It doesn‚Äôt break down, it also allows me to follow some of my favorite people both male and female with the Tour de France and other bike races that they do internationally
title: Good App

review: I‚Äôm a paid subscriber and relying on Strava to discover new routes and track segments. But lately the route discovery stopped working (no matter what I search for Strava shows me the same one little 3 mile route over and over again, and nothing else). Also as I‚Äôve started to use Training Peaks more and more for ride plans Strava has become less and less useful. Finally, the whole social aspect just doesn‚Äôt quite work for me... I don‚Äôt want it broadcasting every time I go for a walk or workout, but if I turn off integration (to shut it up) then it‚Äôs even less useful... I don‚Äôt see myself renewing next year.
title: Less and less useful...

review:
While I like many aspects of this app, I have tried multiple times to stop it from syncing to my Fitbit. It shows that I‚Äôve done it successfully (I even check later in the day after closing and reopening the app) - only to find that Strava had re-synced to Fitbit. I asked for Help but was only given a standard form answer on how to sync the apps and was not able to indicate the answer did not solve me issue.

This is extremely frustrating as I wear my Fitbit (which has more information on me),  but only turn Strava on for a short period during workouts - and then it overrides steps and calories in Fitbit.
title: App will not let me un-sync from FitBit

review:
Good app but it is lacking some features apples workout app has through the Apple Watch. Namely running cadence and custom laps/splits for workouts. 

It should be easy to add these as default features since if the run is recorded through the apple workout app and imported it is displayed - so the data is there. It‚Äôs just a matter of adding it as a default feature in Strava without using other apps as a workaround. 

Custom splits/laps would be nice too for workouts with run-recover intervals.
title: Please add running Cadence and custom splits

review: Strava is an essential part of my training routine. It's a great way to check your progress and keep in touch with other athletes - something especially worth it during the pandemic. However the app lacks a lot of features the web version has to offer. It's beyond me why I can't add new gear with the app for example. If I was responsible for the development team I would focus clearly on mobile.
title: Using it every day

review: I enjoy and use this app a lot - but for some reason you can‚Äôt remove kudos after giving them. This would be equivalent to not being able to unlike a post on Instagram or Facebook. It‚Äôs a very simple feature that has been asked for many times, but they refuse to implement it for some reason. Hence the four star rating. I only wrote this review because I just accidentally gave kudos on someones activity and I can‚Äôt believe that I can‚Äôt undo it.
title: Good, but one major flaw

review: Strava is a great app! I enjoy tracking my bike rides and walks. I also enjoy skateboarding but unfortunately they don‚Äôt have that as an option. So I absolutely think that it would be wonderful if they added skateboarding as an option to track yourself. For all my skaters out there who have Strava, I think that they would be happy to know that they have that option! Otherwise overall Strava is a very enjoyable app.
title: Great but is missing something

review: I‚Äôve been a subscriber for about five years and recorded about 15,000 miles and a million feet, most of them running. I‚Äôve increasingly become unhappy with the political editorials subscriber receive from the company. I‚Äôm not paying for political commentary. I‚Äôm paying to track my conditioning and cheer on my favorite local athletes. If I want to get a political opinion, I know where to go. If I want to track my fitness, I‚Äôm finding that it‚Äôs becoming time to see what other services are available because automatic kudos from nice people is not enough to overcome the irritating political statements.
title: Too Political

review: This makes the app less helpful as I and most people would rather see the difference week to week in distances and going for goals rather than times which should be a secondary thing to look at. It was and the app was great 5 out of 5 but now they‚Äôve taken a step backwards and made it much worse. I‚Äôm going to stop using it which is a shame because I loved it for the past few years.
title: Switching from distance to time as measurement

review:
In the most recent update they are removing certain leaderboard and segment features from non-subscribers. For those that enjoy interacting with free users in clubs on the leaderboards its a huge mistake. Definitely considering cancelling my subscription over this greedy move.

Anytime a company starts restricting already-free features to subscribers instead of introducing new features, that‚Äôs an immediate red flag. Why would you reduce the reasons people get into the app? Why not instead improve the features for current subscribers? This move is directly going to reduce my friends who use the app since majorly competitive segments will now be locked to top-10 only. Goodbye competitive spirit hello paywall.
title: Great App starting to falter

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for the longest time. Used others app but always return to Strava because the design is nice, clean and not too much layers menu but more importantly not those flashy adds. But I do want some improvement. For example, I can‚Äôt import route that my friends send over to me I would have to use desktop to create the route. Also I have Apple Watch but I can‚Äôt use swim mode. It only exist on phone, why? I can‚Äôt carry my phone when I swim üòÇ.
title: Love Strava

review:
I like strava, I like the community. 
Will give you an idea: 
Almost every time I go for a ride, specially during the winter season, I keep finding stuff on the road: a glove, sunglasses, a light.... and we all do the same road few times a week. 
you should integrate a find/lost option on your plateforme. 
I would be more than happy to enter a description of what I have find in the app, maybe drop it in a coffee shop or a bike store who is a partner with starva (that‚Äôs a win for everyone) and on my way home. Then you receive a notification that something was find on your ride (did you lost something?) and the person who have lost something can enter a description of it via a filter and if that match, the person will receive to localisation of the item lost. And starva can give a badge (or a free coffee or whatever) for being a good human. :-) 
Cheers 
Julien
title: Idea

review: Haven‚Äôt been able to sync info from stock workout app so this works great as a log that also links to my final surge account.  Would be better if there was a feature to turn off heart rate monitoring as it drains battery and could let me run longer without worrying about battery life , also it won‚Äôt let me turn on split notifications even thought my notifications are on.  Other wise it‚Äôs an efficient running app that works well.
title: Great app

review: I tried using the Strava app on my Apple Watch series 2 for several runs and it consistently would not start mapping mileage until a quarter mile or more into the run. You never find out it is doing this until after the run is uploaded once I‚Äôm back at my phone. Extremely annoying because it shows my pace to be much faster than it actually is. There needs to be an indicator showing when GPS is acquired so I know when to start my run. I was not in a wooded area when this occurred each time. For now I am going to use the native workout app and then upload to Strava using another app.
title: Watch app needs some work

review: Strava is awesome and I am a premium member. However I am disappointed that my Apple Watch and my phone are entirely separate. I would like to be able to access my premium content on my phone during a ride and also have the info on my watch. What I get is two entries and the stats do. It match. My Apple Watch should act as a remote and/or an additional display for my iphone app. I would like to start my ride on my watch, stop it in my phone add the photos I took and submit it to my social media.
title: Apple Watch and iphone not seamless.

review: I regularly use Strava and love a lot of the benefits - integration with Garmin, tracking mileage for my shoes, sharing popular routes and segments so I can find running trails in other cities, etc. What could make it 5 stars is if they had a more comprehensive list of activities when entering a workout. For example: my tennis match, barre class, and yoga practice all have to be categorized as a "workout", when it wouldn't be hard to make the list more comprehensive. But overall recommended.
title: Good fitness tracking app, but key pieces missing

review: Strava used to be pretty good. It had everything it needed, but was lacking some features that would have made it great. There are relatively simple features that users have been requesting for many years, but they‚Äôre focused on things that annoy users, like making notifications more spammy and less useful, paid promotions for companies in the form of challenges that clog your feed, and all sorts of activities that are nice to track (privately) but annoying to sift through in a feed that can‚Äôt be filtered. Blech, not paying for this anymore.
title: Used to be decent , now it‚Äôs annoying

review: I like the features Strava has to offer, but the app‚Äôs GPS stops working half the time I use it. It doesn‚Äôt matter where I‚Äôm running. This happens in multiple locations (I was originally thinking it was a poor signal issue). But I started using Runkeeper, while also using Strava, just in case it stopped tracking, and the other running app doesn‚Äôt stop tracking when Strava does. Either Strava will save I‚Äôve run zero km/miles or it will only register a small portion of the route. Ive seen others in my feed complain about this as well. What is going on?
title: GPS often cuts out/have to use other app just in case

review: I‚Äôve been using this app (Apple Watch in combination with iPhone) all year to track workouts for half marathon and marathon training without issues, love the features that come in the free version. As of 2 days ago I can no longer use the Apple Watch app without also carrying my phone and logging in on my phone first. What gives? It‚Äôs a pain to have to login on the phone first, and this sudden change makes me worry that I won‚Äôt be able to rely on this app to track workouts, especially important races and training runs, going forward.
title: What changed?

review:
I‚Äôve been using Strava for 5 years now and haven‚Äôt had any issues until the most recent release. It consistently locks up (iOS 12.1) on my iPhone 7. Feature-wise they need to implement more of what the desktop app has. Things like fitness and freshness would be nice to see as well as customizable heart rate zones. TSS would also be nice to see in the weekly summary.

Overall a good app that I have used daily for years, but feature releases have been slow.
title: Good, but buggy and lacking some necessary features

review: I like this app a lot. I use it all the time. The one thing that could really use improvement is that the app should automatically stop when you get back to where you started. There are two many times when I forgot to stop Strava and have to stop at after I‚Äôve driven away from where I started. There‚Äôs also not a future to edit. I don‚Äôt understand why there is not a setting to be able to do that. This could be fixed it would be five stars for sure. Thank you.
title: Auto stop.

review: Strava had the most amazing GPS of any app I‚Äôve tried. It nearly matches my running watch. It has all of the data us running geeks want to see. Analyses of our performance over time, exertion effort, etc. For the cost, it need to offer training plans that are on the app. The only training plans it has are on paper which is as old school as you can get. I like to use a plan for motivation so I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll resubscribe next year.
title: Nice for data geeks but needs more.

review: It would be nice if Strava worked on an indoor track- for some reason whenever I‚Äôve tried to log miles indoors, Strava usually doesn‚Äôt record anything, but one time it got about half my run. I usually run alone, and where winter is coming and daylight hours are decreasing, I‚Äôm a lot safer running indoors, but I can‚Äôt track my mileage as accurately. Otherwise, the GPS has worked great for me most of the time- there have been 2 races though where there was some glitch and Strava missed most of my mileage (but got all of my time), but usually it works fine.
title: Mostly reliable

review: As someone who has headed mobile teams I must say that there is much to be desired with this app. The app has gone through UI and UX updates from an already unintuitive experience to yet another. Information is redundant in various screens, confusing to navigate and incredibly buggy. What‚Äôs worse is that if you need support of any kind, even as a paid subscriber, don‚Äôt bother expecting a reply or wait a week, or two. Really. If this were my CS team they would be properly trained, or fired. But hey, since they don‚Äôt have any competition it affords them the arrogance to ignore their user base‚Ä¶ until it doesn‚Äôt.
title: Poor engineering and worse customer support

review: Used Strava for years.   My quick access to weekly mileage is now gone!  I‚Äôm not sure if it happened with the last update, but I will now drop back down from a subscription to the free service.  It was convenient in the past to simply swipe through past weeks, now I have to go to a separate screen and see a different layout under my Goals...
title: Weekly Mileage GONE!

review:
I love this app and use it everyday. However, a few suggestions
1. You should be able to post videos, not only photos, when uploading an activity
2. You should be able to mark other cardio events (such as Nordic skiing) as a race, a workout, or an over distance- similar to running
3. You should be able to see splits for miles for other events (like Nordic) as you can for running.
Thanks so much. Amazing app.
title: Great app, but a few suggestions

review:
Strava only has an iPhone app in the Apple store. It will run in 1/4 your screen, or blown up and pixelated as if it were a fisher price toy.
If you go to Strava  using Safari on your iPad, it will fail to render properly - most significantly it will not display notifications or challenges. There are other bits missing,  but those are the two I noticed. It will place a banner at the top of the page telling you to get the iPad app, but that is a lie... you will get an iPhone app.  Additionally requesting the mobile or desktop version of the website will not fix the problem. You either will be blind on notifications or you will curse and go to your desktop/laptop and log in there.
title: Not for iPad

review:
I use this app whenever I run, workout, etc. but during my runs it only tracks the 0.1 which is kind of a pain when you are finishing up and you gotta keep looking down to see if you‚Äôve hot that 3 mile mark or something. If they could update that small little feature this app blows everyone else out of the water with HR tracking, elevation and all of the other small details it has. Very interesting for a fitness nerd like myself.
Thank you.
title: Love this app, need better tracking though

review:
I‚Äôve used Strava off and on over the years. I‚Äôm not an ‚Äúathlete‚Äù, but I like to track my casual weekend rides. 

I was very disappointed to see them remove many basic free features and put them behind a paywall. Even just seeing your monthly mileage (which is all I wanted) now costs $60+ a year. Mostly I‚Äôm disappointed by the messaging and abruptness. To suddenly remove features during a pandemic and recession is not customer friendly. Would love to see a tiered version for more casual users. 

App works most of the time but sometimes it doesn‚Äôt record my rides or stops recording mid ride.
title: Many features removed from free version

review: Like the app, have used it off and on for a couple of years, but the gps often cuts out and makes weird jagged lines instead of following my course. Not sure why it does that but it messes up tracking my activity a bit. Also, I really want the option of choosing who I‚Äôd like to share that I joined a challenge with. I don‚Äôt like that it notifies everyone every time I join something and want a way to keep it from automatically posting that.
title: Please allow us to hide ‚Äújoined challenge‚Äù notification

review:
I know there will always be occasional errors, but this one ‚Äújagged‚Äù so far away on a location that the top speed on a run came fo 60 mph.  This obviously doesn‚Äôt make sense, but there seems to be no error checking or smoothing on the location data the app receives. 

Why are Strava programmers allowing such absurd deviations of location data to be graphed and even used to calculate speed?

My 5-star rating has dropped to 4... and could go even lower if such obvious and serious bugs aren‚Äôt fixed.  

However, in all other ways, it‚Äôs a terrific app I‚Äôve been using for years.  When it works right, it‚Äôs amazing how closely it tracks my route and all the stats are very useful.
=====
Update: Feb 5 - latest update didn‚Äôt fix this bug
Still adding extra out & back jags to places I didn‚Äôt go.
=====
title: Started getting serious errors recorded on routes in 2020

review:
For the most part I love what Strava‚Äôs done with this app & it‚Äôs really sparked my biking motivation, but it‚Äôs been saving 2, 3, sometimes 4 copies of the same workout to apple health vastly inflating my fitness data. Turns out there‚Äôs a known issue in the Strava support pages with no resolution since OCTOBER 2016. Such a simple crucial integration and yet we‚Äôre coming up on 3 years with no fix. 

I want to give 5 stars but until this is fixed I just can‚Äôt justify it.

Please Strava!
title: Saves duplicate entries to apple health!

review: I switched from run keeper to Strava last year because it was some compatible with my Iwatch3. Up until a week or two ago that was the case. Now, I can‚Äôt get it to work. I get a message on my Iwatch 3 that tells me to log in on my phone, which I‚Äôve done. That doesn‚Äôt fix it. I‚Äôve tried uninstalling it from the watch and then reinstalling it. That‚Äôs worked three times. Now that‚Äôs not working. I don‚Äôt want to use my bulky phone. I hope Strava fixes this. My running club uses Strava.
title: Strava not favorite anymore

review:
App hasn‚Äôt changed in years. Paying money for nothing new. I‚Äôd love to see an analysis page similar to zwift companion - power, cadence, speed, elevation etc all on one overlay with the ability to remove/add metrics. Right now can only even get cadence on computer - why? Maybe get the relive extension built in once activity is uploaded. 

No better apps out there. But let‚Äôs make some changes before another app comes along.
title: Time for some updates and changes

review: I have been using Strava on my Apple Watch 3 for about 10 months now. Three day ago I used the app and had no issues. Today I can‚Äôt get the app to open on my watch. I‚Äôve deleted and reinstalled it on my watch and phone and it still won‚Äôt open. The screen goes black for about a second and it goes back to the app screen. I notice that there was an update three days ago. I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs what caused it or not.
title: Apple Watch Series 3 issues

review: For years I have been using this app and it has worked great. But within the last month or so, it refuses to record distance and pace correctly. It basically stops tracking distance and pace. It is basically, at this point, a stopwatch recording my time.  I sent a note to their customer service a week ago and have yet to receive a response. At this point, there are plenty of other apps to use.
title: Was great, now isn‚Äôt

review: Been using the app for years and recently subscribed for first time though I probably don‚Äôt use most of the features. One question and ask of developers: can you please put the weekly totals back in the main view of dashboard instead of a worthless chart of the last 12 weeks (or at least make it an option to show that instead)? I miss my weekly totals!
title: Miss weekly totals

review: I love using Strava has everything I want and need except only problem is I run in intervals  (walk and run) so I have to use two apps in order for me to that. Would be nice if they could have a setting to put in how long you want to run and walk for and notify you like Runmeter does, I would only use Strava at that point but I have to use both which then my phone battery dies faster because of the two apps.
title: Wish it had an intervals option.

review: Excellent app, been using it a long time, but I have to echo other reviews in that the price hike to $80/year is pretty dang expensive. It‚Äôs an excellent app, and I use it all the time so I‚Äôve bought a subscription, but the price hike was poorly communicated and if it rises again, I‚Äôm probably going to cancel my subscription. I can‚Äôt imagine driving long-term customers away with price hikes is a good business model, but maybe the numbers on the dev‚Äôs side speak differently‚Ä¶.
title: Great app, too expensive

review:
The fact that you cannot remove kudoses. If you give someone a kudos on accident (which happens more often than one might assume) there‚Äôs no way to get it back. I don‚Äôt get why such a simple function hasn‚Äôt been implemented from the start.

Also, when I crop an activity where I‚Äôm running with someone, (I‚Äôm talking like one second at the beginning) it removes me from the group even though the rest of the run we were literally side-by-side.
title: Great except

review: I used this app for years, but over the last year all they do is push their paid subscription. Without it, you can only view limited statistics on your workout that any other fitness app provides. To put the icing on the cake for the year, you can only view your yearly recap with a paid subscription. Not to mention the handful of times this company feels the need to push their comments on political situations, which I absolutely have no interest in from any company. Will find another app to track my workouts in going forward.
title: Free functionality declining

review: Just recently had some one from Germany hack my account.  I tried blocking & reporting it to Strave and received no help and/or anything indicating that Strava was looking into the matter.  In the meantime this person, even after blocking them, continued to send me kudos.  It looks like they are promoting their porn site.  I tried going to Strava Help icon to see how to delete my account and start over.  So, many steps it too difficult to figure out and where it prompt me to click nothing happened.  So, I did all I could think to do & deleted the app.  But, of course it just goes into the cloud, so, now I still can‚Äôt just start over.  Don‚Äôt expect to get any real tech help from Strava.
title: Hacked account

review: Total BS app , they force articles they publish  on your feed and if you comment or question that validity of said article they call you a racist and ban your account after months or years of hard work and erase all of your stats . If they don‚Äôt want public discourse on their fitness app, maybe they shouldn‚Äôt have started to turn the app into a fitness version of IG or Twitter. Bull crap app , should just stick to fitness instead of political pandering and political correctness .
title: Turned into an identity politics app

review:
I love Strava and I‚Äôm a paid subscriber. The new route recommendations are a great feature. However, a much more basic and obvious feature seems to be missing: when I go on a great ride, or when my friends do, I should be able to save it into ‚Äúmy rides‚Äù so I can easily go back to it.

Let‚Äôs basic but also useful would be for the app to signal more obviously upcoming turns to stay in the route that one is following, a bit like car or walking gps apps do.

Thanks
title: Should be able to save routes

review:
So many awesome changes taking place. Thanks for bringing back G.A.P!  

The Apple Sync is super nice! Love the heart notification too!

Special request |  can we adjust for those of us that use more than one device without the double workouts counting towards the weekly running goal (e.g., some workouts are from the AW while others are from another device)? If I import from both as a comparrison, my weekly goal mileage is impacted.
title: Great Job Devs!

review: I have recorded every ride that I have done since 2013. Now, in 2019, I have the app on my iPhone XS. The app power use is minimal during 50 mile plus day on my bicycle. I use my mileage to keep track of scheduled bicycle maintenance. The premium features are useful to me, especially since I like to compare my performance with other riders. Premium has also given me access to detailed heat maps for trip planning. Highly recommend the app.
title: I‚Äôve Used Since 2013

review:
The GPS is always off. I‚Äôve ran with my iPhone and Apple Watch. The Watch is more accurate than my phone. About a week into using the app, with my phone, the app registered the first .5 mile than lost connection for about a mile. The app showed me running through houses and even a pond lol. Today, now only using my watch, it didn't registered the first .5 miles. It‚Äôs really a shoot or miss, I start at the same point everyday and usually wait 30 sec after starting the run to make sure I have a solid connection. 

It might be unfair to blame this on the app since it does rely on gps, however I haven‚Äôt had this problem with other apps. 

I would suggest an edit feature after you run, in case there is an hiccup with the gps. 

TLDR: Overall the app is great, LOVE the design and the amount of data that is tracked, just fix the GPS connection and add an edit feature after the run
title: Great App but....

review: I have used the app on phone and watch for years now. Using the watch app with series two Apple Watch in two recent marathons has convinced me that it is inaccurate and consistently overestimates your pace/distance. Both marathons it was ahead of the distance by roughly 5-10 percent.  Unfortunately this makes the app useless for races and not ideal for training.  I love the app‚Äôs simplicity and mike split notifications etc along with strava‚Äôs community. It just doesn‚Äôt make the cut for an accurate gps running experience. Here‚Äôs hoping that one day...
title: Great running app but unacceptably inaccurate

review:
I like the ability to plan routes, but it would be nice to have turn-by-turn directions while using a route. 

The watch app needs some attention too. Can you add the ability to re-order the activities, or favorite activities, or remove unwanted activities?

Also, when cycling, I like to track my activity using my phone so I can see the map. However, heart rate data from my Apple Watch isn‚Äôt included in these activities. Is there any way to add this data?
title: Great app, but could be better

review:
Everything useful to long time users has been moved behind a pay wall:
- elevation adjusted pace
- leaderboards
- segment performance comparison over time across repeat workouts 
- comparison against friends and people you follow

If taking features away wasn‚Äôt enough now you throw it in our face with annoying ads to pay for premium service. Note: you make money off of us dedicated long time users because you have our data and usage to improve the app and develop routes which you sell and charge for. 

On top of that, you don‚Äôt have interval training features, you can‚Äôt edit/add gear using the app, and the performance of the app is dismal. Watch app won‚Äôt load. Watch app crashes. Phone app doesn‚Äôt log elevation, distance, or time accurately when comparing to garmin and other devices. Not just a few feet elevation or distance but we‚Äôre talking hundreds of feet of elevation and miles of distance off from other devices. Uploads fail. I‚Äôm ready to leave you!
title: The company continues to disappoint

review:
I have been using this app for years. Nearly 1000 runs and 6000 miles. I switched from the Nike app years ago as I felt like they were trapping my data in a way I was not comfortable with. 

Over the past year Strava has been slowly stripping away features saying they are only available with a premium subscription. As I am a developer myself, I understand the need to keep the doors open. But this is getting rediculous. First pulling monthly mileage totals away and now weekly mileage totals is absolutely ridiculous. What‚Äôs next, hiding my runs after I complete them?

Instead of adding a million sports to widen your foot print and user base give me some features that are actually premium to running and biking where you started and then I will fork over my hard earned money. 

Until then I am going to start leaving my data on my Garmin and only leaving my strava on for my friends to see my progress.... unless that is considered a premium feature now too.
title: Add value by adding features then I will pay for premium

review: My screen was on and my phone was in my pocket while I was riding my bike. I took my phone out to change songs, and what do you know, somehow I purchased the $65 subscription for a year! THIS HAS HAPPENED TO ME TWICE. Screw this stupid app. They should be sued. I immediately canceled the subscription but I have to wait on Apple to DECIDE if they will give me a refund. For real?! Are you guys serious with this nonsense. I never wanted the stupid subscription. Was it designed such that any random contact with the screen takes you to the subscription page?! Again, this shouldn‚Äôt even be legal. This app blows.
title: Beware! It will purchase subscriptions without your knowledge!

review: Classic money grabbing company. They used to offer a leaderboard with the free version. Now they want you to pay for everything. This app no longer offers anything unique to the other apps which are free. Don‚Äôt waste your time dealing with an app that tracks your workout and constantly shows you all the cool things you could pay for. All your doing is giving up privacy rights with no trade off. Really disappointed with the company for making this change, I hope everyone else is fed up enough to uninstall so they can see the mistake they made.
title: Always wanting more money. Free version is devoid of features.

review: you guys ruined this app w/your latest update. everything that was great and unique about this app now requires a purchase. did you really have to become this greedy !?!? not being able to review old rides or times, and stats of those rides. as a mountain bike i do rely heavily on this information and with bikes and equipment being as expensive as is i‚Äôm disappointed to find basic information of my rides unable to be seen. the app is purged. this literally only tracks the total distance and nothing else. this used to be an amazing app w/a great community. others and I are saddened by your greed ! you have ruined your application and more importantly the community !!!
title: strava is greedy

review:
Not so long ago or maybe longer Free membership users are optioned to sign up for Strava Summit via the Beacon feature. In the preference field when selecting ‚Äúbeacon‚Äù the next screen appears and advertisement screen for Summit. It cannot be ignored and beacon trouble shooting is not available.
The Beacon feature suddenly stopped working and my family is not in the know when I‚Äôm riding my bike. This safety feature is one of many features I like about Strava.
title: Beacon a No Go

review:
Great app with room for improvement.
1) The app needs to include provisions to see Cadence, temperature, and the other parameters that gps units export, and that the Strava website shows. The app is the main go-to over the website but lacks the same amount of data.
2) The app doesn‚Äôt accept custom photo uploads when Zwift sends a photo as part of the ride...something is lost in translation.

Add the data, and this will be near perfect.
title: I need to see more data in the app

review: All around this is a good app, and you get drawn in to subscribe to premium, but it is a big let down when you learn you can use Apple Watch OR iPhone.  You get a heart rate with the watch but the display is unusable when you are riding.  In the other hand, with an iPhone and a phone mount on your bike you can see your speed, race your prior rides, but without the ability to monitor heart rate.
title: Nice but Premium does not work well with Apple Watch integration

review:
Problems again, but I did have a good 3 months of proper tracking. Not it‚Äôs split between being pretty close to accurate, to completely crazy & all over the place. I still want to use this app, but it‚Äôs getting harder & harder to support it, since it‚Äôs become so temperamental & hard to trust. I will be trying out alternate apps now...

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Old 1* review;
For the last 5 months or so, with a few days here and there of working properly, Strava or iPhone has been unable to properly keep track of my distance. It just goes crazy & puts random lines all over the place. It was a 5 Star app, but lately its just been a disappointment. Made walking not so much fun. Fix it & you‚Äôll get your 5 Star back. 

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Old 5* review:
I use this app daily, but I can't run. I have to use the run option for it to keep up with my miles daily / yearly. Wish there was an option to change this.
title: Serious problems.

review:
I was a premium member for 6 years, and cancelled it this year.  Strava has slowly been removing capabilities over time.  One example is the option to search/explore strava segments in a specific area.  What‚Äôs the point if you can‚Äôt look for segments in your neighborhood. 

Customers have asked for options such as the ability to filter out unwanted activities (like swimming or yoga, no one cares), but strava has not responded.  There are more and more ads of course.  I‚Äôve read a lot of strava‚Äôs forums, maybe strava should as well.  

Strava switched to an algorithm, which shows random activities on my feed vice showing my friends activities in chronological order. I don‚Äôt care about their rides from last week, I want to see this weekend‚Äôs rides on my feed. 

Adding photos to activities was a good touch though. I like that. 

Strava is no longer worth my money. I use the free version occasionally, but I‚Äôm definitely not on it like I used too.
title: Strava is getting worse

review: I used to love this app - seeing my progress on the segments I run often is particularly cool - but the last handful of runs I‚Äôve gone on the app isn‚Äôt picking up my gps even though it says it is. Frustrating to the point that I‚Äôd rather not bother with it. The other thing that bothers me is the lack of options as far as the voice cues are concerned. You can really only choose between half mile and mile splits but it would be nice to have time interval cues as a choice. I also wish you could set the distance or time of your run and get light coaching cues along the way.
title: Good not great

review: I had thought with today‚Äôs technology one could map their ride/ jog/ walk with the use of a smart watch that has GPS vs having their cell phone with them. This was the purpose of buying the watch in the first place after all. Well you can‚Äôt. The watch app only seems to give you your heat rate and time of event. Very lack luster offerings by a well respected app. You live you learn.  If it matters I have an iWatch 7
title: It works great‚Ä¶ If you keep your phone with you.

review: Moving free features that are now only accessed via paid subscription while simultaneously jacking the annual cost up to $80/yr is ridiculous. I MIGHT have considered it at $60/yr but even that seemed a little steep. I enjoy using the app but I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate drop Strava like a bad habit and switch to something else that offered comparable features for less money. I couldn‚Äôt even access my yearly recap without paying for a subscription, REALLY Strava!?! No loyalty shown to their user base that have been with them for years‚Ä¶ shameful.
title: Empty your pockets!

review: I use Strava for cycling and kayaking and it tracks well but when I use it for swimming, hah! I swim in an outdoor lap pool at the park, but Strava shows me tracking all over the park! Also, it shows me swimming 3,450 yards at 49 seconds per 100 yards when I only swam 1,500 yards at 1 minute, 50 seconds per 100 yards. Maybe Strava is trying to make me feel better than I am! Guys at Strava, please fix this major flaw! I have the full year paid subscription. Do I need to go to another app developer like myswimpro to get accurate stats?
title: Swimming? No, otherwise good

review: This had literally everything I wanted: distance tracker, timer, elevation measurements, speed, ways to record all types of works outs, stats for long trends of use, it could‚Äôve been great! But it‚Äôs so garbage when I‚Äôm excited to check my progress and it‚Äôs auto paused itself for some reason? I‚Äôm not even not moving it just stops. I just finished a 20 mile bike ride but it only recorded 14 because it decided to stop when I took too long on a hill I guess. Seriously, if this app would work it would be a god send but after today I‚Äôm going to try some alternatives :/
title: Has all the features I wanted but forgets to work

review: ...yhea my polar hrm won‚Äôt connect to the app a but connects instantly to other apps running on the same phone. polar H7 bluetooth smart hrm strap. i got it to connect once and then never again. Update: removed any record of the hrm from the phone and added it again, then added from strava and did not pair with other apps and it works perfectly weber since.
title: now i see why you took off bluetooth hr support

review: Many of my friends use Strava so I have really been trying. I even paid for ‚ÄúSummit‚Äù thinking maybe the paid service would eliminate the glitches. I can not get it to consistently work. Sometimes it quits recording mid ride, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt connect to my heart rate sensor, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt connect to my cadence sensor. It is truly worthless as it provides incomplete data, almost every time. Map my Ride
title: There must be a better app

review: Have been using this app to track miles because it‚Äôs an easy way to compare weekly miles and have a little competition between XC teammates. I have never written a review but recently I‚Äôve felt the need to since the new update. Getting rid of the ability to see your weekly miles and previous weeks on your profile is an insanely aggravating change. You can now only view it if you have the paid subscription. Mine as well make the whole app subscription based. I get that they are a company and need to make money but they already lock away a ton of their features behind the paywall. I will take my review down if they change it back.
title: Why?

review: Strava is great until subscriptions get involved. When you do sign up, beware that the 60 dollar per year is a one time fee. IT DOES NOT DISCLOSE THIS! Only for you to assume the 7.99 monthly fee, if selected is one deal. It disguised as if you sign a ‚Äúone year contract‚Äù that it‚Äôs only 5/mo. I am looking into how a class action lawsuit can assist others that have tricked by this application. I love the application, but the companies process for a subscription should be blatant and transparent. Very disappointed. ‚ÄúWe support........‚Äù I get capitalism, but not capitalizing on lack of information. I tried to verify the 5/month was actually monthly, to my own despise, I learned a lesson. Don‚Äôt let my lesson become your mistake.
title: BS Subscription

review: I use Strava only casually. The last two updates have been pretty disappointing. Using the free version, you used to be able to see weekly progress compared to the previous week. You used to be able to see your speeds for matched runs in your history. Both of these features were removed in the last two updates! Now you have to pay a subscription fee for those features! I know they have to make money somehow but removing features isn‚Äôt going to win you any fans.
title: Removing features to make you pay

review: Seems to pick and choose days it will work/not work. I know strava isn't the MOST accurate when it comes to tracking  your time and miles. But when I pay for the premium I expect it to actually track my results. Instead I come back home only to realize that after 2 hours of riding it didn't record a single mile. You're honestly just better off getting a bike computer.
title: Strava Problems

review: I have been using strava so much throughout this year to help me train with my cross county team. It is one of the best running apps out there and it really makes non runners like my mom want to get the virtual badges. I ran into this problem a while ago and I noticed it when I went running and it said it was tracking my run but it wouldn‚Äôt show where I‚Äôve been or tracked my distance, which make my runs very annoying because I wouldn‚Äôt know my splits or my distance/pace. It is a bug i found but maybe for others it doesn‚Äôt affect them. I have re downloaded the app so hopefully it changes
title: Technical difficulties

review: Ok, it's the most random review title ever but Strava is a great app. All the cool kids use it! I like having the ability to track my runs right from my smart phone. One of the best features is Strava keeps track of the mileage I put on each pair of my running shoes so I know when it's time to phase them out. It's also a great way to see what other routes folks run to get ideas for different runs. Also fun to offer support and motivation amongst other runners.
title: Strava is Hot Lava!

review: I still think this is the best app for tracking cycling, but I don‚Äôt like the change to the ‚ÄúStart‚Äù screen on the Apple Watch app. You used to be able to set your preferred type of workout, and then the ‚ÄúStart‚Äù screen was a big easy-to-push button. The updated version of the Apple Watch app took that away, and I wish they would bring the big ‚ÄúStart‚Äù button back for people (like me) who mainly use the app to track one type of activity.
title: Still great, but slightly less so

review: Generally quite like Strava. My biggest complaint is that when I am actually riding,  using Strava on my iPhone , one can not see the trails. When one checks your tracks on a desktop, all the trails are seen, but when being able to see the trails would be most useful on the iPhone, when out on the trails,  Strava does not show them. I wish that would be improved.
title: Can't see trail map on iPhone when actually riding

review: Strava is an amazing app. The best for cycling imho, or at least it would be if they best allowed you to connect with a Bluetooth cadence meter. I have yet to buy a garmin but I‚Äôm close to replacing this app with a 1030. Right now I have to use the Cyclemeter app to connect to my DuoTrap S cadence meter and import those rides to Strava. Now Cyclemeter doesn‚Äôt always record my heart rate so I have to chose which metrics I want to record when everything is Bluetooth and could work seamlessly together in Strava if only you could connect a Bluetooth cadence meter. So frustrating.
title: Greatness, limited by connectivity option

review:
iFit can now export fitness data to Strava. This is particularly helpful when using an iFit enabled Nordic Track‚Ä¶Except Strava only imports just half of the iFit wattage and cadence information no matter the length of the trail. 30 or 60 minutes makes no difference, just imports half. All of the speed information from iFit is imported.  All of the wattage and cadence information is displayed in iFit. 

I‚Äôve contacted Strava support twice over the last few weeks re this issue and have received no response. 

I count on Strava to keep track of all my workouts. As a subscribing member I was very excited about this new feature because it would allow me to incorporate all of my workouts, with more accurate information, for use in its analytics and of course record keeping. 

Where is support?
title: iFit and Strava

review: Got a regular Apple Watch? Use Nike Run Club. This app can‚Äôt communicate properly with the watch and read your heart rate unless you run it from the watch which is kind of dumb. I‚Äôm not recording my workout twice and deleting one when other apps will work the right way regardless of where I start my work out. If you have an LTE Apple Watch maybe this is for you. Myself I run with my iPhone and would have liked this app to work like NRC and actually be compatible with the $400 heart rate monitor on my wrist‚Ä¶ Wish I didn‚Äôt get charged for the year for an app I will likely never open again‚Ä¶
title: Don‚Äôt waste your time‚Ä¶ or your money

review:
The new release breaks simple usability of notifications: you‚Äôll see the red-circle count on the app icon, but nothing in Notification Center, and when you open the app there may be no visual indication of where the notifications are coming from. You‚Äôll need to hunt through every screen in the app, and now they are nested.

Also, as always, their data collection/sharing defaults are abysmal and will let strangers on the internet find out where you live by googling you.
title: New release breaks notifications

review: I‚Äôve been a long time user of Runkeeper and just recently switched to Strava for the social aspect. There are a lot of nice features but I do miss some things from Runkeeper. Primarily, customizing your audio cues (by time or distance, split pace, current pace, average pace, etc). And it seemed easier to access your activities and see general summaries and stats on Runkeeper, but that might just be lack of familiarity with Strava. In any case it does the job and I‚Äôll continue to use it!
title: Could add more features

review: Strava is great as social media, and for comparing with your friends, but seems to be lacking a little as a serious training tool. After a ride, I like to look at my phone and see how it compares with other rides. Unfortunately it seems to take an hour or two before the information gets from my watch to my phone. By then I am usually on to something else.  Segments are nice for comparing different areas with other athletes, but 1 mile intervals would be a great feature for seeing how you are doing on your daily rides.
title: Disappointed

review: I use a wahoo ELEMNT bolt and I just got back from a ride. I got a PR on a segment and my time shows that I should be in the top 10. On the overview it says I have my PR but when I go to the rankings it shows my older PR and says I‚Äôm in 26th place when it should say 6th. My PR shows but it does not count as a top 10. I have not checked off ‚Äúprivate‚Äù nor ‚Äúhide from segment leaderboards.‚Äù There should not be bugs like this especially when people pay for premium.
title: PR but no rankings

review:
I‚Äôm training for a triathlon and was given a few recommendations for this app to give me a little more motivation. So far it‚Äôs worked great with the running and cycling, I have it linked to my Apple Watch and it gives me all the stats I need and more. My only complaint (and it‚Äôs a BIG one) is that it doesn‚Äôt allow you to track your swimming on the watch. You can do so on your phone (somehow. I dunno, swim with my phone shoved down my shorts maybe?) 
Come on Strava, sorely it can‚Äôt be that difficult. Hell, if you fixed that I‚Äôd be more likely to subscribe to the upgrades you have on offer in the app.
title: Great app with one huge flaw.

review:
This kind of drives me nuts.

When you are looking at an individual activity there should be a previous and next button so u don‚Äôt have to go back to the feed.  When I‚Äôm looking at only my activities in my feed and I look at one of my rides the previous and next should only sequence through my rides.  When I start from the general feed and look at one ride previous and next should sequence through the individual rides from the general feed
title: Next and Previous

review: Strava is great in many ways, but listening to customer feedback has always been TERRIBLE! On the Strava Support page, people have been asking for YEARS for them to add other categories of activities like Triathlon, Mountain Biking, Trail Running, Obstacle Racing, etc... It seems like such an easy thing to do since they have added activities in the past few years like SUP, Crossfit, and Kayaking. It‚Äôs not a huge ask, but we‚Äôve been ignored for years. I really like segments, but if they don't start listening to their paid customers, I'll be switching to another app, and suggesting my friends do as well.
title: Don‚Äôt listen to customers

review: Strava has changed my life by helping me see the affect that different approaches to my athletic life . I have been a member since day one. I have logged over 50,000 miles on my bike and a ton of walks and hikes. They are all accessible. Plus now when I travel I can find where to ride! Awesome! Not to mention the challenges and social aspect. I stay in touch with friends in other countries through Strava. I love Strava!
title: Total recall

review: Long time user. I generally like the app, but lately with the more frequent updates, comes a few more glitches that usually get worked out fairly quickly. I hope so because the latest is bigger. GPS did not map about half the run on a run I‚Äôve done 8-10 times. I really wanted to see how I did on a segment but of course it didn‚Äôt capture it.
title: A little (some would say more) glitchy with latest update.

review: I have been using Strava for some while, both as free and as premium user.  While I like many of the aspects of the app, I find Support to be atrocious.  From my interaction, it appears that the only support function they offer is to direct users to articles, most of which are irrelevant to the problem you have.  And if you click enough times indicating that the articles are irrelevant to your problem, you are finally get directed to a support function that responds a few days later with even more irrelevant article.
title: Bottom of the barrel for support

review: Ok, so I downloaded Strava because I was looking forward to enjoying the clubs and the leaderboards, as well as looking forward to sharing my photos with the activity stats on them. However, upon using the app, I‚Äôm getting constant errors when I‚Äôm looking at clubs members list like ‚ÄúSomething went wrong, please try again‚Äù Errors, and I‚Äôm not finding ANY OTHER OPTIONS to share my photos with activity stats other than just sharing a link to the activities themselves.  This app needs some serious fixing before I download it again. If you don‚Äôt like all these errors, don‚Äôt sign up or download this app!!!!
title: Constant Errors and NO OPTION to share photos from Strava

review: The ONLY reason I use Strava is for the beacon and this is for SAFETY!  It  worked for a while on one person in contact list then stopped but worked for the two others. I did everthing suggested by Strava and it never would work for this person.  Now I am down to one person, my husband, and  the beacon stopped alerting him.  I was stranded recently and thought the beacon went through.  He could not find me as no beacon.  Customer service with Strava is NON EXISTENT!  Too expensive for it to not work on all the features I  have paid for.  Idiotic and difficult to find out  how to reach customer service.  They are a rip off.
title: Paid for subscription and beacon never works

review: People beg for their newsfeed to be in chronological order yet every social platform thinks you want it organized by what you interact with most. That‚Äôs senseless for a workout app. How are you supposed to encourage people who may not be an everyday athlete when their activities get pushed passed people who workout constantly? Please put the feed back in chrono order or allow us to choose to put it in order. I‚Äôm tired of just seeing the same 10% of people I follow when I open the app.
title: Good but...

review:
The only issue I have with this is when I post a manual run, the time it appears tends to be off hence when you look at your training long it can post your Saturday evening run that actually look place at 7pm on Sunday at 2am for example. 
Otherwise the app is flawless and very easy to use. Helps me keep in touch with family and friends and well as show off a little bit - what not to like! Lol
title: Some minor bugs, otherwise perfect app

review: I like using this app for tracking my workouts and routes for biking and running. I love the challenges. It‚Äôs a great motivator. I would like to recommend to the developers to put a search function on Strava to search my previous activities and that of my friends. It would be nice to even be able to search by month and year instead of having to continuously scroll to find a past activity. Overall this is a good app to use.
title: Good app but areas for improvement

review: I got a new phone and then the app stopped working on my Apple Watch. All that I get is a message telling me, ‚ÄúOn your phone, log in or sign up using the Strava app.‚Äù I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling on both devices, changing the privacy settings, and making sure that my software is up to date, but nothing has helped. Really liked the app, but a large part of the benefit for me was being able to leave my phone and use the app on my watch.
title: Worked great until
