review: I really enjoy being able to see my and others data, explore new routes, analyze fitness tracking, and have one place where my fitness life story is found. Strava links with so many devices and websites and does a great job with a mostly add free feel.  I do wish they had a dark mode as I hate looking at the bright screen planning tomorrows adventure right before I go to bed.
title: Great App

review:
I rarely give negative feedback 
Buy Strava does not compute workout calories when using the Apple Watch. Quick search online found out that this issue has been going on for long time and no fix. This is a red flag to me. It‚Äôs quite frustrating to see Zero calories after working hard on a workout. It‚Äôs good to be a free trial. Unsubscribing and deleting the app.
title: Deleting the app

review:
So I‚Äôve LOVED Strava for years. I had a premium membership a couple years ago, but life has changed and I can‚Äôt justify something so expensive anymore. 
With the recent update, it took away all the features I enjoyed. I can‚Äôt even see my own records anymore. Complete BS - will be replacing this app with something like runkeeper from now on.
title: Done - almost zero basic features

review:
Great for tracking my exercise and connecting with my exercise buddies. It‚Äôs not perfect, but it‚Äôs good enough that I continue to use it in spite of its flaws.

For example, a recent update added new notifications about my goals that I don‚Äôt want and cannot turn off. Most other notifications can be turned off, but not these. I think this is the latest in a pattern of ill-considered changes to the app that the developer later fixes or removes.
title: Great!

review: I‚Äôm starting to get more serious with running and started looking for a dedicated running app. Strava seemed to be one of the more popular ones. Everything seemed to be going fine on my first run until I finished and hit save. The app crashed, and continued to immediately crash every time I tried to re-open it. I ended up having to delete the app and reinstall it, and finally got the app to open again, but my run data did not save. Definitely not paying for this app and will continue my search for a better running app that actually works.
title: Crashed first time using it and lost run data

review: I love this app. The only thing I as well as many people would love to see is being able to adjust the activities summary screen to show the three most used activities rather swim bike run. With so many folks coming on and getting into fitness it would be great to see as an example, walk and run both on the summary feed. As it is now, I set all walks to runs so I can get an easy weekly summary without having to go through all my workouts.
title: Great app if you set your walks as runs.

review:
This app used to be great. However; unless you choose to subscribe and pay for the app, the free version offers very little of use. 

-Previously the free app would allow you to compare efforts. Now you must subscribe to do so. 
-The app now only seems to track my total time out riding whereas previous versions would accurately track my moving time exclusively. 
-Cannot turn off notifications for the app. I often receive banners suggesting I ‚ÄúStart an Activity in Strava‚Äù even though I have notifications turned off for the app. Moreover, you receive a notification within the app for EVERY single activity you do (mostly just an eyesore that you can‚Äôt turn off). 
-Customer service simply does not reply to you unless you have a paid account. 

The app seems to track where I am well. But that is about it. 

So, either pay to play or find something that allows more than just a single activity tracker.
title: Losing Features

review:
Strava is not properly tracking my runs. I have asked for advice via email, social media etc. no customer service. I run 25 minutes it says I ran 20 minutes. I run 3 mile it says I ran 2 miles. I hate to give a poor review and wouldn‚Äôt have, but the app just asked me to rate my experience. Poor customer service. It asks me to upgrade and I would probably consider it if there was any customer service to get the app fixed. I have tried to delete and re download and many other things. 

I know my other friends love it and I used to love it.
title: Poor customer service- app doesn‚Äôt work properly for me

review: I‚Äôve been using strava for 3+ years and I have the paid membership. I understand the need to charge a nominal amount to pay your staff and keep updates/enhancements coming. Things that were free now require a membership.  That‚Äôs fine as it‚Äôs only $60 per year. But I think the upload from the Apple Watch should be seamless. I shouldn‚Äôt have to sync my run each time to get it onto my strava account. Especially since my watch has cellular. Any chance you can fix that?
title: Great app BUT

review: The Strava team took one of the few good features of Strava which was the only feature I used, km tracking for rowing, out of the free version and made it a premium feature. I like many others are students who do not always have the luxury of paying for subscription services and am disappointed to see my once favorite tracking app follow suit with so many others subscription based companies. As an entrepreneur I understand that this is a strategy to generate revenue, but from a consumer standpoint it is a disappointment. Time to go back to the excel document for tracking.
title: Update Decisions

review: I am still looking for an App that will do everything I want on the Watch without needing to run with my phone as well. This App is greatly lacking in this area. Here are the areas it falls short: No half mile verbal splits, can‚Äôt hear 1 mile time splits while listening to music, stats viewable on Watch are almost nonexistent- you have to view your run on your phone at a later time, the auto pause feature would be nice except it pauses every time you look at the watch, the syncing to the phone is slow. If you use this app with only the phone I suspect you won‚Äôt run into most of these areas. I will keep looking for a better app. ‚òπÔ∏è
title: Not great on Apple Watch

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava since it‚Äôs inception. Sure there are a few glitches here and there with the interface, but those who complain Strava drops off part way through a ride, it‚Äôs not Strava- it‚Äôs your phone. There is no other app out there that allows me to track my training, and keep track of my friends and competition‚Äôs activities. It is an amazing venue to follow pro athletes who are willing to share their training
title: Love it

review:
It‚Äôs ridiculous that even with a paid summit membership you don‚Äôt have the option to display your live heart rate or your live cadence. Only displays averages which is completely useless when you are really exerting yourself on a hill climb or a sprint. This would be a simple interface update to give users the option of averages versus live data.

It‚Äôs also crazy that the app doesn‚Äôt display your average cadence in your workout analysis even with a paid membership. You have to go to your computer to look for any cadence data after the fact. We are in a mobile centric world, get it together.
title: Ridiculous that doesn‚Äôt show live heart rate or cadence

review: Strava will crash my iPhone about once in every 6 times I use the app. It will freeze up and cause my phone to freeze on the Strava app, and also outside of the app, until I force close the application. None of my other apps do this. Also, they recently made an update to the photos on the feed which makes them low resolution, and therefore less nice to scroll through. I much preferred scrolling through Strava when the feed photos were high res, but now it is less  enjoyable as things like trees (which are common in Strava pictures) just look terrible.
title: Latest updates crash my iPhone X

review: Strava has done a great job with this update. I have been using Strava for many moons. This is a big update and they knocked it out of the park. I love how you can easily swipe through pictures and the feed is cleaner and more informative. I checked the website and it has also been updated. Now all they need to do is integrate a messaging into Strava so we don‚Äôt have to leave private stuff in the very public comments.
title: Excellent update

review: I‚Äôve been running this app on my Apple Watch Series 6. The app functions just fine but when I finish my run on my watch, it restarts my watch. The watch then restarts in low power mode. When I go to charge my watch, it shows there is plenty of charge left in the batter (over 50 percent). This only happens with the Strava app and started about a week ago.
title: Issue with Apple Watch Series 6

review: Definitely one of my top rated workout apps. And will continue using. Could add a few more updates like dark mode and other sports. Would recommend strava just needs to get with the times a little bit on updates and be willing to change the overall look and add different challenges. I also think strava premium is kinda pointless yea you get some cool maps that nobody else gets but that‚Äôs really it.
title: Strava

review: The year in sport was great marketing for strava.  People would share them around other social media and with friends creating great awareness of how cool it is.  NOW, year in sport is locked behind a pay wall.  I‚Äôd love to know the genius that did that, say bye to your biggest free marketing of the year!  Please don‚Äôt ruin the app by continuing down this horrid path of the pay wall, because it really is a great app and I would really hate to see that happen!
title: Great, fun app, please don‚Äôt destroy it

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for years and have an excellent record of every workout, hike and long walk. They continue to add value with social (great for motivation and encouragement, especially the challenges), unique analysis (really cool to review the chart of my times for a given run, etc.) and ease of use. Try the free version if you like but then cough up a few bucks to keep it going.
title: Worth paying for

review:
I‚Äôve been using strava for years now. Overall I love this app and the sense of community it provides for fellow fitness lovers. 

The reason I‚Äôm giving it 3 stars is because the new 3d maps are absolutely terrible. They rolled these out a few months ago and there‚Äôs no way to get rid of them. I‚Äôm looking into whether these maps are connected to my premium subscription, if so I‚Äôll be cancelling. Strava - please get rid of the 3d maps and go back to the old ones!
title: Great app but new maps are a problem

review:
I love this tracking app.
I do have issues with the time being switched.   If I am tracking yoga or biking, importing from my iwatch it is adjusted 4 hours later.   I do not have this issue when tracking biking, but I track that on the app and usually my iwatch as well.  Not a huge a issue, but it is annoying.   There also isn‚Äôt a way to report an issue that I have found if you are not a subscriber.
title: Good but some glitches

review: I use Strava daily primarily for bike rides but am disappointed in continuing recording errors in my rides, almost weekly, for months. This usually includes dropping the recording of my ride so I‚Äôm missing total distances and times that I don‚Äôt find out about until the end of the ride. It seems Strava is more interested in creating more bells & whistles instead of fixing existing bugs to make a quality experience & product. I will not subscribe to an unreliable app.
title: Recording errors

review: It doesn‚Äôt have common sense. Say you ride a trail with no other trails around it. If your gps drifts just a tad off the trail it will assume you‚Äôre no longer on that trail and won‚Äôt count the segment. This issue happens on nearly every ride so you never have an accurate picture of what you‚Äôve done. Big waste of money to pay for the app. The free part is fine, I expect issues with free stuff, but to pay money for an app telling you you didn‚Äôt ride the trail you literally just rode is frustrating to say the least. Especially when you‚Äôre pushing hard for PR‚Äôs or top times
title: Expect half of your segments to not be recorded

review:
The app is good for the most part. I‚Äôve started to create my own routes but keeping going back to the Footpath app because of the ease of use. 

Here are my suggestions- 

Mile Markers- I wish the Strava route feature showed the mile markers (or at least had the option to turn them on or off). When planning a big route it‚Äôs nice to have the mile markers especially when you‚Äôre planning to have people pace you.

Editing- after saving a route you should be able to edit the route or the name. 

Creation of Routes- it‚Äôs frustrating having to click on the draw icon each time you‚Äôre adding to the route. On Footpath you just hold your finger down on the next point. Makes it a little quicker. 

Elevation- Footpath allows you to see the elevation at any point during the route instead of the overall elevation like Strava. I prefer the Footpath version.
title: Route Update

review:
The app is great, and it does what you would expect it will do. The reasons for not giving 5stars are subtle:
- I wish I could create my split distance per run
- The milleage vary. I use Sportstracker in parallel on the same run, and Strava always shows less. An official IAAF 10k race measured as 9.9k. It is not much: 1-5%s, still: improving time by a few %s is a lot of work!
- if you run the same path over and over - and Strava knows that - it does not set the same distance. It wouldn‚Äôt be exactly accurate, but at least comparable.
title: Great app

review:
Update: currently on v13.0 and going strong. Every time strava updates their app they increase the version number from8.0 to 9.0 etc. must be the new trend.   I only have great things to say. Keep up the good work!

V4.6.0 makes the live segments voice sound like Diane Rehm from NPR, it's hilarious. 

I talked to someone the other day that said they were using the Nike app. I said why, have you heard of strava?  Paid athletes use Nike. Real athletes and casual people that just want to see real stats use strava. 

Then, if you want you can get into the whole social piece of the app and the doors fly wide open. Beat my time from last spring?  Beat my buddies time up that crazy climb. Oh what was my HR on that time trial compared to last time?

You have it all with very regular updates, bug patches and new features!

Go ahead and waste your time with map my ride, Nike, etc.  I have been there. This has it all and get your friends onboard and let the fun begin.
title: They dropped Bluetooth HR support. Trying to find a new app.

review:
I use strava almost daily for my commutes, and enjoy it a good bit. i‚Äôve had recurring problems with strava not recognizing my heart rate from my Apple watch. i‚Äôve already done everything to make sure there should be no communication errors. strava thinks i don‚Äôt have a heart rate monitor at all, which is obviously not the case, but, i haven‚Äôt been able to find a solution. 

Apart from that, i love the app. would definitely give a five star rating if that wasn‚Äôt an issue.
title: Good app, a few bugs

review:
You‚Äôd think this would work better. About half of my rides forget my unit settings (ex: metric vs imperial) and recording can get stuck on an autopause. 

Settings feel like they‚Äôre hidden and difficult to find and the overall design feels super busy while also frustratingly minimalist. 

I love the community and the features, it just feels like more and more stuff keeps getting added while the bugs with core functionality are slowly getting worse.
title: For as many app updates‚Ä¶

review: I took a running class that suggested this app so the coach could follow our progress. The first few times I used it (yes, the free version) were fine, but then I noticed I ran a ridiculously good mile and knew that was wrong. My coach suggested I restart the app, so I did. Things seemed fine until last week. It‚Äôs worse. It won‚Äôt register my total time, mile distance, or pace in full. I‚Äôm getting things like .4mile in 5minutes when I‚Äôve actually ran over 2 miles in 30 minutes. While I agree you get what you pay for, all the other free apps seem to do just fine. I don‚Äôt want to spend money when this version is so inconsistent. I don‚Äôt recommend.
title: Not worth it

review: I enjoy this app quite a bit! Easy to use and understand. Challenges are fun! One thing I would like to see is being able to change when your week starts for weekly progress! Strava is on Monday to Sunday week. I live by the Sunday to Saturday week schedule. It messes my data progress up and is not inline with the rest of the other apps I use for fitness! Being able to go in and change my fitness from Sunday to Monday would be a great update!!
title: Good but could be a little better

review: Update removed all apple health integration for workouts recorded in 3rd party sources. I record a run via the Strava phone app once maybe every month if that. Every day it‚Äôs rides from my Garmin edge unit, or rides. (And now even runs) from Zwift. This integration was great - all my activities went into Strava which pushed out to Apple Health. Then AH pushed it all to my Oura Ring (and before that Apple Watch) so everything talked and were working happily together. Strava updated and removed that function. Just a terrible move. Makes me question my premium subscription and look for another activity hub‚Ä¶
title: Update removed apple health integration

review: I love Strava. I have the paid subscription but even the free features allow one to record all exercise. I add pictures of all the gorgeous places I ride, and use the app more like FaceBook or Instagram, mostly for myself or for anyone who‚Äôs half-interested in what I‚Äôm up to. Anything that assists in reaching your exercise goals is a good thing and Strava allows you to do this seamlessly.
title: Unpretentious blog-ability

review: Strava finally added maps!! That was the one thing they have been missing this app is great to push yourself with all the time but now I don‚Äôt need a second app to see trails. They just added them so I‚Äôm sure there will be some bugs but it‚Äôs great. My one suggestion would be to make it so you can click on the trail and see how long it is and elevation changes
title: ABOUT TIME!!!

review:
The recent update with the refreshed gui and user experience is a nice enhancement. I think that the app has some great things going for it and right now it is the best of the rest when it comes to a social running log. I am giving this a two star review because of a critical functionality that is missing, I can‚Äôt update my shoes in the app. 

Strava does a great job keeping me updated with how many miles I put on my shoes but when it comes time to switch them out I have to sign in on the web to do it. This is difficult for no reason.
title: I hate/love this app

review:
Not sure if it is a Strava ap or Apple problem, but ever since I did the latest update on my phone my ap is closing and not tracking me during my entire run.  3 days ago I ran close to 5.5 miles but my ap only said 3.8 miles and then the route it showed I ran was a straight line, which is impossible unless I ran thru extra thick brush!   If it weren‚Äôt for this I would rate 5 stars.

Anyone else having these issues?
title: Ap Closing

review:
I had heard great things about this app and was frankly tired of Nike‚Äôs app deleting all of my runs that I started on my watch. I was disappointed to say the least. What sad excuse for a running app doesn‚Äôt tell you your current/real time pace?!

Even more disappointing is that it looks like users have been requesting this functionality for years. Sure - pretty charts at the end of a run are great, but I want to make real time adjustments so I don‚Äôt have to see my charts at the end and realize that I could have shifted midway through a mile to have a more productive workout.
title: No Current Pace Feature - What?!

review:
I have loved this app, until recently. The way to maintain customer retention and entice more paid subscribers is by constantly improving current features and adding new ones. If you really want to upset your base start charging for
Features that have always been free. The latest snafu from Strava has been removing the weekly mileage from your profile view. This has been a crucial metric i have used since inception and now is hidden behind the paywall. 

TLDR; I had considered supporting this app with a paid subscription, but instead of adding features they are simply removing them from the free version and locking them behind a paywall.
title: Race... to the bottom

review: I don‚Äôt know how got the idea that segments leaderboards should only be available for people with strava premium. Leaderboards are one of my favorite things about strava and now I have to pay if I want to see them? Hellll no, Strava used to be my favorite app, but I honestly might just stop using it and use finalsurge exclusively with this bs. If you‚Äôre not getting enough people buying strava premium, add something useful to it that actually helps training, don‚Äôt take away a feature from non-paying users in the hopes that they start paying, it ain‚Äôt gonna work.
title: Segments now only for paid users???

review: The app just cut out all the features people use it for and made them pay only. I have been paying for services but I feel this move was the final straw for me with Strava. Not only do they refuse to implement changes that users have been asking for for years, they have now hobbled their offerings for basic users. The route builder has always been buggy and there are other free apps that do it better. Now strava is charging for access to this? I‚Äôm letting my subscription expire and in the meantime I‚Äôm looking for other services that care about their customers.
title: Used to like it

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for several years now, but it‚Äôs stopped working lately. It often misreads my runs, doesn‚Äôt record distance, or skips parts of my run. I‚Äôve tried everything to fix it, but it just won‚Äôt work. Runkeeper works fine-even while I have them going at the same time. It‚Äôs a bummer because I have all my data on Strava, but I think I‚Äôm going to have to move on.
title: Too Many Issues

review:
I‚Äôve used Strava app on & off for several years to track and log my workouts. And it works OK, but overall it could be so much better.  

In a recent update, they forced workouts to post directly to the news feed ‚Äî no adding photos, renaming the post, adding details. All of that has to be done with multiple taps as an edit after it posts. 

Even if that is a better experience for 80% of their app users, it‚Äôs an absolutely terrible experience for the remaining 20%. And just demonstrates poor design and product management choices.
title: Little change, big inconvenience

review:
I have introduced the Strava App to many athletes. They love it! I like that I can add pictures to my run or Gym activity so my friends  can see. It makes me feel very special to get a ‚Äúkudo‚Äù from a far away follower. Thank You for features such as ‚Äúelevation,‚Äù the ‚Äúsatellite‚Äù view and giving trophies when a unique distance was achieved. Thank You to the designers of Strava! 

Runner/ walker/ Swimmer/ Biker and Stairclimber, 
Jean Louise Robbins
title: All toes go to Heaven

review: I love this app, it‚Äôs the most accurate way I‚Äôve been able to track my runs. I like that I can connect with friends and see how they‚Äôre doing too! I‚Äôm curious to know what happened to the map when you select a single run? It‚Äôs cut off now whereas it used to be a full view in the feed view and single view. I miss that! Please bring it back. But recently (for about 2days now) it‚Äôs been crashing upon opening the app. So I can‚Äôt track my activity.
title: Great way to stay consistent!

review:
Or at least give me the option to view Tommy feed in chronological. I hate looking through strava and seeing my friends activities from 3 days ago before I see what happened today. It's really frustrating. 

Would love to see an option to save photos from other peoples activities. I want to be able to save a photo that I'm in. 

I love Strava as a whole and use the desktop version frequently with premium but the app needs some fixing before I give it 5/5.
title: For the love of god please bring back chronological ordered activities

review:
I used the free version of this app for a while without losing rides. My first ride after subscribing disappeared and my week shows 0 miles. The app showed my ride at first and then disappeared. Maybe I shouldn‚Äôt have upgraded - this feels like a downgrade. 

Update: Well, after writing my review the activity reappeared in the activity feed, but the weekly progress still says 0 miles. So annoying.  I created a weekly distance goal, but if Strava thinks my miles for the week are 0 after I recorded a ride it‚Äôs going to be a useless feature.
title: Subscription?

review: I‚Äôve been a Strava user for over 8 years and honestly have had nothing but good experiences in using this app. It worked flawlessly throughout my 2015 cross country ride and continues to be my go-to app for recording my daily rides. The social aspect is a bonus and I highly recommend premium membership for the modest monthly fee. What are you waiting for?
title: Reliable, accurate, great value

review: I would find the notifications, specifically badges useful to enhance the social aspect of Strava, except they do not work. As long as I‚Äôve used Strava (about 4 years) the notifications are always stuck at 26 and do not reflect activity of those I follow. I usually end up turning them off. But try turning back on from time to time. I‚Äôm surprised Strava hasn‚Äôt fixed this, especially with the big push last year for paid subscriptions.
title: Please fix notifications

review: With this new update when you are syncing to Apple Watch the calories are not added to the move ring as with every other workout. I prefer to delete duplicates than the calories not being added, thanks, other than that great app and features, syncing needs work, I‚Äôve been a summit member for a couple of years
title: New update sync issues

review:
I have an Apple Watch Series 3 and the Strava app just doesn't work sometimes - either it calculates my time and distance wrong or it doesn't sync my runs when it reconnects to wifi. 

I also don't like the pricing. $7.99 is great for a Disney Plus subscription, but not for a route maker and some progress charts. I would actually pay for these features if they were cheaper though, maybe $3-4 / month. 

Other than that I love the app. Still using it daily.
title: Love It Except...

review: I‚Äôve used Strava for years & recently upgraded to Summit after deciding to give the membership a try. The simple purpose of this app for an Apple Watch & iPhone is that it should be updating HealthKit with Activity Energy & Move Rings which has ceased with the latest release. Not sure if this was an intentional change after they announced ‚Äúimprovements‚Äù to HealthKit syncing or if the plan has been to reduce cross-syncing. Really a bummer that the core functionality has ceased right after agreeing to pay for a membership‚Äîand what‚Äôs worse is this has occurred days before a primary race weekend for me. Very disappointing.
title: Either Poor Quality Control or Miscommunication

review:
The bug fixes are actually addressing annoyances in the app. The need to go back to an activity after it auto directing you to the feed was a nice fix. 

I have an issue now where when you used pro, turned on beacons, then quit pro, the app will never let me turn the beacon off; instead it bombards me with an ad to turn sign up for pro. The issue with that is that now every time I use an activity it forces me to say ‚Äúdon‚Äôt send beacon text‚Äù. Minor, but for an app I use every single commute it can be quite annoying.
title: Getting better

review: I absolutely love Strava! It keeps me motivated! There has been a glitch lately where when I pull down on the main page and refresh (and have no notifications) it adds a notification. Well, if I look at the notification it‚Äôs he same notification I had before. It just keeps notifying! Please fix! It also causes there to ALWAYS be a 1 notification on the outside of the app.
title: Notification

review: I connect my Garmin app to Strava primarily for the social aspect of fitness. We can‚Äôt always run or workout with friends each time but following along on Strava is the perfect motivation I need most days to get out when I normally wouldn‚Äôt because you know your fitness group will see you, cheer you on and motivate you to do it again. It‚Äôs always good for some humble bragging too when you want to challenge those same friends to push themselves and compete.
title: Perfect app for motivation

review: Since the recent update, every time I open the app it says I have a notification but when I select it there are no new notifications. Not a problem with function but annoying. It would also be nice to be able to analyze and flag activities on the mobile app. As many users there are that leave their device recording for the trip home, it would be nice for it to be easier to flag those activities.
title: Ghost notifications

review:
Fun app for MTBing to track your fitness, and push limits. Just because you‚Äôre trying to set records tho, stay on the trail and don‚Äôt make shortcuts. There‚Äôs a achievement in making that obstacle, or getting that segment ‚Äúintact‚Äù w/o making new lines. 

Making the ‚Äúbeacon‚Äù live tracking feature accessible to all is an unbelievable feature that will no doubt save people headaches, if not lives!
title: Beacon!

review:
The watch used to be a convenient remote control for the phone app. Now it runs an independent app (but Watch 1 users still need their phones for GPS). In principle this is fine, but in practice the watch app is unreliable and often fails to save activities. Or it stops sensing motion. Or it just randomly quits. Or the latest fun, it pretends to record an entire ride and then claims the phone is unreachable and refuses to sync it. This is of course nonsense because the watch needed the phone‚Äôs GPS to begin with.

Dear Strava: please go back to making the watch a companion to the phone app instead of a completely broken alternative to it.
title: Apple Watch app is utterly worthless

review: Lately when synching Strava activities with Apple fitness I‚Äôm losing calories - if eg I bike most of the day I end up with hours of workout and a mere 200 cal to show for it even though before the sync I had closed my rings on Apple fitness & had 800 cal! I‚Äôve tried everything; delete / reinstall, look up ideas on community boards‚Ä¶ Nada. I love Strava but will have to stop using it. Not sure what to do because apple watch won‚Äôt last 5-6 hrs of activity tracking. Meeh‚Ä¶
title: Strava syncs negative calories w/ apple fitness

review: The app is centered on social networking instead of the users who use it for self-fitness. One day last week, I forgot to end my cycling session, and the app continued to log activity during my drive home in my SUV. Who cycles at 60 MPH?! There is NO way to correct the saved activity manually. I‚Äôm not particularly eager to spend money on apps that control me or my capabilities. The reason for NOT allowing users to correct app errors manually is lame at best. The performance of the app does not justify the annual cost of the app. I‚Äôm canceling today.
title: Too Expensive For Basic Functionality

review:
Straightforward and reliable app. But the multi-screen multi-button way of starting a recording is clunky and fails UI Design 101. And no iPad support, really? Sure, we're not going to go running with our iPads but it would really be nice to have for mapping and analysis. Also, latest update as of Dec 2, 2019 suffers from frequent freezes on iPhone 8 / cellular.

Update: 2022 coming to a close and still no iPad support. Heck, for 8 bucks a month *I'd* implement it for them.
title: Solid app but needs basic improvements

review: This is a hometown company for me, I have enjoyed using it and will continue to use Strava. I would gladly pay a fee to have landscape orientation as an option. I don‚Äôt know if anyone watches TV, but they‚Äôre not vertical for a reason. If you DO watch TV, you might think Strava should at least have the option. I think that they should. Please please. Make me a paying customer. I can‚Äôt be alone on this issue.
title: Perplexing lack of vert orientation switching

review:
Really enjoyed using this app, really helps keep track of of how far I‚Äôve gone. 

If I could recommend anything, is change the ‚ÄòFinish‚Äô button color during a run to Red. I know it sounds stupid, but sometimes I see the word Finish, and think ‚Äúpress button to start my run and finish it.‚Äù I think if the button was red, it would make it more obvious to the brain that button means to stop the run.
title: Great App

review:
I appreciate the recent uptick in new stuff. It is well done. I used to be a paid subscriber, let my sub lapse for a year or so. I am back as a paid  subscriber. It is worth it to me. 

Lesson to Strava: keep bringing new features that people are willing to pay for. Improve  your service for ALL,  taking away features which used to be free and made you popular was a questionable move, imo.
title: I am back

review: Just switched over from Nike + after losing multiple runs and the app crashing multiple time. Strava is great I should have switched a long time ago! The only thing I‚Äôve noticed is at least for me my split times aren‚Äôt syncing over properly to the activities App. I only see the time for the first mile. Other than than that everything is great!!!
title: Great App!!

review: I absolutely love strava! It‚Äôs been such a motivational tool in my progression of riding! Especially the segments because I‚Äôm always pushing myself to better my times! Only down fall is that I can‚Äôt see my own power stats without paying for an upgrade, so I‚Äôve had to keep track on other apps for that. Makes sense not to see others, but at least your own would be nice. Other than that I love it!
title: Strava is great!

review: The latest update swapped distance for time in the large font for each week; how many people are keeping track of overall time spent each week?! Most training plans (for running at least, I personally can‚Äôt speak to cycling or swimming) call for weekly increases in mileage, not time, so being able to swipe through the weeks and see that progression in large font is useful. Such a minor change, but enough of an inconvenience that I came on here to write a 2-star review, and I doubt I‚Äôm the only one annoyed by this.
title: NOT a fan of the switch from distance to time

review:
Strava is awesome. Feature updates and additions are thoughtful and insightful. Things work. The membership is worth it.

They certainly seem to care about their customers. It‚Äôs clear Strava is a purpose-driven bunch and it shows.

It‚Äôs been fun to watch their intentional growth ever since I saw their first ad on the Tour way back when. Excited to see where they go and how they keep improving.
title: Strava Rocks

review: I like the app a lot. But lately, the run analysis seems way off. I run the same distance I always do using my watch and phone combo. (I start the app on my watch and my understanding is the phone (strapped to my arm) helps keep it accurate)And after the run everything seems right. About 3 miles  in 28:43 (on the watch)(typical short run for Saturday) and then when I upload it from watch to app it says I ran 2.8 miles in 2 minutes and 4 seconds in the actual app in my phone. I hope this helps cause I don‚Äôt want to continue paying for this if it isn‚Äôt going to get fixed.
title: Inconsistent

review:
Like the app interface and the features. Been using it while paired to the Apple Watch. There is one feature request that I would like to see in a future update and that would be able to track the steps per minute / cadence while running.

Also in the past I recall there was an option to alert the runner of the pace and distance at half mile increments. Is that still present or has that been removed?
title: Great app for logging runs and hikes

review: Strava seems to be behind with being able to upload apple heath data back to Strava. There are tons of people that have been left in the dark concerning this requested feature. They have had plenty of time to add this feature that many others already have. Until they get with it then I am giving them three stars. In the meantime you can use the app called HealthFit. Yes it cost a few bucks but at least it provides a workaround for something that should already be included.
title: Get up to speed Strava

review:
****This review is for APP only****
***I did not attempt to use website***
**This is for free version I did not upgrade**
I got this app because of a virtual race I'm running soon, but don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs going to be my go to app for running. 
Pros. 
1. Good community 
2. Used for many virtual races

Cons.
1. 1 decimal place
2. Cant switch to kilometers 
3. Phone and watch run separately
4. Very limited info on screen
5. Doesn‚Äôt read heart rate from Apple Watch
6. Can‚Äôt do custom training sessions

Seems like a great app for cycling though. 
There may be more options on the website, however I am looking for a good easy to use app not an app/website combo. I would recommend Runkeeper for a great free running app, I have used it for manny years without spending a cent (though i have been tempted to try their training plans which require the upgrade).
title: Okay running app, probably better for cycling.

review: So Strava Is a great gear and activity tracker! My problem with it those is the lack of moderation or public ability to edit segments. There are numerous public segments that have inappropriate names. There are also segments that the go‚Äôs data is ether wat off, ends in a location that it should not or the location proximity to starts and finishes needs alteration. I say this all being a paid subscriber.
title: It‚Äôs great but

review:
Strava is great way to remain connected to your friends who are out training too. I like seeing my fiends routes, fastest athletes on those routes, and how I measure up to the fastest times on these routes. 
Strava fosters competition. Folks can get away with cheating this system but we know who they are. And this pushes me harder to throttle those cats at their own game on group rides. 
Glad I joined, cool stuff, thanks Stravaüö≤üëç
title: When you‚Äôre riding, you‚Äôre not on the phone

review: Strava itself is great.  I‚Äôve used it for years.  I have noticed recently (as have several of my friends) that the GPS tracking is taking a very long to acquire, and will sometimes drop during a ride.  The ‚Äúlost‚Äù mileage is usually 1-2 miles on rides of known distance.  This has been the normal mode of operation for the last several months, and hasn‚Äôt been an issue prior to that.
title: Great app...GPS issues

review: I have been using Strava for my cross country needs. I have been running daily but when I try to record my run it only tracks the time. I have tried updating it and deleting then reinstalling but it won‚Äôt seem to work. I have service when I run but not internet. It has only worked once this year at a Race. Could you please give me advice or help me get it to record my runs?
title: Helpful, but won‚Äôt track mine.

review: There is nothing really special about the app or strava platform in general. It is very generic and lacks any sort of specialization (customization of running metrics while running). There are plenty of better apps out there for running, swimming and cycling. The paid features aren‚Äôt worth it either, as you‚Äôre better off with a real training solution such as Training Peaks. The best features are the relatively open APIs that allow you to upload activities from other better apps so you can partake in the social aspect of Strava.
title: App is meh

review: I have been using Strava now for almost a year and it‚Äôs great, I have use Nike and Runtastic, Strava has been better in my own opinion, all the useful data you can get is really valuable when training, the only ‚Äúbad‚Äù thing is that you don‚Äôt have an option for Trail Running, this is a feature has been requested I think since 2015 so we don‚Äôt have a tag to identify runs on roads from trail running, beside this the app is a jewel üòé
title: Great App with some missing features

review:
Really needs ability to copy previous manual workout entry (without really tedious manual opening of prior activity, copying, exiting without saving, scrolling/manual new entry, paste details, re-type title, etc.. a joke of a process that would be super easy to fix.. and requests for this have been around for years)

Please add landscape mode support (I check others status, would like to type notes, etc while using iPad)

Please all basic bike computer display without having to pay for premium. Cuz otherwise I skip Strava for recording altogether and use other apps
title: I like Strava, but app disappoints

review:
Being 70 and some health concerns I am able to have my emergency contacts know where I am at all times. Since I gave up my driving license.  I ride an Etrike my contacts know there I am. (I have about a 15 mile ride to my business) Making there life‚Äôs better not having to worry about me. I also get a much better read out on my month activities. ( my doctor sees a great improvement in my health)
Standley Redmer
title: A great Racking  tool

review: I really enjoy Strava. My only issue is several times, and this is the fault of touch screen tech, not the app, something will happen and the app won‚Äôt start after I hit start and store my Phone in my running belt (ie, in between hitting ‚Äústart run‚Äù and putting my phone away, ‚Äústop‚Äù will get pushed and my run doesn‚Äôt get tracked). I wish there were an auto sensor or something so if I have Strava open, and am actively moving, it can log the run regardless.
title: Love it, just one thing...

review: Terribly problematic watch app. Audio cues work one day, then it stops working the next. Records data on several runs, then ‚Äúno movement detected‚Äù and can‚Äôt save your run. When it eventually saves it, there is tons of missing data - all you get is distance and average pace. No splits, no course, no heart rate. Even when the app works (which is about 10% of the time), the functionality is super basic and lacks a lot compared to other apps. Feels like a beta version at best. Finally, Strava support is not responsive - I‚Äôve tried contacting them through several channels with no luck (and I am a paid subscriber.) Very frustrating.
title: Apple Watch app is awful

review:
Strava is a pretty decent app, but recently I‚Äôve really been losing confidence in the accuracy of its data. When I track my runs on my Apple Watch, the summary at the end always shows different results than the results I see on my phone, and sometimes those numbers are different than the ones I see on the web. I can understand there being some difference between the data during a run vs after, but once the run is over, it should really be the same on all platforms.

Might be time to switch to run keeper or something else, I guess.
title: Losing confidence

review:
Ive been out for 2 Injury surgery recoveries for 2 years. I recently started training back up. I open the app to find that they deleted out most of the local segment trails.  Deleted a bunch of my data  runs in other states and countries I cant get back. 
I didn't realize how much I used it to Find new Routes when traveling and to mark the trails I was planning on running for the week .  This used to be a 5 star app.   Now  I‚Äôm not really seeing the point of using it unless its just to keep track of your friends training.
title: What happened to Strava?

review:
I am ready to drop strava. 60$ a year x 10 years assuming no additional increase or additional fees.... I wonder what I could buy for 600$ for gear that could last ten years.  
Don‚Äôt think it is worth it. Why not use advertising instead strava? Can‚Äôt you make you money other ways? Sad to see you go. Will be looking at other apps in 2020. There are others that are making progress with this. I am sad because I have recorded so much with strava. Is anyone out there willing to put together a new apps for this? I have some ideas about how to make a better fitness tracker.
title: Drop strava?

review: Longtime (free) Strava user here. I‚Äôm a recreational rider who rides 3-4 times a week and always liked to track my segments and performances throughout the year. All of the other premium features were not enough for me to warrant an actual paid subscription. So what do the owners of Strava decide to do in the middle of a Worldwide pandemic? Decontent the free app and try and squeeze a few more bucks out of the millions of loyal users. Segment history: GONE. Basic Leaderboard stats: GONE. Great job Strava. Hate to do it, but I‚Äôll be testing out new tracking apps as an alternative. Reason...pure spite.
title: Middle of a pandemic, more users...lets decontent the app!

review: I love using Strava, but now they‚Äôre making you pay for many of its best features. It‚Äôs a shame to see this app go downhill so rapidly in a shameless effort to make a profit. Now Strava only lets you see the leaderboard if you‚Äôre in the top 10. It seems like they only care about the athleticism of the fastest men. Women need to pay to see their leaderboard, as do people of different body types and ages. So unless you‚Äôre one of the fastest, Strava is going to milk you for all you‚Äôre worth. It‚Äôs a shame that the ruined an app that encouraged people to go out and be active with a little friendly competition.
title: Strava was great until they made you pay for its best features

review: I like the actual app version of this just fine. If you have sponsors for things such as running, biking, swimming, and triathlons, they want you to use this app. I‚Äôve tried everything to fix this for my Apple Watch and nothing seems to work. It is super buggy and doesn‚Äôt log anything at all. I have to default to my activity tracker already built into my iPhone, then pay $8 for a year of RunGap‚Äôs app to transfer that to Strava‚Äôs app. That is ridiculous. Please Strava, fix your Apple Watch interface. Not all of us like Garmin or fitbit.
title: The actual phone app is good, but the watch portion is crap.

review: The app has literally downgraded over the years, and they have removed many key features. The main gripe I have is the random algorithmic dashboard of activities. Rather than using a sensible chronological order of activities on the dashboard, Strava uses some random algorithm that makes no sense. Nobody likes this, and we have repeatedly asked Strava to change it back to a chronological order, as that is the only order that makes sense. However, they don‚Äôt seem to listen to their customers at all.
title: Development seems nonexistent

review: I love Strava and that is on periodt! I use it for all of my runs and it‚Äôs great for sharing and seeing what my friends are up to. However, I sometimes have the feeling that something is missing. I believe that Strava would be greatly improved with the implementation of a direct messaging, or DM, system. How else am I supposed to slide into the DM‚Äôs of the girl who ran next to me in mile 6 of the san francisco marathon? Tell me that, Strava. Anyway, amazing app. Really nothing to complain about.
title: Great App. Needs Another Feature

review: This has been my go to app for fitness the last few years. I really love the different sections of trails for mountain biking and how it records times. The only thing that would make this review 5 stars, is to make an update that you can turn on/off voice of start and stops of each section. This way you can get the most accurate way to keep pushing until the section is over and see how fast you can ride that section.
title: Great training partner

review:
The Strava concept and database is very powerful and very handy if you like to keep track of your workouts and be social about it. But the Strava website is not a very well written one, with many interface issues that make it difficult or impossible to do specific things.

The iPhone app is not any better. In fact it‚Äôs much worse. The crash is often, and it lacks lots of functionality that, for some reason, seems like it would be very easy to add in. It leads me to believe that the portable device audience is just not very important to Strava.
title: Crashes a lot and doesn‚Äôt even approach the functionality of the website.

review: Our bike folks love Strava, but I've yet to find a runner who finds your product useful. Is there any chance you're going to make your service more runner friendly? Elevation is worthless for example (if I run up 300' and down 300' you show the elevation for that split as 0) ha ha The adjustment for elevation for "if there were no grade this is how fast you would be going", is totally wrong as well. I can run on a totally flat road where Garmin shows 20' of elevation over 10 miles and your service says I would be over 60 seconds faster if the road were flat üòÇ I could keep going forever with issues with your service.
title: Great for cyclists, worthless for runners

review: I first started using the new feature where you can more easily view segments and even allow Strava to create a route for you. I was impressed with the quality of a road route it gave me. Very good roads/paths to follow and minimal busy roads. The edit feature is great too and this route update will directly lead to me road biking more.
title: New maps and routes feature is awesome

review:
I believe that the price is appropriate if you do an annual subscription. I‚Äôm a little disappointed in 2 things: 

1) Still no dark mode? Seriously?!

2) Sometimes, after a long bike ride, I accidentally tap ‚Äòdismiss‚Äô instead of ‚Äòsave‚Äô. I highly doubt that anyone would do a 5 hour activity and want to dismiss it. Maybe have an backup option ‚Äòare you sure you want to dismiss?‚Äô like it does with short workouts, strangely. 

There‚Äôs a lot of potential, but since being a premium member for a year, not a whole lot of new features have been deployed. I get the whole if it‚Äôs broken, don‚Äôt fix it, but their development team should listen to the massive user feedback to refine and improve the app.
title: Pretty good, please work on future enhancements

review:
Lots of my friends have this all and I like the social aspect of it. I tried the free trial for their paid service and the data was useful. 

However, my pet peeve is when 3rd party apps don‚Äôt work properly on iOS. That‚Äôs the case with Strava. The syncing from the iOS Health app is atrocious. 

Initially I would manually upload my workouts. I‚Äôd get a notification that it was ready and then I could upload. 

Eventually I switched to auto and that‚Äôs when the trouble started. 

Now my workouts don‚Äôt sync. Deleted and reinstalled. Updated. Nothing. 

Since I track workouts with the Fitness app and my Apple Watch, I don‚Äôt use the tracking in Strava. So, since the app won‚Äôt sync the data from my Health app, I have zero need for it. 

It‚Äôs too bad because I really, really enjoyed the social aspect as well as the insights with the subscription.
title: Wanted to love it but it has a fatal flaw

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few years now. It has replaced all my other apps because I really enjoyed the segments and being able to compare with my friends. This recent app update made the segment comparisons only available to paid subscribers. Not cool. I hope they get a lot of negative feedback from this change and go back to the way it was.
title: Not happy with the new update!

review:
-First off strava is an amazing app and I‚Äôm yet to see something better for recording my runs
-secondly I don‚Äôt appreciate how many things are locked behind the Summit subscription, but it in no way makes your experience bad
-Finally I wish there were more privacy options like only sharing with certain followers and/or removing the map from your posts
title: Great, but I have some complaints

review: Seriously, I do like the fact that I can have the app with the social connections and stuff like that. But I noticed that the accuracy of it is somewhat questionable. Like, I did a sprint once and it reads 32 fricking mph. Because the pace was 1:55 per mile. I know myself, and I know I CANNOT run that fast. Complete bogus. A few times it even reads 29 mph. And another time where it says I ran 18 mph tops on one of them. I know I can‚Äôt run that slowly because I was affirmed as 25 according to a video I took of me following a car at this speed.
title: Inaccurate GPS

review: Would be nice to have the miles be accurate for your gear you identify for each workout. I spread my bike miles evenly last year, yet the numbers don‚Äôt reflect that. Over the last month I try wear my run shoes evenly and you add the miles for one shoe into another. I use this app to keep track of mileage on each piece of gear. If you can‚Äôt manage to fix that, then this app no longer serves a purpose to me
title: Gear data

review:
Strava recently removed the ability to connect to some external Bluetooth devices, for example my heart rate monitor.  This is basic functionality that should work, but because they cannot figure out a ‚Äúbug‚Äù they removed the ability.  
HR is one of the basic performance training targets.  Without that, Strava is just a basic tracker and not a performance tool.
The device will work if I launch a 3rd party app and have the data cferred to Strava, but I don‚Äôt believe that‚Äôs real-time.  And the need to launch another app to use basic functionality is ludicrous.
title: Lacks basic BLE Bluetooth connx

review:
Using my Garmin Edge 820 bike computer to track data and syncing it with Strava at the conclusion of my rides creates an accurate and detailed record of my performance.

Strava‚Äôs mapping of my routes is far more vivid than what Garmin provides through its app. To top it off, Strava analyzes and charts my performance  on ride segments over time and versus the community. All in all it‚Äôs powerful and motivates me to keep striving to do better.
title: Strava fed by Garmin is a powerful combination

review: One improvement for my safety contacts watching the Beacon text: they never know when I intentionally stop or pause my ride. I see and hear the app when I update my status but that never gets relayed to those who are watching me. I then have to go to my Beacon text and manually type in that I‚Äôm stopped or taking a break, etc. It would be nice if that info was automatically relayed to them.
title: Love this app!

review: This app is amazing. You can record almost anything, from a soccer game to kayaking! There is no dislikes, you can make your account so only your followers will see your activities and you can make it so people have to request to follow you! There is goals you can reach and you can achieve digital trophies! This app is awesome and I recommend it 100%
title: Strava Is The Best Social Media Ever

review: I love the format of Strava and the ability to track my sports across platforms. I mainly use the Apple Watch app and it‚Äôs ALMOST better than the native Apple Watch Workout app. The best improvement that could be made would be a true multi sport mode for triathlon support. I would pay good money for a subscription to Strava Premium if this were available. Also, customizable watch face would be very handy. As a trail runner and triathlete, I love the audio cues and notifications. They really keep your eyes focused on the trail rather than the watch.
title: Great app, BUT...

review: Largest issue I've had lately is that start times for rides are sometimes erratic when launching from the widget. Data isn't useless, privacy can be cranked down, social features exist but don't get in the way, and the duplicate entries in health issue seems to have been squashed (most likely apple is de-duping on uuids, like they should have been). It would be nice if there were some degree of quality filter for segments, though, and if geolocation did a better job of detecting segments adjacent to roads, and the difference from said roads...
title: Mostly okay

review: A little disappointing that the Heart Rate Sensor on my Apple Watch doesn‚Äôt show up in the record ride feature. Seems like this should be a fairly easy fix. So as for now I still have to start a recording on my phone and also start a work out on my watch to I can keep track of my heart rate. This definitely needs to be addressed
title: Heart Rate

review: It‚Äôs a great way to build community and friendships. I have met soo many people thru strava and have built my own running club thru the app. I use it to also coach kids and guide them in their training. Strava is like Insta for running and it‚Äôs the app I use the most. There Always ways to improve but strava does make the effort each year to get better themselves.
title: Strava is amazing

review: Strava is your go to app when it comes to keeping track of your workouts and your friends works outs.  They have a really easy user friendly app.  The app offers so much to take your workouts to the next level.  You can find new places to run or bike . You can see how your training is going and if you are making progress.
title: So Good

review: I bought unlimited subscription to this app but then noticed there are certain situations in which it barely works. There‚Äôs a pre-download function where you can download your music before you run, for example in a rural area where those poor service and that simply doesn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôve been working with customer service for over a year to get it fixed but it‚Äôs just to be addressed.
title: Still glitchy

review:
Do I enjoy using this app? Definitely. Will I continue to use it? Yes, but only because some of my friends use it too.
What I loved was the ability to view my previous segment times and compare them to general leaderboards. These features aren‚Äôt enough for me to purchase a yearly subscription, however, I am sad to see them go. It appears that I‚Äôm not alone in this aspect so I‚Äôll keep my fingers crossed that the recent updates are reversed.
title: Sad about new updates

review:
As a long time Strava user, we‚Äôve built routes and segments and supplied data about them without pay and effectively helped build your platform and turned it into the top fitness app. 

But now you want to turn it around and charge us for these core functionalities because you‚Äôre not innovative enough to create demand for paid services? Can‚Äôt get behind this new subscription based move. Provide me something new that I‚Äôm interested in paying for, fair. Take away the core services you‚Äôve given for free because nobody wants to pay for the new features when you‚Äôre lacking innovation, bad form.
title: Disappointed

review: Been using Strava for four years now, and so far have been very pleased with the app but this recent update in regards to premium and subscriptions has ruined the app for me. Now requiring me to pay $60 for a subscription so I can compare my previous times on segments/routes, and to see my rank on the leaderboard, both previously free features and personally the main reason I enjoyed this app over others. Always thought the premium features looked neat but unnecessary for me and I was happy with the free features the app had already. Disappointed Strava chose to go this way with the paid subscriptions and features.
title: Really Strava?

review:
I use premium.  It is simple enough to take off and ride with little thought.  At the same time Strava facilities my exercise experience.  I can see what I‚Äôve done and where I‚Äôve been and how much work it was for me.
Keeping track of my workouts is critical to keep me on course and Strava is sophisticated enough to do that from many perspectives.
Being able to follow and üëç fellow bikers is also a great motivator.
title: Great app

review: The new privacy feature really forces users to open their activities to all. Before, an activity set to private would still appear on leaderboards. Strava says they respect privacy, but force users to share all or nothing. Relative Effort is pointless as it goes by calendar week. If I do two tough workouts on the weekend, how is my Monday effort ‚Äòlower than average?‚Äô It‚Äôs annoying to repeatedly try to upload a photo to an activity in the app. I‚Äôm ready to let my subscription expire.
title: Not sure premium subscription worthwhile

review:
I love this App. Mi have been using it for a few years now and with every update it keeps getting better. 
But there is one feature i would like to see, and that is the ability to setup your default activity so that whenever you open the app it will default to your type of activity right away instead of showing all options. 

Keep up the good work guys and I hope that my suggestion will someday make it to the app.
title: Great App but....

review: The Apple Watch app is not user friendly and would be greatly improved if the buttons were the size of the screen. Since the auto pause is slow, I manually pause the app at stop lights while riding my bike. The problem is that the pause button is so tiny and placed on a corner so it‚Äôs often hard to push it. Half the time I don‚Äôt manage to press it ... Can‚Äôt really stand at a green light and fidget with the tiny button. I think if it‚Äôs not improved I will get a garmin computer for my bike.
title: Apple Watch app

review: I switched from Runkeeper after hearing good things about Strava. Unfortunately, not only has it failed to successfully track my activities, but it also doesn‚Äôt show how many calories were burned. My husband uses this app the same way I do, but his seems to work. I‚Äôm very disappointed, it‚Äôs inconsistent, I can‚Äôt control what stats I want to see, it‚Äôs not as user friendly as some other apps I‚Äôve used, and I‚Äôve reached out to the company to try and get more information on possibly resolving these issues and have gotten nothing in return. Not worth it. Will be deleting and returning to my previous fitness app.
title: Not very useful

review:
I used strava for a couple of months before deciding to upgrade to premium and let me tell you it is NOT WORTH IT.

As a free mileage and route tracker, strava performs as well as any other cycling app with the added semi-benefit of a social media style feed which no one really interacts with in a serious way. 

Upgrading to premium offers several benefits, none of which are actually that enticing. The main feature is being able to map your heart rate and caloric burn rate against other variables for each ride. 

What made me cancel my subscription is how poor the HR tracking actually is. There are huge flat spots and unexplained cliffs (example: going up a hill and strava says my HR is around 100bpm) on my charts consistently. This translates to returning home from a ride with a huge discrepancy in how much work you‚Äôve actually put in vs what strava tells you.

100% not worth the exorbitant subscription price.
title: Premium not worth it

review: I have always logged my miles with pen and paper before Strava. I use Strava with my Garmin 520.  Now I have a extremely accurate and detailed account of all my rides.   It allows my wife to track me while I am riding so she doesn't have to worry as much.   I love how I can compare my rides or segments to past rides.   Lastly, it is compatible with 3rd party programs such as Skuga so I can ride my course in the winter on my indoorWahoo Kicker trainer.
title: Strava

review: I have been using Strava for over a year and I analyze my runs very frequently. I love the data that it gives me. One quirk that I have with this most up-to-date update is that the splits for miles are inversed of what they used to be. For example, a 6:00 min mile compared to an 8:00 min mile used to have the 8:00 min mile as a longer blue bar. Now it is reversed. I liked the old method where the longer the time, the longer the blue bar in the splits section.
title: Marathon Runner

review: Have tried a couple different apps over time with different devices & watches & this has been my all time solid platform. It has diversified the types of activity it records & usually will give you the metrics you‚Äôre looking for. I have found it to be fairly accurate when comparing my race data given there are variables.
title: My Go To

review: The GPS (on my iPhone 12, just for reference) is kinda broken. The lines for my run are all squiggly and the accuracy in terms of distance and time are messed up. My friend also has this bug too and I would like it to be fixed please. Other than that I love your app and it's really useful for someone who runs as much as me.
title: GPS accuracy bug

review: Been using this app for 5 years now, and I absolutely love it. At first I was all about seeing how high up the leaderboards I could get. But as I‚Äôve continue to use it, I‚Äôve gotten even more use by understanding how to improve my cycling and see the progress that I make over time. Absolutely recommend this app to anyone!
title: Makes exercising fun and drives improvement!

review: This app is the best! It tracks all your workouts and stats. Segments are competitive and fun! I‚Äôm always looking for segments to do wherever I go. It does require a subscription for some premium features but it is mostly free! I‚Äôve tried other apps but this one is definitely the best. You can connect with other athletes near you and find clubs to train with. I love Strava!
title: Best workout app!

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for years and have enjoyed it till today... I understand that all companies need to make money, I would have rather watched a few adds then see where I rank with others instead of paying 60$ a year. Thanks Strava and to do it during this crisis is absurd!!!
title: Why would you take away something that was free?

review:
Mint

Epicjcg120!

5 stars because this app is honestly one of the best running apps I‚Äôve ever had. I run a lot and many of my friends do as well. It‚Äôs nice to see how we all compare and it‚Äôs very motivating. 4 stars because I‚Äôm surprised one of the most simplest changes you could do is not available. I suggest that you add an option to switch from the Monday-Monday week to a Sunday-Sunday week. You have diverse users who start their weeks on different days.
title: Good but one thing

review: It can be pretty frustrating at times. Often if you try to submit a workout where there‚Äôs no service, it won‚Äôt bank it, it will simply delete it. My job tracks my PT through Strava, so that can make a two-hour PT session look like I stayed home eating barbecue chips. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a well-made app. I just wish it tracked elevation gain for you to see live. You have to finish and close out a workout to see your gain.
title: Good app, but occasionally deletes workouts

review: I‚Äôve started running and taking long 4-5 mile walks during quarantine. Having this app has been such a blessing because it tracks everything! Miles, pace, total time, and where I‚Äôve been. I also love the social aspect where I can join clubs and earn digital trophies for different challenges. I have the watch app as well and it works wonders! I‚Äôm a big fan and highly recommend!!
title: So great!

review: I love the heck out of Strava, but I am pretty disappointed in the latest update, which removed the ability to edit running shoe or bike used for an activity prior to saving/uploading. Major pain in the neck to have to go back and edit every single upload. I have to assume this was a mistake and not an intentional change...Pete Kruse would never allow such a thing.
title: Please bring back Edit Gear feature

review:
I‚Äôve used it for biking and running so far and it works out great.
It would be amazing to have a feature where only certain people you choose, like coaches, can see your routes and progress. It would be much safer and more convenient than just having all your followers see what and (where) you run, etc. and also random people couldn‚Äôt see where you go by following you!
title: Pretty good overall, but needs a feature.

review: Multiple times, I have accidentally paused recording an activity in the process of switching apps. Then I missed out on most of the data, as I had just started the recording, then immediately went to switch to another app. For devices without a home button, where we need to swipe up from the bottom to switch apps, it is very easy to accidentally pause the recording. Then Strava and the users both miss out on data! Please move the pause/stop button on the record screen to somewhere it is harder to accidentally hit. Thanks.
title: Please move the pause/stop button on the record screen

review: The Strava app is great as it works now. I would like to see an addition to be able to plan routes with the app, drawing runs, rides, swim sessions on the map with our fingers. That way if our route won‚Äôt sink up because a malfunction occurs with our watch, or we forget our phone and watch for a run, or want to plan a new route somewhere the. We can still upload the route and see exactly how far our distance travelled was.
title: Route planning?? Both following roads and connecting breadcrumbs like when you run on trails

review: Strava has revolutionized my fitness journey with its rich features and social aspect. Connecting with friends, joining challenges, and tracking progress in activities like running and cycling keeps me motivated. The app's detailed analytics and compatibility with various devices make it an essential tool for anyone looking to improve their fitness experience. Highly recommended!
title: Inspiring Fitness Companion

review:
Overall pleased with the app. It‚Äôs a bit too Facebook like for my taste but whatever...

With recent update in past 2 weeks I‚Äôm noticing multiple times stats collection is inaccurate. I know I didn‚Äôt run 400 meters in under 60 seconds. I also know miles stats as I ran to see recorded stats are quite different. For instance today‚Äôs run I ran average about 8 min miles but stats reported say 9 and otherwise. 

Happy otherwise!
title: Anyone reporting inaccurate stats collected?

review: I have found this to be a great tool of tracking how I‚Äôm progressing with my daily activities and even training for any races.  Having various challenges have been my motivation to keep improving.  Great way to also connect with other people in various clubs or activities.  Happy to see athletes helping athletes attain their goals!
title: Tracking Progress

review: I like connecting with friends and seeing what they did, where they ran and accomplished.  I like pushing myself to see if I can earn a new PR on a segment.  I value and utilize the data to see where I was a year ago and what challenges I can complete too.  But in the end, you have to remember not to compare yourself to other people.
title: Really enjoy using Strava

review: The intrusive, never ending pop up ads for ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù are really killing this app. Strava, I knew about the personal group challenges when you announced them. I‚Äôve actually started one. I don‚Äôt need an interruptive full screen ad for one every 3rd time I use the app to quickly change a setting or entry. It‚Äôs infuriating. I paid for your overprice premium membership (although I‚Äôm not going to be renewing that). Just let me use the app. If you want to add features, give us parity with the website instead of the app which has been crippled for years.
title: Steadily going downhill

review: This USED TO BE a great app. You CAN‚ÄôT CONNECT hr monitors, cadence monitors, speed, or anything els Bluetooth....what‚Äôs the point. You have to use a 3rd party source like a garmin or wahoo app where you connect your bluetooth gear THEN after your workout, send that to Strava to have in combined into your recording. MANY MANY people have ditched this platform...check out Map My Ride, it IS what Strava WAS.
title: Used to be great, now junk

review: Having the ability to see your weekly mileage and vert with one click in your profile has been a part of the app for years but it was changed/removed recently.  This was one of the more useful things about the app, and seems like it should be a basic feature of a fitness tracking app.  This seems like more of the silly changes that Strava is making to put things behind a paywall.  I wish they would just use ads so that they could continue to provide a decent free app, rather than charging for features that used to be free.
title: Change/removal of weekly mileage and vert is a bad move

review: My average pace for runs often disappears and the app shows a map instead with no useful data. I spend my  runs messing with the app to try to show pace instead of running fast. Not what I need. No crashes or bugs though. I think average and current pace may be hidden behind a premium pay wall. Let me know if I‚Äôm an idiot and you can make the app always display your pace. Until then 2 star and peace out.
title: My average pace for runs often disappears and the app shows a map instead with no useful data

review: Was encouraged to try this app so i downloaded, would only install if i gave it a credit card to enable a free trial which i did because it assured me i could cancel.  Two weeks before the end of the trial i  decided i didn‚Äôt want it, tried using the cancel button in the app and it does nothing.  I canceled through Apple purchase history, says it has been cancelled although the app still says i am signed up for full year of service after trial ends.  Hope Apple comes through for me because i am not encouraged by other reviewers response they have gotten from strava support.
title: Cancel subscription doesn‚Äôt work

review: I‚Äôve had Strava for years now and really loved it. With the recent update there‚Äôs basically no reason to use Strava unless you need a simple map/tracking app. I have an Apple Watch so the app is essentially useless to me. I loved the matched runs/leaderboard/other stats. I understand taking away some of the more advanced features but taking away the simple leaderboard feature?? Doesn‚Äôt make sense. It‚Äôs ironic because I was actually considering the premium version before this left a bad taste in my mouth. Sad to say I will be switching to another app with more features and less pushing of it‚Äôs premium version.
title: Sad to see a good app go

review: Strava you were great! Now you want to charge an amount (that is nowhere near worth paying) for something you offered free for almost a decade? I get it, you have to make money. But as a family of four who only does casual rides, this cost is not worth it. I‚Äôll never make top 10 overall so I don‚Äôt really care that you offer this for free. I love the segments and being able to compare myself with my family members or friends I rode with that day. Please reconsider Strava, I think you‚Äôre making the ‚Äúkiss of death‚Äù app mistake. Charge a very minimal one time flat download fee for everyone but NOT a monthly or annual fee.
title: Don‚Äôt bother anymore

review: This app has so much going for it. Social Media for athletes. It not only tracks all of your activities, it connects you with other athletes. Tracks you daily, weekly, monthly and yearly totals.. you are able to compete against yourself or others. Strava is not just an app it‚Äôs a way of life! It can be another layer of motivation in your daily life. If it didn‚Äôt happen on Strava it didn‚Äôt happen..üòÜ
title: This app is the best!

review:
I greatly enjoy Strava, here‚Äôs what would get me to 5 stars though: 

A) I know it‚Äôs primary activities are run/bike/swim but more support for Nordic Skiing would be nice. For example being able to search segments from the app for all activities (esp for Nordic skiing for me)

B) more consistency with the segments for running, I‚Äôve made segments that don‚Äôt appear when I search for them and my friends who use Strava have the same issues.
title: Use it almost daily but room for improvement

review:
Not sure how else to file a bug. Every time I refresh, the notification icon on the top right in the app and the home screen bottom nav button are badged with a ‚Äú1‚Äù as if I have 1 notification, but I have none. If I do actually have 1 notification, the icons will be badged with ‚Äú2‚Äù. I‚Äôve tried clearing the cache (reinstalling the app, logout/login) but nothing has fixed it.

This started yesterday for me.
title: D

review:
As of Sunday, August 4, Strava for Apple Watch stopped working. If you start your activity when you are indoors, and then head outdoors, it doesn't record your activity. This used to work. Who knows, it may be due to GPS acquisition problems, but I was quite disappointed to lose both a bike ride and a hike due to this new problem. 

One star until they fix this.
title: Great app but it has stopped working

review: I love Strava. It‚Äôs really the best app for running/riding/swimming. I mainly run and most of my runs are based on maintaining a heart rate range. Personally, the only thing missing from Strava is the ability to set a heart rate range and get either voice feedback, or simply a beeping to let you know you‚Äôve gone above or below your predetermined range. Strava would blow every other running app out of the water if it had this one, simple feature.
title: Real-time Heart rate feedback, please!!

review: It is a great app to track outdoor activity. My only complain is the notification. It tells me I got notification, tap the notification, the app opens and shows the notification. I close the app and still tells me I have notification. The notification badge number just won‚Äôt go away in the app icon.
title: Great app but pls fix notifications

review:
Great app, but the developer needs to improve the iwatch interface... Too simple and they also need to make better use of the iwatch hardware for example by adding cadence on runs, real time pace after every mile , on the last update it says splits, comes to find out you need to be close to the iPhone. Please improve the iwatch experience.

Update: they finally improved the Apple Watch app and I must admit it works good, good job üëç
title: Great app but needs to improve the iwatch...

review: I‚Äôve used Strava for three years now and was genuinely impressed with the app for the first year or so. Starting roughly a year and a half ago, the quality of the app has started to slide and has only gotten worse. It seems that after every update, there are tracking issues or something that just doesn‚Äôt work. It‚Äôs frustrating and I‚Äôm not renewing for the next year. Seems like I can use the native Apple app and not have to pay for the same level of service.
title: Long time user, not renewing.

review: Strava‚Äôs data takes far too long to upload (Endomondo‚Äôs was instant, as soon as you got off your bike and pressed ‚Äústop‚Äù your ride was logged and already synching with your Garmin ‚Äî it‚Äôs been over five minutes and Strava is still updating).
