Its maps aren‚Äôt accurate for neighborhood laps, and it  pushes group synching at you constantly even if you‚Äôve made clear in your preferences that you are only interested in private data, not sharing.  Not worth the subscription fee.
title: Endomondo was far simpler and far superior

review: Love using Strava to track my runs and workouts and really impressed with developers regarding feedback I submitted wanting my weekly mileage on my main profile (after it was moved to only Training tab). I submitted feedback and about a week later it was back in place. Now that is quality customer service
title: Great app and receptive developers

review:
When I run, all I want to see is my timing screen - time, distance, and pace that I‚Äôve been running. However, after a few seconds, it auto-switches to the map mode where I can no longer see my stats. After about 10 mins of running, it gets completely stuck on the map screen, so I can‚Äôt even see my stats for a second.

Once it gets stuck in this bad mode, mile time notifications also can‚Äôt be dismissed. I finish a mile, the blue banner pops up over the top of my screen, and I can‚Äôt push it away, so it completely blocks the upper quarter of the screen.

Stick with NRC.
title: Really frustrating UI!

review: The challenge are a test of what you are on the outside but on the inside.  The results aren‚Äôt only in numbers but you can log how you feel too as an indicator.  Having the opportunity to reach out to like minded people around the world. The professional athletes whom are willing to share their experience outside of the spotlight has been a great inspiration that it takes work.
title: PMA Effect/Goggins Mode

review: Strava was just an amazing app at the start and it works just great. If you were biking then you could compare your times with other people and try to go faster and faster to try and get a good time, but than they updated the app and now they charge 60 dollars to see other peoples times and compare yours to them, it was and astonishing app at the start and I loved it, but they charge way too much for things that were free before, because of what they now charge everyone is mad.
title: They charge to much

review:
Strava is great for tracking your activities and efforts for cycling, running and swimming. 
You also can use it for workouts and other activities not listed, however, Strava needs to update how activities such as gym workouts are shown and have a list of other sports that can be tracked or the ability to add other sports such as dirt biking. 
Strava is well overdue for updating the app
title: Tracking Activities

review: In general I like the app, but there are some Annoying bugs, most annoying is the Watch app pauses my run as soon as I start a run, an option for a 3 second delay to starting my run on the watch would also be nice. Auto Pause in general on the watch is flaky and inconsistent not that I use pause much but when you have to wait for traffic it often doesn‚Äôt pause or it doesn‚Äôt resume.
title: Ok but has some annoying bugs

review: My strata app worked fine for the few months I have been using it with my Apple Watch. In the last few days it does not work at all on my watch!! I have paid for the strata summit and can‚Äôt use it at all. I have updated my phone, turned it off, turned off the watch and did a total reinstall. Still to no avail?!?  Anyone else??
title: Not working with Apple Watch now ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

review: Odd that current pace is not available in your runs. All you can see is the avg split time of the current mile you‚Äôre in or the total avg of all your miles in this run. Why would you not be able to see your current running pace. Very odd that Strava doesn‚Äôt care about this. So I don‚Äôt recommend this for runners. It‚Äôs a great app outside of run training.
title: No current pace for running

review: I have used it as a social media for runners for a while now and I absolutely love it. It does everything that Id like it to. One problem though, it is a pretty easy addition, make it so you can add in more specificity in the distance on a manual run. If I do a 400m race I can only put in .20 or .30 so another slot would be a nice addition.
title: Great, one ask though

review: Loved this app at first. It was tracking well and I like the community aspect. The last few weeks though it won‚Äôt track my mileage - even if I wait for a strong gps signal. Sometimes it starts partway through my run and sometimes it never tracks distance. I‚Äôve tried updating, restarting my phone, messing with the settings but nothing works. I might switch back to Runkeeper if this doesn‚Äôt get fixed ASAP
title: Great at first but a bug is making tracking correctly impossible

review: Searched everywhere in the app to try and get my data from my Apple Watch ultra 2 to import into strava. This should be a basic function when you sign up. The app becomes useless to me if I have to start over and lose years of workouts. If you want more subscribers I recommend making it painless to switch to your app with a basic function, if it‚Äôs there I recommend it being part of setup because it is hidden.
title: Couldn‚Äôt sync

review: can only recommend if youre looking to accurately record about one run a week - the app regularly gives incorrect mapping and thus mileage information. its only good if you dont have a stop watch to use instead - I wish I could share images of how poorly the app does at giving consistent useful information. the elapsed to moving times make 0 sense but then again most of the interface is useless so thats no surprise. if you have an iphone just use whats already installed on your phone do not pay for this
title: just as bas as other options

review: There needs to be a way in settings that you can choose your activities that you are most likely to participate in and then subsequently only have those choices on your Apple Watch. With the addition of all of the new activities, it now seems cumbersome to sort through until I find the activity I am planning on participating.
title: Great app but needs one new feature

review: I was using strava for my while biking season. I was able to look at my year in sports to, but they recently changed that feature to members only. I‚Äôve also seen that they are slightly rising the amount to pay for members without giving notifications to the users, and then saying that they were just changing the prices to fast, also, it doesn‚Äôt have dark mode that is a much needed feature.
title: Is a good app but‚Ä¶

review:
Love Strava - best in the category for sure. But a few feature requests. First, the routes don‚Äôt allow for turn by turn cues on bike computers (eg Wahoo or Garmin). Second, why can‚Äôt I set a different default bike for road cycling vs mountain biking? Seems like an easy add. Same with shoes - I only want my running shoes to be default for runs, not every type of activity I do on foot. 

Overall though I love it. Keep up the good work!
title: Great app but‚Ä¶.

review: I feel the accuracy when tracking with apple products are very inaccurate. When I ride with friends I should not show 4 additional miles. I did not wander off and disappear for 4 miles without someone noticing. The accuracy I feel keeps getting worse with every update. Can you fix this so my friends don‚Äôt feel bad they didn‚Äôt ride as long as me? I also feel that the tracks look like I ride drunk. The trails aren‚Äôt wide enough to make that many micro turns.
title: Accuracy on apple is terrible

review: When I have to run with this app because my Garmin is very inaccurate it is great! However, my only complaint is if I do a treadmill workout and want to record it I can only load it at .1 intervals so today when my run ended in .85 I couldn‚Äôt decided if I should put .8 or .9 I just would like to be able to put exact distances in manually. Otherwise great app will continue to use!!!
title: Overall good

review:
I trusted this app for few years, as an app is really nice. I use it to track my activity, connect with friends and explore routes. 
The bad thing the management what to be political, I was ignoring this whatever but then they decided to shut down services for all Russian and Belorussian users, essentially telling them they are no longer welcomed and they are second class citizens who are not deserved to be a part of their community. Beware because depends on what is in political fashion tomorrow they can decide that you or your kind of people is not welcomed and blocked too.
title: Use if you support discrimination

review: Three of us walk together. One uses Map My Walk, one uses Apple Watch activity tracker and one uses Strava. We walk 3.3 miles on the same trail each time. Strava consistently reports longer distances than the other two apps. And it tracks different everyday even though we walk the same distance... 3.5, 3.6, 3.7 or 3.8. Seriously, how could it track a half mile longer than the other two apps? As such, I don‚Äôt trust the inconsistency of the data and would not recommend this app.
title: Inaccurate data

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for about 6 years and I‚Äôm really disappointed with the latest version. I use it on my bike and if I hit a big bump it disconnects and I loose the info, if the batteries run out it disconnects and I loose the info. Older versions used to automatically feed into my Apple health app but no longer so I have to add that info by hand, and the constant nag to upgrade is very tiresome.  I‚Äôm reluctant to change apps because of my data I‚Äôve been contributing for years and all the friends I‚Äôve made but I‚Äôve just about had it.
title: Disappointed with latest version

review: As a cyclist this is my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù app. It‚Äôs great for keeping track of my progress as well as that of my friends. The only thing that is missing still is Climb Categories. This is visible on the website for quite some time but never on the mobile app. People have been requesting it for a while but still hasn‚Äôt happened.
title: Great but still missing one feature

review: I understand that a company is supposed to generate revenue.  But are you joking.  I have used Strava for years and all of a sudden I need to pay 60$ to look at a leaderboard of times, even against my friends.  Kinda thought Strava would stay this cool app that was community friendly and supported and helps athletes grow.  Turns out they only want to give you even half-useful data for a price.  Can‚Äôt wait to see all the other apps that use the segments from Strava get completely ruined.  Waiting for a good alternative, any developers get to work, I would even be fine with seeing ads for a carbon-copy of old Strava.
title: I get it

review: App does not auto-rotate with the device. I know that sounds simple, but it‚Äôs such a necessary feature when you‚Äôre zooming in on maps, and individual sections of roads that any app dependent on maps should include as a very basic feature. I was once a paid subscriber, but the restrictive decisions by the STRAVA board have turned me sour on them receiving another dime. The ‚Äúpremium‚Äù features aren‚Äôt worth the subscription... the routing feature is just plain bad and has never worked well. It‚Äôs a poor UI, and completely worthless with other options like RideWithGPS, GARMIN Connect, BikeMap, et al... Pass this one by.
title: Not worth your time

review:
I started using Strava last summer for the social features, within our local parkrun group and other local running friends. Then in December I got an Apple Watch. Syncing was so easy - it just worked, and afterwards you could see your activities in the Exercise app and on your phone. It even tracked cross-country skiing - cool! (Try that, Nike Run.) 

BUT THEN IN FEBRUARY STRAVA BROKE IT!! Why? It no longer works. Activities recorded with the Strava complication don't show up in Exercise, don't show up as a workout, sometimes you don't even get the activity credit. PLEASE RESTORE THE OLD FUNCTIONALITY!
title: They BROKE Apple Watch syncing üò°

review:
I have been using Strava regularly in a effort to really understand why people are so drawn to it. In a word: it‚Äôs the feed. It‚Äôs seeing what others are doing and measuring your progress against them. My issues with the app are:
1: bad UX.  It is confusing to use the app. I want to go straight to my history which is under profile.  
What‚Äôs the purpose of the ‚ÄúExplore‚Äù tab?  Seems useless. I spend too much time trying to find my history and rides and the app is confusing. Make it simpler. 
2. It seems inaccurate.  I have used Strava on the same runs and compared it with my friends Garmin GPS watch.  Strava always seems about a half mile off than the others.  I‚Äôve tried different apps too, and used phone only and Apple Watch and the mileage is really inconsistent.  

I wish it was a better app, because the ability to connect with friends is great.
title: It‚Äôs good for social athletes.

review:
I have been an avid Strava user/subscriber for years for my biking. I live in the NE and during the winter months I indoor row on my WaterRower and log my rows manually in Strava. What I don‚Äôt get is why the Strava team cannot link this manual data to a annual miles/km goal under the water section so I can track my rowing and be invented to do better each time just like I do biking. Yes, I‚Äôve reported this many times.

Anybody else frustrated by the lack of manual activity reporting to goals?
title: Great App, but...

review:
I mistakenly paid money for a subscription. I immediately regretted it because it didn‚Äôt provide any more useful features. I couldn‚Äôt get my money back but continued to use the app because there are some third party tools that connect with Strava data and actually provide useful information.  

Whatever you do - don‚Äôt waste your money. 

They keep taking away more features even though I‚Äôm a subscriber. After recently updating the app... even though I PAY MONEY - I can no longer even see my yearly mileage. What a piece of crap. Really screws up my incentive to run.
title: Keeps taking away features even for subscribers

review: I love keeping track of my activities and seeing how my friends are progressing on their goals. I do not care for the politically motivated commentary. Given the current climate of high tensions I value a place where the focus is on personal goals and physical activities and encouraging others to push themselves in various physical activities.
title: Like the app but can the political commentary

review: I really enjoy the app and seeing my ride and times and all the other information when I get home. The past week or two the app has been crashing on my watch or phone. It has also started me in the wrong location making my total distance further than reality. But really minor issues when 95% of the ride is on point and shows the details so I can make my next ride better.
title: Ready to cycle

review:
I‚Äôve been a user for a couple of years for cycling and running, but am tired of losing my data after an activity. No hint of trouble until activity ends and doesn‚Äôt upload to phone. They interface has also changed on the watch a few times. You‚Äôre always looking for the features/buttons. 

The features of phone app are great (although they do move things around there frequently, too) but I will take less features if it works every time. 

Do not expect this to be as stable as the built in tracking app on the Apple Watch.
title: Used to work well with Apple Watch

review: Overall great app. The connection between Strava and my Apple Watch series 2 is better than I expected. However, I feel in a future update you should be able to edit the time or distance manually. While running in the woods or on trails the GPS is naturally lower than what you‚Äôre actually running, so it would be good to be able to edit it to an extent so the pace isn‚Äôt way lower than it‚Äôs supposed to be.
title: Could use some tweaks

review: Very useful app but I do not understand the reasoning behind changing which info is displayed in the feed for each run. Half of my runs show the pace and the other half do not. Just make it consistent so users can easily compare stats between runs when scrolling through the activity. Makes no sense to only show the pace on some runs.
title: Why isn't pace shown?

review: Had one account a long time ago. Forgot about it for a few years. Made another account that was linked to my Apple. Paid for the premium, didn‚Äôt have access on the new account, turns out it went to my old account- all my fault. Emailed them twice in two weeks about how to fix it or get a refund‚Ä¶. No response.  Now I have to start over or try and transfer all Nike data to the one I PAID for. üò§
title: Poor Customer Service

review:
Strava has no data cleaning or smart smoothing, so when running under a bridge or next to tall buildings (where GPS data can be temporarily inaccurate) it includes all erratic data points, making tracked distance much longer than real distance and thus tracked pace much faster than real pace.

This defeats the purpose of most of any paid features that involve pace, matched runs, etc. Strava thinks my best 400m is 0:39!
title: Canceled my subscription due to buggy run tracking

review: This is probably one of the worst apps created for running.  I was forced to use it for a virtual run and it‚Äôs buggy, simplistic to the point of useless. Counting in your head is probably a safer bet.  Oh and good luck actually drawing your own route that‚Äôs a nightmare with or without a stylus.  Map my run at least allows you to edit the route and make changes.  Draw and undo with no ability to do anything else to the route is silly.  And charging to have a subscription while providing a very poor app should be criminal.  You‚Äôre better off with Nike run or under armor even Samsung health is better than strava.
title: Who wrote this app?!
Strava has been great in helping me meet my goals and challenging to become a stronger cyclist!

review:
This is a really good running app with lots of monthly challenges you can participate in. I‚Äôve been using it for about 4 months and it‚Äôs definitely more accurate and faster than Map My Run which I was using before. 

My only complaint would be how much you pay for ‚Äúsummit.‚Äù They get you with bundling services and it‚Äôs not cheap. 

Other than that great app is you run consistently and have friends that do it‚Äôs the best imo.
title: Would recommend

review: I wish I had stayed with free app, but I really wanted the calorie burn data. So I paid the $60 subscription fee to find out I need to add a device to read heart rate. So spent another $100 on a Fitbit and sync the apps, but Strava app and website says I still need subscription. I have the receipt that shows I paid through Apple store, but no luck regardless how many times I go through sync process and give access permissions. HELP!!!!!!
title: Paid $60, still no heart rate or calorie data

review: I‚Äôm new to using this app. It‚Äôs ok so far, I‚Äôve only had it for a week & half & today it totally crashed on me and didn‚Äôt record my workout/mile time correctly. I had to screenshot my time, which is better than nothing. I ran 1 mile and it only recorded half of a mile & showed a huge size zag lined Indicating that I cut my run short which I didn‚Äôt do. Needs improvement & the pop up is annoying trying to get to start the free trial/yearly membership. Definitely going to look for another app to track my progress/workout.
title: Needs improvement

review: I like the idea of Strava on Apple Watch as a way to ditch the phone at home but still have activity recording and all the social components of Strava. Unfortunately, this isn‚Äôt terribly accurate. Strava‚Äôs Watch app doesn‚Äôt use GPS to calculate pace and distance it uses the pedometer. This seems silly because the app still uses GPS to track your route. Why not just do both? The app also drains the Watch battery much quicker than other workout apps such as Apple Workout or Nike Run Club.
title: Not accurate on Apple Watch

review: I use this to track my training runs and cross training on my bike.  I really like how it automatically compares runs and run segments.  What I really wish for though is for a haptic/vibration at each mile. The audio cue is too loud (and drawn out), but unless you happen to look at your watch at the mike mark you could miss it.  I really really hope they can add this small feature!!
title: Great app for Apple Watch

review: I have had way too many issues on here. If it worked, it would be great but there‚Äôs far too many bugs and stupid errors which have made me spend more time on here than I need to. I simple upload of a picture, for example, shouldn‚Äôt be hard. With Strava, you might have to upload over and over again for it to actually post. I hope there is an equivalent to Strava soon that‚Äôs more reliable. I can‚Äôt believe I am paying $60 a year for this frustration and for a product that constantly needs fixing.
title: Way too faulty

review: I don‚Äôt use this app for improving as an athlete or monitoring my stats (although that might happen eventually.) I love how this app connects me to other people, I love the interactive maps, and I love naming my rides. This might be my gateway app for social media, I‚Äôve recently considered using FB, but let‚Äôs not get carried away. Kudos Strava.
title: This is the only social media I can get behind

review: As someone trying to get back into running, at a more competitive and serious level, Strava has been a game changer. It has given me a community, challenges, and a very accurate way to track progress. Segments & PRs are so motivating! I recommend to all of my running friends & family. Thanks, Strava Team ‚ò∫Ô∏è Truly.
title: Strava has changed my life.

review: What an absolutely wonderful app, where it not only helps newbie‚Äôs such as myself meet others in my community thanks to Strava, but also to uplift, encourage, and root one another on in our own personal journeys. The beauty is we each have our own goals, and our own reasons, but one thing remains in common, the love, support, encouragement, and inspiration of others on here! Thank you Strava!
title: Such an encouraging app

review: I paid for a full years subscription and for the first couple rides, the gps worked fine. But now it is trash. I‚Äôm on the most up to date version of the app and on the most current Verizon of iOS but my rides never record. I ride the same route multiple times per week and never have an issue with my watch‚Äôs built in tracking. I‚Äôve reached out to their support teams on social media and via email and no one responds. I learned my lesson‚Äîsave yourself the hassle and find a better tracker.
title: Don‚Äôt invest in a subscription GPS tracking never works

review: It doesn‚Äôt get any better than Strava! A well know brand that is easy to navigate and fun. Connect with friends or just set your own personal goals for motivation. Whether you are new to sport monitoring or a seasoned vet Strava is the one to connect with. Start your membership now and bring in the new year on track!
title: The Brightest Star Among Many

review: Ok heading too quickly to my sixties I‚Äôve been an avid heart rate (monitor)since early twenties and over last five years collected numerous data points that suggest .... I‚Äôm getting older and slowerü§®good fun though hate seeing six min miles becoming seven.. eight .. nine and now tens the new normalüòÇüòÇüòÇbut heck I‚Äôve got to say running on my own the last 15 years it‚Äôs a good companion well worth investing in at any ageüëçüëçüëç
title: Benefits of strava apps

review: I love Strava but now with the recent update many of the things I love now require a subscription!   I‚Äôm just a recreational runner but I liked to be able to compare my runs over time and see how I rank in the different segments.  Now all that costs $4.99/month!   I can see paying maybe $0.99 or $1.99/month but not $5!   These features were free for years and years and now without warning they were taken from me!  So disappointed...
title: Took Away Favorite Features with the Update. :(

review:
Just want to say thank you all at Strava for a great app!! This app has changed my life and my girlfriends as well. Love how we keep in contact with our friends and family here, so nice to see everyone together and being competitive.
Looking forward to upgrading our membership soon. Thanks again and keep up the great work!!
Speedy : )
title: Great App!!

review:
So disappointed that the routes feature is now behind a paywall. As a woman generally concerned about safety, and living in the COVID-19 world, routes was a really important feature for me to have the security of knowing exactly where I‚Äôm going and if certain routes were more populated than others. Now I literally only use this app to sync my Garmin with my Apple Watch. 

I‚Äôm kind of appalled so many features must now be accessed through a fairly expensive subscription at a time when millions of people are out of work. Seems rather gauche.
title: Disappointed

review: I‚Äôve used this app for years, the latest update must have been edited after 20 beers.  Heart rate doesn‚Äôt work, FAQ says its just a quirk.  If you do a little twerk, turn your self around, ‚Äúdo this to do that, don‚Äôt do this or you won‚Äôt get that.‚Äù Why not just make it work? Gotta spend a few hours turning on features that don‚Äôt automatically show up. I end up spending more time in the settings than running. Summit is short for ‚Äúsome it‚Äù you just don‚Äôt need. Developers, go back to plan A, start over, make it right, lay off the beers.
title: Bugs... like a mosquito

review: I heard about this app through some friends and it has encouraged me to see others workouts. I‚Äôm very happy I found this app. Also helps find local trails and paths to do runs or bikes on. Wish I would have found it sooner! Make sure you encourage your friends when you see them do workouts! Such a great community!
title: Accountability

review: I love Strava but lately some of my runs don‚Äôt get uploaded. I always check to see if my Garmin and Strava accounts are connected before I upload a run. There have been a few instances over the last month where my runs would appear on Garmin but not on Strava and I would have to manually post the stats of my run and loose the gps track route. Please fix this!
title: No uploads

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for over 4.5 years now and I love it! It has a lot of what I need and what I enjoy using as a non-premium user. However, the one annoying thing about this app is how typing out a description of an activity is terribly glitchy. I will be typing out my description and for some reason my cursor goes to the very end of it, even after editing one thing.
title: Review

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for more than 5 years now, and it‚Äôs changed my mind, my body, and my outlook on life. I‚Äôve got more and stronger friendships with other cyclists, renewed friendships with long time ride partners, and expanded my riding territory across four continents. And I‚Äôm not even retired yet! Can‚Äôt wait to see where Strava will take me then...
title: If you believe in the power of friendly competition‚Äî Strava is unbeatable!

review: I really want to like the app and from when I downloaded it a month ago it‚Äôs worked pretty well for viewing others activities, but it never uploads my activities, I connected my Fitbit and strava app but it keeps disconnecting and when it does connect it doesn‚Äôt upload anything and I‚Äôve researched and found others had this problem and I did were you completely disconnect it from both sides of the apps of Fitbit and strava but it still doesn‚Äôt work!! If anyone knows how to fix this please let me know.
title: I want to like the app...

review:
If I had a dollar for every time I‚Äôve driven somewhere, turned on Strava, done my run or bike ride or whatever, and then forgotten to turn it off before I get back in the car and drive home, I‚Äôd have more than a few bucks.

You guys need to add the ability to delete parts of an activity off the end, because I‚Äôm certain I‚Äôm not the only one who drives home without pausing the app.
title: Need to add ability to delete parts of activity!

review: Shoe tracking is awful at actually allocating the runs to your shoes. The miles seem to disappear when you change from the required default shoe to a different shoe. Useless and unreliable feature. Paid subscribers should be able to look at all sorts of data by shoe as well. And why in the heck can you only add shoes on the website and not the app. On a mobile the website automatically sends you to the app so adding a shoe becomes unnecessarily difficult. Not worth paying for!
title: Shoe Tracking Extremely Buggy

review: I‚Äôve been a Strava user since 2015, and have enjoyed using the app until this new update. The one thing I loved about the app was being able to compare my segment times to my friends and the other people on that app, as I am a very competitive person. But now you have to pay to see where you stand on the leaderboards, which I think is very stupid. The free app didn‚Äôt offer much other than tracking your distance, time calories, etc. but at least it had leaderboards. Now it doesn‚Äôt even offer that without making you pay. Probably won‚Äôt use the app anymore.
title: New update

review: Does what you want and connects you to your friends and runemies. Of course you need to be in the same ecosystem to really shame other people with your smokin‚Äô split times... It has no major bugs. It has decent analytics, but not super-awesome physiologic monitoring or reporting. It ports from any gps watch or use the phone (your wife is going to call you a few times during your run anyway).
title: Good App.

review: I mostly only use the Apple Watch app, which is still lacking features like marking splits/laps, which Apple‚Äôs Workout app can do. Cadence for running is measured but not reported (again, Apple‚Äôs workout app can do this).  Given this, will use Apple‚Äôs workout app for recording activities and use iPhone app for reviewing results, etc. New strain feature looks good so far.
title: Good and getting better, but...

review: You can‚Äôt use most of the options on the app itself. You have to use a computer to use most of the ‚Äúbenefits‚Äù Sure, you can program routes but when you do... there‚Äôs No voice guidance along the route you chose, so why bother? Training package is not what was advertised. Who needs heat maps anyway? Oh... and they won‚Äôt give you your money back if you decide you don‚Äôt like it within the first 3 days.  In fact, they won‚Äôt even answer your complaint. I guess I‚Äôll stick around for a YEAR and use the only thing that is useful. The safety feature. Glad I paid $60 for that!
title: Don‚Äôt buy the extras

review:
Have been cycling with paid (premium) Strava over a year here are what needs improvement.

1.  Generation of Beacon Texts.  Overall way too slow and often have wait before I can start my ride as it just hangs and have to restart the app. Especially inconvenient when riding in winter and have to take gloves off to deal with this. 

2.  Would prefer an easy way to save and select different beacon text groups.  So I can quickly get going and have a minimum amount of time to get notifications out.

3.  Would like some privacy options that track and log your entire route but when sharing to the larger outside world (not friends and family) omit the first and last parts of the route for privacy.
title: Nice but needs work

review: Switched from Nike+ because Strava start/pause/resume/finish is more consistent and reliable on Apple Watch. Upload is poor - it usually takes 10hours or more to see my run on the app. Weather - why doesn‚Äôt the app show weather for the run? Best x - Nike+ had a page with best 1m, 10k and so on, that would be nice. Awards - Nike+ had awards for days and months, that would be nice. Active Calories - I just don‚Äôt let the app write this data any more as it is so far off from what Apple calculates.
title: Lot of room for improvement

review: Who‚Äôs going to read this? I‚Äôve been using these guys for years and appreciate the number of features and other fun stuff they include. I feel some of the menus aren‚Äôt very intuitive at times, and I wish some of the web portal options were available on the app (Flybys!), but these are minor and aren‚Äôt necessary for my on the go experience.
title: No major complaints

review: I wish the map would show the point where you reach each mile. Additionally, the map could identify areas on the map when you are running faster (shown on map in green) and areas where you are running slower (in red). This would really improve the app.
title: Map updates

review: This app is great for tracking and all but I‚Äôm here for creating routes and it‚Äôs an absolute joke. It‚Äôs terrible. I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm doing something wrong but it‚Äôs becoming really inconvenient. It automatically makes the route go around all over the place instead of going 5 feet in front of the last point. So instead of having a 5 mile straight line it will create 20 mile backtracking going all around different roads type of trip. I don‚Äôt care for that. Why is google maps better?
title: Good and bad

review: This app is mostly super great. My main beef right now is that my iPhone Home Screen will show I have seven (7) new notifications, but when I go into the app, I only have two (2). This has been happening consistently for a month or more now. The Home Screen notification count is ALWAYS inflated by at least four (4). Fix this and five (5) stars for sure!
title: Notifications are whacked

review:
Prior versions would sync activities recorded from garmin and Peloton into Apple health. This now longer works. Not mentioned in the release notes that this functionality was taken away. Needed to find that on a support page.

When Strava used to sync all activities to Apple health, it was my favorite way of getting things from multiple sources (garmin, Peloton) to all go into both Strava and Apple health. I‚Äôll adapt my workflow but this is very annoying.
title: What the heck

review:
I don‚Äôt understand where the resources from this company go, now that users have to pay to use most of features of the app. If an app can‚Äôt fix their technical problems, it is a matter of time for competitors to take over. Every single app can sync data among devices just fine but Strava.
Adoption is good due to marketing, but I know serious riders leaving the app. DEV TEAM, Please buy a few iwatches, model 1,2,3 etc. and test in different iphones. It just doesn‚Äôt synch.
title: Iwatch with iphone xr synch doesn‚Äôt work for years

review:
Latest version replaced the easy to read leaderboard for a segment (all time, this year, today, by weight/age) that gave you a quick view of where your effort stood on each of these (1-5 bars). 

That‚Äôs gone. Now you have to click ‚Äúsee KOM‚Äù and then click again to see where your effort places you.  No quick look just a lot of clicks. Not an improvement.  

Love the app otherwise.
title: New segment leaderboard lousy

review:
I‚Äôve never had a problem with the Strava app over the years, but something is wrong with the latest update. 

I have background app refresh completely turned off on my iPhone. Even so, after the update Strava has been running in the background for 4 hours and 11 minutes over the past 24 hours. Even though the app is closed. 

Until this is fixed I‚Äôm unfortunately uninstalling the app.
title: Latest Update = Lots of Background Usage

review: I‚Äôve LOVED strava for the past 2 years as it‚Äôs been fun to post activities and get credit from friends and family as well as see what other are into. However earlier today I went on the longest run I‚Äôve ever done, saved it at the end, and then nothing was posted. I was so excited for everyone to view my activity but now they won‚Äôt unless I add it manually which doesn‚Äôt look that good.
title: Didn‚Äôt save my best activity...

review:
I‚Äôve used Strava for years, have invited many friends to start using it to record their rides and track their progression. And I would have given an honest five star review if it weren‚Äôt for the recent changes to the app. 

What was once a full featured free app with premium features, is now basically a premium paid app with a barebones ‚Äútrial version‚Äù with many of its most useful features (that have always been free)being reserved for those who can afford to pay for the subscription service.

It‚Äôs a disappointment.
title: Great app Crippled after update...

review:
I was an avid Strava user for 2.5 years. Every time I was on the trail and met someone new, I‚Äôd ask if they were on strava. Every time I was on the trail, I‚Äôd record it with Strava.
No longer.
Strava used to make biking more fun, but now every feature that makes the app worth having requires a subscription.
Want to see how you stack up against others?
Pay up.
Want to see how you stack up against yourself?
Pay up.
Want to see your heart rate over the course of your ride?
Pay up.
Want to see the terrain rise and fall over the course of your ride?
Pay up.
The only service this app provides for free now is your current ride and your fastest time.  From an app that has a reputation for providing time and distance accuracy that‚Äôs less than stellar, the subscription just isn‚Äôt worth it for me.
I can do what Strava does with a stopwatch and apple‚Äôs health app. If I want to compare my times to others‚Äô, I can get a group text started.
title: Nope nope nope

review:
It kind of snuck up on me. Did a couple rides this spring, but only recently went to check out my sections to see how I‚Äôm looking this season. To my disappointment, they‚Äôre behind a subscription wall! Been using this app for years. I understand charging for premium features, but not removing long-standing functionality in a cash grab. Guess it‚Äôs time to track elsewhere. 
Disappointed that the developers made this move. They‚Äôll lose a lot of faithful users, and many apps will be right there to take their place.
title: Getting greedy

review:
The most recent update ruined the app, as the other endless reviews are saying. $60 a year to even just see my own runs is ridiculous. Everything that I‚Äôve loved about this app for years is gone. I found so much motivation watching myself improve, the satisfaction of seeing my new PRs after each run, and being able to check out the leader boards to find motivation as well as connect to the running community around me.

  This app is now nothing but a glorified stop watch. I will no longer use strava, nor suggest it to others. You guys got way too greedy.
title: Update ruined the app

review:
Strava used to be a good ‚Äúsport social network‚Äù. But the company greedy ness and unwillingness to fix the app makes for a very, very poor experience.
Never implemented the ability to add/edit segments on the app. Never implemented the ability of add/edit gears (shoes/bikes) on the app.
They already took away the integration with Relive, which was what ‚Äútranslated‚Äù the boring stats of our rides to a nice video so other people could understand and actually feel like joining in.
They also removed the ability to use BT/ANT+ sensors with the app, claiming it was causing crashes (how about fix the app then?!?).
Now we lose proper access to the segment leaderboards. 
What‚Äôs the point of having all the ‚Äúsocial network‚Äù aspect that make people want to use the app in the first place, if it‚Äôs behind a paywall? Might as well go full paid service! At least it will be honest, stating that you don‚Äôt care with the core community, just with the money....
title: Poor app support

review:
Nowadays, I get a very intrusive all screen ad for their subscription multiple times a day. That's in addition to all the ads in the feed for Summit. 
It's just extremely annoying, especially because the subscription is quite useless. 
The app is bare bones. Simple things like adding  new shoes need to be done on the website.
If you can't build your platform features in an app in 2019, you're just a bad company. 
The only updates they release are for removing features from the app, most recently connection to sensors because they can't be bothered to make them work
title: Good platform, terrible app

review: Love this app , enjoy track my Miles and feet of climbing. Enjoy signing up for challenges each month. The only thing I don‚Äôt like now with a group of friends that you have ,you can‚Äôt always see everyone unless you click on them. Sort of like Facebook you lose connections with them.
title: Strava

review: I feel like since I‚Äôm paying for this app now, I can no longer put up with the YEARS LONG bugs on the watch about ‚Äúnot being signed in,‚Äù when my phone has been signed in for well over a year. You get it if you‚Äôve used this app before. I hope I never have to pull my watch out on a ride and encounter this, or I‚Äôll flip. This bug has been present since generation one Apple Watch.
title: Current Version on Watch

review:
I love Strava, have been using it for 5+ years to track cycling.  It‚Äôs a great way to see my progress on paths/roads that I ride regularly as well as create some friendly competition among friends.   

That said, the latest version is very buggy and has caused my new iPhone to crash more than a few times.   This never happened prior to the latest update (and no other apps do it either)
title: Latest version is very buggy

review: Strava works fairly well overall, but why in the world is the average speed of a workout not displayed in the feed view?? The design has so much open space to incorporate it, but instead I have to click on a workout and swipe right twice to see it. Average speed should be visible in the workout feed and on the first display of a workout when you click through to it.
title: No Avg Speed in Workout Feed

review: I have now lost several workouts now trying to use the awful Apple Watch app. I was looking forward to using my Apple Watch instead of my Garmin 920xt for spin classes but the app screws up the sync every time. Today I did back to back classes for over an hour and a half and after syncing, my Strava app said that I did a ride for zero time and all my heart rate data was lost. This has happened multiple times now. Don‚Äôt bother releasing an app if it‚Äôs going to make me lose all my data. And now when I try to sync, it just says ‚Äúuploaded with errors‚Äù and I get no data. Useless.
title: Useless Apple Watch App

review: Been using Strava for years, almost everyday recently. But will def be going back to free after a $20 price increase for PRO! That‚Äôs a 35% price hike. Not worth it, I was mainly only using PRO for live tracking, but found out you can do that via garment or other apps. Disappointed Strava is just another company raising their prices without doing anything to earn it. The app hasn‚Äôt really changed in years or gotten marginally better.
title: Price increase, boooo, boooo

review: When you crop entries now, the crop doesn‚Äôt change the track image for the entry. I‚Äôve tried force closing the app and re-opening, ‚Äúrefreshing‚Äú the feed, all that stuff. Go in to try to ‚Äúcrop‚Äú again, and the crop that you submitted is already there properly the way it supposed to, it just doesn‚Äôt change the image of the track on the entry when you back out.
title: Something broken with cropping on iOS.

review:
I‚Äôve use the Apple Watch app for several years now. Exclusively for mountain biking. It‚Äôs been great. Just two feature suggestions to bring it to parity from Garmin and others.
-why can‚Äôt it show total elevation climbed during a ride?
-speed doesn‚Äôt need two decimals, just makes it more cluttered to see at a glance while riding
title: Watch app needs to show elevation  & climbing

review: There are bugs in the app‚Ä¶ one that has been bothering me the most lately is with the weightlifting option- if you pause the time, it still posts as the elapsed time and not moving time. Plus your screen has to be on the whole time or it will stop keeping track of time. I cannot lock my phone when it‚Äôs in weightlifting mode.
title: Bugs

review:
I‚Äôm happy with the app, although I wish it was more accurate tracking my activity and had a better customer service who is focused on solving problems when they occur. 
Difficult to distinguish between paid and non paid services. 
I keep complaining about activities not being  accurate, especially when I run inside the city, unfortunately it seams nothing has improved.
title: Good app

review: The small things ruin this app‚Äôs potential. I could list a bunch of things but everybody else has already done that. Let me just say that the app should know when you have stopped running or biking and got in a car to drive 70 miles an hour. It should either automatically stop or alert you that something has changed and give you the option. Instead, after your run if you forget to stop the run and then get in the car then later that day you see that you have run 40 miles at an average pace of a car speed.  Dumb.
title: Small things ruin it

review: Everything about this app is easy to use and it‚Äôs features are one of a kind. Incredibly reliable and is able to synch with other devices. Has helped me beyond words better myself as an athlete and individual. I use this app almost everyday and cannot see myself ever using another fitness tracking app.
title: Can‚Äôt live without it.

review: I was very excited to use the app and bought the yearly subscription, but it would not work on my watch. I even created another account to see if that would fix it, but it didn‚Äôt. Very sad. Kept getting a message saying something like ‚Äúset up on the app first‚Äù or ‚Äúlog in on the app‚Äù I was already logged in, and my watch was already supposedly connected through the app with all health/motion/whatever access granted. After trying to get it to work for about an hour, I deleted it and will be rescinding my payment for the subscription.
title: Would not work on Apple Watch Series 5

review: They‚Äôve been charging me double for almost a year. They‚Äôre taking 8.99 out of my account and I already paid $69 for the year (used to be $59). There‚Äôs no way to cancel it either. I‚Äôve contacted strava and they‚Äôve not gotten back to me. Therefore I have to call the bank and get them to stop payment which costs $35. Even if I do that they‚Äôre still taking out yearly and didn‚Äôt even send a notification saying that it‚Äôs been a year and asking if I want to renew, it‚Äôs just deducted. I went to try to cancel the main subscription too and there‚Äôs no way to do that. Get it together Strava and STOP ROBBING PPL
title: Not good

review: Truly abismal customer service. I paid for the update once they put the majority of their features behind a paywall, was double charged, then had the subscription removed completely. I submitted multiple tickets online, emailed them, and contacted them in social media. Crickets on their end.
title: Customer service

review: Overall the app is great for tracking my outdoor runs BUT why is the outdoor walk so limited? With the run I get pacing/splits, heart rate, etc but if you walk you get nothing. Makes no sense. The app should be able to track similar data points regardless if I am walking or running. I will at times walk 5 to 10 miles and it would great to see pace, splits, heart rate and compare to other walks. Seems like a simple fix.
title: Fix outdoor walk

review: Been using Strava for 4 years and have logged over 10,000 miles on it. Love the app and recommend it to all my teammates and friends. Extremely upset that Strava removed the progress bar, and made it a premium feature. This is very inconvenient and goes against the reason why I got the app in the first place. Some of us are college kids (like me) who are running hard every day to make ends meet in terms of tuition and scholarships and can‚Äôt work due to covid so a $60 purchase to see my training bar isn‚Äôt ideal right now. Please consider bringing this feature back.
title: Bring Back the Progress Bar!

review:
This app use to be amazing, still is somewhat, with being able to see how you perform against others on the same route. And everything for free! Now I feel like I‚Äôm using an app for Electronic Arts (EA) and I have to pay to use it and see the same information that I used to see for free.

Unfortunately there aren‚Äôt any other apps out there collectively used, and they know this.

So does it count if I don‚Äôt upload to Strava because I don‚Äôt want to pay?
title: Pay to Play - Does it count if I don‚Äôt pay?

review: Like other reviewers, I have been using (and loving) Strava for years until the most recent update, where Strava decided to remove formerly free features available to everyone and change them to subscription only. I understand some business model changes, however there was no heads up to non-subscription users, nor any indication whatsoever that these options would ever become subscription only. Unfortunately I will be now on the hunt again for a new running app that I don‚Äôt have to subscribe to.
title: Disappointed

review: Here‚Äôs a suggestion. If you people to upgrade to premium, let the free version to work for the basic stuff... like uploading exercise. I ran over 3 miles (3.2) but you app rated it at just at a 3 mile run. Then, to add insult to injury, it won‚Äôt sync. I have tried 5 times. 5 times. Tried turning off my phone and restarting, swiped it and here‚Äôs what it keeps saying: ‚ÄúPlease you data connection.‚Äù What the heck does that mean? I am connected to WiFi. It keeps saying it. So... I‚Äôm just going to use my Apple Watch fitness and Nike Run Club. Using Strava is a waste of time. Do not buy their premium...
title: And you want me to pay for it?

review: I used to live for Runkeeper. That was a huge app for me. The great coaching and such. Loved it!!! After almost a decade on runkeeper i moved to Strava‚Ä¶.wow! Runkeeper was the first app that I could compete and talk to others like a social media platform. Strava was even better. Since joining I‚Äôve gained mileage and have meet people all around the world. Strongly recommend this app!!!!
title: Great app

review:
I only use Strava because it‚Äôs linked as the official app for NYRR Virtual races. But it‚Äôs buggy at best and GPS signal leaves a lot to be desired. I find that I have to manually enter my races as it will record my times but not my miles, paces or anything else. Thankfully a friend introduced me to Runkeeper and that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve been using along with Strava and I have no issues with it. 
Hopefully Strava updates will fix this issue as lots of runners are out and about and need their runs recorded.
title: Come in Strava NYRR Runners seems on you

review: The app works, 90% of the tone. There's a serious issue with the push notifications and alerts generally, in that in you clock through the push notification, the app opens directly to the comment or activity, but doesn't clear the notification. You've gotta navigate back out and clock on the in-app alert icon. Just a poor programming issue for an established product to have.
title: Mostly good

review: I‚Äôve been a user for about a decade and lately I‚Äôve really come to enjoy the fitness/freshness tracker. But now that summer is coming and I want to swim in addition to run and bike, the tracker becomes completely useless since it doesn‚Äôt have a way to log heart rate while swimming. The Apple Watch fitness tracker is great for swimming. Why can Strava use that data? If it could replicate the data or download the data I would give it 5 stars.
title: So close

review: It would be a great idea if you have it allow you to use motorized vehicles such as motorcross bikes. I use it now from motorcross and log as a work out, if keeps track of my lap times. I noticed many other people who ride motocross and also ride mountain bikes or road bicycles have cross used the app for motocross.
title: Additional app for motorcycles.

review: I really want the app to be great, but cannot figure out how to do it. It doesn‚Äôt play well with Apple fitness (I have to import) and my Strava rides only have partial information. Now, I thought I use Apple fitness instead, but then I lose the ride features, which are reasonably nice. For how long the app is on the market, it does incredibly bad on the basics. I almost forgot, neither times nor dates are correct on any of the rides or workouts. Really disappointing. Not worth the money.
title: Really disappointing

review: I‚Äôve used the app for five years and have been Summit/Pro/Whatever for almost two. Strava makes 0 effort to listen to its user base and this latest removal of the ‚Äúdaily summary by week‚Äù is just the latest in a long list of disappointing decisions by its design team. Seriously who is running that division?
title: I love Strava, but they consistently disappoint me

review:
I like the connectivity to Facebook, friends, and Peloton, however I am done using this app. 

I originally added Strava using my university email account about ten years ago. I started using the app again, however was not able to access my email address with which I originally signed. Contacted support‚Ä¶ THREE TIMES to help change email and ZERO response. I am completely handicapped without my email access. Had to delete the app. Going to try something new.
title: Zero customer support

review: I‚Äôve used this app for a long time to track runs and rides. They track and gather a lot of data about the user, but that‚Äôs always been the trade off of using a free app. But over the last year it seems with every update they take away more and more features unless you are a paid subscriber. It‚Äôs seems every time I open the app there‚Äôs yet another menu that‚Äôs now behind a pay wall. :(
title: Erosion of service

review: Strava is doing more and more to gain users, but consistently drifting farther away from being effective for actual training.  All I want it for is to log rides and keep track of training volume.  Can‚Äôt even do that now because it‚Äôs logging Zwift and outdoor rides separately.  If you‚Äôre serious about cycling, consider other options, as Strava has continually shown it would rather draw in users and income rather than actually tailor the program to its athletes needs.
title: Drifting farther from useful by the day

review:
I have been trying for a year to get Strava to reflect me as a male.  When u look at segments u want to compare how u r doing against other people of the same sex.  However I have not been able to get a reply from anyone e at Strava except for an email that says someone will reach out some day and *here are some articles that might help‚Äù
Spoiler....they don‚Äôt help.

 I  pay the premium which I though might get me some help from someone there. It doesn‚Äôt. Also no phone number to call.   Great app. Horrible support.
title: Zero Customer Support even if u pay the premium

review: I‚Äôm not into instagram or other social sites but I love using Strava to see what my friends all over the world are doing for fun and training as well as sharing my own exercise adventures. The recent updates have also made tracking performance metrics a lot easier, although other apps like TrainingPeaks are better for that kind of thing.
title: My top social app

review:
I love the app. It tracks a lot of stuff and makes tracking not only your running but help stay connected with friends as well. 

My only complaints would be resulted to the Apple Watch interface.

1.  Unable to hear starts, mile markers, and finishes when using the Apple Watch. Especially when music is playing. 

2.  On the Apple Watch while you are running it does not show your distance to the hundredth place only to the tenth place. 

3.  When posting to social media, it again only shows the distance to the tenth and not the hundredth. It rounds down the distance when posting.  Trivial, but still.  Show the whole distance!
title: Great App with a few tweeks needed

review: This app was the leader of the pack in my opinion a few years ago.  However, now with the Premium subscription service, rather than develop new, high end analytics for premium users they are taking away free features, consistently, one at a time and adding them to Premium.  I‚Äôm becoming more and more disappointed with the free service with each update.  It‚Äôs lazy - innovate something for Premium to make me want it, stop robbing me of the free features to try to incentivize me to subscribe.  Your current strategy will not keep me as a loyal user.
title: No innovation

review:
Over all the app is great. Maps and segments are super fun. Analysis of rides/ runs are interesting. It can be fairly social but it‚Äôs not nearly as active as other social media‚Äôs. 

I changed my password online and had to sign out/ back in. Unfortunately the sign up and dig in button look exact the same and now my app is stuck in their sign up flow. Tried deleting and reinstalling the app and no dice.
title: Great app bad sign up/in experience

review:
I love the app. However, every single time that‚Äôs driver get an update, it stopped working on my AppleWatch.

To fix the problem, I must uninstall from my phone, uninstall from my watch, reboot both devices, reinstall on my phone, and then reinstall on my watch. I will call rate this about two more times. Can we get the updates to work?
title: Great App! Awful Updates!

review: I have to restart my iPhone and Apple Watch, both of them, EACH TIME I finish a run to get the workout from my watch into the app. Usually little bugs in apps get worked out over time, but this one has just gotten worse over time. Extremely frustrating. If you (Strava devs) can just make this very essential piece work I would be a happy customer. Instead I‚Äôm on the market for a new solution. I‚Äôve used this app for years and I am a paying monthly subscriber - but you‚Äôre about to lose me. Please, please fix.
title: Apple Watch Data sync is terrible

review: Been using strava to log cycling for the last 6 years straight! I‚Äôve loved, and been about most things they‚Äôve done to make this tool better, but lately my rides are getting cut off not even half way into the ride, it‚Äôs like each time it won‚Äôt log more than 2 1/2 miles! First I figured it was an auto start stop glitch, then I turned auto start stop completely off, then again the ride is cut just over 2 miles and then it just shows a straight line connecting the route ): Please fix, id like to continue using this app!
title: Long time user, been let down lately

review:
Please add an audible beep or voice cue selectable so I can know when Strava locks up and stops recording. Which it now does. A LOT. I‚Äôve lost over 39 miles in the last 3 weeks. 

Also please add a "night screen" with dark colors that doesn't kill your night vision.

But hey, thanks for adding the ability to add shoes. It would be nicer it just worked and was stable.
title: Please add two tiny features

review: I‚Äôve used Strava for a few years both cycling and running.  It‚Äôs syncs perfectly with Garmin Connect.   The last two years I‚Äôve used it mostly for running and I have really enjoyed all the segments on the routes I run.   I used it a while back to train for a marathon and it was great.  Now I‚Äôm training for a 50K.  Can y‚Äôall add a training schedule for different length Ultra‚Äôs?
title: Great app for any athlete.

review: It‚Äôs hard to succinctly state why this works so well but the window that it offers you is what people really like doing. Some go fast, some go long, some just go. But being in motion is what it‚Äôs all about and rubbing elbows with the various possible options of awesome is nothing short of astounding.
title: The best social media out there

review:
I have been using Strava for around 6 years, was premium for 2 but cancelled because I wasn‚Äôt getting the value in paying anymore.

One of the biggest things me and thousands of other people have asked for is the ability to switch to chronological view but they keep trying to add new features instead of listening to what people want.

Good app but the developers should pay attention to what people are asking for.
title: Good app but don‚Äôt listen to user requests

review:
First, my family is on the free version. The app says there is a free version but I couldn‚Äôt find it, and so ended up on the 30 day free trial.

Second, I joined Strava 9 days ago and was unable to sync activity from Lose It and Google Fit the entire time. It wasn‚Äôt until the third email from the help desk that I was informed that you can only sync from Strava to these other apps, rather than the other way around. No thanks.

At least deleting my account was relatively easy.
title: Two Issues

review: I downloaded Strava after my first 5k, 6 years ago. Now I‚Äôm four months out from my first attempt at a 100-miler, and I don‚Äôt believe I would have developed a love of running the way I did nearly as easily without Strava there to automatically record, keep track of, and aggregate my running.
title: 5k -> 100 miles, thanks Strava

review: This app is great most of the time, but every so often it says that you ran across the water, or traveled from one point to another in a straight line, through back yards and kitchens, over roofs and through garages, Ferris Buehler style. It‚Äôs kind of funny when it does this, but then it messes up your times too, and there‚Äôs no way to fix it.
title: When it malfunctions, it really malfunctions

review: Love that my miles are logged and tracked by activity. Love the fact that my sister and best friend get a notice when I start my activity. They track me, when I‚Äôm solo, it gives me peace of mind. I keep in check on my training - with my health condition, it‚Äôs ideal. My friends know I love Strava and got me the T-Shirt ‚ÄòIf it‚Äôs not on Strava, it never happened‚Äô. ‚ò∫Ô∏èüëüüö¥‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: If it‚Äôs not on Strava‚Ä¶.

review: Like this app a lot. Disappointed that payment is really required now. Biggest disappointment is that when cycling there is no provision for seeing average speed while riding, can only see an estimated current speed which doesn‚Äôt appear to be too accurate.
title: No LIVE Average Speed  in $$$$ Version

review: Great app with good features but seem to be focusing on constantly moving things around and pushing the social aspect more.  I am considering dropping and just going to the Garmin or Wahoo apps exclusively mainly for the dark mode setting.  Strava had this dark mode which is easier to read in direct sun light, but removed dark mode and implementing mediocre features instead.   The competition to Strava is getting better and less expensive.
title: Great App but Becoming a Mess

review: I enjoyed using the Strava App but I will no longer use it and my family and friends are also canceling their subscriptions since you have to post your political views. Why can‚Äôt you just be a business that provides a service? Because you feel you have some kind of power! I also condemn the Capitol violence that occurred , however most of the people were protesting why they think they have been done wrong, just as the BLM movement and I didn‚Äôt see you write anything about the violence they did all over the major cities in our country. So Good bye!!!
title: Keep Your Political Views To Yourself

review: I finally became a paid subscriber when some of the Strava data features I enjoyed became paid only. Ok. Didn‚Äôt like it but paid anyway. Now, I can‚Äôt update the app because Strava requires iOS 13.0 now. However, I can‚Äôt update to iOS 13.0 because I have a fully functioning, reliable iPhone 6+. I just hope that the current functionality of the app will at least continue to work. I‚Äôll just have to say bye-bye to cool things like the year in review.
title: Left out in the cold

review: What is going on I‚Äôm a paid subscriber and can no longer see my weeks numbers on the home page. Where is my weeks elevation and weeks millage? How can I scroll back to see the previous weeks as well?  Please leave well enough alone and out it back to the way it was
title: New updates üëéüèæ

review: I LOVE Strava!  I don‚Äôt care if anyone else does or does not look at my rides.  Strava has made me a much, MUCH better rider than I would have been.  I challenge myself everyday and Strava has made that very easy.  I track all my stats and set personal goals all the time.  Having that data so easily accessible has really helped my development as a cyclist.
title: My own improvement

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for almost 5 years but the changes they‚Äôve been making lately are very disappointing. I‚Äôve been a paid subscriber for a while and felt that I am getting my money‚Äôs worth, but now they have taken away the ability to view your weekly mileage with the graph, even for paid subscribers. What is the reason for this? Strava was just fine before, and I understand they need to make money. But really? Why take away such a core feature and offer no replacement?
title: Really disappointed

review: Having been using this application for about two or so years and have never had an issue with it. Loved how I could use numerous features, including comparisons between runs and more. I would have given five stars; however, as of recent update many of these features are now a part of the subscription which is a little saddening considering that they were free at one point.
title: Great app!

review: I can‚Äôt open the Strava without it transferring data from every run it loads to my Apple workout app. I want the data from my runs from August to remain, but I don‚Äôt want new data added. There is no option to control this. I can‚Äôt even disconnect Strava from the workout app without deleting Strava and all its data from my phone. Fix this.
title: Broken

review: Strava has been an awesome app to see all my running friends and theta they are doing recently the upload time has taken as much as half a day. Also, a recent software ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù think are linked. Says problems with peak upload times. Never have I had an issue with uploading runs. Come on strava. Get it straight.
title: Well that was short lived.

review: Most all the folks I ride with use Strava. It‚Äôs nice to be able to see how you‚Äôre doing compared to other riders, especially those you follow. But a recent update has taken that last feature out, it appears. If I look at a segment I just completed, I used to be able to instantly compare my time to those I follow. No longer. Maybe it got moved.
title: Great App

review: Strava is easy to use, it makes it fun to look back on what I have accomplished. It helps me to see how my current fitness compares to previous years. I paid for the upgrade and didn‚Äôt use it much, but consider it a worthy donation. I put my phone on airplane mode when I‚Äôm riding, to preserve battery. The GPS does a great job of tracking my ride.
title: Strava is easy to use and fun.

review: I resisted using Strava for a long time and finally gave it a go. Some of the metrics are questionable nor am I using the social aspect of it. Tracking and segments shine for me. The segments have changed the way I ride for the better and give me motivation to push harder. I mainly go at it solo so having goals mid ride are a huge plus. I upgraded to premium after 2 weeks. I‚Äôm happy!
title: Fell in love with it.

review: The app works great. It‚Äôd be cool if some of the website features were transferred to the app like the ability to view laps and GAP pace. Also, as many people have said, it‚Äôd be great to be able to use the calendar to plan future workouts. Other than that, I like the app but love the website... only wish they merged a little better.
title: Great App! Could be a little better

review: Haven‚Äôt really got to use the app yet (due to sickness), but days after I had the app downloaded, I was followed by someone promoting some adult junk. This is a silly thing, but I was wondering if there can be a ‚Äúreport‚Äù button? This person promoting sex hasn‚Äôt run at all, but is just promoting. I‚Äôm curious as to how the heck they even added me. Didn‚Äôt expect to deal with this on the app :/
title: Spam

review:
Pretty run of the mill. The added features of the subscription aren‚Äôt really worth it unless you‚Äôre serious about all your stats. Achievement system seems to be a little busted and could use some work.
Overall functions well to track exercises
title: Paid subcription isn‚Äôt worth it

review: Strava is the premiere exercise ‚Äúsocial media‚Äù and it really lives up to the hype. I always look forward to putting my runs on Strava and seeing what my friends did. Our club leaderboard is a great source of friendly competition that pushes us to run more. Segments are always fun and add a new fun dynamic to running. Just a great app all around.
title: Great App for Runners and Bikers

review: I was looking for an app to track my cycling and found this one. I read all the reviews about how it‚Äôs buggy and stuff but I still decided to give it a try. The app worked perfectly for me. Got a few of my friends on the app so we could share our rides with each other.
title: Great tracker

review:
I tested it today with a ride with my mtb. 
I set my bike in ‚Äòmy gear‚Äô (brand, weight etc. ) But when I come back to my gear settings, the bike isn‚Äôt here - I had saved and set it as my default gear. 
Another bug is on the date of a given activity: I did my ride this afternoon but it is displayed as ‚Äòyesterday‚Äô! 
Well minor bugs probably but still‚Ä¶ and the app is 60$ a year ?
title: Nice but two bugs

review:
I love this app. There is just one feature that I would love to see expanded upon and that is the personalize heat map. I love the personal heatmap. It gives me a great idea of where I‚Äôve explored and I use it often to plan new routes. However, it doesn‚Äôt feel super supported at the moment. 

What I want to see: 
-app support for personal heatmaps. Currently I have to use my computer.
-ability to see your personalized heat map instead of the global one on the ride map
-ability to have a private account with personal heatmap only visible to you (I believe personal heatmaps only tracks public rides)
title: Great service. Got me biking more!

review: In fact, I received a notification that it was ‚Äúcanceled.‚Äù I made the commitment to no longer use NRC because it was glitchy, now Strava is giving me the same struggle. If this happens a third time I am going to be extremely disappointed and will look for another app to use.
title: 2nd time my run wasn‚Äôt logged in

review: This app absolutely rocked. And then in one of the releases in Sep 19, BAM!!! Not working on Apple Watch I‚Äôm extremely disappointed. After struggling through multiple attempts at un/RE-installing I‚Äôm having to move back to Nike and Apple. It was nice having everything in one nice package while it lasted. Really hoping you guys can fix this and be easy to use once again.
title: What did you do?

review: The route feature was a great addition, however the experience is not the best on mobile. You can refresh the routes if you don‚Äôt like what you see - you‚Äôre only given three options - and many of them are routes that are very busy roads and unfriendly to runners. Would be great to be able to zoom in on the map before having to save it as well.
title: Routes need a lot of work

review: You have to use the watch app to record your head rate and upload it to the app. If you use the iPhone app with more features, it does not stream heart rate from the watch. Other apps support streaming your heart rate from Apple Watch while running the app on your phone. The watch app has limited functionality, less accurate gps. This feature have been requested over 2 yrs ago. Not worth to me to get a separate heart monitor while paying for this app and owning an Apple Watch. Dumb.
title: Does not record heart rate from Apple Watch.

review: I‚Äôve used Strava since 2012 and loved it up until this week. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with wanting to make money, but this approach is pitiful. Offering features for 7+ years, then charging for them? It‚Äôs not some week trial version of the app. It‚Äôs the real deal. Most freemium apps offer more features for paying customers, but they don‚Äôt cut others out for the free group. It started when they cut Bluetooth support so you had to buy a partner product. The absolute biggest sham is taking away individual comparisons. Now it‚Äôs just a glorified bike computer. Figure it out.
title: Pitiful attempt to expand

review:
The free app has been phenomenal for years, and the subscription had a lot perks.  With the most recent changes, Strava stripped free users of features that had been free for over half a decade and made them ‚Äúsubscription benefits‚Äù without warning in the middle of a global pandemic.

They claim they are yet to be profitable, but there‚Äôs no way they‚Äôve been around for so long without turning a profit.

The free version now is a shell of its former glory and not worth a download.  And if you like the feee version now, just wait. I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll strip the features you love and make them available to subscribers only.
title: Baited and switched

review: I used Strava a year ago and it was pretty friendly in terms of literal ‚Äúon the run‚Äù use. Now I swipe my screen off and accidentally turn off the run button. It‚Äôs unclear what the new black bar at the bottom with the time means (is this supposed to be my current lap time without a break?) and suddenly I have a whole new spectrum of data I didn‚Äôt need. Guys, and or Gal Developers: please don‚Äôt try to make me think while I‚Äôm trying to run. I‚Äôd like to avoid death by pothole.
title: Difficult UI

review:
I rarely leave reviews but this app has changed my life. I started cycling 3 years ago and Strava has been one of the main motivators to keep me training. It is fun to push yourself and see the progress in such a clean and clear format. The social aspect is great and SO POSITIVE. It is truly a community platform and Strava continues to get better and better. 

Kudos to you Strava!
title: Strava has changed my life!

review:
Good
1. Generally works OK.
2. Solid community of users

Lacking
1. The UI makes it too easy to end an workout with your sleeve rubbing against the Watch. After this happened during my very first run, I learned to turn on Water lock. But that makes pausing or stopping h a workout a multistep process.

2. The app does not implement the ‚Äúpress both buttons to pause/unpause‚Äù feature of the default exercise app. At the end of a sweaty workout, it can be impossible to end a Strava workout until I can get to a towel and dry my hands and the screen.

3. Data shown on Watch should be configurable.

4. Doesn‚Äôt estimate calories burned on indoor bike workout, even with heart rate data. 

5. Calories burned on other workouts (runs and outdoor cycling) are dramatically inflated.
title: Social aspects are good, Watch implementation is lacking

review: Had been using Strava for a few years now. Awesome time up until a week ago where now I can‚Äôt seem to choose which bike I rode when I try to save my ride. The option is just completely gone. Only way to choose my bike after is to edit the ride and I will watch the selector pop back into the screen like it was playing hide and seek. Obviously a bug. Running on an iPhone 8+.
title: Fix please

review: Shows your PR and all the other details, except for the actual time for the current effort.   Also, new segment page doesn‚Äôt allow user to ‚ÄúStar‚Äù a segment.  Aside from that, GPS track has been very accurate and overall performance high.   Four Out of Five Stars on this update
title: New segment page doesn‚Äôt show the current time

review:
Just started seriously using the app about a month ago and the main feature I would love to see is the ability to take a photo straight from the app once you are uploading your workout. 

It‚Äôs a bit of an archaic, total first world problem to go through editing your progress, open the camera, snap the shot, go back to the app, and upload it.
title: Take photo straight from app!

review: As the title says I do not understand the love for this crap, sorry ‚Äúapp‚Äù. Over the years I have used MapMyFitness and Wahoo Fitness and they both blow this out of the water. That said they both have their issues, specifically Wahoo won‚Äôt let me use an Apple Watch has a heart rate monitor. This is a real shame because Wahoo is the only app I have used that calculates calories by factoring your heart rate. Speaking of calories Strava doesn‚Äôt even display calorie burn! I can only assume that the people who truly loves Strava are people who haven‚Äôt used anything else, or are merely in it for the social aspect.
title: I do not understand the love for this

review:
Just got motivated to do a review because you guys finally put out a release note on a minor release. Uninformative notes on minor releases is a pet peeve of mine, and I‚Äôm hoping this is a trend. 

All and all a great app and site, still the center of my running tracking. 

Need to support power meters for running (like Stryd) to stay up with the times though.
title: Thanks for the release notes!

review: My favorite features of Strava is being able to follow people in your local community to get new ideas for bicycle rides. I‚Äôve met some cool riding partners thanks to this platform. I also love both the personal and global heatmaps. Especially the past year or two, the app keeps getting better and better!
title: Great!

review: I have an Apple Watch that I run the workouts on. When I start the workout on both devices it works just fine. When I‚Äôm done though, strava will automatically override the Apple workout, and is Inaccurate in the amount of calories I burn, heart rate, etc. when I go to delete the workout from strava the results go back to normal, syncing from the Apple workout. When I launch the app again though (the strava app) in reinstalls the workouts, rendering my stats inaccurate... again. It‚Äôs overall just a very frustrating app, and will be going to something else.
title: Overrides Apple Watch workouts

review: Nice features if you only use for running or biking, but terrible for other sports. I have been using it for long distance longboard skateboarding, and while they‚Äôve recently added skateboarding as an activity, it doesn‚Äôt get nearly the same features as running or cycling. Want audio cues? Not supported. Distance traveled on Apple Watch app? Not supported. Equipment log? Not supported. Super disappointing and will not be paying for a subscription because of the lack of features for other sports.
title: Ok for Running or Biking, but terrible for other sports

review:
I‚Äôve been a paying Strava subscriber since 2012. I‚Äôve largely loved and recommended the app over the past decade; I‚Äôve logged hundreds, if not >1,000, activities.

Since around Jan the app and service have gone downhill and are now totally useless. It started with losing activities on my Apple Watch Ultra and now, no matter how many times I log out, uninstall the app, soft rest my iPhone 14 Pro Max, etc it just never works!
