I filed tickets and **Strava tech support admitted there‚Äôs a bug** but then went silent for over a month now. I‚Äôm afraid they just care about the new big price increases and no longer focus on basic app functionality and usability! 

***If you too are no longer able to use Strava on Apple Watch, please report it with a 1 star rating! They just might listen if the app rating plummets.***
title: Now totally fails on Apple Watch after 11yrs as a paying member

review: Love the app but poor to no customer service.  Sent a request to change the display to show run, bike and weight training but fell on deaf ears with the company.  No response that was satisfactory considering a very simple request and I pay for summit services.  When another program becomes available I will leave strava.
title: Love app but customer service near to none

review: Great app, I love using Strava. Even the free version offers quite a lot of features. One thing I‚Äôd like to request is please add an option in the settings to change the display font size. This would be a very useful accessibility feature for those with sight issues. On my iPhone 13 mini, the display font is just a tad small. Thank you!
title: Great app, please add accessibility features

review:
I am using Strava more regularly to track my bike rides and it works well for that. 

As I explore areas on my bike, with Strava, turn-by-turn directions for my routes on my watch would be really useful. I would rather not be looking at my phone while I ride to figure out my next turn. 

Also it would be helpful to catalog a route I have ridden, and be able to pull it up to ride again. It would be even cooler to pull up a route and modify it in the mapping function so I can set up new titled routes.   I have poked around the iPhone app and haven‚Äôt been able to figure this out. 

Finally pasting together segments from others ahead of a ride to create a new route would be great as well.
title: Needs Better Integration with Apple Watch

review: The latest version of Strava for the Apple Watch adds ebike. So just like the iPhone version if you select E bike before the ride starts, auto pause does not work! And just like the iPhone version, if I select ebike after the ride and just leave it on ‚Äúride‚ÄùDuring the ride, auto pause works fine. Come on guys fix this!
title: OK so the latest version add the bike to the watch but‚Ä¶.

review: Used to love this app but now its telling me theres no internet connection all of the time even when i have unlimited data and hotspot for my computer too. Beyond dissatisfied because I could not track the pace of my run or even save my data. This needs to be fixed cause this is unfair to the customer or others out there that have the same process. I tried uninstalling it and reinstalling, updating and reconfiguring my wifi but nothing works. This needs to be fixed common yall get it together!!!
title: Useles App

review: I‚Äôve used it for years and used to love it. With every update from Strava and from Apple, the watch integration gets worse. Recently updated my phone from X to XS and now I can‚Äôt even get Strava to work on my watch. Keeps telling me to activate with settings on my phone. Never works regardless of how many times I do that. Gonna take the opportunity to cancel my subscription and find another app. Not a huge fan of the Nike one but at least I know it works on my Apple Watch. In research mode on other apps.
title: Terrible with Apple Watch now

review: Huge thank you to the Strava folks. By far the best cycling app around. Can‚Äôt even begin to list all of the advantages it provides to every type of cyclist. Keeping track of your rides, routes, performance, physiologic data, and being able to follow your cycling friends are just a few.
title: The best of the best

review:
Strava doesn‚Äôt allow anyone to edit activities. They say this is because people would cheat on challenges and segments. 
That is a ridiculous policy for many reasons:
1. Some people forget to stop their watch/app at the end of their workout, so it logs their car ride home as part of the workout. 
2. GPS is often wildly inaccurate on small courses, like a track, where counting laps is much more accurate. 
3. Treadmill and spin workouts already don‚Äôt count towards challenges (or segments). This means the app/website already has the ability to exclude data from challenges. So make edited workouts work the same way. 

Strava‚Äôs one job is to be an accurate activity log. If it can‚Äôt do that, it‚Äôs worthless. 

Still, deserves one star (not zero) because the UI is nice, and the segments are a nice way to race the neighbors or find neat spots when traveling.
title: Inaccurate, and Strava doesn‚Äôt let user edit

review: Sometimes I‚Äôll finish a run and my watch will show the correct data. After uploading to the app either the time changes or distance changes and it messes everything up. One change had my first mile at 4:05 and it should have been more like 7:30. My watch told me the right time during the run. Allow the user to manually go in and change the time and distance if the gps or software can‚Äôt get it right.
title: User control

review: Just ran my first run with strava, loved it while I was running. It called out my times while I was running, and I ended up running 6 miles in around 48 minutes. However when I closed the app and opened a few minutes later, it said that I ran 6 miles in 43 minutes and it showed my splits and average mile time being much different than they were before. Why‚Äôd this happen?
title: Confused

review: My daughter races mountain bikes. She‚Äôs been trying so hard to place in top tens on different segments. I recently was checking her times and realized she was actually getting some top ten times but they weren‚Äôt showing up. After doing research I see now that they will only post those times if you pay. Well Strava, my teenage daughter who loves the outdoors and biking can‚Äôt afford your subscription. So now she doesn‚Äôt get the accomplishments she‚Äôs been working towards.
title: New updates are awful

review:
An app that goes above and beyond to show you everything about your workout/fitness. All you have to is show up and do the work. 

If your in it for the numbers that is there too! Keeps you going and motivated. Paying for the premium version is worth it.
title: A true athletic community

review: ~a month ago, every notification started showing up as a red ‚Äú2‚Äù on the Strava app icon on my phone (where it indicates you have unread notifications within the app) instead of ‚Äú1‚Äù. Today I am now seeing ‚Äú3‚Äù on the corner of the Strava app even if I only had 1 notification for a ‚Äúkudos‚Äù on an activity. It‚Äôs driving me nuts. Strava developers PLEASE fix this before I feel like I need to delete the app.
title: Please Fix Notification Count

review: I pay the annual membership and have an iPhone 13 yet the GPS will drop sometimes when I take a photo, text, or call. This doesn‚Äôt happen every time but it has happened too often, even when I have a strong signal. It‚Äôs at a point where even if I want to take a photo while on a nice ride or hike, I won‚Äôt for fear of losing the rest of my activity if it‚Äôs one I care about the stats.
title: Erratic tracking

review: I have used map my run in the past but the functionality of that app has decreased significantly over the years.  I love this app and it‚Äôs ability to map my progress on different runs and also the competitive nature to measure my progress and see how I stack up against others.
title: I love this app

review: Love the concept of essentially a social media platform for working out. Beyond that though, this app doesn‚Äôt offer anything that will help you become a better athlete. Blocking users data under by requiring a subscription to see things like splits is ridiculous. The app does not add monetary value or show metrics you couldn‚Äôt just see for free on Garmin. Again, love the concept of the app, but it‚Äôs not something that should be run as a for profit service to its users.
title: Overpriced subscription

review: Be it biking, running, weights training, other strength workouts, peloton workouts etc are all recorded in the same place. Love to see the hours worked out in a week. Love to see being a local legend. The relative efforts feature allows to see how we have been doing.
title: Love the way the app tracks all the workouts

review: The tools offered help me with training, however the new subscription price is too much. My watch‚Äôs app offers the same features for free.  In my opinion, strava is a social media app with a fitness component.  Features continue to be taken away and put on the subscription side. This is not providing access to users and it‚Äôs impacting my drive to keep using it. There are other tools out there and the subscription disheartens some users.
title: Good training tool, costs too much

review: For the most part this app is good but it crashes way too often in the middle of a ride. Even with an updated IOS and no other apps running in the background still crashes. It does not happen all of the time but it has been the number 1 reason why I have not paid to subscribe.
title: I have been using it more but it is still way too buggy and crashes

review:
I wanted to check out what made a lot of my running friends want to use Strava so I downloaded it and made an account. 

I went for my FIRST (and only) run with Strava. I went to save the run and the app crashed. I tried to open it back up and it crashed continually. I even reset my phone and the app still crashed. I signed in online and my run wasn‚Äôt there. It was a waste of my time. Luckily, I always run with my Garmin. That was my first and only time using the app. If I can‚Äôt save my first run, why would I even continue on with the app?
title: Bugs!!!

review:
As prices go up, paying for a premium account as Strava decide to remove basic features that users rely on. 
Not allowing HealthKit data (calories etc) from third party applications to be written from Strava to HealthKit (zwift ride info to HealthKit), meanwhile hoarding all the data we provide to them while paying for the service. 
Time to unlink all third party app Data being shared with Strava, might also choose not to renew membership.
title: Cost More - Less Features - Not Worth It anymore!

review: Maybe I am just missing it, but I can‚Äôt find anywhere on your website that allows me to email you. Beacon has not worked in months, and I have read comments by others who have the same issue.  I am paying for premium, and Beacon is part of that. It no longer works.
title: Beacon/ ability to contact Strava

review: When Strava was building their user base the customer service was outstanding. Now that they have grown, they give you automated responses and make it difficult to reach a human. When you finally do, they simply regurgitate the exact same info that the automated system sent. Premium users do not enjoy any additional customer service benefits. The extra data generated for premium users costs pennies on the dollar compared to the overall infrastructure so instead of getting additional value, they are simply subsidizing free users. Shame on Strava.
title: Garbage Customer Service

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a couple years now and most recently on a multi-leg hike along the Tahoe Rim Trail. Midway through the 170 mile trek the app decided to completely stop working and I also lost all the data leading up to day 4 of our 8 day hike. I was absolutely furious and will never use this app again. If you use this app, make sure not to use it for anything critical like documenting a monumentous trip or any trip where you value the information and data as something important as it is not able or reliable enough to count on for something valuable.
title: Horrible App

review: I have loved Strava but today had to download an update that says it fixed bugs and now can‚Äôt even see my own data from prior rides (or leaderboards).  No warning this would happen.  The cost of the app is high.  I can understand charging to see others‚Äô times but keeping a user from seeing their own past data?  Going to start looking for alternatives.  Strava, please consider a more reasonable cost for your app and restoring personal data to the free app.
title: New ‚Äúupdates‚Äù take away most features from free app

review: I live in Venice Beach CA where there is no issue with cellular reception. I use Strava for running. Three out of five times I use the app it will lose connection during my run, not record anywhere from a quarter mile to a mile, but still count the time it was recording. This is a horrible morale ding when you‚Äôre trying to push yourself hard and you can‚Äôt accurately know how fast or far you‚Äôre running, especially when you are in the middle of the run. No issues like this with Map My Run.
title: Horrible connectivity

review: This was a phenomenal app. I only used the free teir (was thinking about upgrading) and then they stripped free down to the bone. The segments are now useless because you cant see how fast you went compared to others. I understand they need to make revenue, but taking away the basic features that make strava strava was not the way to do it. I would be happy again if they gave back the daily and allowed us to see our position on the leaderboard.
title: 5 star app, until they nuked free

review: I really liked using Strava and think the app has really great content and a lot to offer active people. However their recent change to make a huge push for people to subscribe is seriously disappointing. Taking away so many great features that now you need to pay for. You can‚Äôt even look at your past results now without paying. In my opinion that‚Äôs not a focus on activity and encouraging people to ‚Äústrive‚Äù but a focus on making money. You‚Äôre striving for the wrong things, Strava.
title: Going downhill

review:
This app has bugs and it doesn‚Äôt always track your movements accurately. It makes a long line in places where it looses gps connection. Tired of the issues I got the SportsTracker app and I like it a bunch more than Strava. 

Tried to unsubscribe from the monthly payments but the ‚Äúcancel subscription‚Äù button is not available on IOS. I have screenshots of this and so far I sent an email about the issue to Strava and have not heard back. 

I will not recommend this app to anyone but the SportsTracker app is very good.
title: IOS issue unsubscribing

review: I love using this app I run everyday and all my friends have this. I like how it tracks weekly miles and it‚Äôs cool to see other peoples races and workouts on here. I wish it just had more decimals for the timing. How hard could it be to add a hundredths place for time and mileage I‚Äôm constantly getting like 3.99 miles and it counts it as 3.9 erasing almost .1 miles off my total
title: Add this

review: Using Strava for continuous runs on the Apple Watch is incredible (although for track workouts I‚Äôd rather use my Timex). GPS locks instantly, all the right metrics are displayed, and Auto-Pause works better than in the default Fitness app. If only the distance was displayed to 2 digits past the decimal point (3.1 vs 3.12) I would be completely satisfied. Otherwise, hands-down the best available running app on Apple Watch.
title: So Close...

review: There are not that many life changing apps. Strava surely got me to run regularly and i just finished 3 half marathons in 3 weeks  and strava is the reason behind it. Strava has all these fun challenges that keeps me motivated and i can see my friends worksouts and gain inspiration from them also. Highly recommended app!
title: Positive Life changing app

review: Works fine for running or hiking but if you‚Äôre just in the gym using a treadmill or elliptical, this app is not for you. When I choose the elliptical setting and press start, the timer often only records 3-5 minutes of actual time even if I‚Äôve been going for 30-45 minutes. Sometimes app updates fix this but often times, the issue persists.
title: Not great for all workout options

review: I‚Äôve been a strava OG user and I love to see my metrics. However, I‚Äôve had so many issues the last few months with my runs not syncing than I‚Äôve ever had in the last few years. I‚Äôm not sure why. I‚Äôm still the most loyal to this app, but I‚Äôd love to strava to get it together and fix the bugs. Don‚Äôt even get my started on the subscription
title: So glitchy lately!

review: Last update giving us practically spammy post notifications to groups I‚Äôm not a member of, so they are irrelevant and annoying, with no way to turn them off. I used to be a member, but did not renew because the price increase was crazy. You‚Äôre getting all my data, that‚Äôs worth a lot more to you. You should not be increasing my price. Stop messing up what used to be a good thing.
title: You are making it worse

review: The app is great. The only issue I have is making routes. I wish the routes would tell you what percent of dirt your route was in your created routes. I also wish the route making part of the app was a little more user friendly. If you could combine your app and ride with gps it would be perfect!
title: Great app with a little Improvement needed

review: I have been using Strava for years now. Really enjoy the app and the various features that it brings. One of my favorites are split times and keeping track of how this evolves over time. I also enjoy the ability to compare my runs with others. You can also get s good annual summary of your workouts, how many miles run, bikes etc.
title: Strava - Great App

review: So Strava said they feel that $5/month is fair...well what if you live in New England and physically can‚Äôt ride outside for 2-3 months a year...they should at least offer the pay monthly feature if they stand by the ‚Äú$5 a month is worth it‚Äù according to them...they should have done something for ppl that have been users since the beginning...this immediate price charge is a slap in the face and I‚Äôll be looking for other platforms now to build a simple route. Two thumbs down Strava.
title: Extremely disappointed

review: Look I love Strava, but with the new update it‚Äôs fallen into the dirt. You can no longer see your daily mileage, your weekly mileage, and unless you have premium you cannot see your month to month graph. Now I tried premium (summit) and I discovered nothing new besides a graph and I have no idea a couple other tacky features not worth paying the monthly subscription price. I cancelled but now I discover there is a new update and I can‚Äôt even see my daily/weekly mileage???!! That‚Äôs low.
title: New update is not gonna do it

review: I am new to strava and have had it for around a month. Today I went for a 5 mile run and hit finish on the app. It then went back to the main screen without updating and saving my run. I assumed it just didn‚Äôt save and would check again later. So I did later and it said ‚Äústrava is taking too long please try again later‚Äù so naturally, I closed out of the app and reopened it. Nothing. No trace of the run I had just saved. I will continue to use the app but don‚Äôt recommend and if there was an app I could use instead I would gladly stop using strava.
title: Didn‚Äôt save run

review: I am a happy Strava user for the last 8 years on and off. The recent change forcing free users to pay for the premium service to now view and compare segments is a joke. Instead of adding real value and providing a better service that makes users want to pay for premium you are ripping the rug out from your community of free users and forcing them to pay for the service. On top of this your doing it in the middle of one greatest economic crisis, forcing people to pay for your service. Poor job Strava hugely disappointing.
title: Ripped the rug out from their free users.

review: Really enjoy Strava but no alpine ski activity on the apple watch. They offer integration with slopes but it is terrible, you dont get a good transfer of data into strava and have to open slopes to see most stats from your day. Far better to record from strava on phone but wish I could use watch like other activities. Get rid of slopes and support the apple watch yourselves and easy 5 stars.
title: Add alpine ski to the apple watchactivities

review: Just a week ago the program worked great and had been awesome.  Now they removed the ability to use Bluetooth devices with the app like the wahoo HRM that they recommended.  Now you have to upload with a third party app and record with Strava and use another website to combine the files so you don‚Äôt have duplicates. This is a huge step backwards and a major issue that they need to resolve.  It would be nice if we could choose to risk the app crashing so we could have the connectivity that we once had.
title: Was great.  Until they removed the Bluetooth connectivity.

review: It was so nice to be able to just grab my phone and gear and go for a bike ride and Strava would record everything. I became a premium member I liked it so much until they took away the heart rate and cadence integration. Now I have to go by a different computer to record those and ‚Äòstore‚Äô in Strava. And all my buddies used it. The new reduced features has caused everyone to change platforms and so goes Strava. Cash in your stock options because even Rome fell.
title: It use to be great

review: I do really like Strava for the clean layout and ability to track a lot of activities, but I‚Äôve had several instances of starting tracking on Strava, doing a workout, coming back to my phone, and the app has just not recorded my workout (or only part of it). If that happened rarely instead of being a semi-regular occasion, 5 stars.
title: Overall good, but expect some workouts to be dropped

review: App is great for stats regardless of what I‚Äôm doing and ever since Apple Watch integration came out I‚Äôve been more than happy with it. I hope in the future a feature will be added to set a pace while running so that if I deviate too much my phone or watch will notify me and I can adjust, just a thought!
title: Great app, have been recommending since 2012

review: Lately just trying to view the feeds or even attempting to edit my own information has become impossible. Running the latest version of Apple OS 12 as of Jan 14 and I‚Äôve tried multiple times to look at an activity causing multiple crashes. It would be nice to see the app back to the stable system it used to be.
title: It‚Äôs such a motivational tool but lately the app crashing...

review: I‚Äôve enjoyed using Strava for running and biking, and like the running clubs. However, I must have updated because there is a now a new male voice that is horrible! I can barely hear it and definitely can‚Äôt make out what he‚Äôs saying with music on low volume. What‚Äôs the point of announcing your splits if it‚Äôs muffled and way too low? How do I get the old voice back?! Five stars for a free app if this is fixed, otherwise I‚Äôll go back to Nike.
title: I want the old voice back!

review:
It's been more than once I've found the app to have not tracked my run and the statistics are just not reliable! I use my iPhone to track my runs and do not use any run tracking devices. But I've tried all the ways suggested by Strava Support to troubleshoot my phone's GPS and the app just doesn't pick up my position. (I haven't noticed such consistent location errors so far on GMaps)
The frustration at the end of your run, hoping that you'll track your statistics and progress and then you see - 0.5mi run in 38mins! Not a reliable app!!
title: Strava has let me down on many runs

review: Strava definitely motivates me to keep up with my training, and that‚Äôs key.    I find it logging miles is strangely satisfying and pushes you to do more.   I find some of the emphasis on getting "kudos" from people on the other side of the world is a little weird, but it's all part of the game.  A big help for training
title: Great ap for athletes

review: Just started using Strava. Neat features but why on earth doesn‚Äôt it automatically pull data from HealthKit. I do a workout with my Apple Watch (a type not supported by Strava so it‚Äôs not like I can use that app) and open Strava. It says, ‚Äúyour workout is ready to be imported!‚Äù Cool‚Ä¶ why on earth is there a user interaction required? Massively diminishes the value proposition of Strava. Signed up for a free trial but won‚Äôt be buying a subscription entirely because of this very strange oversight.
title: Doesn‚Äôt auto pull from HealthKit?!?

review: I‚Äôve used Strava for a couple of years, but a week or so ago, the wonkiness started. At times, recording of an activity would seem to start normally, but at the end, only a small portion of the route had registered. Today, there was no ‚ÄúSTARTING RUN‚Äù announcement, nor were there the usual half-mile announcements of distance and pace. After three miles, only .43 miles had recorded. Deleting then reinstalling the app and restarting my iPhone 7 several times didn‚Äôt help. Please bring my old companion STRAVA back! Thanks.
title: Have loved the app, but‚Ä¶

review: I'm not competitive athlete I just practice physical activity for join and be healthy and Strava gives me the opportunity to analyze my progress, shows me new tracks and contact me with would wide active people. Very nice app as performance, tour ir social media, once you can follow and be followed, comment and post photos. I recommend. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Excellent

review: I‚Äôm very disappointed with the new one price forcing me to buy everything when I only want the Safety Contact feature. So for me the price went from $24 to $60 per year with no real added benefit because I don‚Äôt use the other features. I don‚Äôt know how many other users are like me but I think there are many. Alan Dow
title: New Pricing

review: If you want to have an out of touch San Francisco based fitness app push politics and their liberal agenda, this is the app for you.  Very racists app that encourage rioting and looting all summer long and refused to denounce the violence against small businesses and communities but immediate was quick to brand the half the country racist after the act of some idiots.  Also be aware they will sensor you. I was banned from the main Strava group when they were openly supporting and encouraging the summer riots I posted ‚Äúlol when a running app gets political‚Äù and was immediately banned.
title: They use their app to sensor and push their liberal agenda

review: I think it‚Äôs ridiculous that you would make us pay for such a basic stat that we already have on our watches but as coaches it makes it much more efficient to be able to look at all your runners mileage at once
title: Bring back weekly mileage

review: Would like to see edit features on web added to mobile. modify the end of workouts (for when you drive off and forget to stop the workout)to the mobile app.  I hate having to open a computer to do that common functions.
title: Great app, but

review: I have installed this less for free version update today and went on my usual route and Strava free version can‚Äôt even seem to track accurate distance anymore. For a 15mile ride it registered 10miles. I know the route and the exact distance and the same iPhone is connected to my apple watch which tracked the distance correctly. May be spend some money to have basics working reliably before wanting new ‚Äòsubscription model‚Äô loot of customers money.
title: New version seems to can‚Äôt even track distance.

review: First, for those with Apple phones (I tend to not run with my phone because it is bulky), this will work fine for you but if you use a smart watch, stay away. For Apple watches this will hijack and stop your workouts that Apple tracks and Strava will give you much less information, and much less accuracy (my 2.5 mile run that I‚Äôve done dozens of times was calculated as 2.3 by strava and a much worse pace). It‚Äôs an app with good intentions but it just doesn‚Äôt deliver well as a fitness tracker. Would not recommend.
title: Bad System

review: If you like to ride, you need this app. Between segments and the social aspect of Strava, it's a great tool to track your own performance and improvements, as well as keep tabs on how your friends (or professionals) are doing. It's a must have, particularly now that Strava is regularly updating and improving the UI.
title: Great to motivate and measure

review: Works great when recording outdoor activities which use GPS. Strava has neglected to consider those on stationary bikes / indoor trainers. It is not possible to record am activity without GPS. I have a Wahoo Kicker, and do a lot of indoor riding. I know I can upload to Strava from other apps, but this is not acceptable. I would like to use their paid services but will not until I am able to record my indoor bike activities within the mobile app.
title: Great for Outdoor Activities but Not Indoor Ones

review:
I generally really like Strava other than 2 key things. 1) It wont keep give me cumulative totals on any other activities on anything but basically Run/Bike/Swim but for example Id like cumulative distances and time spent Hiking or Walking.. I cannot get that from Strava where I can get all of that via GarminIQ ... Strava is more social but its inflexible for multi activity (-1.5) 
2) Eecently I am annoyingly being prompted to use Facebook to login every single time I login to Strava app.. NO NO NO NO... do you hear me... NO FORCED FACEBOOK integration. (-1.5 almost 2)
title: Stop Prompting me to login with Facebook

review: Apps works well. I gave 4 star coz you have to go to website to change the bike you going to use if you have more than 1. Like me changing my mtb to road biking. Hopefully next update you put this one function on apps. Make easier for us changing equipment thru apps not logging in on website to change it. Map my ride can do it why strava cant? üòÅ
title: Apps works well need to add something

review:
Strava is a great app for monitoring running - however I‚Äôm getting pretty sick of the app automatically resetting my notification settings every time a new version is released. Was set for just a few actions to cause a notification, it updated a few days ago - and sure enough - my settings in the app has EVERY single notification turned on. 
I will stop recommending to others to download for this reason.
title: Always resets notification settings.

review: I really hope you all bring back Strava widgets for the Home Screen? They disappeared after the last two updates and it‚Äôs more motivating than I thought it‚Äôd be to have my daily progress in my face at all times, and therefore want to keep running (aka using the app) to keep my bars up ‚Äî it was always a good reminder‚Ä¶.thank you!
title: Widgets

review: I love strava and have been using it for years, but since the new update it will not load at all. I have to open and close the app five times or more just so it will fully load. It won‚Äôt load my notifications and will freeze up randomly in the middle of use. I really liked this app I‚Äôm hoping it gets fixed soon so i don‚Äôt change apps.
title: its gotten so slow with updates

review: Strava was explained to me as crack cocaine for cycling (or running, or ‚Ä¶). I installed it and learned the truth of those words. But unlike most addictions, the crack cocaine of Strava makes you a better athlete‚Ä¶even for someone like me who‚Äôs never, in his life, been described as an athlete. Strava makes you better. And it makes it fun doing it.
title: Best Activity Tracking App, Period

review: Motivation of self of others (peers, friends or family members) - Strava has been a game-changer for me for years.  During a pandemic, it has been an even more valuable tool. How better to ‚Äústay connected‚Äù around exercise while distancing from one another. Not to mention, if you can‚Äôt measure it, you can‚Äôt improve it. Run/Ride/Row/Paddle/Hike on Strava!
title: Motivation...

review:
After the latest update, while exercising my distance will be displayed in miles rather than kilometers. When I view my activity though, it will show as kilometers. Seems to be only during exercise. My settings are set to km and while running the app gives vocal updates by the .5km. 

Thanks for the great app
title: New update added a bug

review: Was a good way to see how well my favorite youtubers were doing and also a great way to graphically see the effort I was putting in to staying fit during work furlough. Now that I‚Äôm back to work and won‚Äôt use this expensive app as much, it‚Äôs time for me to reduce my expenditures by unsubscribing. I‚Äôm also unsubscribing from nearly everything else and I‚Äôll use the money I saved to travel when work allows me to. Btw swimming is still not a choice as a primary form of exercise hence the low rating.
title: Was a good distraction

review: Agreed to a trial subscription, that if you don‚Äôt cancel automatically charges you 60 some dollars a year. Contacted them three different times to opt out! They will not let you! They send you complex hoop-jumping Insipid instructions that are impossible to comply with. Anything to make it as difficult if not impossible to opt out of the renewal. Don‚Äôt let these scumbags rip you off as well! Now I have to contact my credit card company and show them screenshots of the three times I‚Äôve tried to opt out, and Strava refuses to let me. Good luck!
title: Refuse to let you opt out of paid subscription!

review: This is an amazing app that all of my friends use to share bike rides, runs, etc. The only problem is that sometimes it says that I have 12 notifications when I actually only have 2 notifications. This doesn‚Äôt really affect anything and it doesn‚Äôt take away from the fact of how fun the app is.
title: Amazing app

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for 6 years and it‚Äôs been a game changer I train better and I improve when I use the app. My favorite features of the app were the leaderboards which pushed me to go faster and the route builder which pushed me to go further. Im very disappointed that Strava got greedy and decided to limit these features to only people that pay them, this makes the app basically the same as map my ride which is what I will be switching to until the leaderboards and route builder come back.
title: Disappointed

review:
Does what it does well. 
Strava Support basically doesn‚Äôt exist. In its place is a discussion forum with posts as old as 6 years and no progress or update regarding those very evident insufficiencies in data handling.
Statistical analysis of the input data is very limited. Impossible to separate mileage by activity, hence it possible to compare mileage totals from month to month, week to week, etc. Impossible to look up previous months totals in the phone app. Online data analysis is limited as well. 

Hence, it only really makes sense to use the app to track ONE sport at a time. Which, basically, defeats the purpose of having ‚Äúone app‚Äù like Strava. I‚Äôll ‚Äúhave to‚Äù keep it because of my cycling club. 

I‚Äôm seeing a lot of people leave Strava when they run and only use it for cycling due to App‚Äôs obvious limitations.
title: Very useful but unfinished

review: I downloaded this app to track my progress as I get back into consistent running:hiking etc. the set up and features seem ideal for basic needs. Unfortunately I can‚Äôt count on the app to accurately track my miles. Invariably I finish my run only to see that the app accounted for less than half of my distance. Of course, this affects pace, etc. this happens whether I have weak or strong GPS signal. Very annoying. I like the features, just wish the data were accurate.
title: Unreliable data, Very inconsistent

review: I have been a Strava user for over five years and always found it reliable and an excellent way to track my rides and runs. Three days ago I updated to version 58.0.0 and now Strava no longer tracks distance and speed correctly - only time. This happens with both rides and runs. I‚Äôve looked online and tried turning off WiFi, closing apps, turning location on/off, but no change. This is an issue Strava engineers are aware of but have no idea how to fix. Bummer. Guess it‚Äôs time to move onto something else.
title: Version 58.0.0 broke distance/speed

review:
I wish if there was a way to track the maintenance of the bike. If I could just get a notification of when my bike is due for service based on hours or miles ridden. Otherwise I have to remember manually. 
This would be very helpful for mtb where shocks are serviced based on hours ridden on bike.
title: Request to add feature service notification

review:
So I have used this app before with no problems. 

I recently started using it again and have run into some weird issues. Every time I start the app through my drop down screen it won‚Äôt log the bike ride. 

I can hear the voice throughout my ride (stop, resume) that kind of stuff and I can see it logging my miles but when I stop to save the ride it doesn‚Äôt save it kicks me out to the normal screen.... very annoying
title: Errrmeerrgeeerd

review: It would be helpful to have the athletes home base location also be listed by their name IN THE FEED, just as its an avail option on their profile page. In addition, it would be super helpful for a location of the session being viewed/reviewed by others without having to tap the map then pan out to figure out where on the planet it took place. Thx!
title: Location Suggestion

review:
Strava is my favorite app on my phone, no joke!

It‚Äôs easy to use, works flawlessly with Apple Health, and just recently I got to use the ‚Äúcrop activity‚Äù feature to fix where I accidentally forgot to end an activity. WOW, was it easy to use!

Thank you Strava peeps/PMs/engineers for making Strava just a joy to use. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Keeps me motivated and inspired!

review:
This app has literally not changed in years. How cool would it be if it notified you if you took a segment from a friend? Or if a friend took a segment from you? Or if you completed segments for the first time? Or if you set a new record for that year?

I really wish they would improve this kind of stuff instead of adding more social media features like uploading a video.
title: Improvements are a mystery

review: Longtime Strava user and happy that I made the switch in recent years to the premium version; not only bc the data, features and connections are so great but also to what little I can to support the founders who have continued to bypass the commercial and monentizing forces‚Ä¶
title: Best value of any app I use‚Ä¶not even close!

review: If you do things outside, and if you pay any attention to your level of activity, or if you want to pay attention to your activity, or if you need motivation to pay attention to your activity, then you have no reason not to get Strava.
title: No reason not to

review: Great way to track your metrics, especially as a beginner.   I got the subscription and have always appreciated the consistency.  One point of contention is when the app randomly shorts your average speed 1-2mph at random.   The more you ride, the more you notice.   Great way to track growth.
title: Worth the subscription

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for approximately 6 years...probably longer.  It‚Äôs fantastic!!  Works everywhere I travel.  I only have the Free Version, because I wanted to ‚Äútest‚Äù it out first.  I‚Äôm now thinking of stepping up my game and Subscribing.  Love that it‚Äôs on my IPhone so it‚Äôs everywhere with me, which allows me to do spur of the moment activities.  Keep up the great job!!
title: Love It!!

review:
I believe Strava is a good app if you do multiple different workouts. I am only a runner. The map function is very good. However the app overall is complicated to navigate. You can‚Äôt do all on the app, but need to go to the computer for some features. Biggest bummer: It does not show cadence, a critical measure for a coordinated training. 
So, many will get what they want from this app, I just didn‚Äôt.
title: Gave it a good try

review: You used to be able to zoom in on satellite and see your route and how many laps you did - the zoom feature has not been working for months so it‚Äôs not as useful as it used to be still a good app and worse the membership. There does not seem to be any customer service to discuss issues with - just bots.
title: Zoom

review: Please fix your description text views. If a word is auto corrected it should be followed by a space. If a user double taps the space bar to include a period then a space should follow. This is how apple natively does it. I recommend following what apple does natively instead of doing something custom. Your other users will thank you for being consistent with every other app :)
title: Editing Text within Text Views

review: Strava was awesome when I first got it years ago. To keep it short, though, with one of the more recent updates it seems like most of my ability to compare my own times with myself are gone unless I subscribe. Pretty annoyed with that. I‚Äôd like to know how I stacked up on my last hike when compared to times from the past. Can‚Äôt do that anymore? I‚Äôm probably done using the app now - no reason to waste my battery and time.
title: Kind of over it now

review:
I really like and have a lot of friends that use this app. The only problem I have is my Garmin HEart Rate is not transferring to Strava yet speed and cadence is. 
The most disappointing aspect is there is no help to call and to get help one has to go thru a tremendous amount of Twitter etc.  no direct call or email. Disappointed.
title: Review

review: I remember back in the day trying to use a spreadsheet to track my exercise. Ha, double ha, triple ha. Strava came along and took care of all that. I love going after segments, and just documenting rides. Strava helps you connect with other cyclists (or runners, or other athletes). It‚Äôs kind of what social media should be. Thanks Strava. Keep doing.
title: Strava is life...and it's a healthy one

review: As I said. The watch app simply deletes your runs when you go to sync them. No error message. It won't sync, and when you reboot the watch to try to get it to sync, the run is just gone and your data is lost. Use Runkeeper. These developers fix exactly zero bugs.
title: Do not use this. The Watch app just deleted your runs

review:
Echoing the thoughts of others, I too, am a long time Strava user and it pains me to write what would have been a 6 star review (if there ever was one.) The recent updates to the app which has long been the cornerstone of my exercise routine has put their subscription model at the forefront and has restricted features that were included as part of the Strava community for many.

I am very disappointed to see Strava putting profit over purpose and will forward to leadership considering the long time partnership they‚Äôve had with hundreds of thousands of local and global athletes all over the world. Please reconsider your pay-for-service model and put the once free features back into the hands of the masses. 

Sincerely,
A long time advocate for Strava
title: Put purpose over profit

review:
I was just beginning to get hooked Strava and as a casual rider would even pay $2-3/mo. But $60? I‚Äôll put that toward a new dropper post.

The problem is that the app is near worthless relative to other tracking apps without the subscription. I can‚Äôt even see my prior rides to compare times without a subscription. Suggestion  to Strava if they care to keep me or many here
1) keep personal segments and tracking free. Without it, you‚Äôll lose your free base
2) create a mid-tier for basic leaderboards, such as the overall leaderboard and maybe friends. I‚Äôd pay $2 maybe $3 per month
3) create the upper tier with all the fancy leaderboards, deeper analytics, etc. charge $5-10 for those who care enough

This keeps you free base with enough features and history to stay, while monetizing more. Lose the base and your future profits will drop. Best of luck
title: Only useful with paid $60 subscription

review: Take one step off the bike with the phone in your hands, or on your body, the app continues at .2 mph - put the phone down after that starts, and the app continues to run for a long time. I have been stopped completely at times, and the app kept running. This causes AVG speed to drop significantly, or show a quarter mile segment completed in 43 minutes
title: Fails to auto pause often

review: I like the Strava app and have only one complaint:  about 15% of the time, it doesn‚Äôt properly record my runs.  I will finish my run of around an hour and see that it‚Äôs only recorded 30 seconds or so of activity. The app doesn‚Äôt crash or anything and background data is enabled, so it doesn‚Äôt make much sense why it does that. If that were fixed, I would consider this a 4 or 5 star app.
title: Needs to improve recording accuracy

review: I love Strava and all of the information it gathers. The latest update from today (5/23) showing time in larger font was a poor choice in my opinion. People typically look at total mileage first and not time spent. I feel miles should be more prominent and time be in smaller font below the mileage total. Just my 2 cents.
title: Latest update 5/23

review: Happy with app but had a problem today. Recorded a 5 mile run today but was unable to save it. Hit finished on watch and saw ‚Äúmovement not detected‚Äù while I was walking the end of the run. I tried for 2 hours to ‚Äúfinish‚Äù and save the run but had to give up and close the app. I had WiFi and GPS per Nike and iPhone XS do not sure why it was not working. Is this related to the addition of Beacon?!!
title: Apple Watch issue

review: This is a great app. I‚Äôve been using it for years and I have no major issues with it. At this point, I truly can‚Äôt wrap my mind around not being able to ‚Äúunlike‚Äù an activity after accidentally liking something you didn‚Äôt mean to. This seems like app 101 to me. If you can like something, you should have the option to unlike something, too.
title: Very useful!

review: I‚Äôve been using the Strava app for several years now and love it. It‚Äôs great being able to track achievements, history and progress. It‚Äôs fun to follow other riders and to be followed and cheered on. The only reason I don‚Äôt give it five stars is that it occasionally fails to track a ride - so you lose self-credit!
title: Great app to track rides

review: I have used Nike plus runs to log over 7,000 Km of runs and finally switched to Strava.  To my utterly disappointment, every run recorded from Strava Apple Watch has been short of 2 to 4 minutes.  Support says Strava calculates run duration not from actually recorded time but from GPS.  And there is no way to fix this!  What a disappointment!  All I want is a accurate record of my runs, and Strava cannot even provide this basic function.  I will have to switch to something else.
title: Wildly Inaccurate in recorded runs

review: I use my Strava app for everything from kayaking to how far I walk  around the grocery store and most importantly my ride data. My use of Strava has allowed me to visualize my efforts and see my data in a way that helps me get better and understand my body/effort and how to improve.
title: The best all around activity tracking app out there!

review:
I try to log every ride on Strava and really appreciate the data. I ride alone a lot so I need some kind of motivation to keep improving.  

There are a couple of things that irk me.

1. The iPhone app doesn‚Äôt sort PRs in order like the website does.  The app keeps things in chronological order.  

2. Can‚Äôt reply to comments.  It would be nice to be able to reply directly to a comment to maintain some context to the conversation. 

3. It would be nice to set alert indicators for certain thresholds.  For example, if my heart rate goes over 185bpm, flash an alert.  Or if I pass a certain distance .  It‚Äôs similar to the live segments concept where an alert pops up notifying you of a favorite segment.
title: If it wasn‚Äôt on Strava ...

review:
I‚Äôm fine with freemium apps, if the app actually works.

I‚Äôm an IT guy, so if I can‚Äôt figure out how to make something work, Strava you have a big problem. Whatever ‚ÄúOffering Management‚Äù team you hired needs to stop *icking around and get back to basics.

Can‚Äôt for the life of me get Apple Watch 4 to sync heart rate data. Works fine with my Jabra Sport BT headphones for heart rate. Honestly, I switched to the Jabra app since it reports to Strava, and everything actually works. Strava problem solved by using another app, go figure.

Doubles mileage to Apple Activity. Yah annoying. Useless for reporting.

Doesn‚Äôt report calorie, Active, correctly.  No way in hell my 40 minute high intensity 10 mile mountain bike trail ride burned 200 calories. 

Voice over prompts do not work while listening to Apple Music when cycling.
title: Lot to like, lot to annoy the crap out of me

review: I paid for the training membership, and now with the latest update there is so much less data. I can‚Äôt even see an exact time for my last run, only the rounded time. The pace graph is hard to read and there are no units of measurement so I can‚Äôt even tell you what my pace was at certain times. Please fix and add back all the features and data that were there previously and I will update my review and rating. Until then I‚Äôll use another app. I may seek a refund since the features I paid for are now missing.
title: Latest update removes features

review:
I have by now logged thousands of miles biking, running, and hiking. The app is very simple to use yet gives you tons of information if you add heart rate monitoring or your cycle power meter. 
I love the ability to add photos and competition for KOM‚Äôs.
There is no other app out there that is so comprehensive and yet so simple to use.
title: Best app for recoding all your activities

review: When I complete a run using my Apple Watch series 3, it‚Äôll say no motion was detected despite having tracked distance, speed etc during the run. The workaround I‚Äôve found that works is to put my phone in airplane mode before I leave for the run (I don‚Äôt take my phone on the run). I‚Äôve concluded there is a handoff bug between the watch and the phone.
title: Good app but annoying bug with Apple Watch

review: I love that this is a social media platform that does not allow private messaging. As a betrayal trauma survivor who uses triathlon training to help her heal, I love having this as a safe social media outlet for my athletic pursuits. Private messaging on other social media platforms is hugely triggering to me, but I feel safe with my spouse and my kids on Strava.
title: Trauma Safe

review: This app without being premium is pretty good, actually it‚Äôs really amazing. Almost anything I pretty much want to know, will be known. However if you want more stats, you have to pay a $7-$8 fee which is kind of expensive at some point for an app. Then again I don‚Äôt like any other app, so I will continue using this one until something else pops up.
title: Really awesomely GREAT!!! but just pricey..

review:
I LOVE Strava! The only reason I held a star back is because there is no direct method in which to message other subscribers. If messaging is too complicated of a feature for the app, then I think allowing users to input their socials in a specific area on their profile would be great.

Aside from that complain the app is solid on all devices I use it with.
title: I LOVE Strava!

review: For some reason Strava can‚Äôt recognize more than one data stream with same time and GPS info as being one activity, so duplicate activities get published.  Also, no rewards for explorers on new pathways (only workout or race, no explore) for runners and cyclists, and road vs mountain vs gravel, just cycling.  Otherwise it‚Äôs the best social media sports app.
title: The best Is yet to come

review:
Pros: strava is ubiquitous amongst cyclists, runners, etc. plus in general a great place to follow others‚Äô training.
It syncs up to most other apps and devices. 
Good analyses of meta data to help you understand your training history and metrics.
Cons:
The UI is not flexible. This app still seems analog in so many ways with regards to being a social app and allowing features and data from other apps to be used and synced.
title: Functionality

review:
Strava has been dealing with spam issues lately. As a result, they are limiting the number of comments you can make within a 24 hour period. You will get an error message on the mobile app, telling you that the ‚ÄòRate Limit‚Äô has been exceeded. Myself and several friends have experienced this when commenting on big events. This appears to be triggered after about 10 or so comments. 
This has been extremely frustrating given that this is a social platform and I am paying $59 per year as a premium subscriber!
title: Rate Limit Exceeded

review:
Thus used to be a great app. Now it‚Äôs a buggy piece of crap. The fitness calculator is only taking into account my bike rides and disregards my 1900 meters of swimming 3 times a week and my 2 hours of weight training twice a week designating them as recovery times. Thus my fitness scores are taking a nose dive. I‚Äôve tried to contact support 2 times about this a so far ‚Äúcrickets‚Äù.
If this continues, I‚Äôm canceling my subscription and going with Training Peaks. This company got successful, made a lot a money, stopped caring, and let this program go to pot.
title: Now full of bugs. Not tracking activity correctly

review: I up graded in July to a paying customer.  Then as I began trying to use my new features, I ran into problems. 1- my old password was only five digits and the requirements were eight. Also 2-my old email address was no longer active.  When I changed my face book email to my current one, I could no longer access Strava via Facebook. Luckily I‚Äôve never logged out on my phone; at least I‚Äôm still recording my activities.  Strava has failed to help get me reconnected. I‚Äôve given them money and have nothing to show for it.
title: Poor customer service

review: Absolutely in love with this app and use it daily, but with the recent update the weekly comparisons and tracking have been moved solely to subscription. I do not train nor am planning to join any marathon, but love to bike. I see through the recent reviews that this is a concern for many casual bikers/runners. I hope this specific feature comes back (weekly trackers) as it provides immense motivation to even the most casual athletes, who perhaps do not require any further features. I am deeply discouraged and sad to have seen it go.
title: Disappointed to see features go

review: Strava iPhone app is not updating the feed properly. I can see that the feed is up-to-date on my computer, but I cannot see some activities until hours later in my Strava iPhone app. This happens for the activities of people I follow, not for my own activities.
title: Feed is not being updated properly

review: I‚Äôd give you a 5 but I can‚Äôt message people from app, I see ads and I‚Äôm a paying member. Great thing is to build community and private messages would allow us to do that. Please update these  so I can make this a 5. Otherwise it‚Äôs a dope app.  Another cool feature is if it could guide you turn by turn if your off track of your route (might be dangerous?)
title: Missing a few features

review: Pathetic move by Strava: removing many features to only be accessed by the subscription version. I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying for Strava except that it‚Äôs $60 a year! Absolutely ridiculous! I‚Äôve used Strava for many years. I guess they think athletes are rich enough to afford that. Looks like just a money grab. It is truly shameful what they have done. Many do not appreciate this at all and I hope they will reconsider this change. I have always praised Strava to my friends and have gotten people switched from MapMyRun and other apps to Strava but now I do not see any reason to do so.
title: SHAMEFUL

review:
THis is probably one of the best apps out there for analyzing the detail of your workouts. I bring over my swims from MySwimPro and use it to record my bike workouts.

Unfortunately, all of this data and the way it is presented is of little use if you can‚Äôt get the workout data to sync back to the app from your Apple Watch. That has been my problem for a few months now.

I can do an outdoor walk and it syncs fine. An outdoor ride is another story completely. I usually have to reboot my watch and my iPhone and in a few hours the workout will eventually appear.

WHile I have had frequent response from Strava support, it‚Äôs usually repeating the same things over and over....they seem to think that having to reboot frequently is acceptable, or blaming in on weak WiFi.

Time to give up.
title: Time to say goodby

review:
It doesn‚Äôt have some basic features (like the milage tracker chart) unless you lay extra for the summit packages ... the summit packages do not look helpful, so I don‚Äôt want to pay extra to get basic things that should come with the free version.
It can‚Äôt track popular sports like soccer. Specially there are fewer trackable sports on the watch

I would change my rating to 5 starts if the above issues are fixed
title: Some basic features are missing

review: I love strava, but is there anyway you could get with your buddy Zwift and allow people to use only their phone to get Zwifty. I hate how I would either have buy an expensive speedometer or an expensive roller. Please consider making something where you can track cadence and speed but still use your phone.
title: Good but...

review:
i‚Äôve never had any issues with Strava
Occasionally it will not pick up with my Garmin Fenix watch 
but i suspect that is more of a glitch on Garmin.
i think this is a great program 
However , wish it had more distinct routes/maps (i.e. All Trails app)
title: not what others are talking about with bugs

review: This is a great app which does everything you want too, especially with premium. My only 2 complaints are that #1, the app freezes my IPhone 6s sometimes which is really annoying, and #2 you can‚Äôt see your cadence on the app only on the computer. Besides those, this is a great app for everyone and is wonderful for connecting with other athletes.
title: Great for the Anyone Into Fitness

review: I have been cycling for a long time and I was using Strava as a record but then I noticed that my average speed was declining even though my bike computer said different.  I downloaded another GPS bike program and it recorded my average speed up to 3 mph higher. Since Strava has removed the ‚Äúdon‚Äôt record at speeds below‚Äù option it isn‚Äôt accurate especially if you get off your bike and walk to take pictures like I do.
title: Needs enhancements

review: Strava, use to be free.  Then they started charging for it a couple years ago. Then the price went up, then it went up more, now it has gone up again.  For what???? A bunch of useless things 99% of people don‚Äôt want or need.  I quit.  Cancel my subscription. Strava:  let me know when I can see the leaderboard part for free or for $2 bucks a month again & maybe I‚Äôll renew my subscription.  So disappointed in you Strava.  You‚Äôve gotten greedy just like everyone else.
title: Way too expensive now‚Ä¶ üëé

review: The new update is very glitchy and has made the once clean/simple interface confusing. Please reduce the edit interface to better match the activity interface and not some complicated options that don‚Äôt match the final activity.
title: New Update Ruined Strava

review: I like the competitive aspect of the segments. It has really made me a better rider. But what I don‚Äôt like is that people on E bikes are ruining it by logging their activity as a regular ride and there‚Äôs not much I can do other than flag them. They will continue to take the top spots on the leaderboards
title: Strava has made me a better rider

review: By far the best app to keep up with all training, whether you run, walk, ride, swim, etc. Highly recommended for anyone whether training or just getting back in shape you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Although I would recommend Strava add a couple more shorter options for the alerts during activities.
title: Great!

review: I tried this app and wasn‚Äôt a fan. I cancelled within the 14 day refund period which was advertised as the full refund period. Well I canceled and sent an email with no response. I‚Äôve tried multiple times to contact support with no response. It‚Äôs been months and I‚Äôve been unable to get any help getting my refund. They have no customer service number just an email form which starts a ticket but apparently goes to no where because after 4 months and multiple attempts I‚Äôve heard nothing. They will take your $60 and run so beware!!!!
title: Buyer Beware

review: The app is supposed to track your location and how long you‚Äôve been exercising. I‚Äôve been using this app for the past two days for my gym class and I‚Äôve noticed an issue. Yesterday I walked for 5 minutes with no stop and it will said I only walked for 33 seconds. Today I walked for 7 minutes with no stop and It said I only walked for 4 minutes. My teacher has already gotten angry at me for not exercising for as long as he wants us to. I don‚Äôt want a slipping grade just because this app can‚Äôt track me correctly. Thanks for the bad grade Strava! :D
title: Bad at tracking

review: I don‚Äôt understand how the app will log my run/walk and I can see it on the Feed page, but when I click on my profile it doesn‚Äôt update how many miles I have gone for the week. It only has logged one of my runs there. The Feed page also takes a while to update sometimes in logging my activity. I want to like this app but not updating things like this is very frustrating!
title: Doesn‚Äôt Update

review:
I like having the app to track my runs. My biggest issue is that the distances are always off when compared to people who use garmin watches, and on the rare occasion the data is complete garbage (jumps, missing time, or no record of the run at all). I report each run when there is an issue, yet I have not seen any improvements. 

It would be nice if Strava could build in a lap function on their app. It would make speed training a little easier!
title: Distances are never correct

review: Instead of fixing their bugs, Strava seems to prefer removing the feature wholesale. First it was Bluetooth heart rate sensor integration. Now it‚Äôs Apple health no longer getting Strava run activities. And joy for them using distance as the x axis on charts instead of time, causing sawtooth charts which would otherwise be smooth (same run in Garmin for example). Feels Strava doesn‚Äôt care about their quality or apps these days, anything to get more people to subscribe to their substandard premium features.
title: Health integration gone?

review: I feel like the app auto pauses pretty often when I‚Äôm running, which messes up my distance and pace. Then the last run I did, it said I did 3.15 miles, then I save the workout and it says I did 2.52. Nothing major but the only reason I use the running portion is for the distance and pace, nothing fancy. Would just be nice to iron those things out.
title: Needs fine tuning for runs

review: I hesitate to take the version updates...I went against my hesitation and updated. This update does not work on Apple Watch (2). This is fairly common when I do take an update, the app will not open on my watch, I‚Äôll get irritated that I‚Äôm paying for an app that I cannot use. I proceed to cancel and then comes another update which corrects it. It‚Äôs a vicious cycle. When the app works, it‚Äôs amazing. Hopeful for an update, soon!
title: 99.0.0 version update on Apple Watch üëéüèº

review: Just within the last week the app has incorrectly recorded the distance on my runs which have been over the same three or four routes I have been using for the last three months. I hope the issues is addressed soon as it is very frustrating.
title: GPS issues

review: Been using Strava for a few years now and just upgraded to Premium / Pro / Summit is whatever it‚Äôs called.  Seems like every time I think ‚ÄúI wish Strava could / would do X‚Äù, it turns out as an added feature in a short while.  Love the Strava Labs feature.  Just keep doing what you‚Äôre doing!
title: Overall no complaints

review: Strava is the best cycling app, however the new version is atrocious. The change to the more macro view of the analysis is complete crap. Please change it back to what it was (separate page for each with more detail) or make it even more detailed than the previous version (speed, elevation, HR, etc.). Users are more concerned with the functionality and the data than we are it being a ‚Äúsocial media‚Äù fitness sharing app.
title: New Version Not Cool

review: It‚Äôs easy to use and it‚Äôs a great way to keep track of your training as well as being able to see your own incremental improvement on the leaderboards. I love the motivation it gives me to get out and ride when I see friends posting rides and getting faster!
title: Been using it for years.

review: I have used this app for years love it but for the last 2 to 3 weeks it‚Äôs been displaying my morning rides to afternoon ridesmy afternoon rides to morning rides and it is not tracking the correct mileage. I have quite a few friends that use it and we are all experiencing the same thing! Strava people fix it!
title: Fix it

review: Ok so strava is a very solid running app overall and I couldn‚Äôt recommend anything over it. A major problem, however is that on Apple Watch distance is only displayed to one decimal place. Although the more accurate distance can be seen after the run, runners like STATS. It‚Äôd be very useful to see this kind of specific statistics displayed on Apple Watch during the run.
title: Decimal places

review:
I really love this app! I totally converted from NikeRun Club app and even went through the tedious process of moving my previous runs. I only did the last year, but will eventually move over the last
10+ years of runs! 

I‚Äôll upgrade to 5 stars when it can display the current pace.
title: Current Pace??

review: This is bar far the worst running app I‚Äôve ever used. Which is sad because I‚Äôm a huge Strava fan. The only reason I used the app was because my Garmin was dead. I feel the Apple Watch is mostly at fault, but man. 1) Ran tonight. App tells me I‚Äôve hit my 5 mile mark. I slide over the screen to get to the pause/end run page. Hit end. App tells me it didn‚Äôt detect any movement and can‚Äôt record. Ummm.... You just tracked my 5 mile run. What gives Strava? This is a terrible interface, terrible info layout, hard to use app. I‚Äôll be using my garmin from now on. What a waste.
title: What a terrible app

review: I like the social part of this app. Meeting new people and being able to give each other praise for workouts. Even from people you have never meet. They can give you kudos on a hard workout. Feels nice. Plus all the metrics it tracks is amazing.
title: Really enjoy it

review:
The app is good. It tracks all sorts of data much more than I would ever need. I‚Äôve used it for a couple years and was ok spending the $60 a year to help a small app. Now that the subscription has jumped to $80, I‚Äôm out.  I don‚Äôt use 95% of the data they track. I only use the app to track my miles and find new trails to try. 

At $80, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm getting my moneys worth any more. I‚Äôll keep using it to track my rides.  Wish there was a cheaper subscription option. Oh well, strava‚Äôs lose‚Ä¶
title: Good app, but annoyed

review: Amazing resource for motivation and thrills. Huge social aspect to the app that makes exercising the most fun. I really recommend this app for any type of athlete. Whether you are just starting out or you are an advanced athlete - this is the place to log all your hard work and stay connected to the rest of the fitness world.
title: Best Fitness App

review: Have been using Strava for a little over a month to track my road cycling. App is amazing except that for some insane reason they don‚Äôt offer turn-by-turn route navigation? Having to slow or pull over and stop to check a route is at minimum annoying and occasionally dangerous. Please add this essential feature asap!
title: No turn-by-turn navigation?

review:
When are you going to let the speed sensor data be readable in real time? Why just GPS calculated speed? Not to mention the current poor integration with power meters.
I wanna ditch my cycle computer but right now, you are still keeping their business open.
title: No real Speed from sensors (even for premium)

review: I was considered subscribing, but ever since Strava changed the leaderboard etc., I‚Äôve had where my Apple Watch will not synch the workout with my iPhone, and then when it appeared that was working by logging out/on, then Strava released something else this week and now my workout today did not save to the iPhone and unsynched shows 0...
title: Dumpster fire

review: Strava not only has chosen to remove BLE integration, but the battery drain from GPS tracking has increased. So, now in order to track my activity with heart rate data I need to run Strava, an HR monitor, and music. This latest version accomplished draining my 89% battery in a little over 3 hours! I used to be able to do 5+ hour activities while tracking gps, hr and running the beacon without issue. I‚Äôm cancelling my premium and I guess Strava now gets uninstalled. There is now a huge gap in the market for a developer that can integrate sensors.
title: Latest update renders this useless

review: The app is great as long as you upload from a Garmin or similar device. But times when I've left my Garmin behind, I've never once been able to successfully map a ride directly on the app. It always pauses itself at some random point early in the ride. Several friends report the same problem. Stick with a Garmin
title: Don't try mapping rides directly on the app

review: I have been using Strava since February and I‚Äôm finding it very easy to use and I like it a lot. I sometimes do a walk - run and not all of one or the other when I‚Äôm out. It would be great to see that as one of categories. Also, I do keep getting the pace, which is in very large numbers, confused with the distance. Perhaps they could be reversed?
title: Create a walk - run category

review:
My runs miss the first few minutes of time and placement on the map.  This causes my 1st mile pace to be sub 3 minutes!  

The calorie count are entered into the health app multiple times per instance so, for example, a quick 3 mile run records ~370 calories three times.

Finally, with all the distance/time/location issues, I wish I would control the phone version of the app from the watch but there is no operability for it.
title: Missed times, multiple calorie counts, watch app can‚Äôt control iPhone app

review: Overall I love this app & use it 6 days per week. Two things that I would recommend, first make it possible to add new shoes from the app. Second, remove or change peoples activity when it is obviously incorrect, it messes up the segment leaders. When I see someone has ran 33 miles at a 3 minute pace it‚Äôs safe to assume they forgot to switch the app from ‚Äúrun‚Äù to ‚Äúride‚Äù.
title: Great app but...

review: I downloaded this app to use it for surfing with my Apple Watch series 3. The app on the iPhone has a surf workout option but the watch does not. Makes no sense considering no one in their right mind would surf with their phone. Tried to google it Incase I was missing something but didn‚Äôt find any answers. I rarely write reviews but I want the developer to know that if this app has a surf option for the Apple Watch that worked well, I‚Äôm sure it would be a 5-star app for me.
title: No surf option on Apple Watch

review: Please, please turn off the Apple Watch heartbeat monitor with the ride is paused or auto-paused.... it kills my watch battery!!! Also experiment with reducing the constant heart beat monitor to once every 5 or 10 seconds so that I can track a whole long ride and it doesn‚Äôt kill watch battery. Thanks!!
title: Great app, fix Apple Watch problem

review: Guys, I know the Apple Watch APIs aren‚Äôt the best. I know writing tests is a pain. I know that QA takes the backseat to feature development. But please, please test - and fix - your Watch app. I see a lot of people on Strava support complaining about Watch uploads just hanging and then being told that there‚Äôs a problem with their data connection. And now I‚Äôm having this issue too. This seems to have been going on since March. These are your customers that you‚Äôre leaving hanging for months! Pls fix.
title: Apple Watch uploads hang

review: No adds and less incentive for developers to draw users in with endless meaningless clicks and waste-of-time scrolling. Just friends logging miles and encouragement from fellow athletes. Excellent app that functions seamlessly with my Garmin Fenix 5. I recommend this app to anyone with any sort of GPS device who exercises.
title: Excellent. The way social media should function.

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for about 3 months. I‚Äôm pay the monthly subscription fee. The features are nice, but the app is unreliable. I‚Äôve lost data numerous times. I ride everyday and have lost data while riding and while the auto-pause was activated. I‚Äôve contacted customer service 3 times and sent ‚Äúcrash reports‚Äù. Strava tech  support doesn‚Äôt seem to have a clue about what is wrong. Mapmyride is more reliable.
title: Crashes and loses data regularly

review:
I‚Äôve been in a community Strava and have interacted with various athletes, especially cyclist.  It is fun to track your progress and be able to share with friends.

Likeminded friends that are also enjoying the benefits and pleasure of consistent exercise.
I believe cycling is the greatest and a distant second to the game of soccer.  Cheers !
title: Review

review: Of course there‚Äôs room for improvement, but this app is great. The free version has everything I need to block my rides, get useful stats, share with all my friends etc. it would be nice if there was a page for top tens, not just KOMs. And it would be nice if the app automatically paused when you were going up a mountain on a lift. But still, definitely a five star app
title: Great Ride Tracking App

review: Strava has kept me in touch with my friends who motivate each other to enjoy exercise and maintain their healthy lifestyle. Most of my friends are past their sixties and they keep me on my toes and on my bike! Strava makes it easy to see what they are up to and give them a thumbs up .
title: Keep moving!

review:
I signed up for the Strava 30-day trial, and was immediately charged $85 USD for a full year‚Äôs subscription, despite the iOS confirmation indicating I would not be charged until October 20, 2023. 

Strava claims they cannot issue a refund or confirm in writing I was charged incorrectly, and Apple has denied my requests for a refund, with the vague explanation that my claim doesn‚Äôt meet their criteria. Both companies are essentially stating there is nothing they can do. 

The Strava subreddit indicates I‚Äôm not alone in my experience. You‚Äôve been warned.
title: Beware - Predatory Pricing

review: I downloaded it because it was listed as a great way to plan routes for runs, but everything is locked behind a paywall. There is a free version of the app, but the only available features are the same available on every other fitness app like Fitbit and the standard Apple Health app. There‚Äôs really not a point downloading it unless you want to shell out a reoccurring subscription fee and theres no where that lists what you get for free vs what‚Äôs paid until you download it.
title: Useless Without a Subscription

review: I have used Strava for many years. I have always enjoyed the extra perks of their paid subscription. In the last few updates, they have closed off many features to free accounts which ruins the fun of the social competitive aspect. At the same time, they increased the price to $80 a year. Double what it was when I started. I didn‚Äôt receive a notice of the increase until it was charged. Not worth it anymore. I‚Äôve canceled after many years of fun.
title: Price increases not worth the money

review: This app has changed the way I have been biking these last few months. I enjoy how it shows other users rides and rank them based on time completed. Helps to motivate me and push me to push harder and further. I have tried a few others, but they are NOT the same. ‚úäüèø
title: I love this

review: The app sometimes messes up my workouts. Or it will stop my workout before time. It stop sending my beacon for some odd reason. If I import workouts it won‚Äôt let me add my pics or edit the info. It also makes my time different than what it actually was. Other than that when it works it allows me to communicate with other fellow users and participate in a active community.
title: Ok app

review: Would you please consider extending the distance on the dashboard to (2) decimals places? It would be nice to be able to see X.xx miles while walking or running. The extra decimal place can be a motivational piece of information for a person rather than seeing this information ‚Äúafter‚Äù one has completed their exercise. Thank you!
title: Dashboard information

review:
Overall ok to use and better than other apps. Periodically it just stops recording while I‚Äôm running and I don‚Äôt get credit for all that I‚Äôve run. 

(To the App Store - I had a prior review and I had to delete by hand to write a new one. I guess you only get one review per app? Kinda clunky that way. )
title: Stops recording randomly

review:
I‚Äôve had the worst experience with Strava. I paid for the yearly subscription and I‚Äôve had several issues loading from Wahoo to Strava. I submitted 5 tickets in a 2 month period and I didn‚Äôt not receive any help whatsoever. Strava would just close my ticket and say it was resolved. They have the worst customer support. No one ever bothered contacting me to help me solve my issue. Stick to the free version and don‚Äôt bother paying. The only thing that is worth paying for is the beacon. 
WORST CUSTOMER SUPPORT! oh wait, there‚Äôs actually no customer support.
title: Don‚Äôt bother paying

review: I really like this app, I think it‚Äôs cool. It makes me want to get out and bike which is awesome. One of my friends recommend me this app and I often go biking with him. But since we‚Äôre riding together, and both using the app, we should be able to tag each other in each other‚Äôs posts. So that‚Äôs my suggestion, please add a tagging feature. Thanks
title: Really good, but is missing something

review: The Strava community is hands-down the best. Supportive at every turn. Dig giving and getting the stoke from fellow riders around our glorious globe. Too often, though, Strava‚Äôs satellite signal gets lost ‚Äî and with it the miles I‚Äôve ridden. Poof, gone! Then you gotta go log your mile manually. And no one likes doin that. Pump up the satellite signal Strava.
title: Love the community, not the technology

review: Strava stopped recording my runs accurately; for example, an 8 mile run would record as 2 miles and my path and pave would be all over the place.
