I wasn‚Äôt able to complete the Lululemon challenge for this reason. Endlessly frustrating app, and I am very glad I deleted it. It isn‚Äôt worth your time.
title: Very inaccurate

review: Love Strava, but most recent update seems to have dropped ability to edit an activity by changing bike used.  For those of us stuck inside with some outside rides in winter, its nice to be able to change the bike selection for particular rides.  This function still works for the web based computer app, but not on IOS.
title: What happened to ability to change bike in edit function?

review:
I miss being able to quickly scroll through ride analysis and segments when the detail page loaded.  I‚Äôm not a fan of adding two extra steps to have to look at power analysis and segment results... too many network requests and page segues.

Update 10/8: the PR and KOM detail on the map for the activity thumbnails are a really nice touch!!
title: The new detail layout

review:
It appears to sync with Apple health now. They also use meters and yards in swimming finally, which is great! Miles and kilometers for lap swimming was a joke. Still no swimming with the Apple Watch, unfortunate as I‚Äôm a swimmer/cyclist but not a runner. 

I would love to see them give that green through red graph for your speed on the map the way Nike and Apple do in their apps.
title: Good for social fitness

review: I like that I can count on Strava to record each of my walks & bike rides. It has never let me down & I use it 6-7 days per week. It is also simple to use. I wanted to check out the premium app. but can‚Äôt find it in app. store. It seems like I should support people who design such useful apps. Thanks.
title: Strava is dependable & easy to use

review: Great App, works great with Apple Watch, the social feature is very motivating, just wish I could find how many miles I‚Äôve run in a particular month. I‚Äôm shocked this info isn‚Äôt available on app or the web interface, even with full subscription. Friends ask, how many miles you run in June? and I tell them I have no idea because I use Strava.
title: Needs One Simple Feature

review: I‚Äôve used the Strava app with my Apple Watch for more than a year now. It had usually worked well, but recently I started having a problem. I‚Äôll go for a run‚Äîsix miles this morning‚Äîand when I go to Finish the run in the app, it tells me no movement was recorded. If I cancel, I see in the app itself that I‚Äôve gone 6 miles. So it recorded something. Seems like a pretty obvious bug. This appears to me to pop up mostly right after Strava updates the app. Regardless, it‚Äôs making me consider going back to Garmin.
title: Bug Recording Movement on Apple Watch

review: I have Strava on my iPhone and Apple watch. The watch app is glitchy (auto-pause doesn‚Äôt disengage at the start of my run) and for the past week (before the most recent update and after) refuses to automatically sync to my phone. The ‚ÄúSync‚Äù button in Run History is useless. Strava Support hasn‚Äôt been much help in fixing this. I had no trouble before the most recent updates. Generally I love Strava, but this lack of connectivity is really starting to bother me. Without GPS data, none of the features in Strava are accessible
title: Apple Watch app refuses to sync

review: Strava has helped me connect with other runners around my area and the world. It did a fantastic job at tracking my workouts and overall activity. I can see my pacing, elevation, and other averages along with a history of my best efforts! I will be using Strava for a long time!
title: Strava is Fantastic

review: Was using the free version with any issues. Once clicking the Previous Subscription iOS stopped synchronizing.  Health app shows the days I want to use yet Strava app cannot get with the program. Everything is unlocked for it to synchronize days yet nothing happens. If I click on s single segment in the day‚Äôs ride Strava thinks only that one section applies.
title: IOS Synchronization Issues with Subscribers Preview

review:
Been using the app for 10 years. Works good for me and helps me stay in touch with friends. Items don‚Äôt always work. I can‚Äôt change my default sport. (I change it but it doesn‚Äôt stick.)
Also personal best achievements become hard to beat 10 years later. They should have a Best Time in the last year or something.
title: Good app but needs improvement

review: I really enjoy using Strava. It supports most all exercise activities. It also supports most exercise companion devices and the GPS is fairly accurate. The one thing I would like to see added is direct messaging. If they ever add that feature, Strava could very well compete with some other social media platforms.
title: Great All-Around Fitness App

review:
I can be biased because I am clearly addicted to this app. It helps me to track my progress, ensure I can verify my results, but also adds a great flavor to the social life. Challenging friends to beat your record on a segment or chasing some KOMs is an amazing add on.
Again I am addicted to it and using it most of a day  :)
title: Best sport app ever

review: Strava is awful You cannnot edit activities I use Garmin connect for my Garmin devices and at least I can edit if I use icardio for digifits app It does import the data into Strava but it is erroneous I can export from digifits app onto tcx file then import into Garmin connect  This is a piece of trash with tremendous incompetence I would never purchase membership because it gives erroneous data For swimming I would recommend the FREE my swim com app which imports very well into Garmin connects without going through the garbage strava Strava is a garbage app
title: Piece of Garbage

review: App is repeatedly crashing when I select my feed. Ok with other feeds. I just finished running and saved my run. And the app crashed. I can open the app and view/sync my friends events. But clicking on my feed crashes the app. On iPhone 8s+, latest OS 12.2.
title: Latest release crashing when trying to save my run

review: One major problem with the app is the inability to delete segments from your workout. Sometimes I forget to end my workout on my watch if I, for example, go for a mountain hike and then drive home. Once I eventually end my workout, it‚Äôs then imported to Strava, including my drive home. Without the ability to delete what Strava thinks are segments from my activity makes the data useless.
title: Can‚Äôt delete segments

review:
Although I‚Äôd love to think I hiked 6.27 miles in 2.5 hours, it just didn‚Äôt happen! Lol. If I zoom in on the map, it shows spots that look like I ran wildly in zigzag circles before continuing on the trail. I hiked closer to 4.8 miles- so...could this be fixed? It‚Äôs not the first instance - and I see it on others maps too. :)
Otherwise, I do like the concept, but, if the tracking isn‚Äôt accurate, I‚Äôm not going to continue with the app.
title: Inaccurate tracking

review: Connectivity is not working and the app really needs work. Went skating with a friend. Her app said 13 miles, mine said 9. We went the same distance. Also the Apple Watch app doesn‚Äôt have all of the same features as the phone app. You cant record an inline skate on the app or many of the other things you can on the phone. Overall not as good as other apps. Save your money and time.
title: Why doesnt the watch app match

review: They have removed the free feature that shows your leaderboard ranking. You have to pay $3 a month to see it now. üëé that‚Äôs the only reason I was using this app. I know some of you are saying $3 a month that‚Äôs cheep. But i am tired of this monthly subscription crap. You use to be able to buy a program and you owned it. Now they know they can make way more money setting you up on auto pay and slowly bleeding your bank account. So I‚Äôm just tired of the greed.
userName: O my! Its a plastic pistol!
title: Their getting greedier.

review: Comparing my efforts on different segments to my self and others was the main reason I used this app. By locking the feature behind destroys the functionality for me. I would have considered paying before if the features actually seemed worth it, but it really rubs me the wrong way when free features becomes pay features. I also think the mass exodus of free users from this app will make the paid content worth less. I‚Äôll probably use Apple workouts until I find something new. Very poor form strava.
title: One update removed all usefulness

review: I am one of the free riders apparently. I would think strava receives significant advertising revenue based on what I see in my strava feed. I will need to evaluate whether to subscribe or use something else to track my workouts in the future. So far I‚Äôve loved the free version and it has been a helpful resource to improving my workouts and health. I like being able to measure my performance to my own history and to the top 10.
title: Free no more?

review: Would be 5 stars if the app actually updated club leaderboard mileage consistently. The website is just as bad. One minute it will show accurate mileage then 5 minutes later it will take away some of your rides and show less mileage. My competitive nature does not enjoy seeing less mileage on leaderboards then what I‚Äôve actually ridden. Mileage on personal profile is always accurate however.
title: Not bad

review: This app is great‚Äîindispensable for any training and connects me with friends. However they still haven‚Äôt fixed the terrible robot voice that started after recent upgrade. This feels like too long of a delay to find a solution for a paid app. The fact that I still haven‚Äôt canceled is really testament to how great the app is.
title: Wonky voice on iPhone still a problem

review: Strava is my go to app for recording my walks, hikes, etc. Easy to use, helps keep me motivated, and I enjoy the social aspect. It‚Äôs also nice to be able to add photos. The built-in map gives me a feeling of security when on an unfamiliar route. It‚Äôs ia great way to avoid getting lost!
title: Reassuring and Motvating

review: I have pretty religiously used Strava for the last few years. I‚Äôm pretty simple when it comes to run apps‚Äîjust chart my time, pace and distance. Over the last few weeks it can‚Äôt even do that. I‚Äôll hit record, the time will go but distance and pace stand still. Just downloaded this last update, maybe I‚Äôll try it again, but I‚Äôm def looking for other apps to replace it.
title: Suddenly isn‚Äôt recording distance

review: Recently, the Strava app has not been able to properly record my bike rides. At one point, it wouldn‚Äôt record them at all, despite it successfully acquiring a GPS signal and it showing that it was recording at the outset; stopping periodically throughout the ride, I would fine it had stopped soon after I took after and not have recorded a thing. Updated my phone‚Äôs software and now it records a portion of my ride, but misses probably 30-40% of it. Bummer that I can‚Äôt track my activity anymore.
title: Doesn‚Äôt properly record activity.

review: If you want to use Strava with your Apple Watch, they force you to use their App which is terrible.  Lacks functionality and the layout is confusing. I would prefer to use the built in Apple Watch running app but Strava has not, or refuses to, build in the ability to read run data from the health app.  For some reason they want you to use their app.  So Apple Watch users are forced to use a third party app to sync the Apple data to, then sync again to Strava.
title: Not good for Apple Watch users

review: Strava is great and a fun way to connect and compete with friends. With running power meters becoming more common, I‚Äôd love to see better integration in Strava. Please include this soon! Comparing HR, GAP, and Power data would be extremely helpful to training. Additionally, I would love to see a function where Strava can predict FTP for runners based on the data above! More features and analysis for premium accounts are needed!
title: Run Power!

review:
After multiple updates and reinstalls, the app still fails getting heart rate data on my Apple Watch 2. App is otherwise pretty cool, but this is major functionality that doesn't work still months after release.

Update: now with iOS 11, the watch app doesn‚Äôt work at all. Was crashing every time I opened it. I reinstalled and it‚Äôs stuck on saying ‚Äúon your phone, sign up or log in‚Äù. Duh. I have. I‚Äôve reinstalled again. It‚Äôs showing notifications on the watch, but I can‚Äôt record. Ridiculous.
title: Still fails to get heart data

review:
Great app. I love it. Many year user. But 3 stars because all too many times now the location data on my city runs has been a terrible zig zag. I mean come on, I can't run through buildings and I can't run a 1.4 minute mile. Let's use location data we know about Streets ( google API etc) to cleanup the raw path data . I believe in you you can do it! 

I'm sure your engineers are dying to solve a problem as cool and fun as this.
title: I use it. I like. But...

review: I‚Äôm not a world class athlete. I‚Äôm not ever going to get a KOM or be on a leaderboard. Could care less about sharing my activities with the world. I kind of like the route planning to reach a destination, but what I really liked was getting my activities done on Zwift, or Wahoo SYSTM pushed to Strava and then to Apple Health.

review: Great but not sure why I pay full price and my bf has the free app that does just as much. Buggy and won‚Äôt tell me live segments for anything but runs. Doesn‚Äôt work while cycling. If I go back to edit a run to change the shoes or add a comment the split times will change. Frustrating when it‚Äôs not free!!! Otherwise helpful but map my run is easier to use. title: Too expensive

review: I am unable to use the app for tracking distance. Whenever I click start it give a pop up that says enable background app refresh. I do exactly what it says to do and go to settings, but the button is on and grayed out. What should I do?
title: What‚Äôs going on?

review: So far its dropped 2 workouts last week. Since the last update it has not worked right. No support available. Lost events were stuck on my I-watch and couldn't get them to sync to application. Finicky link between app on phone and watch makes it error prone.
title: Lost many rides and run

review: In 2 out of my 3 runs this past week, strava seems to have messed up in recording my run. The app called out my first mile around 3 minutes late, and didn‚Äôt seem to record that first four minutes as part of my run. I was running a route that I have run dozens of times before, and the final distance came out to be around .4 miles short, approximately the distance that I would have run in those first 3 minutes. Forced to give 1 star here because this is pretty much the app‚Äôs only job.
title: recent updates broke something?

review: Latest version has crashed my Apple Watch (shutting it down completely) twice on my long marathon training runs and now *4 times* on my 8 miler this morning. What was once my favorite running app is now totally unreliable. Please fix it soon!
title: Terrible reliability

review:
Here‚Äôs a business model: create an app that has very limited features. Add new features that are behind a pay wall. User subscription unlocks said features. 

Stravas current business model: create an app with features. Continued to add features. Had other features behind a pay wall. Not enough interest in pay wall from users, so the previously added features are taken away and hidden behind a paywall. 

Ummmmm excuse me? That‚Äôs backwards. I suggest everyone just use Garmin Connect.
title: Basic features are no longer free... just use Garmin Connect

review:
This is a great app, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but one thing that bugs me is how there isn‚Äôt a sprint option. The sprint option would be like any other option but when you clicked on it, you could say

Distance sprinted:
(Then with a drop down menu of meters, feet, yards etc)

Then it would say #number of sprints completed with a fill in the blank for how many sprints you completed

Then the last blank to fill out would be your times for each sprint and you could add as many times necessary. 

I think this would be a great addition to the app because I am a soccer player and currently in am having to use the workout option to log my sprints.
title: Great app, but...

review: Works best if you have a smart watch but overall I think it‚Äôs a good App. I think my one complaint is the inability to register running shoes and gear through the actual app and more importantly multiple running shoes/ gear. A drop down menu would make a ton of difference to track mileage on your shoes or bike. I don‚Äôt want to have to login to the site to register or deregister gear.
title: Good Free Versions App

review: I really like that the Strata app has the function that will announce each mile, pace, and total; however, when comparing the gps recorded distance on both the Garmin and Strata running simultaneously they do not match. The longer you run the greater the disparity. The Strata app shows you having gone a greater distance at a quicker pace with the gap continuing to increase. Not sure why this occurs.
title: Strata vs. Garmin

review: I‚Äôm new to this application, looks great but still need to use it a lot more to understand it. A bit confusing to navigate at the beginning but easier as you go. However, since it has lot of different sports would be AMAZING to have also diving log so it can be one stop shop for all of sport activities! Plz make that happen
title: Can we have diving log

review: The last update made it so that you can no longer see a chart of your own last 12 weeks of training. To me that was one of the more beneficial aspects of the Free version of Strava. Despite improvements with the last update, they are outweighed by this take away in my opinion. Would not update if you haven‚Äôt already.
title: Last Update Meh

review: The one thing that would make this a 5 star app for me is the ability to see an entire day on a map...meaning I can go to a calendar with in the app and tap on one day, then, it‚Äôll show me where I rode that day and can then tap into each separate ride, but just the ability to see the whole day on a map would be amazing.
title: Missing one key thing

review: Currently Strava does not add workouts like Strength Training to the mobile weekly totals. It only has bike, run and swim. Please include the other activities in the ‚Äútime‚Äù weekly totals so users can see a true hours worked out each week. Perhaps add another label like ‚Äúother‚Äù for a quick reference of hours spent outside of bike, run and swim.
title: Add to Weekly Totals

review:
I will start by saying that I love 90% of what this app has to offer. However, there is still not an option to load my previous run on Nike run club to the app so I can‚Äôt look at trend data. There is a forum that shows ‚Äòworkarounds‚Äô but none work. This simple fix would make for a five star review. 

Other suggestion:  Allow Beacon to work with the Apple Watch. I don‚Äôt carry my phone while running.
title: Need better support

review: I‚Äôm a pretty dedicated runner and purchased the upgrade within the app. The app regularly under tracks my distance or says I am running significantly slower than I am. I‚Äôve used other apps simultaneously to test and Strava dropped miles the other apps did not. I tried speaking with customer service but was told there is nothing they can do because the issue is with the GPS not the app. Somehow other apps don‚Äôt seem to have issues with GPS, just Strava.
title: Extremely disappointed

review:
I‚Äôve used several apps for running & Strava is by far the best for both the Apple Watch & iphone. Love the ability to create routes, especially in new cities I‚Äôm visiting. Great for post run analyzing. 
By far the best feature is beacon. I live in the country, so it‚Äôs nice to know someone has my back while I‚Äôm out on my runs.
title: Best running app

review: I used to love this app and used it every time I rode. The latest version, however, has become so painfully slow that I only use it when I really want to now. It takes quite some time to start up, and also is unresponsive for a short time when ending a ride. Not really what I want to spend my time waiting for when I‚Äôm getting on or off my bike. Too bad because I like the app otherwise.
title: Slow and unresponsive

review: I am so happy that my wife introduced me to Strava. Please give me something for free. I love Strava !!!! But honestly I hope my sight is ok right now cause I may have been putting to many eye drops In my eyes. I like looking back on one year results. I‚Äôve gotten slower and fatter so it‚Äôs sad but ‚Ä¶ you know reality.
title: Thank you

review:
No dark mode after how many years of it being available on iOS?  Ooh I can answer that- it‚Äôs been 5 years that Strava hasn‚Äôt cared.

No autoflagging of inhuman segment performances after how many years of people begging for it?  Probably since the start of Strava.

It really seems like Strava laid off all their engineers years ago and is just coasting at this point.  Very little effort is being put into new features or keeping up with simple, basic expectations.
title: App is no longer being developed

review:
1. Best-in-class
2. Privacy standards are above industry standard
3. Social component/challenges do not overwhelm the app‚Äôs core focus‚Äî tracking fitness/recreational activities
4. UX/UI is very easy to navigate
5. What‚Äôs next? Need to try Strava Premium to see how much more there is to offer.
title: One of the best accountability apps on the market

review: I‚Äôve used Strava since 2012 and participated in the big update a few years ago as a beta tester. I was a heavy user of segment prior to the update but have found that it is unusable in its current state. I have hundreds of QOMs but no longer ‚Äúplay‚Äù on the leaderboards. The options to filter (climb the leaderboard or explore new segments) is simply useless. I continue to download updates in the hopes that this will be corrected but am now leaving this review‚Ä¶. Please fix my (previously) favorite app!
title: What happened to segment explorer

review: Once you get you bearings and explore all of the avenues this app has to offer, it becomes very beneficial, but most importantly useful. The social media aspect behind it is a perfect balance as well. I reccommend the premium version if your persistent with daily/weekly runs/bikes/walks/hikes/swim etc.
title: Perfect Running App

review: Long time fan and user. Wish I could disable email notifications about thumbs ups through the app. Push notifications are configurable but email communication is a one black box. At some point I'd have to mark all Strava emails as spam just to not receive stuff I don't want
title: Email notifications

review:
I use to really love this app so last year I upgraded to a year subscription. Well now that I‚Äôm trying to take it off it‚Äôs been a nightmare. Literally have been on the phone for days can‚Äôt cancel in the App Store can‚Äôt cancel it on the website or the app. Keep being told to just cancel in the app
Store but there‚Äôs nothing there. Sent videos in email showing there‚Äôs nothing there and still being told that same thing over and over.
title: Won‚Äôt let me cancel my membership

review:
I have been a Strava user for 2-3 years.  While I recognize the need to encourage paid subscriptions the recent strategy has been to take away features from the free version as opposed to encouraging subscriptions by adding features. The most recent change is to kill off the historic weekly mileage summary.  

Strava is still a good app, but less so with each release.
title: Love Strava but with each recent release less so.

review: There may be a huge avid following for this app, but to a new user there is just way too much going on with too many bells and whistles and it has totally failed me at the ultra-basic function I want: tap a link for a shared route, have it pop up in the app, and save it for future use. Absolutely does not work, and/or whatever magic tiny screen icon or strangely named menu option is supposed to do this, is impossible to find. Robo-help chat is worthless.
title: Absolutely opaque to a new user

review: I have an Apple Watch series 3 and have used to to track all my runs and races with Nike run club until I decided to get strava. However, this app is super inconsistent with the watch. For example, say I track a 13 minute run‚Ä¶ it only registers as like 10 minutes or something‚Ä¶ the milage is right but the timing so so off. It doesn‚Äôt happen all the time but it‚Äôs been more frequent, especially on races. It‚Äôs super annoying
title: Wrong times

review: If you are looking for politics to be inserted into your running, biking & swimming, üëçLOOK NO FUTHER! It used to be that sports was the one place where we could be united because of our passion for them & they are fantastic to escape the world‚Äôs woes, if only for a little while. It seems that Strava does not feel the same way; they would prefer divisive content on an app used for simply tracking fitness. Furthermore, it is disingenuous to excuse 6 months of continuously rioting and burning down American cities (including Washington DC) by one group as ‚Äúpeaceful protests.‚Äù
title: Politics instead of SPORTS on this app

review: Been a Strava user since it first began... many years ago now.  Finally went Premium earlier this year. Very disappointed that latest release removed easy access to my weekly mileage totals. Now have to navigate through several screens to get to training calendar. Also entirely got rid of friends‚Äô weekly mileage totals, which I looked at daily. Not sure why they would remove working features from even paying users.
title: Lost good features

review: I absolutely love this app. I use it to track everything I do, and before this recent update, the free version was all I needed. I used to use my Garmin watch to sync my rides/runs to the app, but now that‚Äôs a paid feature. I can‚Äôt justify paying for the app when that‚Äôs the only thing I‚Äôd use from the paid version. Five stars for use of the app, three stars for taking away that free feature.
title: Love Strava, but not the new update

review: Been using strava for 5+ years and recently they are changing all the benefits of use to paid subscription users only...what‚Äôs the point of having the ‚Äúcommunity running group‚Äù with challenges if we can‚Äôt even use/see them anymore‚Äîwhy have segments, routes, etc...if we just have to pay for what made strava special. I have other fitness trackers but strava was different, now it‚Äôs just the same. üòï
title: Need to pay if you want the previously free stuff

review:
According to an email sent out by Strava today, there is such a culture of racism in their offices that they felt the need to apologize to the world and state their intent to change that culture. If they have so much of a racism problem in their offices I‚Äôm out. App and account deleted. 

I‚Äôll find another app that is less focused on political posturing and more concerned with running. Their new business model is garbage. $60 is way to much for the services provided, especially considering that 3/5 runs don‚Äôt track correctly.
title: Get Woke, Go Broke

review: Strava removed direct pairing of heart rate sensors with the mobile app as of Sept 1st, making most of the summit analyses worthless or forcing us to use a 3rd party app to record workouts, which prevents you from using other Summit features like beacon or the segment live view. What was a great app before became mostly useless now.
title: Useless without the HR recording

review: Strava moving features behind a paywall in the current world, is an extremely tone deaf move. I think users understand the need for a service such as this to be profitable, and should value that enough to pay. However, asking for this now when increasingly more people are unemployed is simply a bad move. These features allow folks who are isolating to feel connected with their peers and makes Strava seem like they don‚Äôt understand the value of their own product.
title: Moving Features behind paywalls

review: I loved it for YEARS until they got rid of the capability of tracking my heart rate with my Bluetooth headphones‚Äô heart rate sensor. I absolutely hate strap or wrist type monitors. It‚Äôs a deal breaker IMO. They say you can use wahoo and upload the data to Strava but why would I do that when other tracking apps do almost everything strava does and utilize my current heart rate monitor? I guess I‚Äôll have to switch to Runkeeper until they decide (IF they ever decide) to support them again. :-/
title: I loved it until...

review: I downloaded this app so I could track biking and running. The stats are great, and I think there are even more stats available to see through the Apple Watch after I updated a couple settings. However, the watch app won‚Äôt sync! Even a workout which does sync continues to show up on the watch app as not synced. I‚Äôve tried all the recommendations online short of deleting the app from my watch and phone. I‚Äôve never had a syncing issue with an app. Just had a great run. Wish I could see it. Thanks, Strava.
title: Won‚Äôt Sync

review: I am a big fan of Strava but the Apple Watch app continues to disappoint. Over the last few months when I open the app it tells me to ‚Äúlog in or sign up on using the Strava app‚Äù. I have been a member for years and everything is logged in on my iPhone, yet the watch keeps asking me this. Even when I try to sync my watch I‚Äôm having difficulty. For the last few runs I have had to switch to an alternative running app on my watch.
title: The Apple Watch app does not work

review: This app, and the ability to set long term goals, is the reason I stuck to running for the last three years. From not being able to run a single mile straight in 2016 to just completing my first marathon, Strava has helped me track and document the whole process!
title: Keeps me going

review: Definitely enjoy this app, it is my favorite social media as a distance runner. However there should be a way to group runs together if you‚Äôre doing several reps in a workout. This way you‚Äôre not spamming everyone with 10 consecutive posts and it would all become a group workout. Would love to see this on Strava but otherwise great app!
title: Great Social Media

review:
I've been on Strava for about 10 yrs now and it just keeps getting better. I enjoy being a member of other clubs from other countries and having the abilities to see what others are doing that share the same values as I do.  
Keep up the good work Strava!
title: The best!

review:
I use this for cycling and dog walking a lot, and I love it for that, but I do have a suggestion. I would also like to use this for tracking time spent on self defense through manual entries. Could you create a category for that please? Maybe it could be measured through time spent. I could include the description like one would do for anything else. 

Thank you,
John L.
title: I love this, but one suggestion.

review:
I bought the summit package to get a training plan. Maybe I missed something along the way but getting a plan emailed to me and being promoted to upgrade to get a coach for my workout is too much. I expected to have the verbal cues for tempo runs, paying for an emailed schedule through an app is ridiculous. 
Signing in online to set up sneakers and routes is a bad use of an app. This is supposed to be convenient. The route planning wasn‚Äôt even available at the time. 
I cancelled the subscription and will be deleting the app.
title: I don‚Äôt know what I paid for....

review: Would give this app 5 stars if the watch app was fixed. Every time the app updates the watch app tells me the I need to log in on the phone app. This is beyond frustrating when I am able to start a run without my phone. They point of the gps watch it to run without your phone. Please fix so I don‚Äôt have to abandon Strava
title: Watch App Needs Updated

review:
I've used Strava for about 6 months now and I have noticed a problem: Occasionally, I finish a ride and forget to turn off Strava. It then records all the walking I do until I take out my phone and realize it's still recording.
If it is possible to crop activities already, where can I do that? If not, please add this feature!
title: Missing Feature

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for years and only had some minor blips along the way with tracking. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because of the latest updates, but the app cannot seem to pick up my usual routes anymore. My latest run has me cutting through yards and skipping long tracts, resulting in me running 5:00 miles. I wish!
title: Issues with satellite tracking?

review: The app is great social tool for biking, running, and swimming. However there is zero support for triathletes which boggles my mind considering that ppl have been asking for this for a long time.  One main activity with total tri time which can be drilled down to see the separate sport times. How about triathlon challenges?  Almost impossible hitting sport specific challenges when your training for 3 different ones.
title: Triathlon support please!

review: Which is fine, but it took me going through an endless amount of in-app pop-ups and prompted and trying to get me to buy a subscription, and THEN being redirected to the website (you can only add/manage routes from there for some reason) to get locked out of the page unless I start a trial/subscribe. Not being able to even test the features you‚Äôre looking for without paying is an instant uninstall for me.
title: Can‚Äôt plan routes without subscription

review: Let‚Äôs face it, a lot of us are going to be cutting back as we inch ever closer to recession. While I expect prices on some things to increase, a 50% per month bump is simply too much to justify. That said, Strava is great - a wonderful app and better than anything else that does the same thing. But yeah, I‚Äôll take the second best app for half as much. This is gouging, plain and simple.
title: Great app; terrible price increase

review:
Long time Strava user (2013 I believe). Huge fan of the app and the way it has developed over the years!! Two questions though:

1) can we have mountain biking and road/gravel biking?‚Ä¶ two very different disciplines that I can‚Äôt currently differentiate between because it‚Äôs only set up for Cycling.

2) similarly, could we have more than Long Run, Workout, Race, & Commute in the ‚ÄúType of Run‚Äù tab?‚Ä¶ more experienced runners than I would know better what to add to this list but I  also do Trail Run, Recovery Runs, and Interval Runs. I‚Äôd LOVE to have the option to track these things better.

Thank you!
title: Huge Strava fan but 2 questions

review:
Did you guys seriously just totally disconnect syncing of Strava activities to the Apple Health app/fitness rings from any activity recorded on anything other than directly on Strava? I left Runkeeper a year ago, spent hundreds on a nice GPS watch, and decided to go with Strava because I was able to keep using my fitness rings. Dear Apple (and Strava also) recording runs on the Apple Watch is horribly inaccurate and gives ZERO elevation data. 

How do I get a refund for my Strava subscription??
title: No more syncing to Apple Health?

review: I would really like this if I had the ability to edit my runs. I run indoor on a treadmill a lot and my Garmin is just not very accurate. I don‚Äôt want to do a manual entry because I‚Äôd like to still be able to track cadence, heart rate, and things like that I get from the Garmin, but I‚Äôd like to be able to adjust the run distance so it would actually be accurate. Other apps let me do that so I‚Äôll have to give up on this.
title: Can‚Äôt edit runs

review: I love using this app and the options that they have for exercise is fantastic. I do pay for the subscription because I use the app so much it‚Äôs the least I can do to support. The free version is great and perfect for recording information but if you pay the 7.99 you gain access to so much more.
title: Love this app

review: I love strava but the new update stinks. Please let me see my weekly mileage and scroll back to see the last 12 weeks on my home profile screen.. too many clicks just to see my weekly distance. Why did this change?
title: New update not great

review: Very impressed with how this app has remained fairly easy to use & just plain fun to have for reviewing activities. Add to that excellent customer service (recently experienced an issue that was resolved in a timely, professional manner). Definitely a favorite & highly recommended.
title: A favorite app for more than one reason

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for about 7 years. It has been a 5 star app until the recent update that requires you to pay for fundamental parts of the app.  The best thing about Strava was the leader boards and being able to see how you ranked compared to everyone else on the segments. Now that you have to have a monthly subscription I will likely not bother using anymore.
title: Bring back leader boards for free version

review: Would really love to see my best individual times for different distances and maybe even my top 3 times in my stats. If you can track them during a working you should be able to compile them in my stats correct? Very disappointed that I reading of complaints of this way back in 2015 on your website. Covid has seen an influx of people getting back into working out and this would be a great time to add this feature.
title: Please show PR Lists

review:
So I started using Strava to record my rides/runs and to share them with the Ironman Virtual Club for my virtual competitions (crucial during this COVID sheltering time). Then, Ironman.... NOT Strava.... Ironman, had the courtesy to co tact their athletes to notify us that Strava has decided we cannot share OUR recorded data with Ironman anymore. I can only imagine they want a cut and when they didn‚Äôt get it, they picked up their toys and left the sandbox. And didn‚Äôt even notify their users. Wow. 
So.... f#!* Strava and on to better companies for my tracking/plan purchasing.
title: Not for those doing virtual challenges

review: I really like the community of runners and cyclists. It‚Äôs easy to join group runs and rides. However, if I‚Äôm PAYING for premium features like Beacon, then why doesn‚Äôt it work with Apple Watch? It‚Äôs the series 3. It has GPS. It even has cellular data. It makes NO SENSE that the app developers haven‚Äôt fixed this.
title: Beacon Doesn‚Äôt Work

review: While the phone app is great when working, the Apple Watch app is buggy. The Apple watch app recently consistently forgets that I‚Äôm signed into Strava on my phone and treats me like a new user until I do an elaborate watch restart process with the Strava app open on my phone. Also, after a run, it occasionally doesn‚Äôt sync properly to load the run and I need to manually go into history and sync it.
title: Watch app is buggy

review:
Hi!

I use Strava to sync my Peloton rides to my Apple Watch. Lately, it has been posting the same ride 10 times - which feeds 10 rides to my watch each day. While that would be impressive, it‚Äôs NOT accurate. Suggestions on how to stop that?

Otherwise, appreciate the 3rd party connection between Apple and Peloton.
title: How do I stop multiple recordings of the same workout?

review:
Wanted to add my indoor spin bike to the list of bikes, but an indoor spin was not an option. Not all of us use trainers with our road bikes. 
The app however, proved to be very accurate on my road outings. Compared to the Garman 920XT on a 40 mile ride, I find to only be a 0.1 or 0.2 miles difference.
title: Better indoor spin options would be a plus!

review: Got into using strava earlier this year, liked the functionality so I got the paid version/subscription. Overall their improvements have been great, EXCEPT the ‚Äúsuggested athletes to follow‚Äù. Many paid members including myself have asked Strava to give option to disable. After looking over the strava forums, it seems that‚Äôs Strava doesn‚Äôt care about feedback it receives. I even contact support multiple times. This eventually led me to cancel my subscription, if I‚Äôm having to deal with a nuisance than I‚Äôll settle for the free version,.
title: STRAVABOOK? Used to luv it

review: I would have given this app 5 stars had you been able to see it on the new Infograph watch face on iOS. With this one exception it does all you could want from the app. I particularly like being able to go on a run and record my route even when I don‚Äôt have my phone with me. Keep up the good work but please add it to the infograph iOS watch faces.
title: Good App

review:
I think I have it finally worked out, but I learned the hard way that even after I thought I had cancelled my subscription, it kept showing back up on my credit card.  Emails would appear on my app but not on my actual email.   You would think they would cancel the subscription themselves, but you have to go through iTunes.  

The app itself was really neat but the actual distance was not accurate.  On trail runs it was way off.  Their are free apps that work a lot better.
title: They keep charging me.

review: Amazing app, helped with accountability for running during off-season. Also kept laziness in check during season. Stats and tools provided are great, premium is 100% worth it as well if you are a serious runner.
title: Changed running

review: My coach wanted the team to get this so he can see our progression and it is really good at making sure our paces are good and to see where we are at when we upload our workout and it‚Äôs great to use when your with friends
title: Best workout app

review: I use the app and the website and like the product. But I would like to contact Strava to request a new feature. Or maybe it‚Äôs there and I just can‚Äôt find it. But Strava does not want to hear from me or you. They offer no link, form or email address to contact them through the app or website. I don‚Äôt like companies that hide from their customers. What are you afraid of Strava? And yes, I stepped through you help/support system on the website and app. Useless.
title: How do I contact Stava?

review: The maps are grossly outdated and rely on feedback to ‚Äúsubmit‚Äù and they ‚Äúmight‚Äù get updated at some point. As a user of many different areas, I don‚Äôt have time to send updates on all the areas. They need to go out and source more updated maps instead of relying on users to do this for free. I can see user updates as a use case for minor updates but when the maps show undeveloped land that have been developed for 5+ years‚Ä¶that is a problem.
title: Maps grossly outdated

review:
iPhone app on iPad doesn‚Äôt work perfectly. Would like an iPad specific app where it can be viewed horizontally and be able to add and edit gear. I can log on the online version but it‚Äôs clunky. 

3 stars is for the app. Strava is 5 stars+
title: When will there be an iPad version

review: I‚Äôve been using the app for years and really liked all the features, but most of them are now subscription only. This makes the app good for not much else than timing and pace of your runs/rides. You really don‚Äôt get much else. They also have started incorporating political messages from the creators which is really weird to put in an exercise app. I‚Äôll be looking into other activity apps now.
title: Charges for some basic features, becoming political

review: I recommend upgrading from sneakers to cleats to novices. I recommend top quality components to veteran riders. I recommend STRAVA to everybody. I joined as a geek looking for an easy way to track miles and map routes. Subliminal benefit: within weeks I was setting goals and increasing results. Nothing but praise for this simple to use, no commitment benefit to cyclists.
title: Universally applicable ap.

review: Beyond all the complaints of features moving behind the paywall, it seems like the latest update has broken basic audio. Now starting a workout shuts off music playing on my Apple Watch and I no longer get audio mile splits, which was really the only feature keeping me from just switching back to the native workout app. Realize they need to make money, but the development quality seems to be going downhill fast and not worth buying into.
title: Latest update breaking features

review:
Strava has changed the game for me.  I can now train hard in my house early
In the morning without being stressed and the workouts are actually harder than the road work. Strava has allowed me to maintain and train even with a busy family life!
title: The real indoor ride

review: Honestly, I‚Äôve loved strava for over 5 years. I‚Äôve never wanted to subscribe because it‚Äôs just out of my price range, and I find it kind of ridiculous to pay for an app to make some statistics. I have always enjoyed the free version but recently they‚Äôve taken the weekly summary away from people who aren‚Äôt subscribed? I‚Äôm very disappointed strava- please don‚Äôt continue to make this app accesible only to those who can afford it, it‚Äôs elitist.
title: Pretty disappointed in the new updates

review: This app had been absolutely amazing for me, however the recent updates requiring so many features to be paid for are just ruining it. If they gave us the features for free but added some ads that would be fine but making you pay to use them is just not ok. Again, I love this app but making everything paid features is ruining it
title: Good app, getting ruined by corporate greed

review: I really love using the Strava app except it is not calculating my total miles walked. This makes it hard to do challenges and would be a threat motivation. I just see a big fat zero on the top of my profile. I emailed them about it almost two weeks ago and I‚Äôve received nothing but ‚Äúyou‚Äôll hear from us soon‚Äù automatic response. If they fixed this I‚Äôd be happy and change this to 5 stars.
title: I like it but..

review: Great for sharing stuff with friends but I feel like that‚Äôs about it. When my headphones are on and my phone is in the pocket while running or cycling on other apps ever mile it would give me audio update mile by mile & also I have the App on my phone and my watch but if I active the run on my phone it doesn‚Äôt auto connect with my watch. This app has potential.
title: Could be better

review:
Thanks to Strava I have improved my time and endurance.  The monthly challenges keep me moving more often and become a commitment that helps me improve and keeps me motivated to keep going.  
It‚Äôs also a way to find other runners like me and others that I can learn from.
title: A place to improve and get motivated

review:
Cannot find an in-app way to submit a problem, let me do it here. 
Love the service. Thank you for creating it. 
Now, each time I get one notification, the app badge says ‚Äú8‚Äù. In app, it‚Äôs actually one. Has been like this for half a year now. 
Another, smaller problem: I had completed a ride and went offline. Then I updated the app before the ride was submitted. The ride was lost.
title: Great service, but bugs

review: I‚Äôve been a user for over 5 years. One thing I‚Äôd love to see is a maintenance log, so I can record when (miles and date) things get changed (and a future milestone for the next change). It‚Äôs not Strava‚Äôs core competency, but since it has all my usage by bike, it makes sense.
title: Feature I‚Äôd like to see

review: At work I preach regularly about how you can't manage what you don't measure.  Your fitness is no different.  This app provides a simple graph showing my mileage/ hours of activity  each month and it motivates me  to atleast match what I did last month. So far this thing is great.
title: It makes a difference

review:
It can get you down if you look too much at other people in self comparison.
But as a training tool it is so useful.
Recent updates took on the data pages the Training Peaks offers, but somehow not as good.
Having said that, overall it is still worth a subscription 
Richy ABRT
title: Stravanoia anonymous

review:
Strava is great, but ignores important features of cycling (you can tell it was created for triathletes and runners).

1) group rides. Your strava segment in a group is a different accomplishment from one done on your own. It should be automatically recorded. 

2) wind. The data are out there! Why not use them?

3) ‚ÄúAuto‚Äù detection. It‚Äôs not that hard to tell when somebody has accidentally left their cyclometer on and put their bike on the rack. This should be flagged.

4) races. How hard it this to note that a particular ride corresponds to an officially sanctioned event. Again, the data are out there for the taking!
title: Feature requests

review:
Came back to see if the developers have changed anything. They have not. I used Strava for years before the Apple Watch came out and Strava has gone downhill ever since.

The only thing better in Strava vs Apple Watch‚Äôs built in features is that Strava has segments. 

You cannot track a swim. You cannot customize the readout on your Apple Watch for individual sports. You cannot see your ‚Äúcurrent speed or pace‚Äù, only averages. This is most obvious when you‚Äôre on a bike ride or a run and want to see your speed. You can‚Äôt set a weekly or monthly goal, and you can‚Äôt see relative effort and many other features without premium.

These features used to be free but now they are behind their $60 per year paywall.

Great jobs devs - you‚Äôve alienated users like myself that have been using this app since it first came out.
title: Not worth it

review: App hanging when try to access likes or comments.  Erroring out on liking comments.  Not recording likes on other user‚Äôs activities.  It‚Äôs a mess since the last few updates
title: Lots of bugs introduced recently

review: I used to really like this app. I use it for running & biking. The best thing about this app is that it continues to record even when the signal is weak or there is no signal. I‚Äôm disappointed with the app however because it won‚Äôt upload my activity. My activity shows as ‚ÄúPending Upload‚Äù. I‚Äôve tried several times to upload, but it never does. I was using this app to measure my progress, but without uploading my activity there is no way to track it now. Disappointed :(
title: Failed to upload my activity

review: Ok Strava peeps - you surely know this. The functionality of the app itself is great. No issues. BUT - when using it, even on my brand new iPhone 8, the app seems to soak up all the available CPU resources on the device. Editing an activity, for example, seems to bring the device to its knees. Yes yes I can hear you now - close all other apps, blah blah - I know all that. Bottom line, ya gotta streamline the thing, or do SOME work on the app so it doesn‚Äôt hog all the available device resources. Good luck! üëçüèª
title: App is great but a HUGE resource hog

review:
I would absolutely give this app 5 Stars if they could add one thing:

Action Button

I know they can do it. Apple opened it up. Other 3rd party apps have enabled it. I had Slopes set as my action button this winter skiing. It‚Äôs spring now, summer is almost here. Where is the action button option?
title: 5 Stars if Strava could add one thing

review: I‚Äôm a cyclist and simply cannot think of not using Strava for my rides or workouts to see and/or review my metrics, plan a route or find new ones that may have been completed by others. It keeps me motivated. I really enjoy using Strava.
title: Cannot go without it!

review: Usually people perceive addiction to social media as negative. My addiction to Strava has made me run more and get closer to reaching my goals. I recommend this app to anyone who has or wants to make some friends in the fitness world and also want to improve their physical ability.
title: Good App

review:
I think this app is great to keep track of your runs and hikes. I love all of the variety of graphs! 
However, I have been waiting for YEARS for them to add horseback riding and horseback trail riding to their app! That‚Äôs the only reason I can‚Äôt give this app 5 stars. They‚Äôve added so many sports and it‚Äôs really great to see, but I am still waiting for horseback stuff.
title: Great but limited on sports options

review:
You can either choose to hide the whole thing or not store it. That is it. Want to store the stats but not the route? Tough. Want to not have the part of your route where you are walking home logged? Tough. Want to edit part of the route because the app is bad and mapped wrong? Tough. 

Just use google maps and a spread sheet. You‚Äôll be sharing surprisingly less data.
title: Very Little Control Of your own data

review: I like the easy use of strava. You press record and go on your fitness adventure. It‚Äôs fun to see how others have done too. Ads and political views are better left to other sources and thankfully strava has not been too bad. YET. The minute it does I‚Äôm gone. For now it‚Äôs getting closer to me leaving so don‚Äôt blow it please.
title: Strava app review

review:
This app does what it‚Äôs intended for but falls very short in long term goals. This tracks your ride but you will begin to see bugs where activities aren‚Äôt ever recorded in your history, despite you starting the recording. 

This is immensely frustrating since this app bugs out and never records my really long activities. 

I‚Äôm riding around for 2 hours thinking it will record, nope it doesn‚Äôt. 

The auto start feature is utter garbage. No way to turn it off and it bothers you as soon as you want to even open the app. Why do you automatically start an activity once the app opens?! I just want to view other things in app but it does this every time, wasting your time on the app.
title: Great at start, terrible in long run.

review: This app has a great concept but disappointingly poor execution. I consistently have distance unaccounted for in my runs. I love connecting with friends, if the app doesn‚Äôt serve its main purpose of accurately logging my runs, then what is the point.
title: Inaccurate tracking. Disappointed.

review: Please default this feature back to ON! This was one of the best features that set Strava apart. I understand the privacy concerns, but why punish everyone.  Leave it the way it was and send reminders to everyone. Make them acknowledge that it‚Äôs okay that this is on, or give them the option right there to disable it!  The way it is now, very few will go out of their way to enable this, thus making it a useless feature for all. This was a great way to find local routes and meet new riders in the area. What a shame.
title: No more Flybys

review: I love this app and been using it for years. Don‚Äôt know what happened but recent update took off the option to resume ‚Äúrecord‚Äù after app crushed or restarted. That‚Äôs super frustrating when after hours of biking everything is deleted... Please bring that option back- Thank you!
title: Can‚Äôt resume after app crush

review:
This app is great for running but it was better before it required a subscription to see certain things on Strava. You have just become another one of those apps begging for money from its users. 
Another issue is the order of activities. I set it up to see activities in order, not random, but it still sets it up as random. Is that another one of those wants that require the person to pay for a subscription?
title: Okay, but...

review: I love this app, but as of the latest update my phone is at 50% battery after just 2.5 mile walk. It makes the app unusable if I want to go much more than 4 miles and still have a working phone. If there is any way to make the additional data collection optional I‚Äôd happily use the app again.
title: Please make new data collection optional

review: Strava has helped change me from a person who likes to run into someone who loves to run. The interface, features and connectivity are awesome. The data in this app has also helped me increase my speed and race times. I‚Äôm a huge advocate and recommend it to runners of all levels.
title: Game changer

review: I‚Äôve been using strava since about October last year. In the last week it has trouble getting runs from my watch to my phone app. They get lost in cyberspace. My watch will say 0 unsynced runs yet my runs haven‚Äôt transferred over. So today I thought, no problem, I‚Äôll run with my phone app running instead. THE RUN STILL DIDN‚ÄôT SHOW UP AFTER SAVING IT. Like literally pressed save and then went to my feed and nothing is there. Why would I pay for an app that acts like this when Nike run club is free and actually works?
title: Loved it but then...

review:
At one time Strava was a great tool for tracking my exercise walks. It‚Äôs so sad that it‚Äôs owners decided to make one of the main features I liked, the monthly activity comparison, a premium feature. Replacing it is a weekly activity summary, which is worthless to me, as it does not consider walking to be an activity and so has remained at zero. 
I‚Äôm now looking for a replacement for Strava.
title: A future former Strava user

review: Of the past five activities I have done, strava has either completely failed to record distance/pace, has lost entire lengthy sections of the run, or loses the entire activity altogether. I make sure I am successfully connected to GPS data and I have rebooted the phone and app several times. I live in the city but I run around area lakes so there is not much obstruction going on with the data either. This app needs a serious repair
title: Loses or fails to record runs

review: Great app, just missing a feature to filter looking through runs/activities somehow (i.e. sorting by public, followers only, and private runs/activities... and perhaps viewing activities by country, by relative distance, trophied activities, by runs with HR data, and so on...)
title: Awesome but could use filter feature

review:
Recently activities are randomly unable to save due to ‚Äúmotion not being detected‚Äù even though pace and distance updates are given (albeit inaccurately) during activity. 

When working as designed, great app and makes the cost of Apple Watch worth it! When working properly...
title: Motion Not Detected

review:
What happened to the segments? We have a ton of paved trails in our area. I used to get comps on my ride through segments. Now I have a ‚Äúno segments found‚Äù. However identical rides found segments. 

Please bring it back. It‚Äôs a neat feature and helps me gauge my effort.

Update, I found if I start my ride from my Apple Watch the segments worked. I‚Äôll see if this is a fix for my issue and respond back. Updating my rating to a 4 for now.
title: Segments?

review: When we started bikedetroit back in 2001, there really wasn‚Äôt a good app out there for tracking or bike rides that my good friend Derek recommended his friend a lady who started this app called Strava. That‚Äôs the only app that I have I‚Äôve shared it over 1000 times.  Thank  you #bikedetroit
title: Strava the Early Years

review:
Great community, comprehensive features and integration, great graphic design. Love it!

The route planning features are unnecessarily hard to find (but awesome when you do find them) 

I would also like to see the ability to add forced straight lines, and import/export gpx in the app.
title: Best of breed, but‚Ä¶

review: My only issue has been the emergency contact beacon. I have 3 contacts, my two boys and my wife. The boys get my beacon and my wife doesn‚Äôt. I have asked Strava and they just ignore me. Considering my wife would be the only one that would actually check up on me‚Ä¶I‚Äôll probably be stranded in the woods somewhere for days.
title: Apple Watch

review: Love to post activities and interact with other athletes on Strava, also love to see what others are doing, very inspirational for me. Would like to see Sailing added & also the ability to change activities in the same session, for example SUP & Swimming
title: Love Strava Community

review: I‚Äôve used this for a year and it seemed to be the best app of its type but today, for the 2nd time, it dropped an extensive ride. I used the phone to take pictures a couple of times but that shouldn‚Äôt have any effect on this app. I‚Äôm now looking for something to replace it with.
title: Drops too many rides

review: I love keeping up with my friends on Strava, and seeing everyone‚Äôs personal photos is the best. One thing I really dislike is all of the photos and screenshots that come from Peloton or Zwift etc. They feel stock-ish and spammy and just plain annoying so I‚Äôd love to be able to mute them or filter them out.
title: Feature request

review: I‚Äôm training for the brooklyn marathon using Strava as a training log and I LOVE it. I appreciate how seamlessly the app interfaces with my garmin account and how many tools and resources it has. 12/10 recommend whether you‚Äôre an experienced athlete or just starting out.
title: I freakin love this app

review: Before any new features it would be nice to have a little robustness to whats already available. Only half of the activities can be selected on the apple watch versus the actual app which is kind of a deal breaker despite having the app for so long because thats kind of the point of the watch‚Ä¶ and apps that say they support it.
title: Forgotten apple watch support

review:
I think Strava should have Widgets because it would be cool to see your running while your off the app and you can look at the widget while running it would be a cool addition 

Overall this app is good!
It‚Äôs awesome and anything can be improved
title: Widgets!

review: I love strava and have been using it for 2 years. Everyone in my biking group uses it. For trial I took strava subscription but I realized I don‚Äôt need additional features so I canceled it. And my app started giving authorization failure. For 2-3 weeks I couldn‚Äôt use save my rides ..
title: Faced issues when I canceled subscription

review: After 4 years of running ive used multiple apps to track my biking and running. Strava is by far my favorite. I love the social engagement and user interface of the app. Very user friendly and very well put together for the price. Well worth it.
title: I‚Äôve used multiple fitness apps

review: I have used Strava for years and love the program but I‚Äôm not a huge fan of the constant changes to the weekly totals and the new leader boards. I do wish there was a way that users didn‚Äôt have to have the new updates.
title: Great app, but stop changing it.

review: I like this app and many of its functions. However, all of a sudden it‚Äôs not calculating the correct mileage for my sneakers. I go by how they‚Äôre feeling, but also rely on the mileage to determine when to change them out.
title: Technical issue

review: In general, I like but definitely rooms for improvement. Recently Strava adds a feature to import Apple Watch workout directly which is great; however it doesn‚Äôt import cadence and weather info! Would be great to include those data as they are important to my my run!!
title: In general, like it

review: This app has many great features that are easy to use. But for at least 4 years, from what I can see, people have been asking for a way to search or see Personal Bests that are recorded in the app. The only way to see them currently is to remember which activity the pr was set, and go to that specific activity record. If the app tracks ‚Äúmedals‚Äù for personal records within each recorded activity, WHY ISNT THERE A MEDALS PAGE?! I just want to see my 5k personal best time, and I‚Äôm pretty sure I set it some time last year.
title: No page for PR search

review: I love the app it really helps keep my workouts in check. Some days I'll do weights and runs or accidentally save a run before I was done and I was wanting a feature where I could have multiple workouts back up then merge them together and title them as one workout?
title: Merging workouts

review: The release notes say they finally fixed a bug with duplicate activities synced to Apple Health. Well now it doesn‚Äôt sync at all with Apple Health. I have checked that the proper permissions were enabled, quit and relaunched the app, hard restarted my phone and even deleted and reinstalled the app (including re-enabling permissions). It‚Äôs still doesn‚Äôt work! This issue, the removal of the ability to pair sensors and constantly pushing Summit is making this app useless. I might as well use the website instead.
title: Not syncing to Apple Health

review: I‚Äôve used Strava for years, it‚Äôs kind of a social network for activities. However they‚Äôve now put so many ads in it I‚Äôve deleted it. But they haven‚Äôt made enough of a value proposition to justify buying it, they just ripped a few features of from Training Peaks and added ads. Rather than actually making the app better. So, thanks for the good times but see ya Strava. üëã
title: Long time user, first time deleter

review: I love this app and use it a lot. The big downside is that you have to log in on a desktop for some stuff like adding gear. This is ridiculous. Everything should be accessible on the app. I should never, ever have to log in to the desktop website. Add full functionality to the app and it‚Äôs a 5 star rating.
title: Great App, Needs Full Functionality

review: I‚Äôm a Strava newbie, but form what I‚Äôve seen and tried, its a pretty nice, stable and accurate app. It‚Äôd be nice if one could access the phone music app, being google music or iTunes, within the app, so one could have a power song, just to give one example. Otherwise, up until now, it‚Äôs a pretty good app. Will review again later on after more uses.
title: Newbie

review:
Thank you Strava for the motivation you provide me and my friends to get up and get moving (fast üòÄor slowüò´)everyday!
Thank you Strava for the inspiration you provide by sharing our stories of perspiration üòÇ from around the world so we get out and get after it again tomorrow! VR, Hammer
title: Motivation and inspiration

review:
At the end of my second tracked ride, I attempted to add photos to it. A first for this app. Because I did not yet have the permissions set, Strava sent me to settings to change photo restrictions which is fine. I hit the very top corner where the recent last app is in iOS. Boom, Strava splash screen for 5-10 seconds and no saved ride anywhere.
Simple, extremely frustrating error.
title: Fun, but major flaw for new users

review: I have been using Strava for years and have been very satisfied with it. With the latest version of it and the new IOS it has become a disaster. It starts recording and then quickly dies out. This happens for 80% of my rides. Please fix it soon or I will have to switch.
title: Sputters our

review:
The phone interface and app had been solid. However the watch is just confusing and not work well
I ran 3miles loop and when pause and finished it said i have to discard it since no movement been detected
I believe strava can do better than that
title: Real hard to use on watch

review: I‚Äôve been using this app consistently for a few weeks now and am deleting it today. It does not keep accurate track of mileage during running. Some days I will have run 5 minutes and it tells me it‚Äôs been a mile, when I know I‚Äôm not that fast, other days I will have run 13 minutes and it tells me it‚Äôs been 0.1 miles when I know I‚Äôm not that slow! I wish it worked better, not sure why it doesn‚Äôt but I‚Äôm over it not helping me keep track of my miles.
title: Does not track mileage accurately

review: I use the app every day on my bicycle and love the beacon option for premium users. The photo option crashes every time I open photos to add them. The app needs the ability to add/create routes from the phone and the online version could be more user friendly for route creation. Willing to up my rating with some advancements and debugs in future versions.
title: Great app but needs some de-bugging and upgrades

review: The iOS app is nearly perfect. The watch version needs some tweaks. Too easy to change workout types when going to the settings. Would love to be able to load training plans to the app. Especially for intervals!
title: Watch app could use some work

review:
Hello,

I have a fully up-to-date Series 3 Watch (OS and app version). Every time I finish an activity after the latest release it says my location has not changed and so it can‚Äôt save the activity. This is after running 7+ miles more than once. I know the GPS is working because it‚Äôs accurately tracking my pace and distance.

PLEASE PUSH A FIX ASAP! This is a bug that makes the app actually useless lol, I really would like this valuable data to not be lost every run.
title: Watch app is totally broken - not able to save runs

review: Sure, it‚Äôs annoying constantly being asked ‚Äúare you on strava?‚Äù by everyone you meet working out, but the truth is - you should be on Strava. It‚Äôs great. Technologically sturdy, integrates with nearly everything, and the social features are great. Just download it.
title: Best Running App

review: Not sure what happened. I‚Äôve used Strava without trouble for years, but now whenever I finish my run and go to save my activity, the app has seemingly flickered on and off and thinks I‚Äôve run a fraction of the distance. It‚Äôs incredibly frustrating. Just now, I ran what I know is 7 miles and Strava is telling me it was 2.14. I‚Äôve tried disconnecting from wifi, turning on/off the auto-pause, using the maps/not using the maps. Nothing.
title: Only tracks one of every four runs‚Ä¶

review: I use Strava daily while I‚Äôm running or biking or working out. I love that it can connect to my watch and it breaks each workout down for me. I just recently purchased the paid version so we will see if it is worth the money.
title: This app is great

review: Maybe I‚Äôm missing it but it seems like it would be easy to share your location with a friend you‚Äôre riding with. This would help when you lose your friends on a ride or something like that. Just a suggestion for a useful upgrade.
title: Friend tracking

review: Strava is the one social network I want to be on right now. Given the shelter in place order here in the Bay Area, Strava has been a huge part of getting me to work out and keeping me motivated this month. I‚Äôve been a premium user for two years and I love it more than ever. Thanks guys. You rock.
title: Lifesaver right now

review: Wish your iPad version could detect that I use my iPad horizontally.  There are a few apps that only go vertical.  Vast majority work both ways. Not Strava.  My rating isn‚Äôt relevant because I just starting using the Mobil app on my phone this week but I was already friended and that was quite a boost to the fun factor.  I‚Äôll come back when I‚Äôm grisled by experience.
title: iPad App Won‚Äôt Go Horizontal

review: Why on earth does Strava have to make political statements? You feel like you have to denounce a political movement. Your app is an exercise platform which I enjoy for what it is. The last thing I want to read when I am looking at the app is politics. The cofounders are virtue signaling so that everybody knows they are ‚Äúgood people‚Äù I don‚Äôt care what you think. I agree with you that what happened at the capital was wrong but why why why do I have to read that when I look at your app? I just want to run and beat my old PR.
title: ‚ÄúLetter from cofounder‚Äù politics?

review: I‚Äôve been using the Strava app for 4 years now and have always loved it, until a year ago! I‚Äôve had nothing but problems with the app completely erasing activities. I‚Äôve had at least 15 rides, runs, and hikes that start recording then disappear before the activity is complete and downloaded. Strava‚Äôs customer service is pretty much non existent. I tried for weeks trying to speak to a customer service rep with no avail. I would never recommend this app to anyone ever again.
title: Strava used to be a great app

review: App worked great for a while and then started to bug out. Decided to purchase it instead of keeping the free version and when the trial period was complete the beacon stopped working. My wife and I both decided to purchase because of the safety feature of the beacon and now we don‚Äôt even have that. Very disappointed that we spent money on something that gives me nothing more than what my Garmin provides.
title: Purchased and then it failed

review: Please please go back to the old format where somethings were free. Now the app is pointless unless you pay them. During the pandemic they thought it was a great idea to capitalized and charge for everything in the app. Not worth much any more other than counting miles. Doesn‚Äôt keep track of weekly or monthly miles any longer. Very basic data. Obvious they tried to make money off the quarantine. Great job Strava! Way to show how to be a company in a capitalistic society.
title: Makes you pay for everything now

review: I‚Äôve used Strava to track my rides for years and I throughly enjoyed being able to geek out on the data. With the recent change I am now forced to pony up $60 yearly to access that same data. I don‚Äôt care about any of the other ‚ÄúSummit‚Äù features, so I will be looking else where to track my rides. It was decent while it lasted. I fully expect some cookie cutter developer response to this review. At least let people export the gps data they have collected.
title: Really Strava?

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava for a many years.  I‚Äôve never purchased the paid version as I constantly have some kind of issue.  From syncing data, to the watch being stuck saying log in, to the most current issue of it not finding a heart rate even when the watch can read my HR in the heart app while strava is running in the backgroundü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.  Having a hard time finding something good to say about the app.
title: Starting to hate Strava

review: This is my go to riding app, but starting in Early November 2019, GPS has been intermittent for most of my rides on my phone and Apple Watch. This happens on ride locations that I never experienced issues in the past. I‚Äôve tried all the tricks including resetting phone and Apple Watch. Help!
title: My favorite app...but

review: The update of February 12 seems to have disabled the transfer of information from the app to iOS. My runs and rides don‚Äôt show up in my rings, in Activity, nor in Settings>Health>Data Access and Devices> Strava> Data. It shows up in my Strava app, but nowhere else in iOS. I haven‚Äôt changed any settings, and logging out of Strava, rebooting, etc has had no effect.
title: Update killed functionality

review: I LOVED this app! It WAS accurate. Now it tracks my runs and rides as the crow flies instead of my actual routes, and the timer quits tracking at 10 seconds giving me really inaccurate times. What‚Äôs up, Strava? This just happened in the last 2 weeks!
title: Something happened...

review: Strava is a wonderful app for tracking workouts, but the new update forces users to change from viewing their miles/kilometers to viewing the amount of time they have worked out on the profile screen. Why isn‚Äôt there a preference option for this? Also, I am a runner, and Strava always defaults to biking. Why isn‚Äôt there an option to change your preferred sport?
title: Great App, Bad Update

review: I have been using Strava for over a year with my Fitbit. I hated that I always had to start my runs with my phone and not my watch.  Finally bought an Apple Watch 3. For the main point of being able to start my runs with my watch. Well Strava won‚Äôt pair with my phone because of motion and fitness. I have re-installed and messed around with it 10 different times. Will be finding another app if Strava cannot fix this.
title: Won‚Äôt pair with my Apple Watch

review:
Horrible experience. Watch app is too dumb to pause HR and other sensors while you're not moving, so if you take a lunch break on a ride you come back with 15% battery gone. Also, just did a ride from SF to Marin and it thinks I biked across the bay rather than the bridge...clearly didn't record any gps data or it was so sparse it drew a line between two points. 

Awful. Only reason I use this is because my historical data is there. Apple's own outdoor cycle activity tracking is way better.
title: Drains battery, messes up GPS data

review: I‚Äôve Then using it for about two years and it has worked very nice for me but my phone GPS isn‚Äôt the best so it doesn‚Äôt record it greatest but I still like this app and it‚Äôs a great way to connect with family and friends
title: Nice

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava (free version) on and off for a few years. I‚Äôve used it with my phone alone, with a Garmin and now with my Apple Watch. Now that I am using it with my Apple Watch, I‚Äôm realizing that it doesn‚Äôt capture calories burned. Everything works well but that. I‚Äôm not sure why this wouldn‚Äôt be an option, it seems pretty useless if it can‚Äôt even track calories.
title: Still lacking

review: Seems to be a decent app. However, lately it has been stopping on its own and then continuing all on its own. I have lost record keeping on some of my rides and more importantly on my longest ride. This really upset me because it cut out my longest and hardest ride. This is a big deal to me due to others I ride with and how I compare myself to them. Very bummed about that. Why would this happen...?
title: Not recording full ride

review: Long time user and fan of Strava. I hate the new algorithm based activity feed. I want the chronological feed back. There has been overwhelming backlash from the users and they aren‚Äôt listening. The social aspects of strava are fun and important to a lot of people, but the emphasis seems to be too heavy on becoming the next social network and not enough on fixing some of the technical issues. I‚Äôll submit a better review if they start listening.
title: We don‚Äôt need a time machine

review: Strava‚Äôs choice to increase subscription prices deserves its own review, but holding users ‚ÄòYear in Review‚Äô stats prisoner‚Ä¶not allowing you to review past years accumulated activity and denying it upon request in written emails to support team‚Ä¶is a new level of pettiness.  The information sits on servers somewhere and making it accessible to paying users is a no brainer. The dismissive email from your ‚Äòsupport‚Äô staff upon seeking explanation for why I can‚Äôt access my information is inexcusable.
title: Petty and Opportunistic

review: Over the last few years, a good app has become great. I like the standard timing features, but added data analytics, 3-D maps, and finding maps in places I'm not familiar makes my like it even more.
title: Comprehensive running app

review: Legendary assassin John Wick retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden death leaves John in deep mourning. When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov and his thugs steal John's prized car and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance. Meanwhile, Iosef's father -- John's former colleague -- puts a huge bounty on John's head. 4 stars
title: This app killed my dog and wife
