review: I never review apps, but I probably like this one the most. I can record my runs, track my progress, and even download my data if I want to. Also, it‚Äôs hard to doomscroll on Strava, so definitely my favorite social media.
title: Strava is a way of life

review: I know Strava has been given a lot of grief for their pricing (and rightly so) but this is still one of my favorite apps. I really don‚Äôt use a lot of the advanced features but still worth the premium for leaderboards.
title: Still one of my favorite apps

review: This app is the best fitness tracker I have ever seen! It is so easy to use and you can do a lot without a subscription. I love to see what my friends are up to and can find anything better then this. 10/10 definitely recommend
title: YOU NEED TO GET

review: My biggest complaint is that if you do a random boost of speed if maybe you need to do strides, Strava will track it horribly. The pace will barely go down from the pace you were at before. FIX THUS BECAUSE ITS SO ANNOYING AND INCONVENIENT
title: Good app, horrible bugs with pace tracking

review: The app is great! However, for an app trying to promote a healthy lifestyle, doubling the calorie burn is simply irresponsible. For people attempting to lose weight by managing their calorie intake, the calorie count is the first thing they look at after a workout. This app will give them a false sense of confidence, which will inevitably lead to overindulgence.
title: Great app, but irresponsible

review: If you are looking for an app that is not about equality than this app is for you! I and other Strava users received a letter from the president about the ‚Äúdomestic terrorist‚Äù who raided the capital. Although I do agree the capital should not have been raided, I am disgusted by the lies the letter included about president Trump! Strava talks about equality, but where was the letter when the BLM supporters destroyed small businesses, killed and beat innocent police officers, and beat innocent people who did not agree with them? Strava has lost any future subscriptions for me!
title: Too political!!!

review: I was using strava for running and used the paid version for some months, as I like to run with the Apple Watch cellular and no phone, I wished they would make the Apple Watch app more useful, it doesn‚Äôt even have a music integration on the watch app, it is very limited and if you don‚Äôt pay, the phone app it‚Äôs very very limited as well, as of now even the Nike Apple Watch app is better!.
title: Needs more

review: I have been an avid strava user for over 4 years- I stopped using garmin and Nike and switched exclusively to strava. However, in my opinion it has lost both its functionality and its charm. It does not genuinely care about the users or Running, but it‚Äôs now in the business of making money. There‚Äôs basically zero features you can access now, including your weekly mileage, without paying premium price for a subscription. Huge bummer. I will be looking for a different app
title: Seriously disappointed

review: I would like to see more challenges. Even for just small meaningless badges. It give a feeling of accomplishment.. the only challenges I‚Äôve seen so far are very advanced challenges. I‚Äôm new to cycling and the easiest challenge at this time is biking 100km in 24 hours. That is over 60 miles. That‚Äôs not achievable for a newby like me.. I wanna earn badges.
title: More challenges

review: I started my free month Trial on Strava. It wouldn‚Äôt let me access the premium features, even though I had signed up for the free trial. When setting up my Apple Watch, it started another trial, but instead simply charged me $60. I‚Äôm not computer illiterate, this is a billing glitch. I have 2 active subscriptions right now and I‚Äôm seeking a refund. This all happened within 30 mins of downloading the app. I can‚Äôt seem to find any customer service contact information.
title: Charged Twice, 2 Active Subscriptions

review: Now locks up every time it tries to update my feed. As of today has lost two of my last three bike rides. Voice announcements for bikers don‚Äôt work and are grayed out in the settings for some reason. Why is this available for walkers:runners and not for bikers??? Segment function doesn‚Äôt seem to work at all. Has started showing my peak speed in excess of 30 mph when I know I haven‚Äôt gone over 15. It tells me I‚Äôm a subscriber but I can‚Äôt seem to get those functions to work.  Very disappointed.
title: Disappointing

review: This app was great! Key word was. Ive had it since it came out and never used the subscription because i didnt need the extra features, which were great, that it provided because i have my garmin app. But now with this update theve taken away the most useful features and now want you to pay for something they've provided for free for years. Its ridiculous how they now want you to pay for basic fucntions you get for free on almost any other activity tracking app. Way to drop the ball with corporate greed!
title: Greed!

review: I like this app a bit, but something that might end up making me switch to a different app is you can‚Äôt add your children‚Äôs bikes and track them while you are riding with them. I would be awesome to see that feature added to the app so parents with little ones can track the mileage their kids ride on their bikes too.
title: Pretty cool app, but needs more options for parents.

review: This app works smoothly, is very clear and easy to use. It‚Äôs also easy to upload runs and activities from other apps! I also really like the ‚Äútrace your own route‚Äù feature, and I like even more that they‚Äôre working on making it better.
title: Love this app!

review:
Strava serves as a really nice platform for us athletic enthusiasts who like to keep up with each other near, far, and very far. Great way to meet people even for when one travels.

Perhaps there can be a feature where one is able to message someone directly. That would be nice.
title: Simple & Fun

review: Strava is a phenomenal app geared to helping us keep track of our workouts which in turn helps us live healthier lives. If this app was as popular as Facebook then the only crisis that America would be having would be running out of running shoes.
title: The App America Needs but not the One it Wants

review: Strava is an awesome way to see how you run and ride and compare to others. Also a great way to hook up with friends, or make new ones!! Very easy to use and navigate. Also great for when your Garmin is not working, you can track your event easily on your mobile device.
title: Great APP for runners/cyclists

review: I WAS really liking Strava but recently it isn‚Äôt recording properly. I have deleted and reinstalled the app, and logged out and back in. I start the app and the auto pause is going on. I disabled the auto pause so now it will at least record my rides but it doesn‚Äôt give me any distance or speed while using the app. It just will display 0‚Äôs. It also hasn‚Äôt been accurate with mileage when i can get it to record.
title: Great app when it works.

review:
I really appreciate the ease of uploading data from my Garmin to their app and it auto syncing with Strava, however there is a lot missing on the app. A few major features are ‚Äúlaps‚Äù, which actually show up on the web but not the app. This makes it impossible to make sense out of any workout on a track or has warmup / cool downs incorporated. 

Also, why not add swapping your gear on the app?
title: Love Strava but please unify app + web

review: I have an Apple Watch 4. I‚Äôve been riding the last week in Germany and France. For some reason whenever I enable this Stava app on my Apple Watch it will not shut down when i am done and close the app. I‚Äôve closed it numerous times and the soon as I do it shows up again draining my battery. I thought this might be because the Strava app was turned on my iPhone. Not the case. So for now I have deleted the app from my Apple Watch and just use my iPhone for tracking my routes.
title: Works well on my iPhone ‚Äì not on my Apple Watch

review: Strava is the great social media for us athletes who want to improve in our running, biking or any other sport. I love the matched workout features as it shows me how my training is going compared to past weeks or years.
title: My social media app!

review: I was going on a cycling tour( still am on one)and  wanted to track it and I came across this app, and thought right on just what I wanted... Well it wasn't what expected as it wanted me to sign in and put in my my credit card. So I exited the app and deleted it. Next thing I know my card had been charged. 7.99 put me in the negative ( so that's an extra 30 bucks for bank over draft fees) and when on a bicycling tour I only keep enough in the account to cover my bills.
title: Took my money and I didn't even sign up

review: Apple Watch 3 GPS+Cellular...opening on the watch asks for login or signup on the phone.  No other options available.  Starting an activity on the phone makes no difference.  Watch has been added as a device on the phone app, full permission granted, etc.  Won‚Äôt run on the watch at all.
title: On your phone, login or signup using the Strava app

review: I really like the app. I just done like that you cannot unthumbs up a thumbs up you accidentally gave.  This makes no sense. Can you please change this, so if this happens again or to others we can undo the thumbs up given??  Please let me know if you can make these changes. And I am able to rate this app a 5 stars. As I do love the app, but do not like that you cannot do that!
title: Disappointing in the thumbs up

review: Love the app for fitness tracking. The FB mimicry is disappointing. I liked strava bc it was less garbled and less like the other social networks. I get you‚Äôre trying to increase engagement. Then come up with something unique, rather than just miming FB/IG. And, last thing: the paywall gobbling up an increasing number of features is a bummer. That is all.
title: It ain‚Äôt Facebook for a reason

review: Strava use to be great but now it stops recording half way through my bike ride as well as stops sending my location on Beacon.  I don‚Äôt even know how to contact them to file a complaint. When it works, it‚Äôs awesome. Met a lot of other bikers in my town.
title: Issues with recording and with Beacon

review: I don‚Äôt want to be automatically added with people that I am not even following.  I you have to have your profile somewhat open to participate in challenges.  You should not have to compromise privacy to participate in challenges.
title: Privacy is an issue.

review: I need it to work every time. It lost track of me halfway through an 8 mile run when I was on an unfamiliar route. I didn‚Äôt discover it had quit for maybe another mile and a half. And I couldn‚Äôt get it going again. This has happened maybe once a month which doesn‚Äôt sound like a lot but I need to be able to trust it on long runs. I‚Äôm out.
title: Great when it works, but...

review:
Not the most bug-free app/platform in the world. However, if there is an issue, their support team will get it fixed in no time given the proper diagnosis information. Pleased to see such tech support in an era where many platforms are simply released and never maintained.
See it, say it, sorted!
title: Proper tech support

review: This was a great app, recent updates have taken away all useful and enjoyable parts and moved it behind a huge paywall. This app provides nothing more than a nice bike computer does unless you decide creating your own routes is worth 8 dollars a month even though it used to be free. I would consider subscribing if their maps weren‚Äôt horribly outdated and the generate route tool didn‚Äôt put you on highways and other not bike friendly roads. Great ideas, poor execution, and high prices
title: Only useful features cost huge fees

review:
This used to be a favorite app of mine. Sad to see the most basic of features now requiring a subscription. Especially in a time where many of the athletes that enjoy those features the most may be struggling financially. 

There are plenty of other activity tracker options that now offer the same or better for free. Back to Trailforks for me so I have a map of the trail network and can recoded all in one app.
title: Plenty of other apps in the sea

review: Seriously, remove everything unless I pay $60? If it was a more reasonable monthly fee I‚Äôd MAYBE consider it. No one wants to shell out $60 to support an app that removed stuff that was free for years OVERNIGHT. So either $60 (not once, but yearly!) or $8 freakin dollars a month. If things don‚Äôt change back, I have no reason to use the app any more. I liked the way it tracked things better than garmin, but I‚Äôll probably just have to keep using garmin and delete this one.
title: All features are gone unless you pay $60

review: I‚Äôve been using Strava  on my  Apple Watch and it only syncs to my Activities via a third party app. I recently got into cycling and the iPhone app i OK not display my average MPH which can‚Äôt be changed to current MPH. Also, 55 minutes into my ride, the distance display changed to my location on a map and I could t toggle back to the original display. It was very disappointing and killed my mood.
title: Could Be Better

review: I track my cycling rides with Strava now as their interface is the best to use. The info I need to see is large, and everything can be seen at a glance on my bike mounted iPhone. Strava has done a great job over the years continually improving their app. So useful to me.
title: Big display, easy to see the essentials

review: I just realized that Strava dropped support for heart rate monitors. This is a feature I‚Äôve enjoyed using for years. Their explanation is, basically, that their software was buggy, and rather than pay one of their developers to fix the software, they just dropped features. But I thought they were a software company? It seems that they could back off of their recent feature bloat, and allocate resources to maintaining the features that their users already use.
title: Took away a favorite feature

review: I use my Garmin Fenix 5x watch to record my runs, and then upload my records to the app only to find the app continually cutting .1 of a mile all the way up to an entire mile from my runs so it looks like I ran a lot less than I have. I use this for work to show my boss when I‚Äôm working out and how much I‚Äôm working out so it‚Äôs very irritating to see this because it makes me look bad. Would not refer anyone to use this app until it is fixed.
title: Confused

review: By and large I like the app. However, there is a very frustrating bug: after completing hikes outside of cell service, the next time I open the app it just freezes at the loading screen. Closing the app does not fix the problem‚Äî only solution I have found is to restart my phone, which is very annoying.
title: Good features, frustrating bug

review: Please upgrade this application. Make it possible to view graphs zoom in out something like Training Peaks. Also provide setting so we could choose what‚Äôs most important for us like instead of having speed on X-axis have time so the graphs look more realistic.
title: Upgrade please

review: This app is awesome for comparing segments other athletes have put in place and attempt to best others who have run or biked the same segment.  However runs in indoor tracks or treadmills grossly under report mileage through my Garmin Fenix 3 and there‚Äôs no way to edit the posting with correct mileage.  Summery:  great outdoor app.  Poor indoor app.
title: Great App but...

review:
One star: App is intermittently and incorrectly pausing. Unreliable recording makes it useless for recording rides and sharing location. When can we expect a fix? This issue seems to have been hounding me since iOS 11 update.

UPDATE to three stars: Version 39 installed and I can (tentatively) say that the issue did not rear its ugly head when recording a ride yesterday I‚Äôll test more and update.
title: Strava app fails to record

review: It used to be lightweight and snappy, but new version uses too much phone process.  It gets locked up mid ride and loses the ride detail. Bad bad bad.  This is a pretty new iPhone 8 too so I have a phone that should handle it.  Bummer.  I‚Äôd hate to switch apps but this is no good.
title: It WAS great but new version loses ride details

review: I love tracking my activities with strava, I use it multiple times a week. I have two wishes to improve my use of this app. I wish I could search/sort my activities to find a specific run and I wish the statistics portion of my profile show my fastest 1k, 5k, 10k, etc with the option to click on that activity. Thanks for such a great app!
title: Great tool,

review: The beta is awesome! Cuts down creation time by at least have. All the filter options make it easy to find new paths get creative. One option I would love to see is ‚ÄúReverse‚Äù, so you could have turn-by-turn in opposite direction
title: Route Pencil tool

review: Really wish that voice directions when you select use saved route would automatically enable voice directions from the start of selecting to use route. That would be super nice and worth the money if it did it..
title: Maps

review: Great app overall, just has one downside. No turn-by-turn audio navigation for Apple Watch. As someone who only runs with my watch - it renders the routing feature useless. Please consider adding that feature please!
title: Turn-by-turn navigation for Apple Watch please!

review:
Strava is great when it works. Every one of three times it throws an error or just simply doesn‚Äôt load anything.

It‚Äôs missing basic features like dark mode and threaded comments. For a service that gets such huge monthly subscriptions you‚Äôd think they‚Äôd invest in these things.

At this point I feels like the app is run by a skeleton crew.
title: Glitchy

review:
A couple of things- would be great to overlay current or future weather forecast when designing a route. 

Calendar functionality - ability to plan certain route on particular day for calendar.
title: Great!

review: I use Strava as a form of motivation, holding myself responsible for my training as well as others. I also like it for tracking my workouts and comparing my training. It‚Äôs nice to be able to follow top athletes in the sport to see how they train as well.
title: Great motivator

review: Many features became premium only a couple years back, so the free experience is not what it used to be, particularly segment leaderboards. The experience with a subscription is nice, minimal bugs, and nice features, but perhaps not worth $60 a year unless you have a heart rate monitor and power meter.
title: Pay to Play

review: Every update is essentially stripping the app of basic features and asking users to pay to access them. Extremely disappointed.
title: Useless if you don't pay

review: I strongly dislike the latest Strava update. It seems like app functionality is decreasing with each update. Why would you remove the interactive weekly mileage chart from the profile section of the app? It was great for seeing progress over time. Now it‚Äôs been moved to the feed and it‚Äôs far less useful. Bring back the old chart!
title: Bring back weekly mileage chart!

review: I downloaded this app on the recommendation of others because I like to track my daily walks and monthly mileage totals. With the most recent update, it no longer tracks my walks at all, other than showing them under activities. I really liked this app, but I‚Äôm forced now to search for an app that will meet my needs, because Strava no longer does.
title: No longer tracks walks

review: The latest few updates have made this app pretty useless for its free users. They have taken away the ability to see leaderboards for free. This was pretty much the main feature of the app as it allowed you to compete against people and see where you stack up. Now the app is full of micro transactions. All of this monetization to use features that used to be free. Guess we‚Äôll have to find a new app to take it‚Äôs place.
title: Was great until the recent updates

review: Tracks everything for you! Miles, route, pace...even reminds you when you need new shoes! The best part is Strava connects you with friends and this has made me push Harding during workouts! Don‚Äôt want my friends thinking I‚Äôm taking it easy!!!
title: Best Running/Cycling app hands down!

review: Every time I run with this, regardless of where or how long, it gets my times wrong. They‚Äôre correct during the run (the verbal feedback), but once they‚Äôre uploaded to the phone, they‚Äôre wrong. And I don‚Äôt mean the annoying problem where you have to manually set each run to a race so it doesn‚Äôt count stops. I mean, I thinks I‚Äôm running 2 minute kilometers, which is just wrong. I‚Äôve tried submitting errors repeatedly, but it‚Äôs still wrong. So Im going to, sadly, move to a new app.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work with Apple Watch

review:
Really Strava? Deciding to charge $60 annually in the midst of a pandemic for features that were previously free? Great timing. Leaderboards and the ability to see how my PRs change over time are great features and the only things I care about on the app and are now premium only. 

App works well, would have rated it 5 stars until this new update in May 2020. Too bad, have loved using the app but $60 annually isn‚Äôt worth it for a couple of exercise features.
title: Poor form

review: This was a proper greedy move by this company to take the existing data and features of the user and then shove it to subscription services. I‚Äôm going to delete this app and not use it again as I have no reason to do so anymore. It was a good app with leaderboard, weekly run and route making but when the company gets lazy they try to simply con the subscribers instead of providing new features.
title: Giving a one star because of their latest update to move existing features to subscription

review: Go to profile, select the bike tab view, scroll down and tap into yearly statistics, once in yearly statistics the view resets to running view. Love the app but it's always annoying when the bike view I selected when I first land in profile switches to running for no reason.
title: Possible nav bug

review: I would love this app if we could correct time/distance for activities. I use a garmin, which does not track treadmill workouts accurately, or sometimes forget to stop my watch after run. I can edit the entry in Connect to match treadmill but the corrected data does not import to Strava. Not worth paying for upgrade and probably won‚Äôt even keep the free version. Too bad because I like their other features.
title: Can‚Äôt edit distance or time

review: I‚Äôve been a long term user of Strava and a happy customer since 2013.  Something went wrong with your most recent update (last 5 or 6 days).  The app (Strava) stopped sending data to the Health App on my phone.  I‚Äôve tried troubleshooting the issue multiple times, checked and double checked that Strava is enabled to transfer data to iOS (both read and write) and it‚Äôs not working.  Don‚Äôt know if this has been reported or not but losing the connectivity is not good.  Help!
title: Most recent update

review:
The only thing keeping this app from being 5 stars for me, and I bet a lot of other people, is the inability to manual lap on my watch. If I‚Äôm doing hill reps or 400s or something like that I would love to be able to lap it. I have to switch to my Garmin when I do workout runs for this reason. 

It seems like manual lap should be a no brainer with ANY running app
title: Manual Lap Please!

review: Strava is a necessary evil with a Peloton bike. Strava disabled their API for Tapiriik a month ago, so it‚Äôs near impossible now to get your Strava data - via app or website or their API - into Garmin, Dropbox, etc. Please add better features into your app, or restore Tapiriik‚Äôs API access to sync my data out of Strava. Or just build real integration with Garmin, instead of the shoddy one-way method where you will gladly take data from any fitness tracker but won‚Äôt let us export/sync it out.
title: Fix your broken API to Tapiriik

review:
Social media for active folks!  

Love so many aspects of Strava. Segments, HR, elevation change, speed, ability to look at trends, comparison in age group, with "following" and other sets of folks. 

Wud like one small addition: to be able to categorize separately rides with others (drafting) or alone.
title: Truly well done ap

review: Like on the desktop website where you can view training logs, the app could use that feature to make it way easier to see all of the training on one page without having to scroll through each individual training session.
title: Could add Training Log

review: Overall has been a solid running app. Love the audio cues during my runs and how quickly the app starts up(very responsive). Really miss the ability to customize which metrics I see on the watch during a run.  Should also have a more detailed summary with splits on the watch when you finish a run
title: Could be great

review:
The best sport tracking app there is! Yes there is the best sport tracking app there is, but come on!! GarminConnect already has a multisport view!!! Who is interested in ‚Äúmorning activity‚Äù (my transition from swim to bike) on its own!!!!
Besides it wont benefit just triathletes, there is duathlon biathlon, swim-run races and brick workouts!!!!
title: Absolute Best!!! If and when we get a multisport view

review: I‚Äôm a tech geek and have used Polar Watches and Heart Rate Monitor Straps since before Apps were invented. Strava was and still is the best user friendly designed fitness APP available. I have multiple devices that are paired with my Strava APP and they work flawlessly.
title: Long time fan!

review: I love using Strava and have not had many issues, but with the most recent update my calorie information no longer syncs with the apple health app even though the workout and exercise time does without any issue. Little disappointed I guess I have to wear my Apple Watch during all rides to ensure I get credit for all of my workouts.
title: Last update broke the apple interface

review:
I have used strava for several years. As a nearly 60 year
old rider do I really care how I rate overall on segments?  Better give us a trigger choice to determine our point of comparison.  Hint it will be age group for a lot of us in your older demographic. Without this feature soon I will drop this subscription.  Been subscribing for several years and no substantive update.
title: Needs work to maintain base

review: The last two updates to this app have just made it go from bad to worse. I know you need to keep your developers employed, fix the bugs, but making changes for the sake of making changes is not progress. You need to revert back a couple versions. Does anybody there actually use this app?
title: User

review: The app has worked really well up until this week. It will track my runs perfectly, but when I save them it does not save the whole run, only half. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs in the app or the iPhone update. Just be aware and keep a close eye on it if you like to keep accurate times.
title: Having issues

review: I have the free version.  I am never going to pay for premium. With that said the newest update just made this app even less valuable then the previous ones.  Now I cant even see my weekly totals unless I upgrade to premium.  I realize it is not free to build and maintain but come on.   How petty can you be as a company to not even let me see a total of my activities.  I just hope I can still export my activity history for free.   But I am sure there will be a fee for that too.
title: The usefulness is fading quickly

review: This is a social media app with some fitness metrics. Overall the app is great for tracking and sharing fitness activities. However, it is NOT worth the large price increase for a subscription to a social media app to share you activities. My Garmin and Apple Health do it for free and provide WAY more insight into my workouts. Save your money and time, use the free version if you want to share, use something else to track fitness metrics.
title: Great app, not worth the raise in price

review: I use Strava for all of my runs and rides. Seamlessly pairs with my Garmin watch. Free version is great and Premium is even better. Would recommend you start with the free version because I only got the paid version recently, but I‚Äôm a huge fan of this app.
title: If it‚Äôs Not on Strava, It Didn‚Äôt Happen

review: Strava decided to move features (even basic ones, such as comparing to previous activities) that have been free for a decade to their paid subscription. Absolutely ridiculous that they can‚Äôt come up with added value to make you want their subscription, but instead they cripple their app and move existing functionality to a paid tier. Will move to a different app instead.
title: Great app, until paying for existing features

review: I like Strava but not the best app for me.  I wish it showed one mile markers and had an audible which told me every time I completed a mile.  I also would like to be able to download a route and get turn by turn directions.  The social aspect is ok but not that important to me.
title: Like not love

review: I have used this app for about a year and Logged over 2000 miles (free version)It needs a map update and the ability to rename bikes without having to delete them to rename them. Other than that I am pleased with the app. Great job at keeping the platform ad free!
title: Very Happy

review: You‚Äôre not fully in charge of your privacy with this app. Some things can‚Äôt be disabled. Some settings are hard to find. Some things can only be adjusted on the web site.  Strava shares way to much for me. Their privacy controls only give you some control, not full control. I canceled my sub and deleted the app after 2 months of use due to privacy concerns. It‚Äôs not that hard to put me in charge of all my privacy Strava. You chose not to do that so I‚Äôm out.
title: Due to privacy concerns I deleted and canceled.

review: I have been a long time user. The last few updates they have kept removing features and making them paid. You can‚Äôt even see your own history or compare against friends anymore. App no longer gives me any value. Hopefully another company will do this. I may not be their target audience anymore since I‚Äôm not willing to pay $60 a year for this. I just deleted my account and hope another company will add this functionality.
title: Great app before recent update

review: Strava is one of my favorite apps but they keep charging you for features. I‚Äôm 17 I don‚Äôt have 60$ to drop on an app. The app is also kinda hard to navigate and they should have message features so you can create groups to ride run swim with ext.. they should make it so you can add videos part of the fun of MTB is showing off sick videos. Love the app but it could be way better and they need to stop making us pay.
title: Strava could be amazing

review: I used to give this app a 5 star rating for everything. But with the newest update they took away rankings unless you subscribe. Look everything is subscription now. It‚Äôs getting old. The segment tracking was part of the draw, now I have to pay? Even though I‚Äôve been using this for years with the base app? Come on people!
title: Segment tracking is now subscribers only

review:
I‚Äôve used this app for years, but now I cannot turn off the horrible voice giving me split and mile updates during my run. Yes, I adjusted all the settings and yes I deleted and reinstalled the app. It‚Äôs made this the most frustrating and terrible app ever. I pay for Premium and want my money back. Try to get help on the website? Good luck with that.

This is till true one month later. No one from support helps. Bad ap.
title: Do not buy!!! Can‚Äôt turn off audio cues.

review: After every update there is always a issue with uploading the activities from your Apple Watch to the app. Have to reset up everytime and the latest update became worse. Now it takes forever to upload a activity or it doesn‚Äôt even sometimes. I have the Apple Watch 2 does anyone else have the same problem?
title: Update issues.

review: I loved it when release notes were introduced by Scott the iOS engineer and the rest of the team. It‚Äôs much more friendly than the usual ‚Äúwe update to bring you the latest features and fixes‚Äù. Bring back Scott and friends!
title: Bring back Scott and friends

review: I have used this app for two years now and it has been absolutely stellar until about a month ago... I‚Äôm unsure if it is the auto pause feature acting up but my last 6 rides have all stopped recording at the 10.7 mile mark or 17~ mile mark. Not great when you don‚Äôt realize it stopped until recording three hours later. This has happened with auto pause both off and on.
title: Stops recording

review:
Strava is a fine fitness tracker, and there‚Äôs only one thing keeping me from giving it five stars:

I wish I could track splits post ride (I‚Äôm a biker). For instance, I would like to see what my average speed is after my warmup. And I‚Äôd like to vary my splits from, say, a half mile and higher. Post ride. This enables me to see how I did on a hard slope or where I might have pedaled some high intensity intervals. 

This would obviously work for runners and swimmers, as well.

Other than that, I love Strava

Keep up the great work Devs. For me, with my watch, Strava is rock solid reliable at this time. - enough that Im a premium member.
title: Great but would like to see one feature

review: Please allow smart phone users the ability to select shoes used for hikes and walks on the app. I like to keep track of the miles on my shoes but I don‚Äôt always run which is the only exercise on the app that gives you that option.
title: Shoes used options

review: I love the app, but I wish that I could access my previous best times. I like the awards for having a top time, but I can‚Äôt find the historically ranked information anywhere. I‚Äôm paying for the premium app as well. I thought this would be a given.
title: Need more data

review:
Great app! But it would be great to be able able to see my or others KOMs listed on their profiles. 

Also, can we please get week/month rankings on segments on the mobile app?? 

As of now these things can only be done on the website.
title: KOM listings and Weekly/Monthly segment times please!!

review: Don‚Äôt get this app if you don‚Äôt want to be frustrated. It literally decides when it wants to record my runs and when it doesn‚Äôt. Today I got back from a long run only to find that Strava hadn‚Äôt even recorded the first mile, even though I had pushed start. It also gave me the wrong time. Sometimes it records them perfectly, but sometimes it doesn‚Äôt record at all. Please fix this, it‚Äôs getting ridiculous.
title: Doesnt record my runs

review: Huge fan of strava! My only suggestion would be to somehow flag/remove those people who earned a KOM by accidentally or purposefully leaving their strava on in there car. It‚Äôs usually pretty obvious to tell when you analyze their ride and segment. Running up hill at 40mph huh? Everything else is on point! Thanks guys!
title: FALSE KOM‚Äôs

review:
This has worked well for the past two years tracking my mileage and mapping my commutes.
Had a recent hiccup with GPS reception over the last week; Strava support was very helpful getting to the root cause. Turned out to be an iOS update I‚Äôd missed.
Back on the trail!
title: Solid

review: I was required to use either this or runkeeper for a runbet to track runs. Went for my first run tonight, which needed to be at least 30 mins. I purposely ran 32 to give myself a buffer in case the app was glitchy. I went to submit my run on runbet, and I was rejected for being too short. Some how my time was miraculously lowered to under 29 minutes. Now, after working a long stressful shift as a nurse on my feet all day...I‚Äôm at the gym trying to get another 30 minutes in :/ very frustrating!
title: Beware if using for a runbet

review: Couple bugs with the calorie counter when cycling but not when walking. The app helps me keep track of my exercises which sorta motivates me to the lifestyle going. Now to just get this diet part squared away. Good luck y‚Äôall
title: So it‚Äôs somewhat reliable

review: The Apple Watch app is great as a stand alone Strava app when you can‚Äôt take your phone (or Garmin) with you. However, when one has there phone with them, the app should know and have the capability to simply sync to the iPhone app and mirror its data. It would be great to have a map on my phone screen mounted to my handle bars and data like mph and heart rate displaying on my watch.
title: Review for the Apple Watch App.

review: Strava is great. I‚Äôve been using it for about 7 years. And if you‚Äôre really into metrics and data, paying for the subscription WAS a great option. The price WAS right for the features you were getting. The annual subscription price went from $60 a year to $80 and friends, that‚Äôs not no worth it anymore. I‚Äôll still use Strava, but I won‚Äôt pay for it anymore.
title: Not worth the money

review: This app is great and I have people watching me along the way to check up on me. Lately though, it isn‚Äôt allowing me to stop the workout when I finish which of course causes problems because if I stop moving it wants to call SOS
title: Love it except it won‚Äôt let me end workout

review: Love the many different activities available and the way the app compares to other activities. I love tracking the pace and the progress and profile. Super easy to use! So glad I joined this and became a member! Definitely recommend.
title: Love Strava

review: With the new subscription system it is time for me to leave Strava. They are happiIy collecting our data for their purposes, but give nothing in return. GARBAGE, they don‚Äôt give a f***! I used to love the Summit version as you were able to only use the features you needed. Also segments are gone for long time users now. With the new system you are forced to buy whole package of unneeded features. NO, THANK YOU!!! There is more suitable apps around!
title: Time to walk away from Strava

review:
Don‚Äôt get it. I‚Äôm a premium member and have been for several years. They no longer respond to customer service issues. 

I‚Äôve emailed them on the app and have messaged their Twitter account customer support account. Crickets. It‚Äôs like they just threw in the towel.

Running is an important part of my life and I pay for this app because of that. But I‚Äôm going to cancel my subscription due to their abandonment of customers. It‚Äôs unethical.
title: They quit customer service for premium members

review: I am so motivated by other local runners & runners across the country & even internationally. I‚Äôve made friends through Strava & people really encourage one another - slow or fast - it doesn‚Äôt matter. Love the data it provides.
title: So grateful I found Strava!

review: This is a great app. I am a young cyclist fresh out of college and I was not able to afford a good ride computer. The GPS ride tracking made that much less of a problem. If you want a sense of community and friendly competition, this app is for you.
title: You Get What You Pay For.

review: Prior to Strava pushing for subscription $‚Äôs, you could ask ANYONE on ANY trail, if they were on Strava; check the flyby, check and compare your time vs. their time and compare your own rides over time. This was a THRIVING COMMUNITY. Then you CHANGED your business strategy and the community has fallen apart. This change along with the rise of e-bikes has destroyed what was once an outstanding growing community of athletes using your APP to improve, train and compete with like minded athletes.
title: Shot yourself in the foot!

review: although minor, the bug with the badge alert icon on IOS is annoying. The badge icon shows an alert but when the app is opened there is no alert shown until you open, close and then reopen the app
title: badge alert bug

review: Better than nothing. Better in some ways than anything. Mostly does what it should. Stable, keeps its satellite connection. But it thinks all biking is the same - doesn‚Äôt distinguish between road & mountain. Calories-burned estimates are bound to be inaccurate, but 10 mph lollygagging on the road vs 10 mph ripping on singletrack ate entirely different. Not on Strava.
title: Better than nothing

review: Setting up the sync with my Garmin 830 and Garmin Instinct was a breeze.  ‚ÄúYou can be it if you can‚Äôt measure it!‚Äù  Strava provides 3 week averages for effort on runs which clearly tracks my workouts.  Also, it tracks my PR‚Äôs (personal records) and keeps a record of routes I take frequently.
title: Syncing Strava with Garmin Devices

review:
All the functionalities are there, but your workout goals must be in line with what Strava thinks your goals should be.  

For instance, if I want to look down and see what my average speed is, or average heart rate: not gonna happen.  And you can see about a decade worth of complaints regarding this lack of display customization, but strava seems to have no interests in addressing it, which is why I give this one star

Download the Jabra app instead.  Their headphone/app combo wins hands down simply because of this feature
title: No customzation

review: Like the app a lot just one problem, I got the app so I could find trails easier but the segment page needs some work. It barely works and you can never find a trail that your looking for. If you are looking for a trail map app get Trailforks. Other than that I love the app
title: Segments...üòí

review: I just discovered that i no longer have access to my results as part of the free version of Strava. It‚Äôs fine if they want to make that a paid thing going forward, but it‚Äôs just wrong to take away access to my own stats when it used to be free. I will definitely not be giving Strava a dime of my money and i will actively start testing the competition to find something that respects me as a user. Horrible business model Strava.
title: Not happy about change to subscription

review: Strava is incredible. They are constantly adding new features and do an incredible job listening to their users. Glad they are pivoting more into a model that will sustain them in the long term with Summit. I want this app around for a long time
title: Great app that keeps getting better

review: When I first got Strava I loved it. All my friends would watch the leader boards and compared our previous efforts. However, now all these cool features that made Strava great have been taken off the free version and are now only available on the premium. It‚Äôs disappointing as a long time Strava user to keep having features taken away from you. I might as well just use Garmin Connect and get rid of Strava.
title: Keep Taking Features Away

review:
I removed the app from my watch then re-downloaded.  Back to normal.  Yay!

Ugh...
I using the watch app (gen 1) since I cannot record my heart rate using the phone app only.  Watch app continuously crashing since update.  I have rebooted both devices numerous times, still no luck.  
Please address.
title: Update...New update, watch now crashes!

review: I loved Strava for the competitive nature. I always compared my results against others and used that to motivate my training. Others have already said enough about the update but suffice to say it‚Äôs really unfortunate and really took away from the Strava experience not being able to compare results and see KOMs, etc. It‚Äôs hard but I‚Äôm considering not using the app anymore.
title: It would be 5 stars if it weren‚Äôt for the update

review: Right on schedule, the recent update broke the Apple integration again!!!  Not sure why Strava struggles so to keep the Apple integration working but it‚Äôs a major pain.  The application was working great until I updated this morning.
title: Broke again

review: What was once a great training tool has been hampered for the sake of subscription revenue, but at the cost of the app‚Äôs core competencies. Gone is the integration with Relive, and basic functionalities have been pushed into the paid ‚ÄúSummit‚Äù version. It‚Äôd be one thing If there was tiered pricing but the only subscription option includes all sorts of poorly thought out bloat. So here we are after five plus years, uninstalling what was once my favourite app.
title: A shadow of its former self.

review: I am a longtime paid Strava user who enjoys the app. Would it kill the folks at Strava to allow segment filtering? Many people, like myself, would appreciate being able to search for segments of specific length (for ex. 1-3 miles, or anything longer than .25 miles - which would also eliminate a ton of clutter.
title: Please allow segment filtering

review: I‚Äôve always kept a log book ‚Äúto know what I‚Äôve done to feel this way‚Äù.  Being able to go back to go forward is a huge help. Also seeing where others ride when going on a new adventure is a nice short cut in planning.
title: Great organizer

review: Love the app. But there are serious problems since the update with syncing from Apple Watch. It worked fine before. Now if I start a workout on the Strava app on my watch, it won‚Äôt upload. Syncs forever and tells me to check data connection. So I restart my phone and all that. Then it‚Äôll upload... but without calorie counts. And it will still say it has a pending upload. I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on, but strava broke it.
title: Syncing watch

review:
After the latest update, Strava changed the overall time to the nearest minute, but it is much better at the nearest second. Please change it back! 
(Overall, the app is great! That is my only concern)
title: Please put overall time to the second!

review:
I have always loved Strava but since getting the be Apple Watch none of my runs are saved in the history in my watch. I have tried all the trouble shooting I have seen online and and really tired of logging out and back into my account to recover the data. Will have to quit using this app until issue is fixed.

It‚Äôs been several months now and the issue has not been fixed! Will be deleting this app!! So sad used to be a great app!
title: Wont‚Äô keep history on Apple Watch 5

review: Overall it‚Äôs okay. The one big thing that the app should do is connect with the cellular Apple Watch. It will not connect to the app directly until you have the phone to sync up to it. Because of this the app sometimes doesn‚Äôt come up with the watch when trying to run.
title: Strava on the Apple Watch 4

review: I love strava and it‚Äôs a great app for runners. I like being able to comment on my teammates workouts. My only complaint is that I can‚Äôt give kudos to myself. I like to give kudos to everyone and then my runs don‚Äôt have the orange thumbs up so I think I forgot to give kudos to someone. And what if I‚Äôm proud of myself?! I deserve kudos. Please let me give myself kudos I‚Äôm begging you Strava.
title: Good app

review: After the recently update, watch app doesn‚Äôt work. Start screen does not respond when you touch it, therefore could not start a running session. Besides, the sync function has problems, it keeps telling me my previous activity is ready to upload
title: Watch app crush

review: I like the app a lot (I paid for summit just to support a good app). Now it‚Äôs screwing up on the most important feature: recording my activities.  On my last several rides it‚Äôs missing 6-7miles of my ride on each ride. I don‚Äôt know if it is an issue on my phone or with the software, but I do know that Strava gives users no way for users to correct the issue despite the many, many requests on their support site to do so.
title: Great, then buggy

review:
I had the phone app for awhile, and it‚Äôs great. Then a few months ago I got an Apple Watch. So I paid for summit and was excited to finally see my heart rate. But I couldn‚Äôt see the heart rate on my phoneüò©. Being able to sync my heart rate between the Watch and the phone would be huge.
Also with the workout app on the Apple Watch and with Nike run club I can easily see the music right from the app on the Apple Watch.
title: Please, better Apple Watch support

review:
Have been a Strava user since the beginning and love the app. I do have to admit that I am a little frustrated by your updates, however. 

Seems like every other update and my iPhone is unable to talk to my Bluetooth HR sensor (Wahoo Tickr). Very frustrating. 
Please add some sensor testing to your agile release cycle.
title: More QA, guys!

review: Once I learned I could still track GPS location in low power and/or airplane mode, my battery survives several-hour rides. Makes tracking and showing off easy!
title: Using offline makes this a no brainer

review: I‚Äôve used the app about half a dozen times and I‚Äôm about 50-50 for what actually gets tracked. Coming from Nike run club, I wasn‚Äôt expecting this issue (NRC rarely failed) but this is pretty frequent. I‚Äôd still be on NRC if it was able to track cycling. These issues make the app not fun.
title: Iffy tracking

review:
Why can‚Äôt you add a mode for downhill days. It would be simple enough to allow a ‚Äúshuttle‚Äù mode, or ‚Äúpark‚Äù mode. This will stop the complaints from the roadies whose KOM I just squashed while shuttling up to the top. Popular resorts could have auto shuttle mode that ignores the well know lift segments, keeping our climbing numbers honest. You could also have a feature that automatically notice I was going 60MPH uphill and ask if I wanted to change mode. 
Thanks
title: Show some love for real MTB and show descending stats. Also support a shuttle mode

review: Easy to use, accurate, fun challenges, stay in touch with friends...and race against their times. Only thing I would change would be to indicate hundredths of a mile, not just 2.1, for example...2.18mi like some other apps do. Thanks for a great product!
title: My running buddy!

review: Not sure if anyone else is having this issue, but when using Strava on the series 3 Apple Watch the program pauses every time I look at it to see my pacing and time. It gets annoying that I can‚Äôt look at my watch as it will auto pause and interrupt the recording. It‚Äôs good for what it does but is there a way to fix this feature with auto pause ?
title: Apple Watch App Rating.

review:
Doesn‚Äôt track runs every time, when linked to Fitibit it doesn‚Äôt mesh well and doesn‚Äôt always map the runs. One or the other would be fine. 
Also didn‚Äôt register heart rate data. 

Bones seem great, ideas are great. But it doesn‚Äôt work.
title: So close but bugged

review: It‚Äôs slow to stop and quick to resume. Time not as accurate and it could be. What happened to the feature that tells you how fast you‚Äôre pedaling in real time? It would be nice to have a feature that says out loud so you‚Äôre not looking at the device so  you how many miles  traveled
title: It used to be great

review: Absolutely love Strava!! So many great insights and well worth the subscription. One improvement suggestion is adding the option to choose a 12k race for the ‚ÄúRunning Race Time‚Äù under the ‚ÄúPerformance Potential‚Äù segment.
title: Running Race Distance - add 12k option

review: The fitness part of the app works well enough, but throughout the app they pack in so many advertisements, recommendations, social features and other cheap that I don't want and will never use. I already pay for the subscription, let me customize the app and turn off the junk, bloat, and spam. I want my workout data and that's it. Stop telling me how I should use the app.
title: Junk and clutter

review: Love the Strava program for my cycling activities! I know video posts are coming and I‚Äôm a GoProer. So I will be utilizing the new app features when it comes available! Size and length of videos will be quite limited but acceptable. Looking forward to it. I might raise rating to 5 starts.
title: Great but can be Greater!

review: The reason to have a paid account is for planning routes. Can‚Äôt do that on free. I love tracking my miles and most of my friends use Strava so I stick with it. If a more socially connected app existed I would ditch it.
title: Recording great ride-planning not

review: I‚Äôve been pleased with Strava for years until the last two weeks when my runs haven‚Äôt tracked accurately, showing only a third of my mileage. It is in areas with poor reception, but places Strava used to previously work well.
title: Recent issues

review: Strava‚Äôs testing on releases is pathetic! Over the last 4-months it‚Äôs gone downhill with every release. I get ‚Äústarting run‚Äù or ‚Äústaring ride‚Äù on sporadic basis and the renders the activity useless. On 8 mile run this morning I had to restart 3 times and eventually it froze. Had to get my distance from Apples activity app. I‚Äôve been a active user for years and this is by far the most buggy it‚Äôs ever been. Updated yesterday and completely useless app today. :-(
title: Strava QA is out to lunch

review: I love this app as it keep me honest and accountable regarding my fitness. Recently, I‚Äôve used this app less for cycling and more for other endeavors. However, I specifically love this app when applied to cycling goals and results. While some use this for PB‚Äôs on descents, I love comparing my results on climbs I do regularly.
title: Premium

review: Love the app itself, but hate their business model. Seems like every week they take another feature away that they want you to pay for... I understand that they need to stay in business, but for a recreational athlete like myself that doesn‚Äôt need all the fancy features it just makes me want to pay for it less... seriously thinking about looking for alternatives
title: Good app, but they keep taking away features!

review:
The in-app support is poor. I was charged twice for a month while still not been given access to the paid version. Every time I sent an in-app message to support it gave me an error message after a few days and was unable to load the messages. Did they respond? I don‚Äôt know... 

I really like the other functions within the app and really wish I had full access to them.
title: Poor costumer support

review: Been using Strava for years. All of that data? My PR‚Äôs, memorable runs (which have attached photos, for heck‚Äôs sake!), etc. are now locked behind a paywall, and they literally gave NO WARNING to their users. They took data AND basic functionality (route planning) away from the free version rather than try to make a better product to entice subscribers. Don‚Äôt trust Strava with your data. Maybe next year they‚Äôll triple the subscription price with no warning.
title: No warning update locked data behind paywall

review: Many people are under the false understanding that strava has shut down their free tier and this is why you cannot open the app on your phone. This is not the case there is a VERY unfortunate bug that makes the new version of the app not open on iphones. YOU MUST DELETE AND REINSTALL! This will let you open the app again and still have access to their free tier.
title: Can‚Äôt login after update... WORKAROUND

review:
It‚Äôs very disappointing that they‚Äôre taking features that were previously free and putting them behind a subscription pay wall.  If you can‚Äôt develop new features to add to a premium ‚Äúsummit‚Äù subscription don‚Äôt take away valued features from everyone. 

Bottom line: I‚Äôm not paying for features that were previously free. I use Garmin Connect so I won‚Äôt lose much when I stop using Strava.
title: Disappointing changes

review: I really want to like this app. I‚Äôve heard great things about Strava, but I‚Äôm getting really fed up with the customer support. Nothing but issues for the past month with the app. I have multiple open cases with no response regarding tracking issues, and They keep closing all my tickets without ever answering me. I‚Äôve been all over the forums and many people appear to have been having the same problems for years, so I know this isn‚Äôt an easy problem that I‚Äôm overlooking. What‚Äôs the deal?
title: Fed up

review: If you are an active person and enjoy tracking your miles, I would highly recommend to move on from this app and go to Nike running app or something else. This app tracked my first 10 or 15 runs and now won‚Äôt log any more. There could be a glitch of maybe I have to pay for more miles but if you want consistency, I would keep searching for a different app. You never know if Strava will record it for the future or not. Thanks for reading.
title: Strava Running App

review: This app helps keep you on track and motivated for your running goals. It is accurate and is easy to use and helps you better yourself with active split times and route mapping. Highly recommended
title: Excellent support for your running goals

review: The social aspect about the app is amazing, the main thing it‚Äôs lacking is the ability to customize what is shown on your watch when you do your activity. With the amount of other workout apps that embrace the Apple Watch much better it‚Äôs hard to recommend Strava to another casual runner who doesn‚Äôt really care for the social aspects of the app.
title: Customizable Apple Watch

review: I love Strava. I love the cumulative data. Keeps up with mileage on both my bike and my running shoes. I just wish my Apple Activities would upload to Strava without having to use a 3rd party - paid - app. Come on people - make it happen and I‚Äôll give you 5 stars.
title: Apple Watch support

review: Love the app! Rarely losses signal, in all the runs I‚Äôve ran and I run a lot, I‚Äôve only dropped a few activities and those where in deep country spots. Love connecting and keeping each other motivated through kudos! Thank you and super grateful for you Strava! Eric
title: Best app to connect you with your friends

review: Strava is a great tool weather you use it to keep you motivated by socializing or use it to make you stronger by using it to track your stats from your workouts.  Everyone I know and ride with use Strava, that was enough to get me started with Strava and haven‚Äôt regretted it...
title: Keeping you honest

review: Love the app and use it on the Apple Watch all the time. Is it possible to have more granular distance displayed on the watch? Instead of 1.4 miles I would like to see 1.45 miles. Also, is it possible to add audio cues for half or quarter miles? Helpful for workouts.
title: Runner‚Äôs Request

review: For the last few days, I often open the app to complete a ride, and see that it logged 0 distance traveled because it was stuck on auto-pause.  Not every time though.
title: Not logging my rides correctly

review: You need to be able to save or create a route from a friend‚Äôs activity directly from the mobile app.  Great app overall though.  I think personally it would also be nice to be able to like comments and pm a user directly.  But mainly the first thing.
title: Missing key feature from mobile

review:
To the developers. Let us post videos. It will make it more interesting. Also let us tag our Strava friends with our pictures. 
Let us also create photo albums like on different trails we rode on.
Help us also rate the trails we rode on with stars.
title: Improvements

review:
Nice app!
One question: the map shown on my feed shows trails that connect to the roads. When I click on that map to get to a larger one, the trails are gone. Can you change that so that the larger map shows them too?
title: Question about maps

review:
I have been using Strava for the past several years and it‚Äôs made cycling a much more challenging and enjoyable experience than I originally anticipated. 

Most recently I use the integration with my Bolt Element for cycling and can get live segments on my computer while riding. 

Great app!
title: Great app and easy to use

review: I use it for running and riding. But this morning the time ran but no pace or distance showed. I ran a normal route that didn‚Äôt have any issue before. Tried to restart and it did the same again. End up having to close the app entirely. Little annoying in the middle of a run but overall I like the app.
title: Good App

review: Just the best out there. Adaptable, packed with adjustable data and keeps you on your toes. Measure yourself against just yourself or the pack. The best app out there and well worth the price. Load photos, videos and great privacy options.
title: The apex in workout apps.

review: However, I‚Äôve been asking for one pertinent change and never been done When you open up another ‚ÄúCyclist stats‚Äù it defaults to running instead of ‚Äúcycling‚Äù why?
title: Great for compiling numbers

review: This app is great for different sports and you can connect your watches so you can do it on the go and leave your phone at home I use it a lot for running/walking I give it a 5 star rating
title: Great for multiple sports

review: I love how this app has Nordic skiing as an activity I just wish you could differentiate between classic and skate styles. Classic skiers basically can‚Äôt compete on routes since all of the top times will always be skate skiers. Strava! Make two categories of Nordic skiing!
title: Great app but needs a few more features

review: If you don‚Äôt add audible mileage prompts for bikers, I won‚Äôt be around for a second year subscription. This is basic and your competition has this feature. Step it up or I‚Äôm gone. Thanks
title: Mileage prompts for bikers missing

review:
Not sure what is going on with the app lately but since the launch of the Apple Watch 7 it refuses to read my heart rate consistently which makes it worthless to me. My Apple Watch version 4 is in perfect working condition with a battery efficiency at 85% so you can‚Äôt blame the tech.
Also server issues leading to details not being accurate? What‚Äôs the point then?
title: Once upon a time this was good

review:
While installing and setup, Strata accessed my contacts before asking my permission. Even before asking if I want to sync my contacts, it had already downloaded my contacts and showed who among my contacts was on Strava. This is a violation of my privacy. I have no way of undoing this now and Strava has my contacts information

I immediately deleted this app. But my information could already be with Strava now
title: Serious Privacy issue

review: Instead of innovating and trying to add new features to get more paid subscribers they started taking features away from the free version. I can‚Äôt see my segment leaderboard position, or even check my weekly mileage anymore without paying. I guess it‚Äôs time to delete this and log it in a good old note book once again. It‚Äôs a shame too because I was about to subscribe before they screwed the app up, but now I just flat out don‚Äôt want to support this.
title: Money hungry

review: On the main dashboard where it shows weekly progress on bike/run/swim, I wish you could change those to your preferred sports. Such as bike, backcountry ski and lift or whatever it is that tickles your fancy. I neither swim nor run but I‚Äôd love to see the other things I do consistently! Otherwise great app!
title: Fun App

review: The way Strava is laid out and works, it would be my favorite of the running tracker apps, but so frequently are my distances and time wrong that it makes it not very useful if I were overly concerned with accurate tracking. Frequently it doesn‚Äôt track my run almost at all, or will stop mid-run, or often will think I took a different route than I did and attribute me more or less mileage during a run.
title: Five-star if it worked

review:
Syncing of ride stats from Watch to iPhone is such a fragile process. Most of the time it doesn‚Äôt work, at least not automatically. Worse: when I go to Settings > Unsynced on the Watch to manually initiate a sync, it‚Äôs still a crapshoot whether or not it will sync.

With this failure of a basic functionality and the recent move of features behind a paywall, I‚Äôm saying goodbye to Strava and hello to RunKeeper, even for bike rides.
title: Watch/phone syncing

review: this used to be a fantastic app. it was a perfect way to show others what you did and a great way to compare yourself to others so you can better yourself as an athlete. but this latest update changed that. you are no longer able to see more detailed leaderboards for the segments. it is now required to pay for these basic features. especially in these times when numerous races are cancelled and that was a great way to pace and compare yourself to others in ways that you couldn‚Äôt right now. this was a terrible decision from the developers during these time when you should be making things easier for the people trying to stay active during these times.
title: new update

review: I use this app for basics - tracking distance and a rough pace of my run while running. 4 out of my last 5 runs have omitted at least 0.25 mile, which might not sound like much, but completely throws off my pace when I‚Äôm only running a few miles. At first, it was just at the start. This time, I ran 1.1 miles down a trail and somehow only clocked 0.6 on the way back. Very frustrating.
title: Tracking pace needs work

review:
I am still getting used to the Strava‚Äôs novelty as I am pretty old school when it comes to tracking fitness levels.  It seems to me that the Strava app and Strava Insights should be merged into one app. 

I rated this three stars because there is no iPad version that will allow you to read Strava in landscape mode with a keyboard.   I have to login via Safari/Chrome to use Strava with an iPad.
title: Needs iPad app

review: Strava worked nicely for tracking my bike club rides until recently with auto stop start failed to restart after a brief lunch stop. So remainder of ride not recorded - never had this occur before! Software update caused it?
title: Last two bike rides failed to auto start

review: The app works very well to track runs, rides, skis, etc. but frequently doesn‚Äôt upload workout data to the iOS app. I‚Äôve had several runs refuse to sync even after manually pressing the sync button and have even lost all the data for a few runs that way. Generally good app except that one pretty major flaw
title: Syncing Problems

review: Strava, and it‚Äôs segments, has made riding awesome. Both myself and my coworkers compete furiously for segment times and trophies. Very fun!  The only improvement I would suggest would be to allow one to view all of the leaderboard names on segments on mobile devices.
title: Probably wouldn‚Äôt ride without Strava

review: I have pushed my Garmin Connect data to Strava for years. It has an elegant design and solid social features, but what‚Äôs most frustrating is how few people seem engaged in the community. While many friends have signed up, only a handful are active users. I can‚Äôt tell if that‚Äôs a commentary on Strava or American fitness, but it leaves me wanting more in the app.
title: Beautiful app with a tiny community

review: I had a feeling that this would work. I use an old iPhone. I don‚Äôt get WiFi, except when I‚Äôm home. I didn‚Äôt think the gps would‚Äôve able to keep track of where I went without WiFi. But there it was on the map! I was indeed surprised. Thanx!!
title: Surprised!

review: My pace for my splits on my Apple Watch using the Strava app are fairly accurate but when I upload my activity the pace is no longer accurate. This hinders my ability to truly track my pace from run to run or get accurate splits.
title: Not accurate pace!

review: Would be even greater if you can easily stop a ride or run from home screen on a phone instead of having to unlock the phone. It would be like stop/pause music, shows up a control on home screen
title: Great app

review: It would be nice if the app allowed for activity tracking in increments of .00 instead of .0. I left some feedback for the devs about this a while ago, but didn‚Äôt see any update. Other than that, this app is more reliable than the Nike app. But I may go back to it because at least on there the miles are tracked more accurately.
title: Hard to track miles

review: I like how you can see other people‚Äôs runs and average paces - also I like how y‚Äôall let people post pictures of their runs and just other things they‚Äôve been doing üëç good job Strava
title: Runs and average paces

review: It had to get a five from me it is really an amazing app that can track your progress and helps you stay on track with anything you do, climbing, running, rowing, cycling, anything that can be tracked they are good at.
title: Strava rating

review: Was my favorite running app. But I have made no changes in my Apple Watch or phone and now it is completely inaccurate on distance. Some days it is 50% more, some days up to 50% less. The tracker makes it look like I‚Äôve run through buildings. I enjoyed this app for watching my pace, but it is useless now.
title: Used to love it- but now it doesn‚Äôt track distance accurately

review: Strava pushed a premium subscription preview to non-sub users. 1) we never asked for a preview. 2) Every activity I have recorded in my watch since the preview has not synced to my phone.
title: Issues with sync during premium preview

review: Every time you change the interface it becomes less intuitive and more annoying. It was perfect.
title: I‚Äôve been using Strava for 10 years now

review:
App has a ton of features and used to be the best app any cyclist could own. but now it requires a subscription to do just about anything. can‚Äôt even look at the trails i used to be able to look at and follow without paying monthly. 

all my progress wiped because i won‚Äôt pay monthly. fortunately there are now better apps that have the same features and you don‚Äôt need a subscription to them.
title: app used to be one of the best

review: I am a walker, and wanted to ‚Äúmap my walks‚Äù, track my speed and mileage.  Often, the distance is off by up to 1 mile, very often around a half mile.  I can take the same exact walk every day and there is a significant disparity in the distance tracked.  Too bad because I would like it otherwise.
title: Easy but inaccurate

review: It would truly be nice if a ride or run or an activity could be EASILY edited‚Äî shortened or corrected to reflect information on the activity. Particularly when someone unintentionally forgets to stop the tracking and gets into a vehicle‚Ä¶.it happens
title: Editing

review:
Strava has been my fitness tracking app for several years now, and over that time it‚Äôs getting better and better.
I use Apple products for recording and viewing my activities, and Strava‚Äôs integration of the Apple Watch has improved and that‚Äôs great!
title: Strava Evolving

review: As a triathlete I have plenty of data to log. I‚Äôve used Strava for years and by far I‚Äôve enjoyed its features the most over Garmin, MyFitnessPal, Apple health, and many others out there. All the cool kids use Strava. Support them and buy the app.
title: Love Strava!

review: I‚Äôve been trying for two days to cancel my account and delete my data . I‚Äôve followed all the steps but they have not sent me the final email to finalize this process. However when i ask a technical question an email come right away. I feel they are stalling my cancelation process which should make others feel weary of signing up for this service as they appear to not have good follow through.
title: Cancelation

review: Love the app, but the GPS connection to Apple Watch is too spotty to truly trust when training. Rarely does it actually pickup the starting location so on a run the first half might be a straight line. You‚Äôll never be able to calculate your true stats. Providing feedback to Strava doesn‚Äôt seem to resolve the issue.
title: GPS issues

review: It works well to track and summarize all of my workouts and see the progression. An easy way to connect to others around me, routes around my area, my friends and people I admire. It is motivating to see what kind of workouts others are doing.
title: Works Great!

review: Continuous improvement, simple, and connected. Addictive but fun. Brilliant for both cycling and running. If you‚Äôre going to addicted to something this ain‚Äôt bad. I use for cycling mainly. Uploads easily from the phone, Wahoo Elemnt Bolt or Apple Watch.
title: The Gold Standard in Endurance Activity Logging

review: Srava works pretty well.  However, when I use the Wahoo app to track my fitness, then share it with Strava, the stats get completely hosed. Last week my ~34 mile ride on Wahoo turned into a 194 mile ride in Strava.  I‚Äôm pretty speedy but I‚Äôm pretty sure the average speed of 94mph was a little off too: ).
title: Strava

review:
I have been riding with Strava for a few weeks now. I really enjoy the competition favor the challenges bring but when the top 7 are being completed by people with eBikes, it is super frustrating. There should be a separate leaderboard section for people who choose to ride eBikes. For your typical road bikers it become next to impossible to secure any placement above top 5. 
If they change this I would give 5 stars
title: App Needs to detect eBikes

review: I have a GPS watch with its own app, and the only reason I use Strava is for the matched runs feature. I‚Äôve been logging my routes and keeping track of my progress for years, but I can no longer view my matched runs without buying a subscription. I‚Äôd rather Strava run ads. Why pay to see a chart of my improvement when I could plot it out with pencil and paper for free?
title: DO NOT UPDATE unless you want to lose features

review:
I have used Strava for years recording my outdoor open water swim activities from my iPhone using the Strava app. Have never had any problems with it until the last six months. 

Now my moving times are being recorded/calculated wrong and the overall time and 100yd time are messed up. 

If I switch the activity type to a different sport it shows all the correct time and distance so it is recording it all. It‚Äôs something wrong with how the swim activity uses the gps data points to calculate everything

I was getting ready to sign up for the paid version of the app but with swimming not working ever I am absolutely not going to pay anything. Lots of posts online and in the reviews of the exact same issue for many others.
title: Swim Activities Unusable

review: I absolutely love this app, but i really wish the App was completely independent from the website. Things like accessing training plans, or editing your gear should NOT have to be accessed ONLY from the website on our web browser or desktop computer. Thats my only complaint.
title: Love Strava! But...

review:
I would give this app a 4-4.5 if not for the recent changes in service. Previously standard features  (personal intervals over time, overall segment ranking, etc) now only come with payment to premium status. 
Otherwise it is a good backup to a garmin or other GPS device and a way to see what routes your friends are doing and to comment with them.
title: Pay now for formerly standard free features!!

review: I recently purchased an annual membership and synced my Apple Watch to the Strava app. I have grated all permissions to Strava to use my health data. However I‚Äôm not able to view the heart rate insights on my app. It‚Äôs frustrating because I‚Äôve set all the permissions and the app collects and syncs all the other workout data.
title: Can‚Äôt sync heart rate data

review: I wanted to test out a few apps, I run the same route so know the milage. Strava didn‚Äôt accurately pick it up, and also says my pace was significantly lower than it actually was. I compared with other apps at same time, and my running partner is much slower than I am, yet his times were significantly better using a different app. Reported errors, yet no confirmation from stava that they were fixed etc.
title: It‚Äôs not accurate

review: The app was hands down the best way to track miles and compare yourself to friends or other people. Many months have gone by were I‚Äôve been tracking KOM‚Äôs and training for them but with the new update it‚Äôs no longer possible to unless you pay to see the comparative times. Making it really obsolete just so they can make a quick buck really upset about this hopefully it reverts to how it was or I will find one that does track segments for free.
title: Terrible update

review: The new auto pause feature messes up constantly and now they are trying to pay to even see what place you are on the leaderboard. 60$ a Year come on. I don‚Äôt need another subscription service. I used to love it even with its flaws and recommend it but now I probably will stop using it and will definitely stop recommending it.
title: I do like Strava but

review: I have this paired with my Garmin vivoactive 4s and Strava is entering my times incorrectly. My garmin shows different times than strava and strava is supposed to be pulling them data from Garmin but it‚Äôs putting in the wrong data and strava won‚Äôt let me edit. Love this social aspect of this app but I may quit if it keeps putting in slower times that I‚Äôm actually doing.
title: Not syncing correct info

review:
I was speeding through things and almost signed up for their annual membership w a free first month, it was only Apples prompt that warned me. I was negligent, no doubt, but the app was designed to push you that direction and lead you into the subscription unawares and I find that distasteful. 

Ill update the review when I have a chance to try the actual free side of the app that doesnt require a signup, but my first try left a bad taste in my mouth...
title: Almost pushed me to sign up

review:
For the last few weeks the GPS tracking has been off. During the run the tracking counter for distance doesn‚Äôt register for half the run. After ending the run and recording the results it is far from accurate. .25 to over a mile off. I don‚Äôt run on parallel roads but more encircling a neighborhood so it shouldn‚Äôt get confused by crossing my previous path. 
Please fix! It was a great and very accurate run tracker before.
title: It was good

review: I have and Apple watch series 2 and an iPhone 6 and I have updated all software to the latest versions and the Apple watch app still crashes every time I try to open it. This issue has been going on for over a week now. COME ON!!! Get it together. Additionally, the Strava Apple watch app is very glitchy and laggy even when it was "working" screens would load but take several seconds before they would allow interaction. As a paying customer I am not happy.
title: CRASHES!!!

review: For my last few rides I have been unable to enter my selection of bike that I use when posting my ride on Strava. No matter how many times I edit the post to try and enter my bike selection data, it does not happen.
title: Selection of Bike on App

review: Can you please share the distance down to the hundredth within the mobile app? It‚Äôs provided on the desktop site, but it‚Äôs not within the mobile app. It‚Äôs also not shared with the Health app on iOS, but a long time ago it was. Miss it.
title: Suggestion
