review: Let me start out by saying I love Strava and track all of my workouts with it. But the newest update removed the ability to choose which shoes I used before I upload the activity. Now I have to edit the activity if I want to track mileage per shoe. It wasn't like this until the most recent update.  I hope this issue can be reverted. Thanks
title: New update isn‚Äôt perfect

review: I am a cyclist and bike 5 days a week. I like to track my miles and time and personal best. Strava has recently had an ‚Äòupgrade‚Äô that now automatically stops my timer if my bike stops.  And it doesn‚Äôt start back up when I move. Before the upgrade I could deselect this feature. Cool for runners. Stinks for bikers. And now I can‚Äôt find that feature to turn it off again. Is this an attempt to get everyone to purchase the ‚Äòupgrade‚Äô. If so, no thanks. I‚Äôll find another app.
title: Frustrated. EXTREMELY

review: I enjoy strava because I‚Äôm able to not only see my workouts but also track mileage on my shoes and see how some of my friends are doing. It‚Äôs basic enough for anyone to use but comprehensive enough to give me all the data.
title: It‚Äôs my needs.

review:
Lots of great info.

One peculiar thing is I can‚Äôt put the city I live in into my profile as it changes my time zone. Also you have to change time zone on website. Can‚Äôt do it on mobile app.
title: Great app

review: I decided to upgrade to premium so I could get access to recommended routes. The routes are great, but without audio directions, I have to keep looking at my phone while riding which is both annoying and potentially unsafe. Any plans to release audio turn by turn?
title: Add audio directions to routes

review: I‚Äôm letting my crushes know where I am at all times. And occasionally finding a man who has turned me down and following them and commenting on their activities üíï Words can‚Äôt express what a gift this is to me.
title: Fav app of all time

review: Paired with Garmin Instinct watch and Garmin speed sensor give me all the feedback I could hope for.  There are so many benefits in the free app, I‚Äôm all set. Friends pay for subscription and the added perks are cool to be sure.  To each his own.  Thanks Strava for the free app üëçüèº
title: Strava rocks

review: My rides from wahoo computer take forever to load to Strava. It was never this slow before, I shouldn‚Äôt have to wait 10 minutes for a ride to go from one app to another, especially when I‚Äôm a paid subscriber. With the price increase I don‚Äôt see a reason to resubscribe. The free version will just have to do.
title: Functionally has been downhill for a few months.

review: Since the last update, none of my activities are going to Apple health. I tried everything from uninstalling and reinstalled. No luck. Please fix this issue.
title: Stopped sending to Apple health!!!!!

review: Love tracking my rides, sharing pics, giving and getting kudos. Strava gets me out there and has helped me met a huge circle of cyclist in the Chicago area, but also, across the world. My most used app. Strava is my only social media.
title: Great app

review: An amazing tool that helps me to track my progress, love the monthly challenges. The statistics are so powerful, just perfect for anyone who is out there planning to stay active and fit! Highly recommend
title: Runner without boarders Mulugeta)

review: I have always supported Strava, and going Premium was the best decision I made. I not only keep connected with people back home on their runs but can have new connections too! Love to get the runner connections even bigger!!
title: Strava

review:
There is no way to have Strava team respond to technical issues. For example, laps in Garmin don‚Äôt show up in Strava even in workout mode. 

Strava relies on community answers , but skimps on tech support.
title: Non existent support / bug fixes for paid version

review: Annual price just increase like other fitness apps. Strava is generally worth the increase.  Strava online allows selection of equipment (shoes, bike, etc.) but the app does not allow you to select different equipment.  This does not make sense and should be changed.
title: Good, but could be better.

review: The only problem with this app is that anytime the internet is low or the app needs to be updated, the mile distance goes really slow so if I try to run a mile, I feel like it‚Äôs making me run about 0.5 more mile sometimes but still says that I only ran a mile around there! üò£
title: The problem with this app

review: It‚Äôs very hard to hold and drag the screen to show daily activities in calendar at the bottom. Also you can‚Äôt see previous months‚Äô recap. It would also be nice if different activities can be displayed in different colors so that if there are multiple activities in a day, the circle for that day can be spilt in multiple colors...
title: Poor design for monthly recap

review: Strava on on my phone is down for three weeks. Nine mine of the buttons worked, including the record button. I tried updating but it doesn‚Äôt work. It is very frustrating as I had several major trip that I wanted to record and I‚Äôm paying 60 bucks per year. And I don‚Äôt want to delete the app and download again cause I don‚Äôt want to lose my data. Can someone help me?
title: Down for three weeks

review: How a good experience became an horrible one in a few minutes? After updating your log in password, starting to receiving a ‚Äúauthorization error‚Äù every time you open the app on your iPhone and... the worst part, not having any help either in the Strava website or app! Absolutely horrible!! If nothing change highly recommend to not use this app!
title: Stopped working after password update

review:
I started using Strava a couple years ago to track my mountain biking progress. 

At the time I had access to the leader board and could see all my previous ride time comparisons. 

Then one day they decide those along with other features should be paid for. Well the reason Its not worth paying for those features is simple: there is no honesty in strava. The leaderboard is filled with people on ebikes, even though there is an ebike category, so it makes the competitive aspect of the app completely useless. Koms mean nothing when the playing field isn‚Äôt even. 

So to pay five dollars a month just to see my own times from previous rides isn‚Äôt really worth the subscription trap.
title: Why Strava isn‚Äôt worth a dollar

review: Using it to track a run the mileage is consistently lower than the Apple workout app or the Nike run app. It‚Äôs not a ton lower but it‚Äôs always lower. Shoe tracking is terrible and inaccurate at best. If you share a run, the person you shared it with ends up with lower mileage and sometimes a higher duration which doesn‚Äôt make any sense and messes up their pace.
title: Fix the little things

review:
Strava made recent updates During the height of COVID-19 which prevents you from
Viewing your history without upgrading the paid membership.   They also took away other features.     Paid membership is $5 a month or $60 for year.   Why can‚Äôt they play a short ad or another options.   I contacted Strava 6 weeks ago with my complaints but like most online apps there is no support or response... hence the reason for bad review.
title: Recent updates are disappointed

review: Strava let everyone compare their times for segments with their friends for free. Once enough people we‚Äôre signed up with all their stored times for various trails, they strated charging $7.99 a month!  Shame on Strava for now shutting off one of the best part of their apps unless you pay outrageous pricing.  Even your own previous workouts for segments can‚Äôt be viewed for comparison.  What‚Äôs the point of using the free app that if you can‚Äôt compare your workout segments to previous attempts.
title: Bait and Switch

review: It‚Äôs a great concept. But unfortunately inconsistent. Kind of a bummer when you try to accurately track your progress & get inaccurate results. Most of the time it‚Äôs great. But when it fails (more lately) its a bummer.
title: Inconsistent

review:
If an app maker decides it‚Äôs necessary to switch to a subscription model in order to make things work financially, I have no problem with that. A number of apps have gone this route, but nearly all of them preserved the free features as free, and added value to the subscription tier. I appreciated this, and in most cases, paid for the subscriptions. 

And then there‚Äôs Strava. These guys decided to take away most of what was free, in order to gain subscribers. And that‚Äôs why they‚Äôll get no money from me.
title: Disrespectful

review:
Really sad. I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôre all struggling with COVID restrictions and getting outdoors is one of our only reliefs. In April I pushed myself to walk 100 miles (huge deal for me) and I did it. I was so happy to see the number climb all month. 

Now all this app does is track my route and time. My numbers and segments aren‚Äôt visible unless I pay. Feels unfair to do this during a time when everyone‚Äôs already surging to this app. And at the same time everyone‚Äôs less financially stable.
title: Bummed with the update

review:
Spend years gathering data from riders. Ignore user feature requests. Implement one or two and start charging users. Brilliant.

I was a former subscriber and didn‚Äôt see the value in it as a paid app. I understand some features being put behind a paywall but something as simple as me comparing past rides is frustrating. And the limited new features just aren‚Äôt worth the price for subscription.
title: Ok for subscribers, free is pointless

review: The DAY I finally download this app they make pretty much every feature subscription only...not sure that I want to pay monthly for an Athlete Instagram when you can look up trails online for free. Might still use it to track my rides for myself if it lets me do that without paying (if not, that means the app is only free to download but not to use in any way) but I‚Äôve heard it‚Äôs often inaccurate. Meh
title: Subscription Only

review: This is terrible!! I‚Äôve been using Strava for years now and they recently removed leaderboard info for non paying customers. I get that there is a paid for version and a free version but to take away features that we‚Äôve been used to is a terrible move and makes me want to start using a different app. I guess I‚Äôll have to start shopping around. Any good suggestions?
title: They removed leaderboards for non paying users

review: I‚Äôve been using the app for the last several years after my post knee replacement return to cycling. I was always interested in subscribing but they offered very little extra value through those years and as a rider who only gets to ride 4-5 months a year at a low level, it just didn‚Äôt make sense. This year instead of adding value they decided to pull several major features from the free membership. Time to find a new app.
title: Strava Jumps the shark.

review: Strava is a very unobtrusive way to track your workouts. It‚Äôs free and easy to use. Strava doesn‚Äôt use up battery or space on my phone. By keeping a record of past performances Strava motivates me to be more active and to push myself harder during workouts.
title: Great app

review:
Fun to track and compete with friends, but support is absolutely abysmal. I have been trying to fix an issue between the app on the online version for over six weeks. It can take as much as 18 days to get a response. 

I asked a question on January 10, 2020 and finally received a response on January 28th. I did what they suggested (I had two profiles) and deleted the one with no reported activity. Now I can‚Äôt sign back on to the old profile with all my activity, nor does it sync with Garmin Connect anymore. 

I asked for help on January 28, 2020 and I still have not heard from anyone as f today February 9, 2020. 

Worst support ever!  I‚Äôll be dropping Strava if I don‚Äôt hear something soon. I actually thought about the pro version, but why pay for such terrible support.
title: Has Potential

review: I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app multiple times in hopes if getting it to synch with my Apple Watch. It is hung up on the Motion and Fitness setting. It is all very straightforward as this process should be, then a dead end! It would be nice to be able to look at my watch during activities to see my progress as it is tracking. When will this be fixed? It isn‚Äôt the sign of a great app that a user has to comb through forums for workarounds for bugs!
title: Fix the bug!

review: Strava is basically awesome. I have used it for a number of years and it does everything I want. It‚Äôs easy to use and reliable. I really enjoy being able to post pictures to the rides. The format is clean and easy to use. All-around pretty awesome.
title: Awesome

review: The app itself is great. Use it for running and cycling.  When I decided to upgrade to Summit, that‚Äôs when the issues started.  1st, it‚Äôs not a ‚Äú30 day free trial‚Äù. I was charged instantly.  2nd, after Being charged, it never worked.  I contacted Strava they replied with a request for a screen shot of the receipt.  I immediately sent this to Strava. Almost 12 hours later it still doesn‚Äôt work, and no one from Strava has contacted me back.
title: DON‚ÄôT SUBSCRIBE!!

review: I listen to audiobooks when I run, and the updates provide way more information that I need every half-mile; time, pace, etc. etc. ‚Äì I have to rewind my book by the time it gets done. All they need is a simple setting like Runkeeper so you can select which data they provide, such as a short and sweet number of miles.
title: Lots of useful bells and muscles, but updates are tedious and give too much information

review: AGAIN!!!  I updated to this current version and now there‚Äôs no option to choose which bike I rode.   Please restore this very useful and important feature.  Thank you!
title: Current version lost ability to select which bike was used

review: Power meter data is inaccurate. Has to be a way to accurately import data from Garmin connect with actual power meter connected. Readings are more than 10-15 watts off average. Other than that, Strava has become a very effective training tool. Thanks!
title: Great!

review: I converted to strava after using Garmin for years. I  use it daily for biking and running and only have one suggestion. Like Garmin, I would love a two digit decimal for the iwatch. I like to end my runs on a whole number, so unless I‚Äôm watching it, I end up going over.
title: Two digit decimals

review: The program works pretty well most of the time. It is very difficult to get technical support, but you don‚Äôt need it that often.  It would be great if they had a family plan so that kids and families could track each other‚Äôs exercises etc. but there hasn‚Äôt been any information from Strava indicating this could be an option in the near future.  It‚Äôs too bad, because I think they are really missing out on this market segment.
title: No family plan?

review: I am a big fan of Strava.  It is the best app for running I have encountered over many years of using many different apps.  I have one major complaint about the app though.  Strava would be even better if it had more features targeted to trail and ultra runners.
title: Great app but....

review: Good app except the whole point is to connect with your friends while using it. So why in the world is it so difficult to do so? To add a friend it requires you to add your whole contact list, but doesn‚Äôt sort them alphabetically or give you the ability to search through them. So I have 500+ contacts, am I supposed to scroll through all them to find the two I want to invite? Fix this.
title: Game breaking flaw

review: Love that strava is getting updated frequently. REALLY wish that you‚Äôd publish what changes you are making in each update. Can‚Äôt look for new improvements if  I don‚Äôt know where to find them. Thanks!
title: Love it...update us on what you‚Äôre changing

review: I love strava. I live and die by it. But the feed is no longer chronological, and it‚Äôs horrible. The last thing I want to see when I log on is a run from 4 days ago. It‚Äôs not Facebook. I want to see what‚Äôs happened lately. Please #bringbackchronological
title: Would be 5 but...

review: Great App. It's fun and motivating to see your friends out exercising! Distances can be a little off, think this has to do with GPS tracking interval setting. However, more frequent GPS pings use more battery power, so feel the app strikes a good balance.
title: Great functionality, fun to use

review: Such a great way to see what others in the running community are up to as well as being able to see your own individual progress!
title: Love this app!

review: Strava is the best app ever. I love how filled with genuine positivity it is! I am so glad I can connect with friends and family to celebrate each other‚Äôs achievements in a supportive way! Also thankful for the find a bathroom feature in the maps üòÇüßª
title: TY Strava!

review: I like the app and but for whatever reason the Apple Watch will not link together to show my heart rate during a workout. I do not want to buy another watch. I am not sure if it‚Äôs Strava or Apple but this is the only reason I am not giving it 5 stars.
title: My review Strava / Apple Watch

review: It‚Äôs really good but I‚Äôm having a issue with my notifications Bc every time I get a notifications it goes to like 200 something and keeps adding every time I get a notification but otherwise rlly good
title: Nice

review: I am a paid Strava Subscriber for 2 years plus. The latest App is not recording indoor workouts and it‚Äôs day no change in location recorded. How can you release an App withou proper testing and not fixing an issue quickly that exists for 2 to 3 weeks already. You need to improve your QC and release process
title: Latest App is broke

review: I signed up for a subscription through Apple. The app never registered it so I tried to restore purchase- still didn‚Äôt even though my credit card statement shows they took my money. Was refunded by Apple after I attempted to contact Strava and Strava didn‚Äôt reply to my support request. If this is how Strava conducts its business ignoring customers I will figure out another way to track my biking.
title: Paid for subscription, never got it.

review: Strava is cool but I wish they would keep to cycling and out of opinion pieces. I get that everywhere I turn and cycling is an escape from all the harsh rhetoric on both sides. Please stick to adding cycling value. We will all be better off no matter what our opinions are. Kindly, Badger
title: Political Advice and opinion

review: The latest update does not update Apple health with workout data when using a Garmin computer to track the ride. Not stated if this was taken out of functionality, hoping this will be fixed shortly in a patch.
title: Latest update not syncing to Apple Health

review: Strava has helped me become a better, more consistent athlete. I like being able to see my progress, and see what my friends are doing. I‚Äôve had trouble using the routes and heart rate functions though; they do not seem to work as advertised.
title: Inspiring

review:
The new ‚ÄúHome‚Äù screen the replaced ‚ÄúFeed‚Äù no longer allows filtering to just your own activities. 
This is reason enough NOT to update the app. 
I‚Äôll uninstall my phone and just use my iPad with older app version.
title: Latest version reduced functionality

review: Great to archive and see where I was in previous years at the same time in the season.  Living in a snow belt there are defined seasons where I can do certain rides and the record allows me to see how I compared to other years
title: Recorded history of fitness

review:
I like this so so much I upgraded to premium. 

I never upgrade to premium.

It has helped me find new cycling and running routes in my own town, which I thought I knew pretty well.  It helps me track workload and recovery times.  It motivates me by connecting me with my fit friends and making me feel like part of a mutually supportive community.

It also has some light gamification functions (‚Äúbadges‚Äù for various milestones) that help new roll out of bed in the morning.  

Basically, Strava is great.  It‚Äôs also free, so why not give it a shot?
title: Useful and Motivating

review: App is fine as it is, but needs turn by turn navigation, and Direction Messaging. The latter should have happened years ago.
title: Great, but missing a few key features

review:
Please bring back goals to profile page, they are projected training, not logged training with metrics. It's the first thing I want to see when I go to my profile, and now they're buried.

Also please extend the window of training peak log on profile for a better view of distance over time. 

While hashtag map view are cool with support to BLM and Pride, think about using colors on the map to denote workout intensities/HR/cadence/watts so we can track improvement when we traverse the same course.

Flybys would be a nice feature for the app as well, or a notice on the map when we passed near a friend/teammate.
title: Updates not improving app, suggestions

review: Did you ever think about making this a family membership, possibly for a family of 4. My girls like to use the app but right now they use the free version
title: Family membership

review: I started out loving Strava but my last two weeks of runs have have not transferred correctly from my Apple Watch to my phone. While my watch is correct the phone app will show a 5k pace of 21sec as opposed to 9minutes and will be missing half of my running route on the map. Not sure what‚Äôs going on but hope Strava fixes it soon. Certainly glad I haven‚Äôt subscribed to anything yet.
title: Data missing or wrong

review: strava, if you‚Äôre reading this, your decision to make segment leaderboards a premium feature is real dirty. if this had been the way it was all along, than that would be a whole different story, but updating the app just to make segments only available to view if you have premium, real messed up. a lot of people have been using segments as a normal feature of the app for so long, and it was a great way to see how you stand up against your friends. but i know i speak for the majority of users when i say that there is absolutely no chance that i will be paying a premium fee for this. i really hope you rethink this decision.
title: very disappointed that segments are now only premium features

review:
Why did Strava remove the segment leaderboards? That was the only reason I used Strava - to compete with friends. This would have been 5 stars, but I don‚Äôt have a steady source of income right now, and I don‚Äôt plan on getting the subscription. There is now no reason for me to keep using Strava. I think I might leave :(

This app was fun to use, but ‚Äúpay to play‚Äù isn‚Äôt fun. It‚Äôs like paying to exercise.

I‚Äôll update this as changes take place.
title: So long, Leaderboards

review: My favorite features on strava are the challenge badges and segment leaderboards. I use the app almost every day and even more since the COVID quarantine. Also like seeing where I go after a long bike ride on the map.
title: Keeps me motivated

review: I‚Äôve used strava for about three years for the sole purpose of seeing the improvements in my riding, however with the new subscription centered update I can‚Äôt see all the times I had stacked up or how I compare to my friends. Very disappointed in this move and since the features I got the app for are now subscription based, I have to delete it because I just don‚Äôt have the money to subscribe to a workout app.
title: I‚Äôm deleting it

review: I enjoy both road cycling and mountain biking. The app doesn‚Äôt seem to differentiate between the two, yet they are very different. I wish you would reflect that difference when we select the type of ride we will be doing.
title: Cycling

review: Definitely one of my favorite apps at the moment. Fun to follow other people and meet new runners as well. Makes me quite competitive‚Äî in that good kind of way that keeps you active and wanting to outperform your friends and their runs :)
title: Love the community feel

review: I‚Äôve had strava since 2015 and it has done everything I‚Äôve dreamed and they keep making it better and better for racing on a virtual web of riders and racers.
title: Exactly what you would expect

review: Strava has been a great way to keep our bike community intact and close. Even when we don‚Äôt ride together on the same rides, we are still ‚Äútogether‚Äù on the same trails and segments!
title: Connected to bike friends - even when we don‚Äôt ride together!

review: This app really encouraged me all summer long in getting back into running shape. The stats, like average pace, heart rate, calories burned, etc. are huge in keeping me going back out, run after run. I just finished a run & could not find my average heart rate. Thought I was going crazy, but after reading the recent reviews, my fears have been confirmed - I can‚Äôt believe you removed the heart rate feature! You will be losing a lot of followers because of this, including me. ‚úåüèº
title: No more heart rate monitoring?! Wow.

review: Overall I‚Äôve been quite pleased with Strava. I‚Äôve been a user for the better part of ten years. I recently bought a Wahoo TICKR heart rate monitor strap, as I‚Äôd like to start training with heart rate zones. Unfortunately the newest version of the Strava app on my iPhone no longer supports external heart rate sensors. I contacted customer service, and they confirmed this. Come on Strava, this is very disappointing from the leader of fitness and activity tracking!
title: No external heart rate data

review: What happened to the Apple Watch synchronization? Now once a day when I first try using Strava to track my run or cycling, it doesn‚Äôt work and tells me to sign up or sign in. So I mess around with the app settings on my phone, and I eventually get it to work but not sure how. And whatever I do to ‚Äúfix‚Äù it doesn‚Äôt stop this from happening again the next day. After 5 days of this, I‚Äôm almost ready to abandon Strava and find an alternative. :(
title: Apple Watch UX broken in this update

review: The compatibility of the strava app and the Apple Watch are not the best. I have to either use my watch to track my run and receive insight into my heart rate and sacrifice some of my performance stats, or use the phone and sacrifice the heart rate analytics. There needs to be away to track my run on my phone while recording the heart rate on my Apple Watch the way MapMyRun does.
title: Apple Watch and Strava app

review: I‚Äôve been using Map My Run for several years but heard wonderful things about Strava from running friends so I decided to give it a try. Not sure what the big deal is... all this app does is track your activity and share with friends. It is NOT connected to your music (you need to open your music app for that) and it does NOT announce mileage and time during your activity, something I need to hear during a race. No thanks, I‚Äôm deleting this app and returning to Map My Run!
title: What‚Äôs So Great?!

review: I have been running for years with every series of Apple Watch. I recently started using the Strava app on my Apple Watch Series 4 when I noticed that I no longer get my splits or my run map on the Apple Activity app or the Pronto app. I notified Strava and this idiot says I see your splits and maps are there! Yes, on Strava but not the other apps. He then proceeds to tell me to contact the other apps. He wants me to contact multiple other apps rather than the app (Strava) which is the source of the problem!
title: That Idiot

review:
I use Strava to record my bike rides, runs, backcountry skiing, etc. Great to keep track of your adventures and see what your friends are up to.

I do wish that you could crop a ride from within the app when you forget to stop your garmin :/
title: Best cycling/running app

review: I don‚Äôt understand why I can‚Äôt edit, upload photos, or anything else to my run before it posts. I then have to wait until it uploads, find the run , tap to open, tap the edit button, just to get to the same options that used to show automatically when you finished a run. Updates are supposed to make the experience easier and more intuitive, not longer and more complicated.
title: New update makes the UX more confusing

review: Sadly I‚Äôve decided to leave Strava.  The idea is great and the gamification of segments and tracking is an awesome feature but since the beginning of the year the GPS signal just drops and all your data for a run isn‚Äôt recorded (making the gamification pretty useless).  Decided despite 5 years of data on Strava, I‚Äôm going with a more reliable tracking app until they can get the bugs fixed that started at the beginning of this year.
title: Struggling Since Beginning Of This Year

review: Title says it all. I‚Äôve been using Strava for years and love it, but while reading on my iPad, the Strava website said there was an iPad app available. However, it‚Äôs just the general iPhone app that‚Äôs magnified on to the iPad screen, and it‚Äôs frustratingly use.
title: Great on iPhone.  ‚ÄúiPad app‚Äù is just magnified iPhone app

review: If it didn‚Äôt happen on strava, did it even happen?  I use it for all my running. Good or bad runs, it all gets posted. The social aspect is a lot stronger than most other fitness apps I‚Äôve seen. I wish there was a ‚Äútrail‚Äù surface function though.
title: It‚Äôs the app

review: I love this app, but recent versions stop recording mid-run with no warning or reason (full reception). It‚Äôs making it hard to use because I don‚Äôt want to be continually checking my app to make sure it didn‚Äôt cut out on me 1/2 mile ago.
title: Tracking fail

review:
I am getting injured more trying to get crowns. I‚Äôm hiking things and doing things that I wouldn‚Äôt normally do for extra Vert. I‚Äôm hitting zone five heart rate regularly now and almost dying of heart attack. 
Highly recommend
title: Love Hate Relationship with Strava

review: Since joining Strava I‚Äôve been able to accurately track my runs, run with friends who aren‚Äôt near me, and overall increase my health and fitness. It doesn‚Äôt run the miles for me, no. But it does hold me accountable.
title: Strava is the best.
